name: Incredible Dome 25 min from Lake Michigan beaches!
title: Pullman, Michigan

hosts.about: I am a born and raised southern girl. I love gardening, being outdoors and spending time with my little family.

recent.comments: We loved our stay! Such a beautiful place and the perfect weekend getaway spot! Definitely some of the best stargazing that we have done in awhile.

items.comments: We loved our stay! Such a beautiful place and the perfect weekend getaway spot! Definitely some of the best stargazing that we have done in awhile.

The dome was an absolutely beautiful, private, and nature-surrounded stay. A short drive to cute lakeside towns and the property has everything you need for a relaxing weekend. I would definitely love to return in the fall!

Beautiful little getaway worth the stay. 20 minute drive from south haven strip but very peaceful and quiet. Loved the hottub and fire table! So cozy and comfortable. We were so relaxed. Definitely plan to come back.
We had a lovely stay at the dome.  It was peaceful, private and relaxing!

Brittney was such a communicative and kind host. When I had an issue come up, she worked incredibly hard to get it sorted out. I can’t stress enough how helpful she was and in light of that, I’d recommend the dome to anyone. 

Walking around the property feels like more of an adventure than a neighborhood. The whole area is forested and there are some cool structures and wildlife (we saw a few deer, lots of birds, and a ton of mushrooms during our stay). The dome is private enough to be secluded, but close enough to other properties on the land to feel safe. The dome itself is really comfortable, too. The shower is roomy, the bed is sturdy enough, and there is every thing you need to feel like you’re not camping (or even glamping). The view from the dome is great, even in the rainy weather, and it was nice to just relax indoors throughout our day. 

The location was also great - a reasonable drive to multiple beaches and to nearby towns for dining options.
Unique experience. Huge blueberry patch that’s free to pick from with juicy,sweet berries ripe for the picking.

Tranquil place in the middle of the forest. It was lovely to sit on the deck with some wine and cheese and watch fireflies and stars twinkle in the night. Clean, tidy, and comfortable. Will come again!

description.summary: Reconnect with nature at this unforgettable escape. Located about 25 minutes from beautiful Lake Michigan beaches. On the property, there are residential homes, eight acres of blueberries with free blueberry picking for all airbnb guests during blueberry season which is primarily from the middle of July to the middle of August. There is also a small natural foods retail store within walking distance. Relax, unwind, hike, play, and just enjoy being away from it all in this super private dome!
description.space:
Beautiful open concept dome. Think Glamping. The hot tub is new and can keep up in all temps now! Open year round. You will love the peace and quiet of the location of this dome. We have an air conditioner for summer and a brand new wood burning stove (installed January 2023) and space heater for winter months. Full bathroom and comfy queen size bed. 
We provide towels for the hot tub and for the shower. 
There is a small fridge, a microwave, a 2-slice bread toaster, and a keruig coffee maker.
description.access: No Contact check-in and checkout.
description.notes:
Just a bit of helpful information about the Dome in the winter and summer months. The dome has a mini-split that does have heat, although it only helps a little. In order to stay completely comfortable we have installed a new wood stove (1/23/23) that provides a lot of heat! It will keep the dome very warm when the temps drop below freezing and the mini split can’t keep up on its own. We provide firewood but just know that it’s a necessity to have that going if the temps are very cold. We also have a space heater, and a heated mattress pad. 

For the summer months…We do have an air conditioning unit at the dome, but because of the dome not being insulated much it does get extremely warm inside the dome during the middle of the day.  If you have ever gone tent camping in the middle of the summer, you get that it’s hard to keep a tent type shelter cool when it’s so hot outside. With that being said, the evenings are amazing and the a/c has no problem when it’s not super hot out during the day. 

Another thing to note about this Dome is that it’s wonderful for being “disconnected”, it’s private, has tons of open green space surrounded by trees, open sky and is beautiful and relaxing, but there is no wifi and although most have some cell service it’s definitely not awesome coverage, so please plan accordingly.
description.transit: We are located 20 minutes from South Haven, 15 minutes from Lake Michigan, and about 25 minutes from Saugatuck. In the local area there are a few orchards,  fruit patches, beaches, and amazing restaurants!
description.interaction: I am available almost anytime via messaging or texting. There is also someone that lives on the same property as this Dome that is happy to help with any issues that might come up during your stay. Just let us know

name: Deerleap Glamping Dome
title: East Gwillimbury, Canada

gallery.caption: Self check-in door

recent.comments: We really enjoyed our stay. A very tidy and lovely dome equipped with everything you need. We would definitely come back here again. Hong is a great host and there when you need him. We had a great stay!

items.comments: We really enjoyed our stay. A very tidy and lovely dome equipped with everything you need. We would definitely come back here again. Hong is a great host and there when you need him. We had a great stay!

One of the beautiful place to visit this dome.hong and his wife were very friendly and caring also with clear instructions they gave us. me and my boyfriend went to celebrate our anniversary in this beautiful dome.I was surprised with the dome beautifully decorated and well organized.A big garden with a pond near the dome.we did our amazing BBQ front of the dome.came out so good.well cleaned as well.hong and his wife were polite to us while talking.when I ask them about the check out time one hour later she didn’t mind she said it’s fine.we took our maximum fun and enjoyed so well in this  beautiful dome.I recommend to all my friends to this dome.we will visit again soon💗😻
Thank you so much for the hardworking and help…

We arrived in Canada for our 2nd wedding anniversary. My husband discovered this cool outdoor adventure. Please do not hesitate to book with them. The environment is clean, peaceful, welcoming and warming. The host is a jewel. They make sure your needs are met. You have your own restroom. Your privacy and experience is their top priority. If we’re ever in Canada again, this will be my first stop. I wish them a prosperous future. 

Thank you, 
The Barnes Family
This is a peaceful and private retreat near to many attractions in the area.
Lovely location. The chickens were a big hit, and Hong was very responsive and super friendly. It was a nice place for us to relax and do nothing.
My family and I had a great time. My young sons loved visiting the chickens, hiking the short trail and roasting marshmallows over the fire. Hong was a great host. Highly recommend!

Hong is incredible and so with her husband Janson. The dome is beautifully furnished with particular attention to all the details for the best comfort and it was very clean and had all of the necessities we needed. We would definitely stay here again and would highly recommend it to others! THANK YOU, Hong and Janson!!!

description.summary: Looking for a peaceful escape from the city? Our glamping dome offers just that, situated on 10 acres of picturesque land with trail, streams, and a stunning pond view. Perfect for a romantic retreat or a weekend getaway with the family, our dome is equipped with everything you need, from upscale sanitary to fast Wifi. Relax and enjoy the starry sky from the comfort of your bed, gather around the bonfire for s'mores , or explore nearby Lake Simcoe.
description.space:
- 1 queen bed overlooking the stars
- 1 giant foam chair able to converts to a full-size bed
- Wood pellet stove capable to heat up the entire dome to 20+ Celsius easily
- Powerful portable A/C unit 
- FAST WIFI!
- You will have a full kitchenette (portable stove, mini fridge, utensils, dishes, mugs, coffee, tea, etc)*please cook outside of the dome
- 2 pairs of comfy slippers
- K cup coffee makers which capsules provided
- 3 Pcs bathroom (stand up shower, toiletries, flushing toilet, sink, towels)
- Luxury Hotel Toiletries including Aseop and  L'OCCITANE
- Tiki bar inside the pergola ,giant fireplace, BBQ and outdoor dining area.
- Homemade fire pit
-Commercial grade Mosquito Killer 
and so much more!

Note : although pet is allowed ,there is $50 fee per pet
description.access:
Guest have access to the dome, pergola ,first floor of the main building and backyard area including private forest and trail

- Lots of attractions and restaurants nearby ,10 minutes drive to major supermarkets and Costco.(recommendations will be provided in our guestbook when you checkin)

- Do you have an ATV or Snowmobile ? You can leave directly in front of your dome

- You will have a private parking in front of the driveway.
description.notes:
During summer time a good thing to bring would be bug spray, as there is mosquitos, however we do offer a large screened in pergola to be able to enjoy outside, safe from the bugs as well! :)
(in the pergola we have the  BBQ, dining area, tiki bar , seating area and running water sink)

Feel free to bring your own hockey sticks if you would like to play pond hockey on my pond. But please make sure the ice is thick enough and we could provide you the hockey gate if needed!

Snow shoes and snow grips will also be provided.

Kites ,frisbee,basketball and volleyball could also be provided if needed.

You will have your very private washroom ,but it is not inside the dome. You will have to take a 1-min walk(probably less,40m away,same as the place you checkin) ,but the plus will be ,you will have access to the common area in the main building.
description.house_rules:
REGISTERED GUESTS:Maximum capacity is 4 people – all guests must be registered on Airbnb. Visitors are allowed between the hours of 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. Guests must only invite the number of visitors by host's approval.
WOOD PELLET&FIREWOOD:As a courtesy, we provide a supply of 5 logs for the fireplace and 2 bags of wood pellet for the pellet stove per night. Because of the cost prohibitive nature of logs, additional logs can be purchased from the store or we can supply them at a reasonable cost.
SHOES:Please use the flip flops or slippers provided inside the dome, or bring your own. No shoes inside. it's fine if you want to pack the slippers away for later use.
WASHROOM:We run on septic. Please only flush toilet paper and NOTHING else. If the septic clogs during your stay, a fee may applies due to your improper use.

name: Tranquility Luxe Dome w/Hot Tub & Luxury Amenities
title: Mars Hill, North Carolina

hosts.about: Hello I am Jillian! I can’t wait for you to experience my unique & luxury properties. From glamping domes atop of an 168 acre mountain to a fisherman’s paradise waterfront in Tampa Bay. I take pride in my listings for being clean and organized. Please reach out if you have any questions I can help answer.

recent.comments: Beautiful and quiet place perfect for a romantic get ways. My wife and I had a great time to disconnect from the world. Would greatly recommend!

items.comments: Beautiful and quiet place perfect for a romantic get ways. My wife and I had a great time to disconnect from the world. Would greatly recommend!

This place is like heaven on earth. Incredibly peaceful and quiet, with views that will bring tears to your eyes. The dome is perfectly appointed, with every amenity you could want. The natural surroundings of Vero Mountain are enough to keep one occupied for days, just wandering through the forest, which is alive with benevolent wildlife, and serene vortex energy. Wish I could live there! I will definitely be back!!

It has been a great pleasure to stay at your place! Being at this peaceful place surrounded by nature was just awesome! The decoration of the place and the amenities are outstanding! I rented this as a gift for my boyfriend and I kept it as a secret and when we arrived he was in awe!!!! His was surprised when he saw his birthday cake and the champagne😄

The fast response to my messages from you guys is also a strong point. I will definitely recommend this place 100%. Two thumbs up!!!! Thank you!!!!
seriously, how many adjectives can I come up with to describe this place😊 Beautiful, Awesome, Majestic,  Breathtaking and Stunning place.
I don’t know how one goes about making a dome feel luxurious but you’ve done it! Everything about our experience was so serene.

I surprised my boyfriend with an overnight stay here, and we both loved it! It was so much fun getting to play with the baby animals down by the farm, grilling, chilling in the hot tub and bath tub, the bed was super comfy, and of course the view was amazing. There were so many little details that really made the experience like fluffy bath robes and bath salts. The weather was comfortable and we even got a hint of rain in the morning before we left, which was SO peaceful. At one point we unknowingly disturbed some bees living under the dome and I got stung, but Chris came up quickly to take care of the problem and even brought Benadryl with her. While this was a definite splurge and I wish I could afford it a bit more often, pricing is relatively fair for what you’re getting. Overall it was a fantastic experience, and my boyfriend has already decided that we’ll be returning eventually!

Hands down the best Airbnb I have ever stayed at. There aren’t enough words to describe how perfect this quaint peace of paradise was. To begin, it is by far one of the cleanest places I have stayed in. Every inch of the dome was spotless. It was so quiet and peaceful. A true break from the hustle and bustle of city life. There was bottled/sparking water, fresh eggs, coffee, and tea for our enjoying pleasure. There was also fuzzy robes, house shoes, and towels for the hot tub. The amenities in this place were endless. I appreciated the attention to detail in the dome. I felt like I was at an expensive resort. 10/10 would recommend! Do not hesitate to book this getaway.

description.summary: Recharge your energy in our Tranquility Mountain Dome! Vero Mountain is excited to share an adventure you will never forget. Feel your blood pressure go down as you breathe in fresh air and sink into the hot tub after a day of hiking. The geodesic dome promises extraordinary views whether you’re star gazing or grilling at sunset. Reset your mind and body with sunrise yoga on the expansive deck. We know you will feel as if you've been transported to a destination retreat.
description.space:
The Tranquility Mountain Dome encompasses a mix of modern luxury and Asian-inspired design. Step into the dome’s kitchenette supplying standard cooking necessities and additional features that provide the max of next-level camping. The king bed sits upon the feature wall overlooking the serene mountain range, including Mount Mitchell and Mount Pisgah. Around the corner awaits a full-size modern bathroom including a soaking tub,  private toilet room, & luxurious shower. Be comfortable at your desired temperature as the dome hosts its own thermostat-controlled air conditioning/heater, pellet stove, heated mattress pad, bath robes, luxury linens, dehumidifier, and portable a/c unit.

Please inquire for more information about our amenities for special celebrations, vacation fun, and retreat packages. We also have a farm on Vero Mountain and would love to show you around. Thelma & Louise love new visitors! Please arrange a visit to the farm to meet the animals, plus it seem like we always have baby animals arriving. Come glamp with us in our modern domes at Vero Mountain. Make sure to check out all 3 of our distinctive domes that offer a different theme and experience. You should sit in nature for 20 minutes a day. Unless you’re busy, then you should sit for an hour…
description.access: Secluded dome, dome's viewing decks, and dome's parking area
description.notes:
- 2 guest maximum per property & must be 18+ years old, guests are welcomed (max of 4) but cannot be on property during quiet hours (9PM – 7AM)
- NO PETS, please inquire about recommendations for local dog sitters
- Liability Waiver MUST be signed and returned before arrival
- 1 person at a time in soaking tub, you will be responsible for water damage
- Any guests that avoid any house rules, cause destruction or a disturbance, may be asked to leave immediately with no refund and/or incur hefty fines ($500+). All subject to owner’s discretion (Please review house rules)
- 4WD is recommended to get to Domes, but doable with 2WD
description.neighborhood:
Vero Mountain is located atop a private 158 acres oasis, including 3 geodesic domes & farm, within the city limits of Mars Hill, NC. The surrounding area offers amazing hikes, breweries, and local attractions (check out our guidebook). Located 35 minutes away from downtown Asheville, 45 minutes away from Asheville Regional Airport, and 1 mile from Wolf Laurel Community & Wolf Ridge Ski Resort. Viewable mountain ranges from the property of the Blue Ridge Parkway include Mount Mitchell & Mount Pisgah. The Appalachian Trail is accessible just a couple miles away.

We recommend stopping by the grocery store & grabbing drinking water on your way in. The nearest grocery stores are Wolf Provisions - 15 minutes  or Ingles - 20 minutes away. Downtown Mars Hill & Burnsville, both 20 minutes away offer a variety of restaurants and shopping.
description.transit: A car is needed to get to the Dome's location up the mountain on the gravel road. AWD or 4WD is recommended! Doable with 2WD but might be slightly challenging especially dependent on weather. 2 parking spaces are  available directly in front of the Tranquil Dome.
description.interaction: Host is available and nearby during stay. Please contact by phone or app before or throughout stay with any questions or in need of immediate assistance. Guests will receive information during booking and follow up information a few days before arrival.
description.house_rules:
- 2 guest maximum per property & must be 18+ years old, guests are welcomed (max of 4) but cannot be on property during quiet hours (9PM – 7AM)
- DO NOT litter or leave trash outside, especially things that may fly away/attract pests or animals
- NO PETS, please reach out to inquire about recommendations for local dog sitters
- NO PARTIES or excessive noise, please be respectful of neighbors, especially during quiet hours
- Liability Waiver MUST be signed and returned before arrival
- Security cameras on front exterior towards parking area, do not tamper with
- Any guests that avoid any of these rules, cause destruction or a disturbance, may be asked to leave immediately with no refund and/or incur hefty fines ($500+). All subject to owner’s discretion
- 4WD is recommended to get to Domes, doable with 2WD but might be slightly challenging
- No refunds due to weather, please note we have no control over mother nature, including strong winds, bugs, and animals. We do our absolute best to provide a wonderful experience and take pride in the dome’s cleanliness
- Please check out promptly at 11am, or agreed upon check out time; $50 per every 30 minutes past check out time

name: Dome L'Albatros  | Private Spa | BBQ Zone
title: Lac-Supérieur, Canada

gallery.caption: Lit queen.
Réchauffez vous près du foyer et profitez de la vue.
Accès direct au spa.

hosts.about: After 8 years of working for the Government of Canada, I decided to start a business of my own. I am now in my early 30's and love traveling and everything outdoors. This is the reason why I purchase L'Évasion BnB with is 40 acres of land to build my Glamping business. I cannot wait to host you at my property and show you the beauty and peacefulness of this northern paradise.

recent.comments: Nous avons passé un très bon week-end, très reposant. Les informations et instructions envoyée par l’Equipe L’évasion sont très claires et tres utiles. La localisation du lieu est idéale et dans un endroit très calme qui permet de profiter du paysage et de se ressourcer.

items.comments: Nous avons passé un très bon week-end, très reposant. Les informations et instructions envoyée par l’Equipe L’évasion sont très claires et tres utiles. La localisation du lieu est idéale et dans un endroit très calme qui permet de profiter du paysage et de se ressourcer.

Très belle endroit et bien situé.
J’ai adoré mon expérience dans le dôme, c’était super propre et nous avons toutes à notre disposition. L’endroit était intime et privé. J’ai adoré mon expérience.
Très bon logement comme décrit, seulement quelques taches sur les draps et un manque de serviettes

My girlfriend and I loved our get away weekend! 100% would recommend to any one who’s looking to enjoy some peace/quiet and quality time with their loved ones. 

Planning on visiting again in the future. 

Thanks for having us!

Nous avons adoré notre séjour!
Nous allons y retourner sans hésiter 
Paisible et calme 
Parfait pour un bon moment en amoureux 
Je le conseil
Super bel endroit, très propre
Très belle expérience! Endroit super bien équipé!

description.summary:
Visit our Airbnb profile to see the listings of our 6 private domes :)

Welcome to l'Évasion! 

Live a unique romantic experience in a dome under the stars. Relax in your private 4-season spa surrounded by a coniferous forest and birdsong.

★ Private 4-season spa
★  Fire pit 
★ Picnic area with BBQ
★ Hiking trail
★ Indoor gas fireplace
★ Private shower
★ Full kitchen
★ AC
description.space:
✦ The dates you are looking for are not available? Check out the other domes on our profile to see if we can accommodate you! ✦

Each unit comes fully equipped, with its bedroom with a queen bed, its full bathroom, the dining table area and the functional kitchen. This includes a mini fridge, a microwave, a cooking element, pots, plates, a kettle, a coffee maker, dishes and utensils so that you do not miss anything for your meals!

✦ The Domes are equipped with heated floors, an electric gas fireplace, as well as a heat pump that provides heat and air conditioning in summer! ✦
description.access:
Guests have access to an outdoor common area near the reception, which includes a BBQ area protected by a roof as well as a campfire area with logs.

There is no wifi in the dome, but guests have access to a connection when they are near the reception, in the common area.

The fire pit is not accessible from November to April.
description.notes:
1- The water in the dome is not drinkable, but there is a water dispenser with a filtration system beside the sink, that provides drinking water.

2- There is no cellular network or wifi in the unit. Wifi is available at the chalet at the entrance to the domain, which is a 1-minute walk away. You must therefore be near the chalet to receive the internet connection.

3- There is no television in the dome.

4- Pets are NOT ALLOWED at the dome.

6- During winter,  If you do not have a 4 wheel drive car it is recommended to park at the entrance of the domain.
description.neighborhood:
Attractions & Activities nearby:
◘ Grocery stores, convenience stores and SAQ Sélection within 20 minutes
◘ Restaurants 20 minutes away
◘ UQAM Nature Access Center 16 minutes away
◘ Mont-Tremblant National Park 27 minutes away
◘ Les Ruisseaux Golf Club 14 minutes away
◘ À l'Abordage, canoe & kayak rental, descent of the Rivière Rouge, 24 minutes away
◘ Ranch Ladouceur, horseback riding, 11 minutes away
◘ Scandinave Spa Mont-Tremblant, 23 minutes away
◘ Ski Mont-Blanc at 13 minutes, and Mont-Tremblant at 27 minutes

*LAKE*
There is no accessible lake near the chalet.

*BEACH NEARBY*

- The Saint-Faustin-Lac-Carré municipal beach, 9 minutes by car. The beach is open from June 24 to September 6 with supervision from 12 p.m. to 6 p.m., every day. The amenities of the beach are as follows: sandbox, swimming area delimited by buoys, public toilets, free parking.  Landing stage for non-motorized boats.
description.transit:
The Domain is located at:
- 1:40 from Montreal
- 2:30 from Ottawa
- 2:30 from Trois-Rivières
- 3:45 from Quebec City
description.house_rules:
* CHALET RULES *
1. All our bookings are covered by Aircover, Airbnb's protection. You can be held responsible in case of damage or non-compliance. If necessary, we will use the resolution center with photos and/or invoices.

2. Check-in can be done at any time after 4:00 p.m. The maximum time for Check-out is 11:00 a.m. You can request for a Check-in earlier than 4:00 p.m. or a Check-out after 11:00 a.m., but we cannot guarantee this request and we will be able to give you an official response only 24 hours in advance.

3. It is strictly forbidden to smoke in the chalet. Failure to comply with this rule will result in a penalty of $ 500.

4. Pets are not allowed. Failure to comply with the rules will result in a penalty of $ 500 and immediate eviction without refund.

5. Parties and excessive noise outside the chalet are not permitted. Failure to comply with this rule will result in a penalty of $ 500 and immediate eviction without refund. We have excessive noise detection systems outside the chalet.

6. If the cottage is left in a messy condition, we will charge $ 40 per additional hour per housekeeping attendant to clean up. We love when guests wash their dishes before check-out or take out the dishwasher.

7. Guests are not allowed to book our chalet directly if they do not have verified ID and a profile photo of their face on Airbnb. We do not discriminate, we just want to know who we are renting our property to.

8. Guests assume full responsibility for any accident, injury or illness occurring in the chalet. By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all customers expressly assume the risk of any damage arising from their use of the premises. Customers recognize that they can personally purchase insurance to protect themselves during such events.

9. If more guests than the number initially stated in the reservation sleep at the chalet, we will charge you $500 of penalty and we will request that the initial number of guests mentioned in the reservation be respected from then on. 

10. If you notice anything that presents a hazard that could cause damage to the place or to people, let us know immediately.

11. If you delay the work of housekeeping attendants, at the time of Check-out, you will be charged $ 50. This charge is applied to any late check-out between 11:00 a.m. and 1:00 p.m. Any guest who is still on site after 1:00 p.m. will be charged for an additional night. This does not apply if we have approved a late check out in advance.

12. When you make a reservation with us you agree to all of the above house rules.

description.summary:
***Multiple Domes Available ***
Stay on a 140 acre farm in the Smoky Mountains and get back to nature! Look out the windows at the forest, mountaintop and sky. Relax on the little porch, savor meals on the picnic table and enjoy the warm propane fire pit. Lay down in the comfy queen sized bed and drift off to sleep while watching the beauty of the night sky!
description.space:
Come visit this unique camping dome in the Smoky Mountains! See the night sky from your bed and enjoy being close to nature. This is a Glamping experience. Glamping is luxurious camping with more modern amenities like power, finished floors, beautiful views, and comfortable furnishings, but it is still camping. The domes are not insulated so it can get hot during the day in the summer and cold at night in the winter. There is an A/C and a heater in the unit, as well as a heated blanket, but similar to camping, expect the weather to be a factor.  Explore Tennessee by day and relax in your dome at night. The dome has a large bay window and several sky windows. You’ll find a barn with an apartment, a tiny house, and three other domes on the property. Inside the barn, we have indoor showers and bathrooms. There is also a mini fridge, microwave, and coffee maker available for all guests to use. Additionally, we have an outdoor shower, but it will be shut off during winter months. There is also a propane fireplace to enjoy s'mores or hotdogs at night and a picnic table to eat and prepare meals. 

PET POLICY: We are pet friendly and understand pets are part of the family. We gladly welcome our guests traveling with pets. There will be a $20 fee per stay for each pet. Pet's MAY NOT be left unattended in the dome or on the property. Guests are liable for any damages done by their animal during their stay.
description.access: Dome, porch, picnic table and propane fire pit are just for you. Park in the gravel driveway right near the dome. Showers and bathrooms are shared.
description.notes:
The dome is not insulated so it can get hot during the day in the summer and cold at night in the winter. There is an A/C unit and a heater in the dome, as well as a heated blanket, but similar to camping, expect the weather to be a factor.

Verizon and US Mobile are the only service providers that work here. We do provide Wi-fi on site. It is spotty around the property, but can be used to check email or send imessages. If you are unable to access Wi-Fi at your dome, try the guest area in the passway of the barn to access a stronger WiFi signal. 

There is no plumbing inside the domes. Bathrooms and showers are provided onsite and are shared with other guests.
description.neighborhood: Nestled in the Great Smoky Mountains, you’ll be in a quiet area where you can get away from it all. You’ll be 15 minutes from the Great Smoky Mountains National Park Cosby entrance and just 30 minutes to Dollywood. It’s also a beautiful 25-30 minute scenic drive from Historic Gatlinburg, Pigeon Forge, Sevierville, and Newport. The property is across the street from a beautiful creek and you’ll have a mountain top in your back yard.
description.transit: Pull in front of the barn and park on the gravel, about 10 yards from your dome.
description.interaction: The dome is equipped with a keypad for self check-in. We’re also very accessible via the Airbnb app, call or text.
description.house_rules: Guests must pay for any damage. No smoking in or near the dome please. Please be safe around heat and fire sources and be respectful of any other guests.

description.summary: Bee Our Guest and enjoy stunning mountain views from the large deck, or the comfort of your bed. Dome offers refrigerator, microwave, full size bed, fold out cot, bar top with seating, drinking water, wood stove, Portajohn/hand washing station, fire ring and a propane heated outdoor shower. Come to this off grid sweet escape and relax in nature’s paradise. Enjoy complete privacy, 20 minutes to Asheville, ski slopes, Blue Ridge Parkway. 1/2 mile to hiking, coffeehouse, restaurants, University.
description.space: Property is up a gravel mountain drive. Area around the dome is cleared but much of the 11 acres is wooded. 1/2 mile mountain drive does drop off in places so please use caution ⚠️. Dome is open but has a wall separating the sleep/lounge area from the kitchenette. Kitchenette includes microwave, mini fridge, mini freezer, butcher top countertop, hot/cold drinking water dispenser, kitchen supplies, dishes, and pour over coffee. Important to note is that we have upgraded to a larger wood stove to keep you warm in the coldest winter days and nights!
description.access: Guests will have access to the 1/2 mile driveway and all of the area around the dome. Total of 11 acres
description.notes:
Dome is completely off grid, runs completely off solar power. Guests can check how much power they have on the generator under the kitchen countertop by hitting the display button. Electric should be sufficient but glampers will do are responsible for using the electricity responsibly so as to not drain the battery completely. 

There is a microwave for cooking, a charcoal grill on the deck (charcoal and grill necessities included) and a fire ring for open flame cooking. There is a hammock provided for warmer days!

Please note that when temperatures dip into the teens and the single digits make sure to bring warm clothing as dome can still get a bit chilly on those nights. Also note that there is a hand washing station outside of the dome next to the port a potty however when temperatures dip into the teens and single digits the water can freeze up in the hand washing station. We do also provide hand sanitizer as a back up. In addition, the only form of heat is a wood burning stove with starters and wood provided, so it will be your responsibility to make sure that the stove keeps burning with wood as to keep the dome warm. This most likely will entail getting up at least once a night to stoke/put wood on the fire. On very hot summer days the dome can get very warm inside. We have a high powered fan and black out curtains to help but it still can get very warm. Best to utilize the outdoor space in the late morning/early afternoon hours or use this time to explore the area. There is no air conditioning. This is a Glamping experience which is between camping and a typical Airbnb experience so please plan/pack accordingly. Thanks!
description.neighborhood: Dome is completely private at the top of the mountain. 1/2 mile down the mountain driveway is a nice quiet neighborhood just 1/2 mile down the road from country cattle fields and the infamous Bailey Mountain hiking trails!
description.transit: Parking is available at the top of the mountain either above or below the dome. 4WD is not necessary for getting up the mountain,  however is necessary to park above or directly next to the dome.
description.interaction: My husband Jeremy and I are available to answer any questions and help with anything while you are staying at our Mountain getaway. You can reach us by messaging us through Airbnb.
description.house_rules: No shoes allowed in dome

description.summary: Tranquil waters and pristine beaches await when you stay at 'Stars on the Water'! Complete with a master loft, downstairs bedroom, and 2 full baths, this spacious vacation rental is the perfect home base for exploring the best of Wilmington. After a day of adventure, head back to your home-away-from-home and admire the panoramic vistas from the deck!
description.space:
Waterfront Property | Overlooking Myrtle Grove Sound

Tucked away beside sound waters, just south of Wilmington and minutes from local beaches and attractions, this exquisite dome-shaped home is the perfect romantic hideaway or private vacation spot!

Bedroom 1 (Loft): Queen Bed | Bedroom 2: Full Bed

OUTDOOR LIVING: Large deck w/ bench seating, gas grill rocking chairs, picnic table & umbrella, covered deck w/ SKY hanging chairs, hammock, beach chairs, outdoor shower
INDOOR SPACE: Dining area, fireplace, ceiling fans, bright & airy layout, stunning pottery decorations, beach-themed chessboard 
KITCHEN: Fully equipped, Keurig coffee maker, drip coffee maker, toaster oven, Crock-Pot, dishware & flatware, cooking spices, kitchen island, 4-person breakfast bar
GENERAL: 2,100 sq ft, laundry machines & detergent, central A/C & heating, free WiFi, linens & towels, cleaning essentials, hair dryer
LOFT: Fireplace, flat-screen TV, seating area, en-suite bath w/ soaking bathtub (newly installed hot water heater) & walk-in shower
PARKING: Garage (2 vehicles), Driveway (1 vehicle)
description.neighborhood:
GET OUTSIDE: Fishing on the Myrtle Grove Sound, Masonboro Island Reserve (0.1 miles, across sound), Carolina Beach State Park (5.2 miles), Freeman Park (6.9 miles), OceanFront Park and Pavilion (8.4 miles), Wilmington Riverwalk (11.2 miles), biking, paddleboarding, fishing, boating, hiking
THINGS TO DO: iEscape Rooms (5.4 miles), Carolina Beach Boardwalk (5.5 miles), Jungle Rapids Family Fun Park (9.7 miles), Fort Fisher State Historic Site (10.3 miles), North Carolina Aquarium at Fort Fisher (11.2 miles), Battleship North Carolina (12.2 miles)
GOLF: Beau Rivage Golf & Resort (3.3 miles), Club Golf Indoor (7.3 miles), Pine Valley Country Club (7.4 miles)
AIRPORT: Wilmington International Airport (14.8 miles)

description.summary:
A Geodesic Dome House in the Catskills! Fully renovated inside and out, one of the most unique properties in the area.  
Enjoy fantastic views off your deck, dine or drink nearby at The Arnold House, or shoot down the mountain into town and visit the charming Main Street shops.
description.space:
Come stay at our fully renovated 2 bedroom + Loft / 2 bathroom Dome House located in the heart of Livingston Manor.   It features a brand new full kitchen, a relaxing living-room with plenty of light and a wood stove to keep you cozy, projector upstairs in the loft when you want to relax indoors, and new bathrooms for your comfort.   

Outdoor space - the house sits quietly on the top of Shandelee Mountain with sweeping views off the yard. There is a private deck where you can BBQ, dine and relax on!  Sit around the fire with your partner or friends and enjoy the peacefulness of the property. 

If you want to cook a few meals at home, you will find a large open kitchen that is equipped with all the essentials.  There is a  dining table for 4 and plenty of other seating around the house. 

The house has 2 nice sized bedrooms with Queen beds and sitting chairs.  We also have a futon bed upstairs in the Loft area so there is plenty of room to sleep!  In addition, there are 2 brand new bathrooms 1 downstairs and 1 upstairs. 

All beds boast Sferra linens and we use only Sferra towels for your comfort!

The living area is well appointed with seating for at least 6 people. We also have a loft upstairs with extra room to hang out and a projector to watch movies or stream on - and of course,  we offer free high-speed internet for those who want to stay connected!

The Kitchen is well stocked and includes all the essentials such as:
Plates / Bowls
Coffee cups
Drinking Glasses
Martini Glasses
Wine Glasses
Stove-Top
Oven
Full-size fridge
Tea Kettle
Coffee maker with coffee, filters, and grinder
French Press
Cookware set
Frying Pan
Grill pan
Roasting Pan
Baking dishes
Serving and eating utensils
Basic cleaning supply
Basic spices (salt, pepper, garlic powder, sugar)
Toilet Paper
Paper Towels
Outdoor BBQ
Firewood

A few other things to note: 
We do not have a microwave (trying to stay as healthy as we can) .  We do not typically stock the fridge with food or drink.  We will provide you with plenty of guidance for local food shopping and dining options. 

We provide an AC unit in the living spaces and fans in the bedroom.   There is also baseboard heating throughout in the winter months.
description.notes: The Dome House is situated on a small lot with pretty views and surrounded by trees on all sides to offer good privacy.  The house does sit off of Shandelee Road which is well traveled so you will see cars driving by. The noise is limited though.
description.neighborhood: The Dome House is situated perfectly for a visit to the Catskills.  It is a 4-min drive to downtown Livingston Manor, walking distance to The Arnold House for food and drinks, and offers amazing views and scenery that you are hoping for when you visit.  It is a short drive to Callicoon, North Branch, Roscoe, Jeffersonville, Youngsville, and more!
description.transit: Uber hasn't quite made its way to our County yet, so my best advice to you is to bring a car.
description.interaction:
We will make sure you have a smooth experience from check-in to check-out. 

We strive to provide you with all you need to enjoy yourself and the surrounding area but don't worry, will not be popping by unexpectedly.

The home is yours and yours alone for however long you are with us.  Just give us a call if you need anything, we are extremely responsive and local!

Only 1 pet per visit.  Any additional needs approval by host and could result in additional costs.

No smoking. Guest will be charged the full security deposit in the event of any smoking in unit, regardless of any damages.

When we arrived there was a beautiful cake, balloons on the bed and many other goodies. The dome is very spacious. The kitchen area has everything you will need to make any meal. There was an amazing movie collection to pick from. The bathroom was extraordinary, with heated floor, amazing shower and towel warmer. The bed was huge and super comfy. We did some hiking as well visited downtown. I would highly recommend the muskoka dome, honestly I wish I lived there!
Definitely coming back again to this property!!!

The hosts were super friendly and welcoming but also not invasive. The morning sun woke us up early, but we loved watching the sunrise (and the excuse to take naps later in the day!). There were plenty of food options just a few miles away, but next time we’ll bring food and utilize the kitchen and grill! There were several activity options nearby (we chose kayaking and a distillery tour) but next time we’ll spend more time enjoying the gorgeous property. Hands down the best “camping” adventure we’ve ever had. There was more to experience than we could manage in our short weekend trip. We will definitely be back!

gallery.caption: Dome with Smoky mountain view and large parking area
Enjoy your sunsets from bed or from the cozy swinging hammock chair
Soothe your muscles after a day of scenic hiking and exploring. Bring one of the provided wine tumblers and relax
Wake up with a mountain view and head over for a warm cup of coffee from the stocked coffee bar
Enjoy a spa like shower with unlimited hot water and dual shower heads in this spacious shower.
Sit back and watch your favorite movie on the 50" TV
Prepare your favorite meals using the induction stove top (stored in cabinet) and enjoy them in the  well-stocked eclectic kitchenette

Get up early to see the vibrant hues of the sun rising over the mountains - either from bed or from the jetted hot tub.
Keep the space toasty and cozy with the propane fireplace that you can turn on from bed with a handheld remote.

hosts.about: We are traveling/glamping/adventure and tiny-living enthusiasts who have been living in our camper for over 2 years! We love romantic outdoor settings and aesthetic indoor spaces for creative photography, so we created the perfect outdoor/glamping space for other like-minded guests.

recent.comments: My husband and I loved this Airbnb. It was the perfect get away for the two of us. We can not wait to visit again!

items.comments: My husband and I loved this Airbnb. It was the perfect get away for the two of us. We can not wait to visit again!
This place was amazing!!!

If I could give this 6 stars or 10 stars I would! This place was so unique and well done that I wish we could have stayed longer. How this place is so remote and so beautiful and so clean is amazing. We loved the hot tub, and the fire pit! I just can’t say enough about what a great experience this was! Thank you for creating such an incredible and unique experience!
Beautiful air bnb! Location was perfect - quiet and peaceful. The thoughtful touches from the hosts were greatly appreciated! We would love to go back again.
10/10 recommend!! Super clean and private!! Everything was perfectly curated. The aesthetics of the whole place were just amazing! We really enjoyed the hot tub and fire pit!!
This is a one of a kind place!! Would definitely recommend and come back again!

description.summary:
Don’t just visit the mountains and find a place to stay. Enjoy a full luxury-glamping experience in a one-of-a-kind romantic geodesic dome overlooking the Smoky Mountains and make memories that will last a lifetime. 
Smoky Mtn Dome offers a private in-nature experience, equipped with a hot tub, outdoor firepit, indoor fireplace and private hiking trail to a two-person hammock with an even more stunning mountain view.
description.space:
Lay in bed at night and watch the stars through the large bay window, then wake up in the morning to a beautiful Smoky Mountain sunrise. 

Smoky Mtn Dome also features a cozy hanging hammock chair that faces out the bay window. 

This space offers the ability to be surrounded by nature, all while including the luxuries of a traditional home: AC, heat, a fireplace, a well stocked kitchenette, large living area with TV and a very spacious bath house which is also air conditioned/heated and includes a luxurious large shower with dual shower heads. 

It’s the perfect space for a couples getaway with additional space included for the kids or an extra friend or two!
description.notes:
For your comfort and convenience, we supply each guest with:
• A luxury plush robe for trips between the dome and bathhouse (while this is only a few dry, covered steps, it can get chilly)
• Coffee, creamer and sugar 
• Snacks 
• S’more’s and Marshmallow roasting supplies
• Grains
• Cooking oil and basic spices
• Oatmeal packets 
• Firewood bundles are available for purchase on property
• We also have put together a physical local attractions book within the dome featuring our own photography and experiences from all the best things to do and see locally
description.neighborhood:
Conveniently located:

• 12 miles to Great Smoky Mountain National Park
• 7.5 miles to Harrah’s Cherokee Casino
• 10 miles to Bryson City
• 7 miles to Cherokee
• 7.7 miles Dillsboro
• 8.5 miles to Sylva
• Find white water rafting 5 minutes away 

• We have a book and guide to all of the best local hiking trails leading to epic waterfalls, mountain views, alongside rivers, creeks, and fields of fresh wild picking berries to direct you during your stay! 

• 10+ microbreweries within 15 minutes, cocktail lounges, a wine bar and delicious farm-to-table dining

• 30 minutes to Maggie Valley and Waynesville
• 1 hour to Asheville
• 30 minutes to Franklin

We truly have the best of both worlds - private and remote 4.5 acres - but conveniently located less than 10 minutes from the Great Smoky Mountain Expressway.
description.transit: There is 1/3 of a mile of semi-steep to steep gravel road leading up to Smoky Mtn Dome. AWD or 4WD vehicles are highly recommended. Extreme weather conditions might make the drive difficult for non-AWD/4WD vehicles.
description.interaction: We provide our cell phone numbers and emails to text or reach us at any time during your stay.
description.house_rules:
1. No Smoking indoors
2. No parties or events
3. No food in the Hot-tub
4. Please pick up after pets
5. No unregistered visitors
6.Please don’t leave outdoor fire unattended. Put out completely when done 
7. Quiet time after 11pm
8. Please report of any damages or breakage in a timely manner
9. Please wash dishes and put any garbage in trash bin before checkout

This was everything we hoped it would be and more.  A beautiful, unique getaway with all the peace of camping with all the amenities and conveniences and comfort of a great hotel or home.  I would go back in a heartbeat and will absolutely recommend to friends and family.

Lovely way to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. Responsive host who anticipated our needs. Peaceful oasis about 30 minutes outside of Hendersonville. Watching the fireflies from the dome was magical.
We greatly enjoyed our time at the dome. Everything was just as described. It was wonderful to be able to get away for a few days.
Very nice and enjoyable.
very private. cool atmosphere

description.summary:
Nature meets luxury in this unique Glamping Experience. If you don’t see your dates available, pls check out our other dome “The Overlook.”

Enjoy the privacy of a peaceful, secluded setting, without sacrificing comfort. Relax in the hot tub or by the pond. Roast smores at the firepit at night, ( wood not provided) sleep under the stars on a king-size comfort foam bed. Connect with your surroundings without having to rough it.
description.space:
Do you really have A/C in there? Yep. And Plumbing? Definitely! Wi-Fi? Nespresso? Yessir! 

Here's what's on the inside of the 700 sq/ft space. Mini-split A/C system, gas fireplace/heater, Kitchenette w/ cooking and serving accessories (induction cooktop), complementary coffee, espresso, and tea, glassware and plates, 4.5 c/f fridge, microwave, tankless water heater, enclosed toilet room, shower, linens, blankets, toiletries, leather loveseat. 

Outdoors = pergola w/hot tub and bar seating, patio furniture, propane grill, pond w/ Adirondack chairs, and a bold stream (1-3 feet deep). We have a fire pit, but do not keep dry wood stocked so plan to bring some if you’re planning to use the fire pit. 

Note: our vision for the place is a "couples retreat", we love kiddos and pets, but we didn't design the dome to accommodate them.
description.access:
We send the access code to guests on the day of arrival. 

There are two domes on the property, this one is the larger of the 2. Guests will have use of approx 1 acre each, we have designed the space with privacy in mind. Each dome has its own private parking area, hot tub, and fire pit. Other than the driveway, you will not share anything with another guest.
description.neighborhood:
Our property is located at the end of a private drive, Just 5 miles from Chimney Rock State Park. Lake Lure is right around the corner, and the shops and restaurants of Hendersonville are about 20 minutes away. You can be in downtown Asheville in about 40 minutes (~24miles).

There are a few small convenient stores close by, but the nearest large grocery store is about 20 minutes away, so pls plan accordingly. We recommend stopping by the Ingles before you arrive. There are 2 locations... off the Hwy 64 exit if you are coming from interstate 26. Or ~2 miles off the Hwy 74 exit if you are coming from interstate 40. GPS will get you to both.
description.transit: Heads up folks... you'll be on a gravel road when you get here! Edney Inn Rd winds you through a picturesque setting of farms and vacation homes. When the pavement ends at the artist's studio, you've still got one mile to go through the woods. There are no steep roads or edge of the mountain drama, we are quite accessible for any type of vehicle. Just know you'll be off the beaten path a ways.
description.interaction: We live locally and can be on-site for emergencies. Otherwise available by phone for questions.
description.house_rules:
- Please use the flip flops or slippers provided inside the dome, or bring your own. No shoes inside.

- The property is surrounded by hundreds of acres of undeveloped mountain land. Animals live here too, and we don't want to attract them with food or garbage. Therefore, we require that NO FOOD OR GARBAGE is left outside overnight or at any point that you are not eating. 

- We don't have a TV in the dome, and no cable internet is available in the area, so our Wi-Fi is a hotspot. It works great, but has limited monthly high speed data. Please use for emails, communication, etc., not for streaming video or heavy data apps.

Thanks!

Breakfast sandwiches on the grille!

hosts.about:
Welcome to @GlampingUnplugged ... We ask our campers to "unplug." To recharge and reboot yourself through nature. Away from electronics. 

A nature infused, eco-friendly experience is what the doctor has ordered, are you willing to step a few feet outside of your comfort zone? 

"Nature Needs No Hype." TIME TO GLAMP!

recent.comments: Not really private, the other dome is only about 100 yards away so we could see and hear them during our stay. We had to be aware that our dog didn’t venture to far to their side and we weren’t too loud while grilling in the mornings. Flooring of the dome was coming disconnected and bubbling up. The charger box that was supplied was only charged to around 20% and died within the first 12 hours of our stay so we couldn’t recharge any of the lights or fans. Overall, it wasn’t a bad stay, but I do not think it was completely as advertised.

items.comments: Not really private, the other dome is only about 100 yards away so we could see and hear them during our stay. We had to be aware that our dog didn’t venture to far to their side and we weren’t too loud while grilling in the mornings. Flooring of the dome was coming disconnected and bubbling up. The charger box that was supplied was only charged to around 20% and died within the first 12 hours of our stay so we couldn’t recharge any of the lights or fans. Overall, it wasn’t a bad stay, but I do not think it was completely as advertised.

Really enjoyed out stay at the Treehouse Dome. Very peaceful and serene aside from a passing car every now and then but it wasn't a problem. The site is somewhat close to a country road but again, not an issue in my opinion. The dome gets a bit warm during the day (to be expected, just like any regular camping tent would) but cools off quickly once the sun starts to set. Overall, great stay and would certainly visit again.

Gorgeous river setting. Peaceful and many areas to rest and chill, either by the water in rocks or hammocks, rocking chairs or hammocks in the deck overlooking the creek or by the fire. Almost like camping with a few pluses, and no worries if it rains or downtime setting up and down tents!

The kids (3 and 7) really enjoy the creek, swimming or lounging in sandy spots, or climbing the small water fall by the bridge. Lots of nearby attraction and hikes.
WE LOVED THIS EXPERIENCE! Hands down, 10/10, don’t hesitate! Host was very helpful and friendly. We are already planning another trip to stay here!!

Fantastic place. That stream/creek is the perfect size for swimming and laying on rocks. The little bridge had a great swimming hole beside it. In the FAQ/document about the check in and amenities there were just small things that were off. There does seem to be some kind of leak or water damage happening in the first dome. There were no paper towels. I brought some anyway. There were also three or four air fresheners that were very strong with synthetic held perfume/chemical smell. This triggered a really bad migraine and then later an asthma attack with my partner. We really would’ve preferred to know ahead of time and had them taken out. We did remove them for our stay and put them back on the shelves when we left, the linens were great. The pillows were awesome. The fire pit is great. There is a broken chair beside the fire pit that was broken from when we arrived. So we moved furniture from the deck to the fire pit.

The pictures do not reflect the lack of  maintenance. The property needs to be cared for. The dome was dirty and smelled like cigarettes. The toilet was very smelly in the location it was in. The bunk bed was broken and not stable for the kids to sleep in. The trash can was broke inside . The property was amazing with the creek and waterfalls. It just needs to be kept up if it is being rented out. It looks like at one time it was a priority but not any more. 😞
We had a wonderful stay. The fishing was a bust that day, but we still had a good time. The place is beautiful and very relaxing.

description.summary:
Primitive glamping-camping in Boone NC is Tree House HOT! Gram-worthy, nature-immersive, eco-friendly experience: @glampingunplugged

Huge bay window, 2 built-in cargo net hammocks (one OVER the creek!), king bed + bunks, fire pit, lighting, 8+ acres (shared w/ 2 domes) & trout stream.

No WiFi. No plumbing. No electricity. NO PROBLEM! We thought of everything! Next level primitive camping experience.

365 Year-Round Camping:  Winter Igloo, anyone? Unplug to Recharge!

Pet Fee $25.
description.space:
Glamping Unplugged is primitive camping at an unprecedented level. And we did not spend a mint on this steel dome to disappoint! We have created a space for your much-needed digital detox on a beautiful tract of land that allows for privacy, unlike any other campground.  Immerse yourself in nature and unplug ... step a few inches outside of your comfort zone and you will thank us later. 

Can we camp in the winter? Yes, a tent stove is provided plus we have insulated the floor and the tent walls! Light a fire and expect a cozy stay!

Arrive to a king bed + bunks with cozy clean sheets over a noisy state-stocked trout stream.  A high-end cooler is your fridge. A state park steel grill is your kitchen.  USB powered lighting and power chargers are provided in addition to linens, pillows, towels and toilet paper.  There are screens for the windows. We provide moist biodegradable towelettes for deodorizing and cleaning your body (or take a dip in the stream!) and, of course, there is a private port-o-toilet.

“Everything works better when you unplug it for a little while ... including yourself.”

Help us craft the best experience for future guests, share photos with us for social media: @glampingunplugged & we will maybe refund accordingly,  'grandfather you in," discount a future stay and/or become part of the Unplugged family!

We provide a multi-page F.A.Q. immediately after you book that delves deep into the experience to make sure we are exactly what you are looking for!

We are pet friendly with a $25 pet fee (breed restrictions & pre-approval required).
description.access:
We require that you park just off a state-maintained road and hike 100 yards down a relatively level path and then up steps to your Dome.  You will then have your private deck with chimney, rockers & grill, as well as, 8.5 acres, 1200+ feet of creek frontage for your family to unplug, recharge and enjoy, shared by only 2 other Domes!

Go explore!  Go Unplug!
description.notes: Once you reserve, you will reserve a multi-multi page FAQ sheet to confirm that this experience is right for you!
description.neighborhood:
We chose the land because it is on a popular, state-stocked trout stream.  Outfitters have been sneaking onto your land and using it as their go-to fishing hole with clients for years!  We look forward to your exploring the land and making mountain camping memories. 

This land is meant to be shared: 1200+ feet of creek frontage, the HUGE 3-story wall of rocks across the creek from the Dome, the cave, the swimming and fishing holes and the waterfalls.  We have created a spot you can stay at for days, perfect for the "unplugged" experience. Keep an open mind and simply go with the unplugged, eco-friendly experience!

Deep Gap is located next to Boone NC, the center of the High Country.  Location, location, location! Only 8 miles from the Blue Ridge Parkway, our closest major waterfall is Cascades Trail, just off the Parkway in Purlear. 10 mins to Food Lion, 15 minutes into Boone.
description.transit: You will need a car to get to the property, but while on property, you will be on foot!  We do NOT permit cars over the bridge.  Parking is about 100 yards from your front step, its an easy walk and is an intricate part of the build up of anticipation! Pack accordingly! Bring Your Own Water. A cart is supplied for you to bring what gear you have up to your glampsite!
description.interaction:
CONTACTLESS ENTRY! We are remote, we are purposefully unplugged, please do not expect a cell signal.

We are available via airbnb app and cell phone when you have service - please read our FAQ in full before arriving to plan accordingly!  

Glamping Unplugged's cleaner/caretaker lives in Boone (15 minutes) if you need something important, otherwise, you are camping, go with the flow!
description.house_rules: Cargo Nets + Tent Stove MAY Make This an Unsafe Environment for Small Dogs and Kids. Please use good judgment!!!

items.comments:
Great place really enjoyed our stay…..
Bit unpaved road so an SUV would be a sensible option to drive.

Great, unique stay at the dome! Set up was awesome, you could see the trees and the stream from the bed. Everything was clean, bed was super comfortable, all the amenities we could need for an overnight stay. We were able to unplug, see stars, and relax. Communication from the host was great, all the instructions clear. Great place to get away
Amazing spot to unplug for a weekend. The place was extremely clean and had everything needed. Super close to chimney rock state park, which was a fun day activity. Would definitely come back.
Everything was on point

This place was a great. Unfortunately, the Wi-Fi didn’t work and we had no mobile service during our stay. I assure you, this turned out to be quite the positive. Also, I’ve read reviews about bug issues… that wasn’t what we experienced. It was quite nice but let’s be honest here, though it is hard to believe during a stay here, this is still camping…

Listing was exactly as described. Location is about 10 min from Chimney Rock and 30-40 min from Asheville. 

I thought I would enjoy relaxing by the river or the pond, but naive me forgot that it was the dead of summer and there are tons of flies and mosquitos that will chase you this deep in the mountains so I spent most of the time inside the some when I was there. I think the owners recognize this as an issue and made sure to include a good amount of citronella candles around the property to help. The bugs don't take away from the beauty of the place, but I think I personally would've enjoyed the place more during winter when bugs are not there and when winter has enough of a cold bite to make you not want to leave the hot tub.

The dome was clean and was nicely well stocked with amenities if you forgot to bring a toothbrush, toothpaste, tampon, hairdryer and etc.

Hosts were easy and quick to communicate with and brought tiki fuel the next day when our torches ran out of fuel.
Great off the grid place to stay. I don’t think I have ever stayed in a more comfy bed in my life.

Our stay at the dome was absolutely perfect! It was a peaceful, relaxing, magical atmosphere inside and out. The furniture outside was so peaceful and inviting. I’d give it 10 stars if I could. We didn’t want to leave. And we can’t wait to come back.

description.summary:
Mohican Hideaway is the perfect getaway to experience nature with all the luxurious amenities.
- Open year-round—heat & AC
- Located on 7 secluded acres
- Direct access to the Mohican River
- Private hot tub 
- Fully furnished patio with fire pit
- Fully equipped kitchenette
- Projector with Roku for streaming
- CellularWIFI 
- Luxury bathroom 
- Scenic views of the forest and river
- Paved parking area
- 1.6 miles from the Bridge of Dreams/Mohican Valley Trail
- 5.6 miles from downtown Danville
description.space:
Mohican Hideaway is an eco-luxury glamping dome nestled in the foothills of Brinkhaven, Ohio. Whether a romantic getaway or cozy family retreat, the dome is ideal for everyone.

The dome features a queens size bed with a panoramic view overlooking the forest with glimpses of the Mohican River and a cozy loft with a double bed (the loft area requires a short climb up a secured ladder for access). Adding to the atmosphere is a large projector that is viewable from both beds making the space twice as cozy and perfect for watching movies on those rainy days. A kitchenette and dining area fully equipped to make almost any meal—ideal for a romantic weekend in the woods. The space also includes a full luxury bathroom with shower and locally sourced toiletries, desk space, and a small pantry area. 

In addition to the luxurious interior, the exterior boasts a spacious furnished patio with a hot tub, multiple seating areas, outdoor fire pit and a dual charcoal/propane grill. The property is 7 acres with 2 large fields and a small forest guests can explore. 

WIFI:
Based on our location we have limited wifi options. We have cellular wifi and experience outages on occasion. Please keep this in mind when booking. We cannot predict when these outages happen or provide any alternative when they do happen. 

**Starting late spring/early summer 2023 - we will have a second dome on property available for other guests to book. The domes are completely separate. Each has its own private patio, hot tub, fire pit and grill area. We have them spaced apart a good distance and installed a privacy fence between them for extra guest privacy. The domes/guests share the parking area, laundry center, pathway, riverfront access and other parts of the property (woods/fields). Keep in mind our property is 7 acres and has plenty of space and privacy even with two dome. Please respect the other guests privacy and do not go in the vicinity of the other dome as we do ask the same from them. 

Check our social channels for the official launch date of the second dome. 

If interested in booking domes together please send us a message through airbnb for select group rates and availability.

RIVER: 
The riverfront is a short 1/4 mile walk from the dome and has a kayak/canoe landing area. For guests who bring a kayak/canoe we have (1) kayak/canoe cart to help make the trek to the river a more pleasant experience. 

Greer landing is located a short 7-10 min. drive and is the ideal place to drop in and float down the river, landing back at Mohican Hideaway. 
FROM GREER LANDING: 
- Tubing (3-3.5 hours)
- Kayak/Canoeing (1-1.5 hours)

Guests have access to the laundry center which includes a washer and dryer, folding table, clothes rack to hang wet clothing and outdoor spigot with hose.
description.access:
Entire space, river access and laundry center plus 7 acres of property to explore. Please make yourself at home and respect the property lines (noted with signage) as well as other guests staying on-site when exploring. The laundry center and other parts of the property outside the private dome space/patio may have other guests—please respect other guests privacy and do not go near the vicinity of the other dome as we ask the same from them. 

PARKING: A small paved area is available to park up to 4 vehicles. 
*Please note the driveway is steep. *Area shared with other guests.

PATHWAY:
The dome is located a short walk from the parking area (approx. 350 ft) and has a slight decline at the end of the pathway toward the dome. Please Bring appropriate shoes for the weather (rain, snow, etc.). *Area shared with other guests.
description.notes:
DRIVING: The route to the property include scenic countryside views and dirt roads—especially the last .5 miles. Please take extra care when driving to our property.

CELL PHONE SERVICE:
Cell phone service on the drive to the property can be sporadic. Cell phone service does work on the property for select carriers—Verizon and sprint. Any other carriers we cannot confirm in full at this time but we do offer wifi inside the dome. 

WIFI:
Based on our location we have limited wifi options. We have cellular wifi and experience outages on occasion. Please keep this in mind when booking. We cannot predict when these outages happen or provide any alternative when they do happen. 

ACCESSIBILITY:
The dome is located a short walk from the parking area (approx. 350 ft) and has a slight decline at the end of the pathway toward the dome. Please Bring appropriate shoes for the weather (rain, snow, etc.).

FIREWOOD: 
Firewood is available to purchase at the BP in Danville along US-62 in town. 

STEPS:
The dome has 1 step to enter the dome. 
The bathroom also has 1 small step to enter. 
Hot tub has 2 steps and a step-over-side entry. 

Located on the ground level:
- Bathroom (Single step entry)
- Queen bed
- Kitchenette
- Dining Area
- Pantry
- Desk
*All areas EXCEPT the loft are located on the ground level 

LOFT: Second level. Loft has a permanent loft ladder for access with 7 rungs (8ft)  - must be able to climb ladder to access loft.

SEVERE WEATHER: In the event of severe weather its important for guests to know that our dome is rated for hurricane force winds and the frame itself is very strong. The dome frame/structure is designed of inter-connected triangle frame parts that give it unparalleled strength should anything fall on the dome and the frame is completely bolted to the cement foundation making it secured. Our bathroom inside the dome has a steel frame making is the best place to take shelter during severe weather.  We do not recommend guests leave the property during severe weather, rather take shelter in the bathroom until the weather has passed.
description.neighborhood: Rural countryside of central Ohio.
description.transit:
You will need a vehicle if you plan to explore the local area. 
PLEASE ADVISE, during winter months AWD or 4WD is strongly recommended. We have a steep driveway and many gravel roads in the area.
description.interaction: We are available via phone or messaging in the app. You will be able to self check-in upon arrival.
description.house_rules:
Please take extra care of our dome. It is made out of a material that can be damaged if punctured. We kindly ask you do not lean/push on or damage the front window area. We love our dome and hope you will love it too. 

CLEANING FEES: 
If the check out list is not completed and the dome is left in a state that requires additional cleaning a $50 additional cleaning fee will be charged. This includes but is not limited to: Stains on linens/towels, broken/damaged items, items not put away inside or outside, covers left off of patio furniture, wet patio furniture from not putting covers on overnight, 

HOT TUB: If the hot tub and/or cover has damage, is extremely unclean or has had ANY PRODUCT placed into it during the stay a $150 fee will be charged for a deep clean/refill. 

** If you are not able to complete any items on the check out list please message us immediately so we are aware. We do understand some circumstances will not allow for certain items to be completed and we will work with you if you simply message us. If we do not receive a message and items are not complete you will be charged the stated fee above. 

LATE CHECK OUT FEE:
If you do not check out at the noted time (11 am) a late check out fee of $20 will be charged. We have a very tight cleaning schedule between guests and our cleaning staff arrives promptly after each stay at 11:10 am. 

RESERVATION ALTERATIONS:
Alterations to reservations MUST BE MADE 7+ days prior to check-in. Any alterations requested less than 7 days prior to check in will be declined. 
**With the exception of updating the number of guests staying.

hosts.about: Tiny Escapes was founded in 2018 by wife and husband co-founders, Bryanna and Stanley, with a vision of curating unique luxury tiny home experiences. Our mission is to create one-of-a-kind nature immersion experiences for the adventurous individual that support a deep connection with nature and a smaller footprint on the planet. To date, we have designed, built, and shared 5 unique tiny homes and have plans for several more in the future!

description.summary: As featured on A&E’s Living Smaller (Episode 8), the Tiny Geopod offers a unique and upscale experience for the nature loving adventurer. Have it both ways with a retreat in nature & a 5 minute walk to historic Todd or 20 min drive to Boone & W.Jefferson. Enjoy the Tiny Pod and outdoor spaces with hot tub, fire table, gazebo and comfy outdoor furniture. Cook in the Pod's outdoor kitchen (NOTE: kitchen modified during winter) or grill. Relax & refresh while experiencing the joy of tiny living!
description.space:
The Tiny Geopod was designed and built with the vision for simple yet comfortable living that supports a deep connection with nature and a smaller footprint on the planet. The meticulously designed 130 square foot Tiny Geopod makes use of every inch and lacks for nothing.

With the small interior footprint, the majority of the space is dedicated to three truly magical outdoor areas. The outdoor main deck is equipped with a breakfast bar area, gas fire pit, and seating area to relax and enjoy nature in. The second outdoor space brings you even further among the trees, accentuating the winter views of the mountains. Read a good book, take a nap, or enjoy the view of the trees while relaxing on the outdoor patio furniture or relax in the hot tub after a nice day of hiking. The third space is a unique outdoor kitchen (Note: this space is partially functional during winter - see details below) and bathroom space. Cook delicious meals on the cute small gas stove top or grill to your heart's content on the stainless 3 burner gas grill. You can expect to see birds, deer, and other wildlife about while you enjoy the outdoors.

The Tiny Geopod itself was built with all the essentials and packaged into a cozy, comfortable, and retreat-like space. With an emphasis on sustainability, the Geopod is powered from the nearby community solar garden and guests can reduce waste by recycling and composting on the property. A well equipped kitchen (Note: details on modified partially functional kitchen during winter/late spring below),  unique high end bathroom, convertible working/dining area, and a comfy sleeping space with cozy sheets are a few of the features. Use the high speed wifi to watch a movie on your laptop or tablet while relaxing after a day of exploring. A coffee and tea bar, along with  shampoos/soaps are just a few of the other amenities provided.

Note on modified kitchen (during winter/ early spring when freezing temps occur):  The kitchen faucet will be shut off during this time but water can be obtained from the sink in the fully functional heated bathroom. During this time, disposable plates/cutlery will be provided and the grill, with provided grilling tools, can be used for cooking. A French coffee press, water kettle, and coffee/creamer/sugar will also be provided. You YOU WILL NOT HAVE ACCESS TO POTS OR PANS for the stove since there isn't a good way to wash them.
description.access: Guests will have PRIVATE access to the whole Tiny Geopod, the kitchen/bathhouse, and the patio area with hot tub, gazebo, and 2 fire tables
description.notes:
LOCATION: The Geopod is located on an approximately 3 acre plot of land with 2 other tiny house rentals that can be booked separately or, depending on availability, can be rented together. We emphasize privacy and have set up each home to maximize guest seclusion and minimize visibility of the properties from each other. Also to note, the Geopod is located in close proximity to NC 194, a lightly traveled paved road with occasional traffic. Guests should be aware that they will hear the occasional car pass by.

ACCESSIBILITY: To reach the Tiny Geopod, you must climb up the steps from the parking spot and follow the approximately 150 foot pathway to your tiny destination. 

HEATING/COOLING: The Tiny Geopod is equipped with central ducted heating and cooling as well as dedicated small additional heaters. However, please be aware that the Pod is not insulated like regular houses and will not heat and cool as well. Please be prepared with warm clothing in the winter!

KITCHEN: Unfortunately, the kitchen sink will be closed during winter/early months to avoid freezing pipes. but water can be obtained from the sink in the fully functional heated bathroom. During this time, disposable plates/cutlery will be provided and the grill, with provided grilling tools, can be used for cooking. A French coffee press, water kettle, and coffee/creamer/sugar will also be provided. You YOU WILL NOT HAVE ACCESS TO POTS OR PANS for the stove since there isn't a good way to wash them.

PARKING: You will have one dedicated parking space for your use during your stay. If you have another vehicle or are towing a trailer, you can park it across the street in a large pullout.
description.neighborhood: Whatever you’re in the mood for, you will find it nearby. Historic downtown Todd is only a 10-minute drive, where you will find live music in the summer, the famous Todd Mercantile, and locals and tourists hanging out. RiverGirl Fishing Company and the New River are also located in downtown Todd and offer fishing, biking, kayaking, and tubing. Just a 17-minute drive from the cabin is Elk Knob State Park with miles of hiking, biking, jogging, exploring, and a stunning view at the top. Appalachian Ski Mtn, the Blue Ridge Parkway, ziplining, golfing, hunting, and countless hiking trails are within 30 minutes of the property. Grandfather Mountain, many more hiking trails and countless wineries are within an hour's drive. It really is the best of both worlds with city life and nature readily accessible.
description.transit: You can walk to downtown Todd in 5 minutes or less or drive to Boone or West Jefferson in approximately 20 minutes. The Geopod is located off of NC 194 South, a lightly traveled road with occasional traffic. NC 194 South is a famous biking road and it takes approximately 1 hour to bike to Boone or Jefferson.
description.interaction: Guests will have the whole place to themselves but can reach out with any questions via AirBnb messaging
description.house_rules:
Quiet hours after 9pm. Please remove shoes at door.

DO NOT PLACE HOT POTS/PANS directly on wood countertops or tables (this will cause burn damage!!).

ABSOLUTELY NO SMOKING inside or near the Geopod. You will be charged a $500 smoke removal fee if any smoke smell is detected.

ABSOLUTELY NO PETS! Our insurance policy does not cover pets so we unfortunately have to be strict with our no pet rule. A $100 pet fee will be charged if any pet hairs or other evidence are found inside the property, in addition to any damage fees.

description.summary: Welcome to Treetop Getaway! Escape to your own enchanting oasis, nestled high among the trees in this stunning dome retreat! Situated on a private 14 acres with a stream running through the middle of the property, this luxurious and cozy hideaway offers the perfect setting for relaxation, reconnection, and rest. Book now and treat yourself to an unforgettable experience filled with comfort, natural beauty, and cherished moments. We can't wait to host you!
description.space:
Ascend the staircase onto the huge deck overlooking the forest, and immediately feel the sensation of being in the trees!  Step inside the dome and be captivated by the soaring ceiling, stylish design, and cozy ambiance. The open living space allows for seamless interaction between guests, making it perfect for couples, friends, or small families. The dome's windows allows natural light to flood the interior, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere.

Unwind in the hot tub while the string lights create a magical atmosphere. As evening falls, gather around the crackling fire pit and share stories under the starry night sky; a perfect way to bond with loved ones and create lasting memories. The true highlight is the vast deck offering breathtaking views of the surrounding landscape, making it an ideal spot for morning coffee, evening drinks, or simply to bask in the beauty of nature.

You'll Love...
-4 person hot tub
-Unforgettable views
