description.access: You' have full access to the entire property including the 14 acres
description.notes: The driveway is gravel, and is a bit steep in a few places, however we have not had anyone get stuck. In case of snowy or icy conditions, AWD or 4x4 is required to access driveway. If you dont feel comfortable, you can always park on the side on the road and walk to the dome, it is about an 800ft driveway.
description.neighborhood: The Dome is located on a secluded 14 acres with a beautiful stream running through the middle of the property. There are other homes in the area so please be mindful of excessive loud noise at night

name: Serenity Dome, 20 Minutes From Downtown.
title: Fairview, North Carolina

hosts.about: I am a energetic person who loves their community! Also a small business owner.

recent.comments: Absolutely love our time at the Serenity Dome. Being immersed in nature and completely off the grid was very appealing and a completely surreal experience. Justice was fantastic and a pleasure to communicate with and gave incredible recommendations on local excursions. I cannot recommend this experience enough!

items.comments: Absolutely love our time at the Serenity Dome. Being immersed in nature and completely off the grid was very appealing and a completely surreal experience. Justice was fantastic and a pleasure to communicate with and gave incredible recommendations on local excursions. I cannot recommend this experience enough!

We stayed there for 2 nights and ended up having a great experience! The dome is the middle of a forest which makes it very private and peaceful. The inside of the place was very clean and had a good vibe to it. Be aware there are many little bugs outside of the dome since we’re in nature but none of them were really something to worry about. Everything works just fine, the grill, microwave, mini refrigerator. Also one thing that surprised us was how cool the inside of the dome was, since we went during summer we assumed that it would be hot be it really wasn’t, on the first night we were quite of cold during our sleep witch was nice hahah. But anyways I very well recommended! Justice is a very nice host and waited for us outside on our check-in witch was very welcoming.
Such a peaceful and creative space. The best part was the moon shining through the dome ceiling in the middle of the night 😌

This place is a hidden gem! Located not too far from Black Mountain and Downtown Asheville, this place allowed us to have the absolute best girls trip! My mother and I will for sure be returning. The tranquility and the relaxation that this place offers is truly unmatched. The host, Justice, was also fantastic. He replied within minutes of every inquiry and even gave us a few goodies from his garden to enjoy.  Book this place asap, you won’t regret it! :)

Justice’s place was so fun for my bf and I! We felt very safe and had so much fun building fires and grilling out. Not to mention the bed was so comfortable and the views were beautiful! Very convenient to downtown as well.

The dome was great!  The outside solar string lights and mushroom lights were a beautiful touch to see when it got dark.  We especially liked watching the darkness turn to dawn from the bed in the dome.  The bed was very comfortable.  Instructions on how to manage everything was accessible and Justice responded very timely when I reached out.  Had a great experience!

The overall experience was amazing. Love how eco friendly the place is and every detail well thought.
Recommended for those who need or want to be off the grid for a few days.

description.summary:
A secluded dome immersed in the sounds of the blue ridge mountains. A location that cant be matched for a total disconnect.
The 10FT wide bay viewing window showcases how beautiful a crisp mountain sunrise can be, at night the 5FT viewing window at the top of the dome is perfect for stargazing while in bed. Kick your feet up at one of the two fire pits or swing in the hammock. The dome features two outdoor patios ,microwave, Keurig, minifridge, instant tankless hot water, shower, sink and toilet
description.space:
Serenity is a complete off grid dome and is completely environmentally friendly. 100% solar powered and spring water fed. The solar battery reserves provide more than enough power to keep all the amenities going for as long as you need them! Guests will have the entire space with complete privacy with zero noise pollution just the sounds of nature. 

Give us a follow on IG @serenity_domeavl

The following are fantastic places to visit during your stay!

-Hickory Nut Gap Farm ~ 10 minutes (7.5 miles)
-Smokey And The Pig BBQ ~ 10 minutes (7 miles)
-Blue Ridge Parkway ~ 13 minutes (10 miles)
-Downtown Asheville ~ 20 minutes (15 miles)
-The Biltmore Estate ~ 28 minutes (17 miles)
-Chimney Rock/Lake Lure ~ 30 minutes (15 miles)
description.access: Guest will have access to the entire space.
description.neighborhood: the neighborhood is very relaxed,. while at the dome one car may pass or none at all! there is only one house past the dome so there is hardly ever any cars going by. while at the dome you will not see any houses.
description.transit: Private parking
description.house_rules:
If you burn any incense, smoke cigarettes  or vape in the dome it goes against house rules. The fee is $500. 


Drinking water is bottled only.  Water provided on property is from a natural spring, while is is great for showering it is not suited for drinking. 

Please no plug in heaters, or plug in machines of any type. 
The red and black tote houses the solar electrical equipment please do not touch. 
The dome is solar powered and has ample power reserves. But in the event of prolonged cloud cover/ bad weather will impact how much energy is brought in/stored.

name: The Japandi Dome
title: Durham, North Carolina

Eating and living area overlooking the large dome window and skylight. Optional curtains for privacy.

hosts.about: I feel blessed time and time again with love, inspiration, and all the beautiful, precious little things that pop into my life. My wife and kids mean more to me than any fancy car or esteemed career. I now spend my working hours hoping to inspire others to enliven their spirit and get in touch with the deep, profound love available in this life. If you stay with us, I hope you leave with a greater sense of zest and gratitude for life.

I love the simple things, being outdoors with my 10/10 hubby, our mischievous toddler, and our hound/lab mix, crafting, baking, and trying my hand at sourdough making. I love to travel and meet people from different places, though most days you'll find me at home with our 6 chickens, garden, and the geodesic dome we built. One day I may really achieve the cottagecore homestead life I love learning about!

recent.comments: Marina and Gene’s dome exceeded our expectations. We stayed here after our elopement and her kind words and attention to detail meant the world to us. Plus, nothing beats her pistachio and chocolate chip scones! Hope everyone traveling to Durham or just looking for a staycation makes it here - it’s like a little slide of heaven.

items.comments: Marina and Gene’s dome exceeded our expectations. We stayed here after our elopement and her kind words and attention to detail meant the world to us. Plus, nothing beats her pistachio and chocolate chip scones! Hope everyone traveling to Durham or just looking for a staycation makes it here - it’s like a little slide of heaven.
Great recommendations had a great time
Great stay, great host, great scones. Loved the fire pit and the sound of the rain.

This place was magic and way over my expectations! Marina is a super host, always attentive and available. The dome is beautiful, and you can feel at home with all the nice details around the house. Atmosphere at sunrise and sunset is unbeatable! Lovely place!
A real escape with an amazing and expansive interior that gives you an immersion to nature.  A real treat to relax and focus!

My wife and I loved our stay at the Japandi dome! We were thrilled to find homemade scones waiting for us upon arrival and really enjoyed playing the hygge game that was there. The dome is a beautiful and unique place to stay with a nice view of the property, trees overhead, and night sky. If you're into unique homes, definitely give this place a try!
I loved the aesthetic. The bathroom was so nice, the decor was amazing, and I loved the games that were in there. The amenities were cool and overall a great place to spend the weekend.

description.summary: Experience a taste of Japandi in this glamping dome experience. Enjoy this unique space on our private property that feels like a piece of countryside near the city, and experience the mind and body benefits of being closer to nature with the comforts of indoor amenities. Complete with heating and A/C, full zen-inspired bathroom, memory foam mattress & luxury European duvet. Enjoy your meal around a Japanese inspired floor table with straw mats and meditation cushion for seating.
description.space:
This 415 sq/ft space includes: Mini-split A/C system, Kitchenette with basic preparation accessories (cutting board, knives, utensils), complementary coffee (Nespresso and pour over carafe), tea kettle and tea bar, glassware and a set of homemade pottery bowls, plates, and mugs, 3.1 c/f fridge and freezer, microwave, shower, shower essentials, towels, blankets. Private outdoor lounging area with natural stone firepit and adirondack chairs overlooking a meadow. Plan to bring wood if you desire to use the fire pit; you are also welcome to collect any available wood on our property.

Say hi to our friendly roaming chickens!
description.access: We send a code to each guest on the day of arrival, and will send additional check-in details about the Dome. Guests may check in anytime after 4pm. We will have a private driveway dedicated to your parking.
description.notes:
Our space is geared primarily as a couples retreat and for solo travelers. We love kiddos and pets, but our property features were not designed to accommodate them, so we cannot allow either children or pets for overnight stays at this time. Thank you for understanding this. 

Guests should have no problem getting cell phone coverage with providers within the dome due to full wifi coverage, but signal may be spotty outside of this space (AT&T seems to have the best coverage overall in this area regardless of wifi connection).

The Surrounding Area
We are nestled in a beautiful area close to Hillsborough, Durham, and Chapel Hill. Located 15 minutes from Downtown Hillsborough and the lively 9th St of Durham, and 17 minutes to downtown Durham, there is not a shortage of options in the area. If looking for beautiful trails, go no further than the Eno River and Brumley Nature Preserve 7 minutes away. 

Inspiration behind the Design
Japandi, known for its natural fusion of Japanese and Scandinavian design, includes the use of organic materials, natural light, and a beautiful but functional interior to create a calming and cozy space. The Japanese element is influenced by “wabi-sabi”, a concept of embracing imperfection and impermanence. The Scandinavian element incorporates “hygge” (pronounced hyoo guh), which brings in the element of coziness, well-being, and contentment with loved ones.

We hope for our dome to be a rejuvenating space for couples and individuals, to awaken the spirit and to help one reconnect with the natural world and one another.
description.neighborhood: Set in a rural neighborhood with a countryside feel.
description.interaction: We live onsite within the main house, and will be accessible most times to offer support as needed during your stay. Messages to us work best, and we'll try to respond as soon as possible!
description.house_rules:
No parties please, we live in a rural neighborhood and especially as this is a dome, sound really does travel. Please respect our neighbors.
Please do not bring children (ages 0-12). As much as we love them, the space was not created to accommodate them.

Jordan a été super convivial avec nous et il était super réactif lorsqu’on avait des questions à lui poser et il a même offert une compensation lorsqu’un a eu un petit problème mineur donc je le recommande vraiment!Ce logement est un vrai petit coin de paradis tranquil, bien aménagé et on y retournerait avec plaisir.

The open shower is great and clean. It has almost everything that you would need, basic utensils etc. The only problem was we didn’t take any rain coats or umbrella. It would be great if it was onsite! But also, our bad that we didn’t really check the weather beforehand. Overall great experience! Jordan was very responsive and friendly! Definitely recommend!
Good place to visit.

description.space:
The Canopy is off grid and runs electricity from a battery bank, this will be enough for lights and charging a couple of devices. There is a compostable toilet for the dome exclusively and a shared outdoor shower stall on the property. 
The property is a mature forest where you will find much nature and wildlife. You can explore anywhere you’d like while respecting the privacy of neighbouring units and marked property borders
description.access: Guests may access all areas of the property
description.notes:
The property is located on a dirt road surrounded by forest. I recommend arriving your first night while it is light out to navigate and become familiar with the area. Due to covid 19 linens are not provided and guests should bring their own (bed sheets, towels etc.,)

For Winter glamping: Snow tires are a must, AWD is definitely an asset.
description.neighborhood: Situated between three lakes, and right across from Sir Sam’s ski and mountain biking - there are tonnes of activities year round. Also located minutes away to groceries and 15 minutes to the town of Haliburton where there are shops and restaurants.
description.transit: Parking is at the top of the property, the dome is located approximately 50m back from the parking. This is a live forest, please use caution while walking trails and staying here especially during storms.
description.interaction: I am around on some days doing work on other parts of the property. You can always reach me by phone.
description.house_rules:
Smoking outdoors only, leave unit in a cleanly matter and respect the land. Due to covid-19 please bring your own linens.

Property has multiple units, and some shared outdoor spaces, please respect the privacy of other guests.

There is an outdoor shower with shared access, and each unit has their own private compostable toilet. Battery/Solar power available for minimal usage (lights, charging phone). Candles supplied in the event you use up the battery power. 

Road to property is unpaved and best to navigate for your first night while light out.

There will be periodic work ongoing at a neighbouring unit some days between the hours of 9am-5pm.

hosts.about: Tiny Escapes was founded in 2018 by wife and husband co-founders, Bryanna and Stanley, with a vision of curating unique luxury tiny home experiences. Our mission is to create one-of-a-kind nature immersion experiences for the adventurous individual that support a deep connection with nature and a smaller footprint on the planet. To date, we have designed, built, and shared 5 unique tiny homes and have plans for several more in the future!

recent.comments: Beautiful place, comfortable with plenty of nature around you! Great view of the stars and plenty to do around! Great food in the area and the place itself was nothing less than perfect for me and my significant other! The hot tub was very comfortable, and the dome even more! I highly recommend anyone to stay with Stan and Bry as they have an exceptional place and we’re even better to serve us with anything we needed!

such a lovely place! the pictures don't do it justice. will be back in the future!
The place was extremely peaceful and beautiful! Definitely recommend it for a romantic getaway.

Had a great time. Really peaceful location with amazing amenities.
Amazing place with everything we needed! The hosts were proactive in communication and provided everything we needed to ensure the stay was great. This place is a dream! We will be back!
It was a wonderful experience. There are several places to hike nearby and Stan and Bry were very receptive and great hosts.

description.summary: The newest of the Tiny Escapes properties, the Tiny Treepod offers a unique and upscale experience for the nature loving adventurer. Have it both ways with a retreat in nature AND a 10 minute drive to historic downtown West Jefferson or quaint Todd or 25 minutes to Boone. Enjoy the well appointed custom dome with hot tub, fire tables, grill, hanging chairs, dining nook, and comfy outdoor furniture. Relax and refresh while experiencing the joy of tiny living!
description.space:
The Tiny Treepod was designed and built with the vision for simple yet comfortable living that supports a deep connection with nature and a smaller footprint on the planet. The meticulously designed 315 square foot Tiny Treepod and 100 square foot bathhouse (just steps away from the Treepod) makes use of every inch and lacks for nothing.

The Treepod offers a unique nature immersion experience in the tree surrounded nook in the side of the hill with winter view of the nearby mountains. The deck is equipped with a hot tub, gas fire pit, gas grill, and seating areas to relax and enjoy nature in. Below the deck, you'll have access to hanging chairs and a second gas fire pit. Read a good book, take a nap, or enjoy the view of the trees while relaxing on the outdoor patio furniture or relax in the hot tub after a nice day of hiking. You can expect to see birds, deer, and other small wildlife about while you enjoy the outdoors.

The Tiny Treepod itself was built with all the essentials and packaged into a cozy, comfortable, and retreat-like space. With an emphasis on sustainability, the Treepod is powered from the nearby community solar garden and guests can reduce waste by recycling on the property. A well equipped kitchen,  unique high end bathroom (just steps away from the Treepod), working/dining area, and a comfy sleeping space with cozy sheets are a few of the features. Use the high speed wifi to watch a movie on your laptop or tablet while relaxing after a day of exploring. A coffee and tea bar, along with high end shampoos/soaps are just a few of the other amenities provided.
description.access: Guests will have PRIVATE access to the whole Tiny Treepod, the bathhouse, and the patio area with hot tub, grill, patio furniture, and 2 fire tables.
description.notes:
LOCATION: The Treepod is located on a 4 acre plot of land with another tiny house rentals that can be booked separately or, depending on availability, can be rented together. We emphasize privacy and have set up each home to maximize guest seclusion and minimize visibility of the properties from each other. Also to note, the Treepod is located on a hill above a very small neighborhood and will be able to see couple of homes below in the distance. 

ACCESSIBILITY: To reach the Tiny Treepod, you must climb up the steps from the parking spot and follow the approximately 100 foot pathway to your tiny destination. 

HEATING/COOLING: The Tiny Treepod is equipped with a minisplit for heating and cooling as well as dedicated small additional heaters. However, please be aware that the Pod is not insulated like regular homes and will not heat and cool as well. Please be prepared with warm clothing in the winter!
description.neighborhood: Whatever you’re in the mood for, you will find it nearby. Historic downtown Todd is only a 10-minute drive, where you will find live music in the summer, the famous Todd Mercantile, and locals and tourists hanging out. RiverGirl Fishing Company and the New River are also located in downtown Todd and offer fishing, biking, kayaking, and tubing. Just a 27-minute drive from the sustainer is Elk Knob State Park with miles of hiking, biking, jogging, exploring, and a stunning view at the top. Appalachian Ski Mtn, the Blue Ridge Parkway, ziplining, golfing, hunting, and countless hiking trails are within 30 minutes of the property. Grandfather Mountain, many more hiking trails and countless wineries are within an hour's drive. It really is the best of both worlds with city life and nature readily accessible.
description.transit: You can drive to downtown Todd or downtown West Jefferson in 10 minutes or less. Highway NC 194 South is famous as a biking road and it takes approximately 1 hour to bike to Boone and 30 minutes to Jefferson.
description.house_rules:
Quiet hours after 8pm. Please remove shoes at door.

DO NOT PLACE HOT POTS/PANS directly on wood countertops or tables (this will cause burn damage!!). You will be charged $100 minimum if any damage is observed.

ABSOLUTELY NO SMOKING inside or near the Sustainer. You will be charged a $500 smoke removal fee if any smoke smell is detected.

ABSOLUTELY NO PETS! Our insurance policy does not cover pets so we unfortunately have to be strict with our no pet rule. A $100 pet fee will be charged if any pet hairs or other evidence are found inside the property, in addition to any damage fees.

hosts.about: LSU college grad living a life of wonder and adventure in the magical North GA Mountains. In addition to managing multiple Airbnb's in the area I also work as a Real Estate Agent. We think Moody Hollow is a pretty neat place and we hope you will too! Our team is looking forward to hosting you- please feel free to reach out even if its just to say HEY ! Enjoy your stay.
I clean and manage several rentals in our area.  I am super excited to be adding our lake house as a new rental in the area.

Recent LSU grads, GEAUX TIGERS! We are choosing to step out of the box and live the simple life in a cabin in the woods. 

Moody Hollow is a magical and timeless place, a sanctuary, a place to experience your authentic self. We love creating spaces and experiences for others to enjoy the miracle of life. When we’re not getting unique spaces prepped for new guests, we’re backpacking, reading, throwing pottery, traveling, yoga-ing, and playing our way through life.

In our summers we lead outdoor adventures all over the world. We love meeting all the amazing visitors who get to enjoy the Moody Hollow Magic, but also like to give space.

Please don’t hesitate to reach out and let us know how we can make your stay wonderful!

recent.comments: An absolute amazing stay !!! You won’t be disappointed from accommodation to host skills

items.comments: An absolute amazing stay !!! You won’t be disappointed from accommodation to host skills
Had a ball. Very peaceful experience. I would do it again. Thank you Wil.

Wish the pictures were clearer of the actual place. Was not our favorite. Lots of bugs which is to be expected but the amount of spiders that I saw while trying to drift off to sleep wasn’t an amount I was comfortable with. The windows weren’t clean so they were hard to see through which was disappointing as I booked it because of the unique experience of being in a “bubble.” The bathroom on top of that seemed to not be maintained, with the shower curtain molding and even some parts of the shower not being cleaned properly. Walls of the bathroom seemed to be water damaged or something else I’m not sure. Some of the lighting equipment that I’m assuming is for the dark walk to the bathroom did not work or barely lit up. The outside was beautiful, stocked of utensils that could be used to grill. Lots of chairs and areas to explore. Just expected a little more especially with the pictures showing cleaner bathroom and dome conditions. Disappointed. And for the price at that?No thank you.
Our stay here was FANTASTIC! I can’t wait to visit again.
We absolutely loved Wil and the dome on the river! We have already been looking at taking our girls to his other locations as well! This location was everything and more for a romantic getaway ❤️
Had a great experience, Will was an excellent host. Would highly recommend. Super friendly and gave great recommendations.

My husband and I decided to take our toddler on our her first glamping trip. This spot was perfect! We splashed in the creek, made a bonfire, cooked on the green egg, walked the gorgeous property. It was so beautiful, peaceful, and relaxing (as it can be with a toddler🤣)  
Wil was incredibly awesome to communicate with, super helpful (even when we accidentally locked the bathroom door at night and had to have someone come unlock it🫢whoops!) 
The dome is beautifully decorated and super clean with all the amenities you would need to glamp in comfort. 
12 out of 10 rating! We will be back for a longer period next time as we plan on making this one of our spots! ❤️

* I will note for those looking for extreme quiet, it is close to a road so you do hear cars, but it’s not terrible and it is so worth the visit!

description.summary:
Fall asleep under the stars in this picturesque geodesic dome by the Hiawassee River. It has space heaters, a portable AC unit, heated blanket and wood burning stove. No central heat/air. 

The Dome is in a private campground with 3 other campers beside our family's 8-acre property.

Tiny Dome has fresh linens, towels, queen bed, mini fridge, microwave, kitchen cart, & mountain well water.

Bath house, shower, sink, & laundry is 100 ft. away. Enjoy safe Glamping in style!
description.space:
***Please read FULL description below before booking this Airbnb :)

The Tiny Dome is in a private campground on our family property along with 3 other campers including an Airstream which is also available on Airbnb. 

Staying in a Geodesic Dome is a full sensory experience: Watch the flow of clear mountain water or the bright stars from your queen bed. Listen to the crackling fire when it’s cold outside, or sit outside by your fire pit and hear true white noise as the rushing river runs right beside you!  Smell the fresh mountain air with a subtle scent of a campfire and  plethora of floral scents from the garden just across the river!  Taste the smoked mountain rainbow trout you’ve caught and cooked in our Big Green Egg. And finally, feel yourself exhale, relaxing into your true nature.

What is Glamping?
"Glamping (Glamourous Camping) is where stunning nature meets modern luxury. It's a way to experience the untamed and completely unique parts of the world—without having to sacrifice creature comforts". 

Things to note before booking:
 - Glamping is not for everyone! 
-  Unlike a hotel room, you will be immersed in the elements.
- You will see bugs both inside and out.
- The dome is not completely temperature controlled. We do have a portable AC unit, wood stove, and space heater but it is a tent without insulation so you will likely get hot and/or cold during your stay.
- AT&T gets good service, but many other providers don't get service. We do have Wifi.
- We are next to Unicoi Turnpike (Highway) so there will be highway noise.
- No pets allowed.
- There is not running water inside the dome. There is a shared Bathhouse with a toilet, shower, sink, and laundry about 100 feet away. We do have a water dispenser inside the dome that can be refilled in the bathhouse.

If you have any questions about the experience, please reach out to us before you book. This space is ideal for  one or two guests who want to spend the day exploring the local areas, or just relaxing by the river, and have a comfortable space to rest at night. 


The Tiny Dome includes a heated blanket(cold months), Big Green Egg Grill, mini fridge/freezer, coffee pour over, filters, electric water kettle, plates, mugs, and a microwave.
description.access:
Check-in is 3PM, checkout is 11 AM.
The glampground, fire pit, bathhouse, river, and all the chairs on the property are yours to enjoy! We try our best to make everyone feel welcome. Please park close to your space, and make yourself at home.
Remember to bring firewood, charcoal, starter, etc. for your fire pit and Big Green Egg.
description.notes: The dome is ideal for trips spent exploring during the day and using it to rest at night. It is not climate controlled so the temperature inside can fluctuate. We do have space heaters and portable AC unit to accommodate, but please keep in mind this is glamping (like a tent!)  not a house. We are a few degrees cooler than Hiawassee due to higher elevation and tree coverage.
description.neighborhood: Moody Hollow is a forgotten cove, lost in time, made of circa 1950's cabins. We often refer to our street as the Magical, Mystical, Mossy, Moody Hollow. You will find gardens, swings, and friendly faces, if you walk down the end of the road and make a right you'll end up in the park area, just on the left, past another set of gardens. We live in an inclusive place that accepts everyone. High shoals Falls, Blue Hole, etc. are all just a short drive.
description.transit:
Park in front of the rental door, please. Respect the space and keep noise low… and listen to nature at its best!
You can walk up Moody Hollow Road to the fun park and second set of gardens.
description.interaction: Each space we rent is left open for the guest and is a contactless arrival. We can have someone available as needed, but like to give guests their space. We respect each guests privacy and encourage them to reach out to us. One reason we host on Airbnb is to expand our network of awesome humans, so please don't be a stranger.
description.house_rules:
We have 2 other rentals nearby, please be mindful of your noise and impact and keep both low.                                                 Bathhouse is shared, so respect other guests and keep it tidy and clean please.            
Please do not dispose of any food or trash outside. Trashcan by Bathhouse has a large bag in it, where all trash goes into.

recent.comments: Loved our little glamping getaway! Had everything we needed and more. We enjoyed how peaceful our stay was yet having all of our amenities available. Definitely my kind of camping :) will definitely be back!

We stayed from Friday to Sunday and it’s the best place to relax in the middle of the woods. The Dome was pretty clean and neat. We loved it we’ll definitely go back.
These domes are absolutely incredible. They are well stocked, super unique, and extremely comfortable. I would highly recommend these to anyone!

Alberto was a great host. He was flexible and responsive. The hot tub was a great addition and the the place beautiful! We loved his recommendation of hiking devils den. It is a perfect getaway for couples or a group who wants to rent out all three domes in a  row!

We had an amazing time staying here. We had a little trouble checking in, but Alberto came right away to help us. The dome is stunning and such a beautiful place to get away and relax. It was honestly better than the pictures. We loved going to bed watching the sunset and waking up to the sunrise. We also enjoyed making a fire in the fire pit and relaxing in the hot tub. We highly recommend this, it was a great experience.
what an awesome place. highly recommend.
Absolutely loved this place. It was so homey and adorable. The attention to detail was great! We had everything we needed! I cannot wait to come back here. Alberto is an amazing host.

description.summary: Escape to Big Little Clouds a mesmerizing Dome Glamping site where dreams become reality. Our Eco-Glam Dome immerses you in nature's beauty while providing luxurious comfort. Experience the tranquility of untouched landscapes, unwind in style, and create unforgettable memories.
description.transit:
We're excited to have you as our guests and want to ensure you have a wonderful stay. Here's a guide to some fantastic activities and places to explore, categorized by their proximity to our property:

Local Delights in Meadows of Dan:

- Primitive Coffee Shop (15 minutes) - Enjoy NYC-style coffee and a cozy atmosphere.
- Poor Farmers Market (15 minutes ) - Discover fresh produce, local dishes, gifts, and more.

Venture to Mt. Airy, NC:

- Mt. Airy Town (25 minutes) - A great town with restaurants, grocery stores, breweries, and wineries. Don't miss Andy Griffith's birthplace.
- Andy Griffith Museum (25 minutes) - Immerse yourself in the world of Andy Griffith with artifacts and memorabilia.

Nature and Hiking:

- Buffalo Mountain Trail (20-25 minutes) - A rewarding hike with a stunning panoramic view.
- Rocky Knob Trail (20-25 minutes) - Explore another beautiful hiking trail.

Wineries:

- Chateau Morrisette Winery (20-25 minutes) - Unwind with outstanding wine, live music, and a picturesque patio. Perfect for the whole family.

Charming Town of Floyd:

- Floyd Town (Approx. 30 minutes) - Discover a lovely town with unique restaurants and shops.

Local Flavor and Entertainment:

- Willis Gap Community Center (20-25 minutes) - Enjoy Appalachian Acoustic Music every Friday night.
- H.C. Harold Orchard (20-25 minutes) - Pick fresh apples and savor the experience.
- Willis Gap General Store (20-25 minutes) - Get a taste of country store charm.
- Frontera Roots (20-25 minutes) - Shop for eccentric and traditional home decor.

Unique Eateries and Landmarks:

- The Gap Deli at the Parkway (15 minutes) - Savor delicious lunches and coffee.
- Angel Overlook (20-25 minutes) - Witness a breathtaking view from a special spot.
- Mayberry Trading Post (20-25 minutes) - Explore this charming family-run store.

Adventure and Entertainment:

- Buffalo Mountain Ziplines (20-25 minutes) - Experience thrilling ziplines and stunning surroundings.
- River Outdoor Adventures (35 minutes)- Embark on exciting outdoor activities.

Please keep in mind that most of these locations are in rural areas, offering authentic experiences. Enjoy your stay, and feel free to reach out for more recommendations or assistance!

hosts.about:
Hi!

My name is Kris. By day, I’m a local 40-year-old contractor. By night, I like cooking, music, jiu-jitsu, and getting out in the woods with my family.  I absolutely love the Upstate of SC and have explored quite a bit of it extensively.  I'm always looking to create amazing guest experiences. I really enjoy the ability to share the experience of living in these great homes and the Greenville area. Definitely check with me for amazing sunset locations, where to go for superb walks, and where to have mindblowing culinary experiences!
 
I will always try to meet your expectations and even go beyond the expectation of your stay. If you have any suggestions for me, please let me know!

Some great features I have are due to the inspirations of other guests that stayed with me and had interesting ideas. Feel free to book or message me first, I'm happy to answer any specific questions in advance. Feel free to communicate with me!

Be sure to ask me about restaurants, hiking, mountain biking, tubing, and canoeing/paddleboarding.

Hope to see you soon,

Kris

I'm a small town girl who loves to travel! Originally from IN, I discovered at a young age a passion for the outdoors, traveling the world, and learning about other cultures. I love hosting and sharing our spaces with our guests and hearing their stories.

This is a unique place to stay.  This was booked for my parents for their 60th anniversary with the intention of it being something special and different.  It met that criteria. description.summary: Glamping: where luxury meets the outdoors. This geodesic structure offers a rare opportunity to experience the outdoors without the elements. Complete with kitchen, AC & heat, dual control heated mattress pad, fully functioning bathroom, and sunrise views over the pasture. Whether you are looking to relax and enjoy feeding the farm animals, have an adventure riding the zip line, or indulge in a romantic evening sipping wine in the hot tub under the stars, you will leave with lasting memories.
description.space: This unique structure is a studio style living space, complete with a kitchen and full bathroom. There is a queen size bed and two very large bean bags that unfold into full size beds. The space has heat and AC, an abundance of natural light, gorgeous views of sunrise/sunset over the pasture, and an inviting covered outdoor hot tub area. The shower is stunning, with custom tile work. The space is cozy and inviting, perfect for a romantic getaway.
description.access: There is a gravel parking area provided for guests and a well lit walkway to the dome.
description.notes: Coffee, wine, and animal treats are provided. The animals love the treats and will come to the fence. Feed with hand, treat in your palm. Guests are never allowed in the pasture.
description.neighborhood:
The Geodome is nestled in the woods overlooking the pasture filled with farm animals. There are other homes in the area. It is quiet and secluded, but conveniently located right off of a designated scenic highway. It is within 30 minutes of six state parks featuring hiking, fly fishing, mountain biking, paddle boarding, boating, and a whole lot more. 

THINGS TO NOTE: 

The Gedome is an uninsulated tent. While sufficient heating sources and air conditioning are provided, consistent temperature control is difficult to maintain in extreme heat or cold. In the heat of the summer, as the sun shines down on the dome, it does get extremely warm and it is difficult to cool off the space until the evening hours. We recommend exploring the lakes, trails, and surrounding area during the peak sun hours to cool off and enjoy all the mountains have to offer. During the winter, it can get very cool in the late night and early morning hours. A heated mattress pad will keep you cozy under the covers and the wood burning stove is quite effective when a fire is stoked. 

While free WiFi is provided, it is not always reliable for streaming, zoom calls, or working on a VPN due to the location.

Bedroom 1 - King Bed located on the main floor with tons of natural light brightening up the room.
Main floor living area with comfy seating.
Bedroom 2 - Full Bed located on the main floor.

Small table located in the downstairs living area.
You step through the front door and are greeted by gorgeous dome ceilings!
Downstairs dining area. Note, the wood burning fireplace is not available for guest use.
The kitchen space has a hand painted wall mural spreading across the entire kitchen wall.

Stairway leading to the upstairs area in the dome!
Cozy upstairs living area with large sectional.
Upstairs living room space with a plethora of board games located under the TV!
Queen bed locate in the upstairs loft space!

Full bath located on the main floor with linens provided.
Laundry room located right off of bedroom 1. Note, the water filtration system is located here as well. It can run at random times making a noise for around half an hour or so.
The driveway has a bridge over the stream leading to the Toasted Marshmallow.
Outdoor grill space with charcoal grill.
The property has many outbuildings including this cute little library.
Relax in the little library and borrow any of the provided books.
Tons of yard space to play games here at the Toasted Marshmallow.
Book your stay at this fun little VA getaway - The Toasted Marshmallow.

hosts.about:
Hi there, my name is Landon! We have a company called BNB Breeze. We have really good online reviews come and check us out. Currently managing properties in 13 different states. 

I'm a husband and father to 3 incredible little boys. My all time favorite things to do, would have to be golf, exploring a downtown area, or relaxing all day on a beach. I  love brainstorming with like-minded entrepeneurs who are enthusiastic about new opportunities, just like me. I like to make things happen! Which is why I love what I do. 

Currently, I am helping homeowners from across the country manage there AirBNBs and welcome guests into their 2nd homes through BNB Breeze. We are a hands-on short term rental management company and mostly handle Airbnb listings and the logistical work that goes into managing these properties. Showcasing these properties to look their best and bring in higher returns for investors is just a small part of what I do. 

I'm excited to say that the company has grown to include many team members! Heather, Aj, and Barb are all working full-time to help BNBbreeze maintain all of the beautiful properties we manage. Additional part-time team members help round out our entire business. Working with with these folks is part of what makes this job so fun:)

I look forward to serving you and making your Airbnb experience one you’ll love and remember for years to come!

Landon

description.summary:
Visit the Toasted Marshmallow and stay in a DOME HOUSE with a bubbling stream only 10' away!
- Round Dome Home
- Located next to a bubbling stream
- Gorgeous outdoor fire pit area where you can toast marshmallows ;)
- Large yard
- Outbuildings to explore
- Wall murals
- 2 Smart TVs
- 2 bedrooms/1 loft/ 1 bathroom
description.space:
Stay in a dome home! This round white marshmallow home is nestled in the VA mountains. This remote hideaway is off grid and allows for a peaceful retreat with a bubbling brook next to the structure and a stunning outdoor fire pit space to toast marshmallows at - s'more ingredients are provided! Perfect for all seasons with an indoor fireplace that creates a warm atmosphere on chillier nights and a cool stream for warm summer days! You are sure to be relaxed at this unique getaway!

INDOOR SPACE:
- Full Kitchen: basics for cooking and baking provided (no food)
- Dining Room: 5 person dining table
- Downstairs Living Room: Smart TV and electric fireplace
- Full Bath: Accessible from hallway and includes a standing shower (linens provided)
- Laundry Room: Detergent provided
- Loft Area: Includes queen bed and cozy sitting area with large sectional and smart TV.

| Sleeping Arrangements |
- Bedroom 1: King Bed w/ doorway leading to outside space.
- Bedroom 2: Full Bed
- Loft: Queen Bed

OUTDOOR SPACE:
- Bridge going across creek to the Fire Pit Area with 6 Adirondack chairs. Twinkling string lights brighten this space up in the evenings. 
- Outdoor seating on outside of the Toasted Marshmallow.
- A bunch of out buildings to explore including a peaceful library space.
- Picnic area with charcoal grill - lighter fluid and charcoal provided.
- Large and spacious yard for games 

Brew a steaming cup of coffee and start your morning off right by settling into one of the outdoor sitting areas and watching nature wake up around you. The stream right next to the Toasted Marshmallow creates and incredible peaceful setting for your entire vacation. Lots of yard space and surrounded by wooded acreage. There are also several outbuildings to explore including a small library and small pavilion with a charcoal grill available for guests to use! Charcoal is provided as well.

The Marshmallow is located in Fancy Gap, VA right off of the Blue Ridge Parkway and 20 minutes from good ol' Mayberry.

----> Proximity to Local Attractions <----
1. The Blue Ridge Parkway is located just 10 minutes from the Marshmallow! The parkway is a beautiful drive with incredible mountain views.
2. If you’re an Andy Griffith fan, you should know that Mayberry is only 20 minutes away! Take a day trip to check out the town and visit all of the memorable sites from the show.
3. Briarpatch is a wonderful coffee shop located in Galax which is about a 20 minute drive.
4. If you are needing groceries, there is a Food Lion in Hillsville about 15 minutes away.
5. Gap Deli about the best place to grab some food in Fancy Gap.

Couple NOTES:
1. PET POLICY: We love your furry friends! A fee of $150 per dog must be paid before the guest arrival date. There is a max of 2 dogs on the property and a max weight of 50 lbs. per dog. Sorry, but no cats or exotic animals are allowed in the home. If evidence of an unapproved (or unpaid for) pet is located on the property, there will be a $400 non-refundable fine. Please clean up after your pet in the yard (bring your own doggy waste bags) and in the home.
2. NO SMOKING: Smoking is not allowed on the property. If any signs of smoking are documented, the renter agrees to pay a $200.00 / per day.
3. WATER FILTER - we do have a water filtration system for the home that is located in the laundry room right off of the master bedroom. Note, every couple of days the system has to reset and can cause a loud noise as it runs. The timing of this reset is unpredictable! Just be aware, that it may start up at any time.

**Specific amenities we are providing to get you started:
Linens for each Bed
Towels and Washcloths
Roll of Paper Towels
Bottle of Dish Soap
Trash Bags
Coffee
Laundry Detergent
Bath essentials - Body soap, shampoo & conditioner
*But please be prepared to bring any additional supplies that you will need*
description.access: You will have the entire Marshmallow home all to yourself :) We do have a locked maids closet that will not be available for guests to access.
description.notes:
We cannot wait to host you @ The Toasted Marshmallow!

Please remember to treat the space with respect. If any problems arise, we will do our best to take action ASAP, but there is no one living on site 24/7.
description.interaction: While we do not have someone living on the property, we are only a message away! Shoot us a message on Airbnb and we will respond as soon as possible and try to accommodate any request you may have.
description.house_rules:
HOUSE RULES

Hi there! We can't wait to host you during your stay! However, we do have to enforce some rules for the safety and protection of the Dome as well as our wonderful neighbors who we work diligently not to disturb. 

1. All local residents must communicate with the host BEFORE booking.
2. The occupancy limit for this property is the same number of guests as your reservation at all times. Violation of this could lead to the immediate removal of all guests without refund.
3. No parties, no loud music, no boisterous behavior.
4. Renters will respect and follow all rules as outlined in the House Rules Section. 
5. Renters agree to not contact the host until they have read the House Manual. Will be sent 2 days before arrival. 
6. Smoking is strictly prohibited and will result in an immediate $200/day penalty fee. ($200 for every day of the rental period).
7. Unless previously agreed upon with the host, there is a $50 late checkout fee for the first hour and a rate of $100/hr for each hour thereafter. 
8. By completing your booking, you agree that the homeowner and property manager are not responsible for any accidents (vehicle or otherwise) that may occur in or on the property. 
9. If by your fault of breaking any house rules, a scheduling conflict is formed with other guests, you may be charged the amount owing to a discount or refund of said guest. 
10. Repeated infractions of the house rules can result in dispatching our security team for immediate eviction with no refund. This will result in a $500 penalty additional to any applicable fees.
11. Shipping any items left at the home will require a $25 fee in addition to the cost of shipping. 
12. Booking your reservation is your confirmation that you have read and fully agree to the house rules.

items.comments: Stayed here for my honeymoon, and we loved it! Vivian is always ready to handle any circumstance and is so nice to communicate with! She is absolutely the best host and is ready to accommodate any need. We had a blast. The town was kind of small but there were loads of beautiful scenery to check out. Her place is a must see!!🩷
Great place, definitely the way to camp! Vivian was the nicest and most responsive host ever. She handles a couple situations we had very graciously!

Vivian was a wonderful host! Super beautiful BnB and SO PEACEFUL. ~20 minutes from the downtown area of Tennessee and lots to do at the dome. Such a unique experience for a first time glamper! Thank you Vivian for being so awesome and helpful. Definitely a SUPER HOST 😍

We absolutely loved this place. It was beautiful,clean,peaceful and we really enjoyed having a night time movie outside with the fire going. The kids definitely want to go back again. This is a place I highly recommend going to.

Went here for my moms bday! She loved it!! Vivian’s place was well equipped and a dope experience!! 
Beds are so comfortable! And we loved the outdoor area.

Only thing I would say is that we came at night and you should definitely arrive during the day! I was quite scared lol but I don’t like true adventure either lol .. hence I chose to go “glamping” rather than real camping lol. But my sister loved that part of it. So I guess it’s to each his own! 

Other than that… AMAZING stay!! Thank you again Vivian!

I booked Vivian’s beautiful glam dome for my boyfriend’s birthday and we had so much fun! We were looking for a different not your typical experience and it delivered. Vivian was extremely responsive and all of her instructions were very clear and easy to understand. She even gifted us a bottle of champagne and popcorn for the outdoor movie theater! The inside of the dome was perfect! Everything was super clean, smelled amazing, and the decor was gorgeous. It was a lot bigger in there than we thought!! We were both shocked. I loved how the patio was setup. This spot was a 10 out of 10 honestly🤩We will most definitely be back. Thanks again Vivian for being such an amazing host!!

Our stay at this Airbnb was exceptional, offering a tranquil retreat from our busy lives. The location was serene, peaceful and perfectly clean. The beautifully detailed interiors crafted a blend of aesthetics and comfort that we appreciated. An incident that showcased the host's top-notch service was their swift response when a tree fell due to a storm, blocking our path. They quickly sent a team to ensure our safety and convenience. This level of attentiveness to guests was refreshing and commendable. We highly recommend this Airbnb for anyone seeking a peaceful getaway with an emphasis on stellar hospitality. We eagerly anticipate our next visit!

description.summary:
Indulge and unwind in our designer geodesic glamping dome! This luxury one of a kind glamping experience will help relax, disconnect and align with nature.

Experience off grid glamping with all the luxury amenities! Designer loaded penthouse style design , 65 in tv with Netflix Hulu etc, 
memory mattress and plush luxe sheets bedroom downstairs and queen loft upstairs! Double vanity and rain shower with piping hot water all provide a luxury 5 star hotel experience while you camp!
description.space: This property is completely off grid and runs on solar power and has its own well water on site! Come to disconnect, rekindle or stay connected with our high speed internet to the outside world the possibilities are yours! ☺️

description.summary: Sleep the night away in this forested geodesic treehouse cluster!
description.space:
Welcome to Dome Town! Dome town is a series of geodesic domes suspended in the trees. The domes are connected by suspension bridges that weave through the canopy. In total there are three sleeping domes, a giant canopy lounge net, and one communal water dome, where there are two full baths, and one wash station. Each dome offers a private and unique experience. Sleeping in a dome will change the way you think about square building forever! Dome town is located just a short walk away from The Rock House Cafe. There is no other treehouse dome experience quite like this. Explore the canopy, enjoy the gorge, sleep in a dome!  

Turtle Dome is one of our larger domes and is located lower on the hillside, closer to the water dome. It sleeps two on a queen sized bed. It is heated and cooled, and has its own private kitchenette. Enjoy the expansive interior of the dome, green leaves through the bay window, and soft calming feel of the round space.
description.transit:
The domes are located up a single lane gravel county road. 
 The water dome and other domes are connected by suspension bridges, walkways and stairs.  The outdoor lighting will be on until midnight and then we switch it off to allow the dark night forest sky to be just that--dark!  We recommend packing a flashlight or headlamp to aid in moving around after the lights are off.
description.house_rules:
-Please be respectful of other Dome Town guests and keep in mind the 10 pm to 7 am quiet hours.  
-Smoking is NOT allowed in our main parking lot, near our office buildings or inside of your treehouse. You may smoke outside near your treehouse, but we ask that you to be mindful of affecting others nearby.
-Leave the treehouse in a similar condition to how you found it.  
-Our 3% Management Fee is for our local Wolfe County Tourism Tax and this money is used locally to help encourage sustainable growth and eco-tourism in our area.  
Thank you!

Just two brothers who are passionate about creating places for people to come, rest, and experience the beauty of life with the people they love most. 

We strive to design beautiful spaces, build a culture of honor, and serve our guests with excellence. ￼

From our families to yours - we would be thrilled to have an opportunity to host you for a stay!

recent.comments: The hosting team was responsive and honest about ongoing construction. The space was beautiful, the furnishings were nice. There is a fan there which may not seem like a big deal with it was the perfect amount of noise and air movement. The dehumidifiers were helpful. The ice maker in the kitchen was such a handy touch! We just really loved the vibe there. Such a cool space.

items.comments: The hosting team was responsive and honest about ongoing construction. The space was beautiful, the furnishings were nice. There is a fan there which may not seem like a big deal with it was the perfect amount of noise and air movement. The dehumidifiers were helpful. The ice maker in the kitchen was such a handy touch! We just really loved the vibe there. Such a cool space.
Absolutely perfect stay. Great location and beautiful setting. Some of the best communicaton. Couldnt be any better.
We loved it and can’t wait to visit again!
Staying at home sweet dome was so fun. It was a unique way of glamping. All amenities were great!!!
Beautiful cabin and quick access to places to eat and hike! Would stay again 10/10

A friend of mine had stayed here and so my husband and I had to stay here for our very, very belated honeymoon because it was so cool! It was amazing!  So freaking unique!  First, yes you truly need a vehicle that can handle the drive in and out or at least be mindful of that.  I definitely got to use my Outback for the first time as it should be - off road vehicle.  The Dome is so beautiful and relaxing. It was so clean & fresh.  Many times we giggled to each other - “you know the statement, I feel like I’m going around in circles? Lol well I literally am in here!!” Lol.   We loved HOW close it was to everything we wanted to do. So easy to get to things so the perfect spot!  We truly will come back and stay here again!  We have been recommending this place to all our friends and family!  Great and I mean great hosts!  We learned they have other places to stay as well - so we will be checking those out too in the future! Again GREAT hosts!! Love Home Sweet Dome! Won’t regret it!
Great place to stay has everything you need! We definitely will be back! My kids loved it and keep asking when we are going back!

description.summary: A rare, elevated stay in Red River Gorge, this property offers the perfect setting for an upscale glamping experience. This newly-built dome combines modern design with earthy textures- giving you a "home sweet home" type feeling. Bring your crew over the river and through the woods to our 26-acres of woodlands, with free access to Spirit Lake. Located 15 mins. from Natural Bridge State Park in Daniel Boone Nat. Forest. Come hike, climb, and explore the good ole' outdoors! *4WD VEHICLES ADVISED*
description.space: Our property is located on a 40ft. wide deck structure, lofted 2 stories in the air! The structure is a geodesic dome, wrapped in heavy duty exterior vinyl, but finished on the inside with cozy cabin furnishings. The space has running water from our well, electricity, HVAC, a full-bathroom, and 3 beds that can accommodate up to 6 guests... plus a hottub :)
description.access:
CONSTRUCTION UPDATE:

Home Sweet Dome is the first of several exciting projects we’re working on in the area. This space is part of our "Nature Rooms" project in which we are in the process of developing in order to create/ craft more unique spaces for future guests to experience on the 27 acres. Because of this, we always like to inform guests that the area is in active development, so some building work may be taking place nearby during your stay. It shouldn't be very disruptive to your visit though as much of the development is reasonably spaced out !

Construction could be taking place as well as some traffic passing by the Dome area from time to time. The new build sites are mostly out of eyesight of the Dome but you may see and hear some activity as workers will be driving by entering and exiting the job site as well as constructing new domes and glass houses during typical working hours (9:00-5:00). 

We assure you that we are doing all we can to make sure that your experience at Home Sweet Dome is magical, relaxing, and everything you expected and more but we always want our guests to be aware of this in case you encounter any of it over the course of your visit. In regards to the new spaces- our future domes, glass houses, and other builds are projected to be completed by this Fall. 





WINTER UPDATE:

Since we are located in a more rural area with curvy roads, inclement weather can definitely cause problems with accessing the Dome (as it can with any home). In most circumstances, a 4WD vehicle will be able to tackle the terrain, but snow and ice is problematic. We will keep an eye out on the forecast for your stay and keep you aware of the conditions as we get closer.

In the event that inclement weather is on the horizon for your stay we will be sure to notify you. Since it will be hard to access the Dome in snowy/icy conditions, we advise cancelling/rescheduling your trip and we will happily give you a full refund in that event. There are some locals that work to clear the roadways into the development, but it’s not always a timely event, and there is a risk of getting snowed in/stuck in our cabin development- it’s happened to guests of other cabins in the past :)

In addition to the dome structure, guests are allowed access to our 26 adjoining acres (the land located just behind the unit). There are 3 unmarked hiking loops/trails around the property, so un-hinged hiking and exploring is encouraged, but please be mindful that there are no markings to navigate your way to and from the dome. Across the property are cliff edges, small caves, and even a small waterfall (located on the left side of our property). Also, each guest has free access to "Spirit Lake" which is located at the last fork in the road just before our property. Although swimming is not permitted in the lake- canoeing, kayaking, and fishing are allowed!
description.notes:
Just some special little notes about the property:
+We have walkie-talkies in the home so that you can channel your inner kiddo as you explore the woods.
+Complementary Eno's are provided with every rental. (We even have hooking hardware located on the beams below the dome for your afternoon nap).
+The property is located right along a babbling creek- so the setting is wonderful for soaking in some relaxing sounds.
description.transit:
**4WD VEHICLES ADVISED - USE CAUTION**

We want ensure that all guests who book this space are prepared and safe when driving to the dome.

Please note that the road to the property is gravel and contains steep hills, curvy turns, and is narrow (please drive slow and use caution). The drive to the dome is beautiful and the property is secluded and quiet. When you get to the property, there is a small creek that guests will need to drive through to access the dome parking lot. There is also an adjacent parking lot right before the creek, so if you feel uneasy about driving across it, feel free to park in the front lot and hike across the wooden bridge to access the dome.

recent.comments: This was our first time in Kentucky,  and we hit the jackpot with our place to stay. The Humble Hippie was so nice. Perfect location for many attractions.  It had everything you need for a nice, relaxing getaway. It is obvious much thought was put into designing and decorating the dome. I would recommend staying here and we'll be back.

items.comments: This was our first time in Kentucky,  and we hit the jackpot with our place to stay. The Humble Hippie was so nice. Perfect location for many attractions.  It had everything you need for a nice, relaxing getaway. It is obvious much thought was put into designing and decorating the dome. I would recommend staying here and we'll be back.
Perfectly peaceful. Whenever I had a question Rhonda was always quick to respond. We had a relaxing time
This place is magical. So peaceful and in gorgeous surroundings. It was clearly designed with attention to detail and guest comfort. We can’t wait to come back.
Very nice and cozy place great location

This is a very special place, a piece of the hostess heart really. Airbnb is a great platform for hosting and it’s sometimes easy to forget that someone actually built the home you’re staying in. Here the connection with nature and the little details everywhere let you know that there’s a person behind the structure. I felt right at home and it was hard to leave! There is so much to do in the nearby area and at the same time you feel secluded from the regular tourist activities. Take care of this place and it’ll take care of you!

We chose this AirBnb due to us attending a wedding on the property.  This made wedding festivities so easy as we could easily walk to everything.   I’m not gonna lie I was a bit skeptical going into it as we aren’t big campers and never staying in anything like this before.  It exceeded our expectations and I left feeling like I wished I could have gotten more time to hang out there.   It was a really great experience and I highly encourage anyone reading this to check it out for yourself.  The host was also very accommodating and made us feel right at home in her place.
Perfect little getaway, very clean and private! Will definitely be back to the Humble Hippie!

description.summary: The Humble Hippie was created for the nature loving adventurer in mind.  The peaceful dome is located just 10 minutes from Natural Bridge State Park and 20 minutes from Red River Gorge.  Connect with your surroundings without having to rough it.  Enjoy the stunning view of mountain tops and cliffsides from the 10' panorama window or gaze at the stars through the 5' sky light.
description.space: A step up from glamping, the 20' geodesic dome is equipped with heating and air conditioning , a full bathroom, hot tub, kitchenette, WiFi, projector, and a designated work area.  Relax in the hot tub after a long day of hiking or climbing.  Enjoy the luxury queen size pillow top mattress conveniently stored in a hand crafted Murphy Bed to save on space.
description.access: Full access to all areas
description.notes: The Humble Hippie is supplied with water by a 2000 gallon water cistern.  It is not drinkable.
description.neighborhood: The Humble Hippie is located amongst the beautiful Appalachian Rose Farm. Nestled in the hills just 10 minutes away from Natural Bridge State Park and 20 minutes from Red River Gorge.
description.transit: Private parking for 2 vehicles or vehicle and toy hauler.
description.interaction: I’m available by message or text.  I live an hour away but can make arrangements if needed or wanted.
description.house_rules:
NO PARTIES OR EVENTS WHATSOEVER. This will result in an IMMEDIATE cancellation of your reservation with NO refund.

The dome is run on septic. Please only flush toilet paper and NOTHING else. If the septic clogs during your stay, a fee will be assessed to have a plumber come and make repairs.

No smoking

Not suitable for pets in the loft area

Check-in is anytime after 4PM

Check out by 10AM

Self check-in with lockbox


**Important** Please make sure you read and comply with these rules:

NO CIGARETTE SMOKING IN THE DOME AT ALL

NO Excessive guests

NO Mailing Packages to the home.

NO PARTYING of any kind inside or on the property. Please respect the community. Noise level MUST BE MINIMAL after 10PM! 

PENALTIES FOR THE FOLLOWING. Held against security deposit and claim will be filed with Airbnb.

**Stolen towels: $10 per towel, no matter the size.

** Smoking in the home: $150

**Late Checkout Past 10am without our consent. $75

**Excessive Guests than reservation. $50 per guest.

**Excessive Cleaning if place is left filthy with trash everywhere. $150

You must also acknowledge

Amenity limitations

Potential for noise

Must climb stairs

Security Deposit - if you damage the home, you may be charged up to $300

name: The Penguin Geodesic Dome-"Igloo Vibes"
title: Logan, Ohio

hosts.about: We are new to vacation rentals but dedicated to making our guest feel relaxed in our spaces.

recent.comments:
We had a very enjoyable stay at the Penguin Geodesic Dome.
I wasn't sure what to expect because the Penguin Geodesic Dome is so different than any place we had previously stayed, but the quiet location, comfortable bed, hot tub, deck, grill, lights, (and so much more) all worked together for a truly unique and delightful experience. The shared Game Room in the center of the property was fun. We played darts, shot pool, and played shuffleboard. It was one of the most enjoyable "weekends away" that we have ever had and it made our 35th wedding anniversary a unique and memorable time. 
I believe the staff went above and beyond in making our stay pleasurable. They posted yard signs near the walkway in celebration of our anniversary and even had a card for us on the table when we arrived! They were very quick to respond to our messages and very professional and accommodating in our conversations.
I highly recommend this place and would be very happy to stay there again.

They were very quick to respond to our messages and very professional and accommodating in our conversations.
