We had fantastic stay in the Penguin. The space was decorated perfectly with everything you need for your stay. The space was very private, romantic and a perfect way to connect with nature! The deck with hot tub was just the right thing after a day of hiking. The host was extremely helpful and informative. We had a great stay and can't wait to return.
We loved our time here! The geodome is fun and unique, and it was very comfortable for 2! Loved the hot tub and fun lights! Would definitely stay here again.

The Penguin geodesic dome was just perfect!  Check in was a breeze, Alissa was in super responsive and we had the most amazing stay!  I highly recommend this to anyone wanting to stay in the Hocking Hills area.  The dome had everything we needed and the bed was super comfortable!  The hot tub was just what we needed after a long day of exploring and riding on our motorcycle.  The fire ring was a very nice touch and Alissa even recommended someone to deliver firewood to us as well.  The game room was  such a nice surprise!  We played pool and shuffleboard and it was a nice little area to unwind!  We would definitely stay here again the next time we are in the area!  You won't be disappointed!  Thanks for a great weekend!

This was hands-down my  BEST experience with an airbnb. Excellent hosts, super responsive, shared AWESOME recommendations for restaurants and activities. The actual space was  beautiful, unique, intimate, and aesthetically pleasing. The surroundings were gorgeous. All amenities listed were present AND working. Also, the pole barn game room was great! If you're considering this airbnb BOOK IT! They also impressed me with a personal touch - I booked this as part of a bday trip for my boyfriend, and when we arrived there was a Happy Birthday sign outside and a card in the welcome basket. I will be coming back 🙂

It was Romantic , Relaxing Peaceful .
It was our 32nd Anniversary .
The hot tube was prefect .
Everything about the place was absolutely PREFECT and BEAUTIFUL !! 
I love that they had a rock place on the table to paint for there rock garden . I enjoy painting rocks and I’ve been so busy that I haven’t got to paint a rock in a while . I really enjoyed painting the rock . My favorite saying “ Jesus Loves You “
I definitely will be back !!

We stayed in the Penguin Yert for our 28th wedding anniversary. Pictures  do not do this place justices. The Penguin was much more than I anticipated. Very clean with fresh linens. I am obsessed with lighting and the lighting was awesome.
It was so relaxing with the fire ring and hot tub (also very clean). The bed was comfortable. We slept very well.
Location was perfect with privacy, peace, and quiet.
The pole barn with the game room is an added bonus. We played shuffle board, pool, and darts. It is nicely set up as a community hangout spot with a TV. as well. 
I was in communications with Alissa a month prior, during, and after our stay 
She is very responsive and personable. This place nailed it!!!
We would definitely stay again.
THANK YOU 🤗

description.summary: Nestled in the heart of Hocking Hills, you will find this breathtaking 5 mm Geodesic dome waiting to offer you a getaway of both relaxation and recreation. You will instantly feel restored with our bright, open floor concept.
description.space:
Nestled in the heart of Hocking Hills, you will find this breathtaking 19.8 Ft geodesic dome waiting to offer you a getaway of both relaxation and recreation. You will instantly feel restored with our bright, open floor concept. You will find all you need within this dome, which includes a queen bed, kitchenette, and large bathroom with glass enclosed shower. Enjoy meals in the kitchenette with two cooktops, a microwave, pod coffee maker and even a small refrigerator with a freezer. We have cookware and dishes ready for you! No matter the weather, you will find comfort in our climate controlled environment, as well as a gorgeous electric fireplace to enjoy. Step outside to enjoy a night by the fire pit, love seat outdoor couch and a bistro dining set. Relax in the hot tub as you enjoy the magnificent views of Hocking Hills. .
Once you are restored, the pole barn will also offer you an abundance of activity. We have a pool table, shuffle board, darts, foosball, corn hole, yardzee and more!

This is the exciting and refreshing getaway you are dreaming of!
description.access: You have access to the game room pole barn right door.
description.notes:
Please read below what's provided.

Here is some information on what's provided to help you while you pack! 

Items that come with your rental for 2 night stays. If you are staying longer it will be multiplied for each extra day. 

4 Kcups
2 Black tea packets
2 Mint tea packets
4 creamers
4 Sugar in the raw packets
4 Sweet in low packets
2 bottles of water
2 skinny pop-pop corns
2 little Debbie coffee cakes snacks 

There are pots, pans, dishes, coffee cups, cups, wine glasses,  rubber wine glasses, utensils, knives, scissors, can opener, wine opener, 2 induction cook top burners, toaster, grill tongs and spatula, measuring cup, measuring spoons, lighter. Kcup machine, gas grill, propane for grill, microwave and mini refrigerator freezer combo. 

1 Steamer for clothes, hair dryer, 4 large towels, 4 wash clothes, 2 make up towels, 2 hand towels, 1 bath mat. 
There is a shower dispenser with shampoo, conditioner, and body gel for your use. You will be also provided 1 small hand soap bar. 
Few board games. Use of pole barn game room right as well. 

Tv is a smart tv you will need to log into your streaming service. Each unit has its on wifi hot spot, as we are in the country you can stream but does not work as it would in the city. 

All bedding is provided for the bed.
description.interaction: During your stay if you have any issues or question please text our office line provided on your access information sheet.
description.house_rules:
Additional rules  " No smoking/vaping of any kind in our rentals or game room. No incense or candles. A clean fee will be charged if smoke is detected.  
-Due to the material of the dome, if you smoke/vape, it must be off the deck area or by the fire pit area only.   
Prior to Stay.  You will need to send us a copy of you and your guest IDs for our file and your preferred email for us to send lease to sign electronically via dotloop.  Upon completion, you will receive your access information for your stay.   During your stay.  
-After check in please check please check your welcome basket for instructions for items in the unit prior to calling our office please. 
-Hot tub. Upon arrival, view instructions on how to turn up to the desired temperature. Please see the welcome basket on how to take out of eco mode and turn up. (When the hot tub is not in use, you must cover as it will not stay heated. If not, do not take any glass glasses or bottles in the hot tub. "There are rubber ones provided for your safety." 
-If shoes are muddy, remove shoes and place them in boot tray provided or outside, please, and thank you.   Please do the following prior to leaving.  
-Dishes to be washed and placed in dishes strainer and placed in sink.  
Place all used towels, wash clothes, robes if present, make up towels, and hand towels in plastic hamper located in the bathroom.  
-Please remove trash from both trash cans provided in the room and place a trash bag in the dumpster by the exit of the property on the right.  
-Prior to leaving if fire pit is cooled off, please cover it with provided cover. (Do not put anything but wood in fire pit).  
-Do not flush any disposable wipes, feminine products, or toilet wipes in toilets. The units have septic systems and are not meant for these products to be flushed down.  
-View checklist on door to make sure you followed the instructions.

name: Unique&cozy geodome in SmokyNP
title: Sevierville, Tennessee

hosts.about: My name is Anna,  traveling is my biggest passion, specially to untouched nature with unique stay experiences

description.summary: Escape to the mountains and experience the unique magic of nature in this one-of-a-kind geodome located near the Smoky National Park. Purposefully designed with intentional features, this dome offers the perfect blend of comfort and adventure for travelers who love the great outdoors. Imagine waking up to the stunning mountain views and spending your days exploring the beauty of the National Park, before returning to your own private haven in the evening.
description.space:
Unique mountain DOME is located near Smoky National Park ~
If you love traveling, camping, uniqueness, nature, adventure and experience the magic of the mountains, this geodome is a purposefully designed with intentional features to help you maximize your travel experiences. Comfortable  and right near the National Park . Experience the best of both 
world.

PLEASE READ THIS INFO CAREFULLY

This glamping located on the 10ac private lot in the heart of the mountains. 
We do have a creek on the land, so you’ll hear calm water sound. 
We do have 2 wooden cabins on the property and one more geodome. 

– Parking ……………. – appx a 50 ft walk – parking is on a gravel road and up-hill

YOU WILL HAVE: 
Outdoor private shower and portable toilet. 


AC + heater ( Please make sure that during the winter time its pretty cold during the night time, prepare yourself and bring additional warm close)

Heated pad for bed 

The glamping is equipped with a comfortable bedroom with queen-sized mattress. 

We do provide books and card games, also we do provide YOGA mat

Small kitchenette with gas portable stove and pod for making coffee. 

BBQ grill outside 

FIRE PIT area 

WIFI ( only for messaging) 

Enjoy a mountain getaway on the Great Smoky  National Park with awesome sunrises and sunsets, and star-filled nights.
description.access:
You will have plenty of private space. Property located in the mountains, we do NOT have visible neighbors. 
On our 10 acr land we have 2 wooden cabins and 2 Geodomes in total.

CHECK-IN ……… 4p 
CHECK OUT ….. 11a
description.notes:
We do provide WIFI, but it works only for messengers/Netflix/Hulu etc. 
This cabin located in the mountains and we did our best to provide there WIFi. 

Service, except Verizon - doesn’t work on the property. You can use WiFi calling mode in your phone and by this way accept any messages/calls as usual.

We love pets. Please let us know if you are bringing your four-legged friend(s) as we do charge $35 (per pet) for pet fee and there are some simple house rules to follow.

Wildlife:
Wildlife in the mountains can be categorized into diurnal and nocturnal. Animals that are largely active during the night time are coyotes, bears. Keep in mind that it is illegal to pick them up as they are State protected animals. Enjoy wildlife from a distance and allow them to pass through. After all, this is their home too!

*Please DO NOT hunt, shoot or trap wildlife for any reason. Respect and live harmoniously with Nature as we are all custodians of Mother Earth.


! No loud music from 8pm-8am its prohibited by neighborhood community
! No smoking ($250 FEE) 
! No trash littering ($1000 FEE) 
! Any damaged or stolen property will be FINED and CLAIMED depending on the cost damage 

LATE check in / check out is possible by request for extra fee $50

name: Luxury Camping | King Bed | Sustainable Farm
title: Elkton, Maryland

gallery.caption: Fairhill is a beautiful park within a 3 minute drive of the property.

hosts.about: I am just a enthusiastic person trying to see the world and to keep the adventures exciting. I enjoy cooking, touring through cities, walking in nature, and taking in the full experience a place has to offer.

recent.comments: This was an amazing glamping experience! it was a lovely place to have a relaxing getaway and we had everything we needed. I highly recommend staying here if you're looking for a good time glamping!

items.comments: This was an amazing glamping experience! it was a lovely place to have a relaxing getaway and we had everything we needed. I highly recommend staying here if you're looking for a good time glamping!

Enjoyed our stay! Was looking for something peaceful and relaxing, this was it! Beautiful scenery and clear instructions were provide for use of all the amenities. If you’re looking for a peaceful, quiet, place to unplug away from the city or busy area to experience a more luxury camp experience, highly recommend (as long as you’re not afraid of a possible bug or two). Looking forward to visiting again in the future!
The perfect place to go with your partner
Coolest little spot to stay at. Host were amazing and very helpful.
Absolutely beautiful spot, the yurt is gorgeous. It was glamping at its finest!
Great little spot to stay, peaceful with fantastic sunsets.
I loved staying at Joey’s yurt! If you are looking for a place to disconnect, this is the place! No wi-fi at all. It is also close to a lot of free parks, trails, and more.

description.summary: Enjoy a restorative and Earth-friendly luxury camping experience situated on our quiet farm about an hour drive from major cities (DMV, Baltimore, Philly). Our 300 sq ft Strawberry Hill Getaway Dome boasts a king size memory foam mattress, fluffy towels, a hot shower -- all while being immersed in nature, close to countless hikes, under twinkling stars, warmed by a toasty campfire. This is the wonderful getaway for couples, small group of friends & individuals.
description.space:
Disclaimers:
+ There is a beautiful stone home on the same property. Three lovely gentlemen (including my father) live there. They are very friendly and kind. 
+ We did our best to seal the dome but there may be bugs because of the proximity to nature. 
+ We have a compost toilet we will send videos and instruction on how to use. We ask you follow the direction perfectly for the best experience. It's not hard just different. 
+ It can get very hot (summer) or cold (winter) in the dome because of the lack of insulation. Please prepare for this. 
+ There is a main road about 1/2 a mile away which can cause some background noise during the night. We provide sleeping earplugs for those who prefer more quiet. 

STRAWBERRY HILL DOME/ BEDROOM
+ 12" Memory Foam King Size Bed
+ Lux Hotel Sheets and Pillows
+ Star-gazing windows, so you can greet blue skies, watch the rain during a storm and peer at the stars at night
+ Japanese Tea Table for mindful practices
+ Games and Books for nature lovers

KITCHEN / COOKING
+ Weber Propane Grill (3 burners, grill tools included)
+ Campstove (2 burners)
+ Outdoor Sink
+ All the appliances of a basic kitchen (olive oil + spices, cooking and eating utensils, cutting boards, knives, pans, pot, plates, bowls)
+ Coffee, Tea, Sugar, Creamer, etc.
However, we DO NOT have a refrigerator or cooler on site, but you could get fresh groceries or ice within 15 min.

BATHROOM
It's outdoors, situated under the shade and protection of pine trees.
+ Compost Toilet (great for Earth, and not as scary as it sounds :) -- don't worry we provide instructions on how to use this, and it doesn't stink!)
+ Hot Water for Showering
+ Public Goods Shampoo, Conditioner & Body Wash
+ Running and Potable Water

OUTDOOR SPACES
The Dome is situated on Strawberry Hill overlooking the farm, which we're slowly transforming into an orchard and rewilding with native trees and wildflowers. See if you notice any wild flower patches or the beginnings of one. This property has a stone house on the same acre so it is private but the house is only 50 yards away.
+ Outdoor Seating for 4
+ Fire pit (we provide firewood too)
+ You're free to roam the farm up to the creek and tree line at the bottom of the hill
description.access: Strawberry Hill Dome, outdoor patio, outdoor bathroom are entirely private for you! You are welcome to explore the fields and gardens. Watch where you step! There are many things growing.
description.notes: We have one king bed. For extra guests we'd recommend bringing an air mattress or sleeping pad. We have some extra linens as well, but not in every size.
description.neighborhood:
LOCATION
We are 1.5 hours from DC, 1 hour from Baltimore, 1 hour from Philly, 15 min from Newark, 12 min from UDel, 

THINGS TO DO 
There's a lot of nature, farms and a growing brewery scene.
- Fair Hill (8 min drive) - Lots of hiking, mountain biking, rare birds, water
- Milburn Orchard (9 min) - Pick-your-own family farm. Apples, berries and more. 
- Walnut Springs Farm (7 min)- Pick-your-own family farm. Blueberries and black raspberries. 
- Vahalla Brewing Company (8 min) -  Craft brews, live entertainment, and a kitchen that’s open nightly.
- 1723 Vineyards (11 min) - New winery, family friendly.
- Maryland Beer Company (12 min) - Craft brews, food truck dining, and the space is dog-friendly.
- Elk River Brewing Company (14 min) - Craft brews with someone for everyone, serving local wines as well.
- Dove Valley Wine (14 min) - Tasty wines and beautiful outdoors.
description.transit:
Park up the the driveway by the dome. 
You can wander the grounds by foot (walking around the farm and down to the creek). To go on longer hikes, you'll need  a car though.
description.house_rules:
- *Booking guest need to be of the age of 25 or older*

- Absolutely No Parties Allowed!!! Any parties will result in immediate cancellation of reservation with no REFUND!

- Maximum occupancy will be 2 guests at ALL times. Any additional guests not stated in the reservation will incur a charge of $50 per night for each extra guest.

- Property strictly enforced quiet hours between 10PM and 8AM. There is a residential home on the property with permanent residents. No loud music, voices, or any other loud noises allowed during quiet hours. Please be respectful of the permanent residents who are your neighbors at all times. 

- Smoking in or within 10 feet of the dome will incur a fee of at least $250 or the actual cost of remediation, whichever is higher.

- No illicit drug use or underage drinking.

- Let us know if you are bringing a pet or pets and what kind you have.

- Wipe your pet(s)' paws before they enter the dome. We've provided some rags and towels for this purpose. 

- Pick up after your pet(s)' droppings.

- Remove shoes inside the dome. We provided a bin at the doorway if you'd like your shoes to be in the dome, rather than outside.

- Do NOT leave open food in the dome. It will attract ants and other pests. 

- Do NOT put diapers, wipes, pad or tampons into the toilet. They will NOT decompose as this is a compost toilet. We provided a separate trash bin for this. 

- Do NOT wash shaved hair or food waste down the sink. We provide a compost bin on the property behind the pull up bar with the blue posts -- it's past the bathroom, near the long term residents' parking.

- Shut the door of the dome when vacating. 

- Please wipe you pet's paws before coming into the dome. 

- Ensure all propane tanks that you used for cooking (camp stove, grill) are shut after usage.

This is a luxury camping experience. We offer an experience to unwind and be immersed in wonderful nature. We do not have AC, wifi, or a flushing toilet. Please also note that bugs get into our getaway dome. We use treatments that are safe for pets and humans around the tent, which reduces them, but not 100%. We have a fan in the dome to circulate air in addition to the breeze at the hilltop, and we have a compost toilet.

name: Luxe Dome + Hot Tub + Mtn View + 20min to AVL
title: Clyde, North Carolina

gallery.caption: Your private dome awaits with views you won't believe. Wake up above the clouds to a day filled with adventure, relaxation or whatever you need
This bed, that view, a perfect combination. (We have blackout curtains just in case though)

All of our Domes feature well equipped kitchenettes with a Breville Countertop Oven, Dual Burner Cooking Plate, Keurig, Bodum Pour Over and Tea Kettle, Baking Sheets, Pots & Pans, dinnerware and mini fridge/freezer

Our Luxe Domes are equipped with fireplaces for your enjoyment! These are super unique "gel" fireplaces that are fumeless and ventless. They are more for ambiance, but do put off a small amount of heat (6,000 BTUs).
Sunken hot tub with a beautiful mountain view!
Our domes have private bathrooms with beautiful slate tile and frameless glass showers!  We provide bath towels, linens, shampoo, body wash & lotion.
Dining or work space for two. All of our accommodations feature hi-speed wifi and we have great cell signal.  Come "work from home" like you never have before!
Plush king beds, pillows, sheets and duvet covers are provided for all of our guests. We also provide bath towels, wash cloths and make up towels as well as 2 hot tub towels for your stay.

Bring your friends or meet new ones at our 2 community amenity areas. Beautiful views, flagstone patio, fire pit, gas grills and picnic tables are the perfect place to gather and meet unique people from all over the world!
All of our domes have full heating and air for a comfortable stay, no matter the time of year!
Cool port hole windows!

The Breville Countertop Oven has all the functions of a regular oven, in a countertop package! It includes baking sheets and everything you need to cook a great meal, just bring your favorite ingredients!
Dining or work space for two. All of our accommodations feature hi-speed wifi and we have great cell signal.  Come "work from home" like you never have before!
Sunken hot tub on your private deck!  Beautiful mountain view!
This dome has a dedicated parking space, wheelchair accessible ramp and features many other wheelchair accessible elements.
Start your day with gourmet coffee or tea on your private deck with our Bodum Pour Over and Tea Kettle. These mugs just feel right in your hand.

Bring your friends or meet new ones at our 2 community amenity areas. Beautiful views, flagstone patio, fire pit, gas grills and picnic tables are the perfect place to gather and meet unique people from all over the world!
The Glamping Collective is a unique collection of mountaintop glamping accommodations just 20 minutes west of Asheville and 20 minutes east of Waynesville, NC.

Bring your friends or meet new ones at our 2 community amenity areas. Beautiful views, flagstone patio, fire pit, gas grills and picnic tables are the perfect place to gather and meet unique people from all over the world!

Enjoy a sunset (or sunrise) you won't forget from our private mountain summit! This is accessed via our Sunset Summit Trail- a private 2 mile out and back hike. Be ready for some elevation gain and bring a flashlight for the hike back down!
In the spring, or after a heavy rain, don't miss out the beautiful sounds and experience of our Creekside Trail. This looped trail begins/ends in what my 6 year old has deemed her "fairy garden".
Enjoy miles of private on-property hiking trails
View of our domes hiking down on the Sunset Summit Trail
The Glamping Collective is a unique collection of mountaintop glamping accommodations just 20 minutes west of Asheville and 20 minutes east of Waynesville, NC.
Sunrise the peak of our Sunset Summit trail. Enjoy a sunset (or sunrise) you won't forget from our private mountain summit!
This is a floor plan featuring our well thought out layout of the domes.
Hammock swing for two at one of our amenities areas!
Enjoy a sunset (or sunrise) you won't forget from our private mountain summit! Yes, this is a real photo on our property!
Hammock swing for two at peak of our Sunset Summit trail!
Take it all in- at the peak of our Sunset Summit trail!
Fire pit amenities area with a beautiful mountain view! Adirondack chairs and gas grills make this a great gathering spot!
Beautiful View of the Blue Ridge Mountains!
We share the mountain with mother nature!

all.name: No stairs or steps to enter

recent.comments: Our stay in the dome was absolutely incredible. We were impressed with how clean and nice the unit was, and the views did not disappoint! Sunset on the hammock swing is a must. 30-40min to Asheville depending on traffic, though we found Canton was quite nice and had plenty of food and cafe options for a weekend stay.

items.comments: Our stay in the dome was absolutely incredible. We were impressed with how clean and nice the unit was, and the views did not disappoint! Sunset on the hammock swing is a must. 30-40min to Asheville depending on traffic, though we found Canton was quite nice and had plenty of food and cafe options for a weekend stay.
Great place in an awesome spot! We will definitely be back

Super super super sick place to stay. You wake up legit above the clouds… you’ll never forget this place, I promise you that. 

Only negative were the hiking trails on the property. They weren’t the most maintained and didn’t lead to much. 

Overall tho, this was dope and it’d 10/10 recommend.
definitely the best place to stay !
Loved the stay, beautiful and very private! Matt was wonderful with communicating from the moment we booked throughout our stay!

Geodomes are the way to go! Such a cool experience. It’s like being suspended on the side of a mountain with no obstructing views. It is a stunning way to disconnect from the world in style with perfect 5 star hotel glamping amenities. Love that there is a private gated entrance up the mountain giving it that extra exclusiveness feel. Private hot tub preset and always hot along with a gas fire pit. Linens and bathroom were very nice but again that gorgeous view to fall asleep to and wake up to is where it is at. Ingles is a grocery store with gas at the bottom of the mountain your staying on - about 6 min away and it is all right off the highway. Perfect easy location. Dog friendly. Thank you for a great sister’s retreat.

Incredible experience at the The Glamping Collective!! We made a last minute decision to get out of town and found the geodomes on AirBnb. We were so excited to do something different & it looked amazing online. It was even better in person!! The layout of the entire place is impressive. The views throughout are stunning. The geodomes are designed & decorated beautifully, with modern touches & amenities. The kitchenette contained everything needed. The bed was super comfy & waking up to that expansive, open view of the mountains was an experience. Everything was just absolutely wonderful! We certainly enjoyed the hot tub & deck too!! Can't say enough about this place. The hosts were great too! Easy to communicate & willing to accommodate. We will be back!!

description.summary: Come enjoy our mountaintop glamping experience in our beautiful 23' Luxe Geodesic dome perfect for 1 or 2 people. This dome has one of the best views on our mountain and will provide one of your most memorable travel experiences to date! It comes with a private hot tub and fire table right on your deck. Inside you'll find a plush king sized bed, very well equipped kitchenette, table & chairs, sitting area, and a luxury bathroom with slate tile shower for 2! Wheelchair accessible.
description.space:
Our wheelchair accessible Luxe Geo Dome features a flat dedicated parking space with wheelchair accessible entry ramp and low threshold door for easy access. 

Come enjoy our mountaintop glamping experience in our beautiful 23′ Luxe Geodesic domes perfect for 1 or 2 person getaways. These domes have some of the best views on our mountain and will provide one of your most memorable travel experiences to date!

These premium domes have the best of the best views, private hot tub and fire table right on your deck and a variety of other luxe amenities. They are also the easiest to access with the shortest, downhill walk from our parking area.

Each of our 23′ Asheville Luxe Glamping Domes includes 400 square feet of conditioned interior space and 200 square feet of outdoor living space on an attached deck. Inside you’ll find a plush king sized bed, very well equipped kitchenette, table & chairs, sitting area and a luxury bathroom with slate tile shower for 2!

Step outside and you’re greeted with breathtaking mountain views from your private deck with Adirondack chairs and an outdoor dining table.

All domes are fully insulated, heated and cooled for a true luxury Asheville glamping experience!
description.access:
When you’re not relaxing in your personal glamping dome enjoy the mountaintop experience with 5 miles of on-property private hiking/ mountain biking trails and additional 10+ miles of public trails in the adjoining Rough Creek Watershed. Throughout your time exploring you’ll find scenic outlooks, swings, benches, massive boulders and restful water features with new discoveries around every corner. No trip is complete without a hike to the summit to take in sunrise or sunset from 4,334 feet of elevation with 40 mile views in every direction.

Near our Dome Village is a community area with a large fire pit, Adirondack chairs, outdoor grill, picnic tables and games to enjoy with your friends or make new ones!
description.notes:
Winter Weather Advisory: Please be advised that mountain roads are steep. It is your responsibility to drive a vehicle that can handle mountain roads and poor weather conditions. We will not provide refunds for guests due to snow/ice. Four wheel or all wheel drive vehicles are required anytime snow or ice is in the forecast (potentially late December - early April). Our location averages 10-12 inches of snow per season. It's a stunning time to be here, but we want you to be prepared and safe!

TRAVEL PROTECTION PLAN
Don’t have 4WD or AWD? We highly encourage you to purchase our Travel Protection Plan. You can cancel for any reason, up to 24 hours before check in time, for a full credit of nightly rate, pet fees and cleaning fees.
Our Travel Protection Plan allows you to cancel for any reason, up to 24 hours before check in time, for a full credit of nightly rate, pet fees and cleaning fees for $30(plus tax) per night of reservation.  

Please message or call us after making your reservation to add our Travel Protection plan!

Here are a few additional details:
●	Cancellation is provided as a credit towards a future stay, not a refund, this helps keep plan costs down. 
●	Travel Protection Plan fee is non-refundable, and not included in the credit
●	3rd Party Fees and Occupancy Taxes are non-refundable
●	Any fees paid to other parties, such are airfare, rental cars, tours & tickets are not covered by The Glamping Collective’s Protection Plan
●	Travel Protection Plan must be purchased no later than 14 days before your arrival date
●	“No shows” are not covered by our trip protection, you must cancel 24 hours before your arrival check in time
●	Our Travel Protection Plan is NOT INSURANCE
●	By purchasing our Travel Protection Plan you agree to these terms & conditions
description.neighborhood: Our Luxe Domes are one of multiple Glamping Rentals at The Glamping Collective spread across 160 acres, check our other listings to see the others. We have almost 5 miles of private hiking trails on property including our Sunset Summit Trail- to the summit of our private mountaintop glamping experience!
description.transit: Our Accessible Luxe Dome has a dedicated private parking space just outside your dome. Our location is just a few miles off interstate 40, 7 minutes from a Ingles Grocery, Starbucks, Brewery and great restaurants. We're also 20-25 minutes from Asheville and 20-30 minutes from Waynesville/ Maggie Valley! Our private roads are gravel, but easily traversed by all 2wd vehicles, except when snow or ice is present, then we recommend 4wd
description.interaction: Our team is on site everyday from 10am-4pm (lots to do on 160 acres!). We're available outside of those hours by phone or email and can come on site for emergencies 24 hours/day. We leave you space to enjoy a quiet, private mountain retreat!

Booking Policies

Cleaning Fee
There is a one time cleaning fee of $80 that will be included in your reservation at the time of charging.

Pet Policy
We welcome all well-behaved dogs to accompany their owners in certain units for an additional fee of  $125 per stay.
●  Dogs MUST be kept on a maximum, 6-foot leash under owner supervision and may not be left unattended at any time.
●  Guests are responsible to “clean up” after their dog. All dog waste must be properly disposed of in a dog receptacle.
●  You must bring your own towels to dry and clean your pet.  There will be a charge for stained towels.
●  Noisy, vicious or unruly dogs are not allowed.
●  Glamping Collective is not responsible for, and will hold dog owners accountable for, any injury or damage caused by their dog(s).
●  Dogs are not allowed on property without prior approval
Please add your dog when making your reservation.  You can add a dog after making your reservation by making a "change reservation" request.
Price may vary depending on the website the reservation was made.  

Weekend Rates
Higher rates apply to weekend stays and holidays.

Incidentals
Upon your departure, any room incidental charges will be appropriately billed to your credit card.

Taxes & Fees
All accommodations are subject to applicable taxes based on the nightly room rate, any add ons, and all incidentals.

Occupancy Policy
All rates are single or double occupancy. Domes: 2 guests maximum (including children) per dome. Cabins: 2 guests maximum per cabin.

Minimum Stay Policy
Most weekends require a 2 to 3 night minimum stay. Holiday and Event weekends may require a 3-plus-night minimum stay.

Check-In & Check-Out Policy
Check-in time is 3PM and check-out time is 11AM. Please make sure to adhere to these times as your Door Lock Code will automatically activate at check-in and deactivate upon check-out. 2PM late check-out can be requested for an additional $150, based on availability.

Smoking Policy
Glamping Collective is a non-smoking property. If you smoke inside your accommodation, a minimum cleaning fee of $350 will be charged to your account. The non-smoking policy refers to cigarettes, cigars, cannabis, e-cigarettes, and burning of candles or incense including patchouli and other strong fragrances.

Campfire Policy
Fire pits are located in our community amenity areas for your enjoyment and stocked with firewood for your use. Please do not start a fire outside of these provided fire pits. Please do not bring your own firewood onto the property, only use the provided firewood. Please burn responsibly as well! Our team cuts and places all firewood for your enjoyment, but please don't build a fire that can be seen from mars...it's a waste of wood and puts the entire property at risk. Thank you.

Overnight Stay Policy
Glamping Collective is a hotel with specific rooms associated with each reservation. No pitched tents, easy ups, pop-up shades, or RVs are allowed on the property or in the parking lot.

Good Neighbor Policy
Quiet hours are from 10 PM to 8 AM. Amplified sound or music is not permitted. Please be courteous to other guests around you. Loud, objectionable noise is not allowed at any time. Profanity or violence will not be tolerated. Inconsiderate guests will be asked to leave.

Reservation Cancellation by Property Policy
Glamping Collective reserves the right to cancel a reservation for any unforeseen reason. In the event a reservation cancellation on the part of Glamping Collective is deemed necessary, we will reschedule at guest’s request based on availability, or cancel and refund your reservation in full.

Damage & Missing Items
 Any damaged or missing items by you or your guests discovered in your accommodations, as a result of your stay, will be assessed and billed accordingly to your credit card.

Changes in Offering & Other Incidentals
Amenities and services are subject to change without notice. Specific unit numbers are not guaranteed and subject to change. We will do the utmost to fill specific requests.

Security
Glamping Collective is not responsible for lost, stolen, or damaged articles. Report any problems with your site to the onsite team immediately. We adhere to and maintain all state, county and local laws. The legal drinking age in North Carolina is 21 years. ID is required by all persons purchasing or consuming alcoholic beverages.

Communications & Correspondence
By staying with us, you consent to receive marketing, promotional, and sales emails, as well as direct or automated emails regarding your stay with us. You may opt out of this correspondence at any time. 
 
THIS IS A VACATION RENTAL AGREEMENT UNDER THE NORTH CAROLINA VACATION RENTAL ACT. THE RIGHTS AND OBLIGATIONS OF THE PARTIES TO THIS AGREEMENT ARE DEFINED BY LAW AND INCLUDE UNIQUE PROVISIONS PERMITTING THE DISBURSEMENT OF RENT PRIOR TO TENANCY AND EXPEDITED EVICTION OF TENANTS. YOUR SIGNATURE ON THIS AGREEMENT, PAYMENT OF MONEY, OR TAKING POSSESSION OF THE PROPERTY AFTER RECEIPT OF THE AGREEMENT, IS EVIDENCE OF YOUR ACCEPTANCE OF THE AGREEMENT AND YOUR INTENT TO USE THIS PROPERTY FOR A VACATION RENTAL.
1) The Glamping Collective is a rental cabin resort. The Glamping Collective (hereinafter the "Agent") is a privately owned property which rents geodesic domes and cabins.The Owner is not responsible or liable for any loss of the Tenant’s personal property, accidents, injury, or damage of any nature from any cause to the Tenant (including guests, licensees, or invitees) or by acts of God, wildlife, hiking, skiing conditions, recreational activities, weather conditions, or road conditions.
2) ROAD CONDITIONS:
Weather conditions in the mountains can be unpredictable. Sometimes rain, fog, snow, sleet, or ice create unexpected and hazardous driving conditions - especially during the colder months of November - April. Since road conditions may become hazardous during your stay, a 4-wheel drive vehicle and/or chains and the ability to drive on snow and ice are strongly recommended to get to or from any given property. IT IS YOUR RESPONSIBILITY TO ARRIVE FULLY PREPARED and there will be NO refunds, allowances, or date changes resulting from your negligence in this matter. Please do not ask.
3) RESPONSIBLE PARTY:
The person in whose name the property is reserved will be held responsible for all occupants complying with rental policies, procedures, and restrictions. Aside from normal wear and tear, the responsible party will be responsible to reimburse the Owner for any damages to the property or its contents during your vacation residency. The responsible party must be at least twenty-five (25) years of age and is required to stay in the property for the time reserved.
4) RENTAL CAPACITY:

 The majority of our cabins have a TWO person maximum for fire code (this includes children & infants each counting as a person). Please carefully check the number of people each unit sleeps as detailed on the website description. This represents the MAXIMUM number of people, including children, allowed to occupy the property and/or be upon the grounds of the property at any given time. Evidence of unauthorized excessive number of guests will result in an immediate charge of $50.00 per person per day to the credit card on file and possibly eviction. Authorization to allow extra people for gatherings or other short-term events must be obtained in writing. Authorization to rent a property for a purpose other than for a family vacation must be obtained in writing prior to finalizing the reservation.
5) EQUIPMENT FAILURE, HOUSEKEEPING, AND OTHER INCONVENIENCES:
All equipment in the unit should be in working order. Please immediately report any equipment problems to the office. Every effort will be made to rectify the problem, but WE CANNOT REFUND MONEY DUE TO MECHANICAL FAILURE. Please be patient if you encounter any inconveniences. We will be as responsive as possible and will do our best to rectify those things that are within our control. Samples of inconveniences which are not in our control and which do not warrant any refund of rental monies include but are not limited to: breakdown of satellite systems, hot tubs, or other appliances; poor cleaning issues; outages of the power, cable, internet, water, or telephone services; construction taking place in the area; flies, ladybugs, stinkbugs, or other insects inside the house; chipmunks, mice, or other rodents inside the house; bad weather including snow, sleet, rain, and fog; poor ski conditions; and hazardous road conditions.
We will do our best to ensure that the property is properly cleaned and sanitized prior to your arrival. If you are not satisfied with the housekeeping upon arrival, please notify our office immediately. If the office is closed, please use the after hours number provided in your arrival packet. We will send a housekeeper as quickly as possible. NO REFUNDS will be granted for unsatisfactory housekeeping, but every reasonable effort will be made to accommodate your needs.
6) DAMAGE TO THE PROPERTY:
Any damage must be reported immediately to The Glamping Collective in writing via email to host@theglampingcollective.com or by phone at 828-492-3620. The Cleaning
 
 fee does not negate your responsibilities as a Guest and is non-refundable. Damage excluded is anything not considered accidental and includes:
a. Intentional, willful, reckless, or malicious acts of the Tenant or others on the premises during the tenancy.
b. Excessive damage by pets.
c. Theft from the premises of the owner's property.
d. Gross negligence of Tenant or intentional misuse of furnishings, appliances, equipment, or other amenities provided within the home.
e. Damage caused while under the influence of alcohol or drugs.
f. Damages to property resulting from operation of any motorized vehicle by a Tenant.
g. Damages related to smoking inside the home.
h. Damages related to tampering with "Alarm Systems and Controls" or "Audio / Video / Internet wiring or component programming" within a property.
i. Damages related to the gas log fireplace due to the logs being re-arranged or burning wood/paper/marshmallows etc. inside the gas log fireplace.
j. Gross negligence of Tenant or intentional misuse of the home, by having an un-authorized party or gathering which results in extra housekeeping and/or damages.
k. Charges resulting from excess cleaning above and beyond what is normal for a property.
7) HOT TUB:
Please be aware that many, but not all, properties are equipped with a hot tub. By initialing, you indicate that you understand that it is your responsibility to check the property advertising and familiarize yourself with the amenities of the property, which may or may not include a hot tub. If the property is equipped with a hot tub, special instructions for its use apply. Failure to abide by these rules may result in creating unsafe conditions or damages to the equipment. Hot tubs are serviced and sanitized

 prior to guests’ arrival. Neither the Property Owner nor the Agent shall be liable for any injury or sickness due to using the hot tub.
8) AIR CONDITIONING:
There will be no refunds or switching of properties due to lack of air conditioning.
9)PETS:
Well behaved owners only! Pet restrictions are listed on the website. Pet-friendly properties accept pets with prior approval only and are subject to a non-refundable pet fee. It is Tenant’s responsibility to check the advertising and understand the pet restrictions on any given property, which includes the maximum number of pets allowed, and to abide by any weight restrictions. Unless otherwise specifically permitted in the advertising, no pets shall be allowed on the Premises. Tenant’s breach of this provision shall be considered material and shall result in forfeiture of any monies paid and the termination of tenancy. Pet(s) must be pre-treated for any ticks, fleas, worms, and parasites prior to your arrival. Please note that we cannot guarantee that properties advertised as not allowing pets have never had a pet on the property.
10) PROPERTIES ARE PRIVATELY OWNED:
The conditions of the property, as well as the furnishings, will vary according to the Owner’s desires. Every effort has been made to assure that the descriptions of the properties are correct; however, we cannot be responsible for changes made by the Owner to the furnishings or equipment in the units. There will be no refunds due to the property not being decorated or accommodated to Tenant’s individual preference or due to minor discrepancies with the website.
11) NUMBER OF CARS/ NO RV’s OR TENTS:
Please park in your cabin or dome’s designated parking spot or area. We recommend one vehicle per unit rented. If you must have a second car- please park that vehicle in the designated area for second cars. We do not allow pop up tents, RVs, pitched tents, or trailers. You must adhere to these regulations at all times during your stay.

 12) SUBSTITUTION:
We reserve the right to substitute accommodations if circumstances require. Circumstances include, but are not limited to: acts of Nature or other accidents that may render a unit uninhabitable.
13) WHAT IS PROVIDED AT THE DOME or CABIN UPON ARRIVAL:
All properties are set up for housekeeping, including linens and towels. We provide a STARTER SET of toilet tissue, paper towels, bath soap, dish soap, and trash bags. This is enough for one or two nights, but if you are staying for an extended length of time, you should plan to bring some supplies from home or plan to purchase these items at a grocery store when you arrive.
14) TENANT DUTIES:
Tenant agrees to comply with all obligations imposed by the Vacation Rental Act on Tenant with respect to maintenance of the Premises, including but not limited to keeping the Premises as clean and safe as the conditions of the Premises permit and causing no unsafe or unsanitary conditions in the common areas and remainder of the Premises that Tenant uses. Tenant agrees not to use the Premises for any activity or purpose that violates any criminal law or governmental regulation. Tenant’s breach of any duty contained in this paragraph shall be considered material and shall result in the termination of tenancy. Tenant shall not smoke tobacco or marjuana or use e-cigarettes, vaping, or incense within the house (see Item #12, page 3). Any evidence of smoking inside the property will result in an immediate $350 smoke removal home restoration fee billed to Tenant's card.
15) ITEMS LEFT IN UNIT:
Agent is not responsible for items left in rental units. In the event that Tenant leaves behind items of utmost importance, Agent will attempt to retrieve and return items at Tenant’s expense, but such retrieval cannot and will not be guaranteed.

 16) MANDATORY EVACUATION:
If State or Local authorities order a mandatory evacuation of an area that includes the Premises, Tenant shall comply with the order. Upon compliance, Tenant will be entitled to a refund of the pro-rated rent for each night that Tenant is unable to occupy the Premises because of the order. However, Tenant will not be entitled to a refund if, prior to taking possession of the Premises, (i) tenant refused insurance offered by Agent that would have compensated tenant for losses or damages resulting from loss of use of the Premises due to mandatory evacuation order, or (ii) Tenant purchased insurance offered by the landlord or real estate broker. The insurance offered shall be provided by an insurance company duly authorized by the North Carolina Department of Insurance, and the cost of the insurance shall not exceed eight percent (8%) of the total rent charged for the vacation rental to the tenant.
17) ENTRY FOR REPAIRS AND EXPEDITED EVICTION:
From time to time it may be necessary for employees of the Agent to enter the property during reasonable hours for any purpose connected with the repair, care, or management of the property. If the tenancy created hereunder is for thirty (30) days or less, the expedited eviction procedures set forth in the Vacation Rental Act will apply. Tenant may be evicted under such procedures if Tenant: (i) holds over in possession after Tenant’s tenancy has expired, (ii) commits a material breach of any provision of the Agreement (including any addendum hereto) that, according to its terms, would result in the termination of Tenant’s occupancy; (iii) fails to pay rent as required by this Agreement; or (iv) has obtained possession of the Premises by fraud or misrepresentation.
18) INDEMNIFICATION AND HOLD HARMLESS: RIGHT OF ENTRY; ASSIGNMENT:
Tenant agrees to indemnify and hold harmless Agent and the Owner from and against any liability for personal injury or property damage sustained by any person (including Tenant’s guests) as a result of any cause, unless caused by the negligent or willful act of Agent or Owner or the failure of Agent or the owner to comply with the Vacation Rental Act. Tenant agrees that Agent, Owner, or their respective representatives may enter the Premises during reasonable hours to inspect the Premises, to make such

 repairs, alteration, or improvements thereto as Agent or Owner may deem appropriate, or to show the Premises to prospective purchasers or tenants. Tenant shall not assign this Agreement or sublet the Premises in whole or part without written permission of Agent
19) COURT JURISDICTION:
This agreement and the performance thereof shall be governed, interpreted, construed, and regulated by the State of North Carolina. The parties agree to submit any matter arising out of this Agreement to the Federal courts located in Burke County, North Carolina and the State courts located in Watauga County, North Carolina. The parties further agree that said court shall have exclusive original jurisdiction over any matter relating to or arising from this Agreement and the parties' rights and obligations under this Agreement. Each of the parties hereby expressly waive any objection of defense it may have to the personal jurisdiction of the Federal and State courts located in the State of North Carolina. If Blue Ridge Rentals Holdings LLC (DBA Blue Ridge Mountain Rentals) must seek remedy in court for any reason, all attorney's fees and court costs shall be paid in full by Tenant.
20) POLICY ON EVENTS & LARGE GATHERINGS; NOISE:
Tenant understands that Property is a privately owned vacation rental home and is not intended to serve as an event venue. If Tenant wishes to hold any form of celebration, gathering, reunion, or other event at the Property, Tenant must first seek written permission from Agent before the reservation will be accepted or confirmed. If an unauthorized gathering occurs during Tenant’s reservation, Tenant understands that they will be required to leave the property immediately without refund. If any unauthorized event occurs, Tenant will be subject to a fine and will be responsible for all damages, additional cleaning, and additional trash charges. Tenant understands that neighborhood and county noise restrictions will be in effect for the duration of their rental.
HOT TUB SAFETY INSTRUCTIONS
 
 NOTE: PERSONS WITH A COMMUNICABLE DISEASE, OPEN WOUNDS, OR ANY INFECTION SHOULD NOT USE THE HOT TUB!
All of our hot tubs are professionally serviced between rentals.
Please follow the following instructions for using the hot tub and instruct your children and guests to do so as well. Failure to abide by these rules will place users at risk for infection and may also result in extra cleaning charges.
● Each guest must rinse off before entering the hot tub and after using the hot tub. Lotions, oils, hairspray, perfume, and deodorants may react with the chemicals in the water and failure to rinse off may subject users to infection.
● If there is a sanitizing dispenser floating in the water, do not tamper with it. You must leave it the water at all times to keep the water sanitized. Removing the sanitizer dispenser will place users at risk for infection
● Please do not add anything to the hot tub water including chemicals, soaps, bath oils, etc, as they clog the filter.
● Do not use oils, lotions, creams, etc. in the hot tub.
● Do not allow anyone to urinate in the hot tub.
● Take special care in removing cover- it is foam and fragile.
● Carefully place cover on hot tub when not in use to maintain heat and prevent
excess water & sanitizer evaporation.
● Make sure cover is secure when the hot tub is not in use.
● Do not turn off or unplug hot tub.
● Do not use glassware in the hot tub, as it can shatter.
The Property Owner shall NOT be liable for any injury or sickness due to using the hot tub. USE THE HOT TUB AT YOUR OWN RISK.

name: Luxury on the Edge of Traverse City
title: Williamsburg, Michigan

gallery.caption: A handcrafted King size barnwood bed.
Relax and enjoy 928 square feet of living space on a 1,700 square foot deck surrounded by pristine northwoods forest.  A hammock will be added in spring of 2023.
Nothing says northern Michigan like a campfire in the evening.
This site has its own full-size indoor bathroom with tub/shower, vanity, and toilet.

recent.comments:
We absolutely loved our stay !  The dome is super unique and is in a beautiful, peaceful setting.  Everything we needed as provided - which is very nice.  Comfy bed and fluffy towels.  Our pup loved it too !

We definitely recommend and will book again when in Traverse City !!

items.comments:
We absolutely loved our stay !  The dome is super unique and is in a beautiful, peaceful setting.  Everything we needed as provided - which is very nice.  Comfy bed and fluffy towels.  Our pup loved it too !

We definitely recommend and will book again when in Traverse City !!
We enjoyed our stay! It was peaceful and relaxing. It was the perfect getaway to celebrate our anniversary. All the nice touches are amazing. The furniture is beautiful! We will be back again!

Rob’s place was breathtakingly beautiful, peaceful.  The bed made us feel like royalty.  We slept so soundly. They thought of every possible detail and yet no clutter. We recommend and give this magical retreat 100 out of 5 stars! It’s worth every penny!

This place was exactly how it looks! A dome in the woods. The atmosphere was relaxing and the owner was very responsive and proactive with messages! It truly was close to everything. The owner suggested a pizza place (which was great) that had maps of traverse city which was very helpful! My suggestion to other travelers for this place is to bring a robe to get between the dome and the bath house unless you leave clothes in the bath house to change into after a shower!
You won’t regret staying in this one-of-a-kind place. Spotless, private, and very cool to stay in the dome!
Beautiful place to spend a few nights, bed was comfortable, custom furniture was awesome and the outdoor tub was the icing on the cake. Definitely would recommend!

We read a review that said, ‘don’t overthink it,’ and decided to follow that advice. SO glad we did! The place was immaculate, peaceful, and so unique. It was also a quick drive to everywhere we wanted to go (wine-tasting, downtown TC). Very glad we booked it :)

description.summary: Enjoy an intimate experience with nature and all the amenities of a luxury resort yet only minutes away from Traverse City's finest restaurants, beaches, wineries, shopping, and golf.  Only 3 miles from the Great Lakes Equestrian Show and 1.5 miles from Turtle Creek Casino. 780 sq. ft. of living space with majestic views.  The dome is spacious and 13' tall. Enjoy a private bathroom complete with a bathtub/shower, vanity, & toilet, kitchen with a refrigerator, microwave, & hot plate. AC & Heat.
description.space:
Geodesic Dome Home #5 features a massive, handcrafted king-size barnwood bed that is positioned to provide incredible views of the surrounding pristine forest.  A dividing wall separates the bedroom and living room.  The living room space has two chairs and a coffee table.  Should it rain, there is a TV to stream your favorite movie.  There is a private, indoor bathroom and kitchen. The bathroom has a full-size tub and shower.

Outside you will find a second bathtub.  This outdoor bathtub is private and positioned so you can enjoy a relaxing bath while listening to the relaxing sounds of nature.  In addition, there is a private firepit, barbeque, and hammock.  We provide one complimentary bundle of firewood for each day booked.  

With 75 acres of private land surrounded by state land on three sides, you will have access to miles of trails for hiking and birding.  Pine, cedar, spruce, and cherry trees provide a natural privacy barrier from neighboring accommodations.  Neighboring accommodations range from 80' to 300' away.  Please be careful driving in or out in the evening as there is an abundance of deer and other wildlife in the area.  We seek to provide you with a unique, intimate interaction with nature, yet you are only a few miles away from the best of Traverse City.
description.neighborhood:
Near By Destinations

The Silver Birch Resort is located just a few miles from dozens of attractions.

Horse Show – Traverse City Horse Shows is 3 miles away.  Shows run from June until September.  Check their website for show days and hours

Beaches & Swimming – some of Traverse City’s finest beaches are only 5 miles away on East Bay (due west until you dead end into US31, turn left and immediately turn right.

Wine Tasting – Traverse City’s reputation for producing world-class wines is quickly growing as many of the wineries have been winning awards. Most of these wineries call Old Mission Peninsula home. Even if wine is not your on To Do list, the drive through the rolling hills of the peninsula will provide breathtaking views of East and West Bays. The mouth of the peninsula is approximately 10 miles from Silver Birch Resort. After sampling the wonderful wines, you might as well drive to the northernmost point of the peninsula and visit Mission Point Lighthouse.

Breweries – Traverse City and the surrounding areas have a plethora of micro-breweries featuring locally grown hops. Some of our favorites include Shorts Brewery and Stone Hound Brewing Company. Please note: the owners believe in constantly checking the quality of all our local beers. We have never had a bad beer in any of the dozen downtown breweries.

Shorts Brewery – 211 Industrial Park Drive, Elk Rapids, MI 49629
Stone Hound Brewery – 3593 Bunker Hill Rd, Williamsburg, MI 49690

Shopping – downtown Traverse City with street after street of unique gift shops, clothing boutiques, restaurants, and bistros is only 11 miles away.

Elk Rapids – charming Elk Rapids is only 20 miles away. Would you like to see a real-life “Norman Rockwell” town? It doesn’t get any better than this. The beaches are some of the finest in northern Michigan, but sharing this secret will get us in trouble with many of the locals who refuse to tell visitors about Elk Rapids for not wanting to see it lose its “yesterday” charm. Please don’t tell anyone where you got this information. Elk Rapids also has an authentic single-screen movie theatre that was built in the early nineteenth century. You will feel like you are stepping back to a bygone era. The popcorn, root beer & cherry soda is some of the best you’ve ever had. If a movie is desired, be sure to bring cash as twenty-first-century plastic is not accepted. All employees are committed to keeping the old-fashioned movie experience authentic.

Restaurants

Both Traverse City and Elk Rapids are considered “foodie” towns. Restaurants in our area that serve mediocre food do not last long. Just about every restaurant in this area has good quality food. Some of the owners’ favorites are:

Hopscotch Brick Oven & Taproom
2032 US-31, Traverse City, MI 49686

Red Ginger is located in downtown Traverse City. If you like calamari, you must try the appetizer.
237 E Front St, Traverse City, MI 49684

Red Mesa on US31 offers Mexican/Spanish dishes.
1544 US-31 N, Traverse City, MI 49686

Pearls in Elk Rapids specializes in Louisiana Cajun cooking.
617 Ames St, Elk Rapids, MI 49629

McGee’s in Acme. The closest restaurant and only four miles away.
4341 M-72, Williamsburg, MI 49690

Jolly Pumpkin on Old Mission Peninsula.
13512 Peninsula Dr, Traverse City, MI 49686

Don's Drive Inn. 50's diner theme with great burgers and killer milkshakes.
2030 US 31 N., Traverse City, MI 49686

Pizza Options
East Bay Pizza – In our opinion, the best pizza (partly because the owner’s brother operates it) is East Bay Pizza. Their pizza is outstanding and dining in will also give you one of the best views of the Bay. They also serve 30 flavors of Moomer’s Ice Cream. Moomers won the title of Best Ice Cream in America in a contest sponsored by Good Morning American. A perfect summer night in northern Michigan is defined by a good pizza, ice cream, and breathtaking sunsets on the Bay. East Bay Pizza has all three.
4386 US-31, Traverse City, MI 49686

That’s A Pizza – want to eat in? That’s A Pizza will deliver right to your site. This was the owner’s favorite pizza place until his brother opened. They have excellent pizza and a great staff.
5430 US-31, Williamsburg, MI 49690

Sleeping Bear Sand Dunes – named by Good Morning American as “The Most Beautiful Place in America”. People come from all over the world (no joke, Sleeping Bear sees tens of thousands of visitors from Europe and Japan who travel specifically to see the sand dunes. Expending a little energy and climbing the dunes affords you unbelievable views of Lake Michigan and surrounding lakes. You will quickly realize why Good Morning American bestowed this title. The Sleeping Bear Sand Dunes are approximately 36 miles away.

Charlevoix, Michigan – another wonderful, charming town with great restaurants, shopping, and breathtaking views.

Golfing – we are located near three of Michigan’s finest golf courses: The Bear, The Wolverine, and LochenHeath. Check out their websites for all the awards and reviews. These golf courses are only 4 miles away.

The Bear, The Wolverine, and LochenHeath

Turtle Creek Casino –   If you enjoy the excitement of gambling and the nightlife, you will only be 1.5 miles away from the beautiful Turtle Creek Casino.  In addition to your favorite games, there is a fine restaurant and club with music and dancing.
description.house_rules:
PET POLICY

We are dog lovers.  We have two of our own.  We did realize at the end of last year that we must put a pet policy in place. A guest last year left their dog all day in the dome, and it barked the entire time they were gone disrupting the experience of other guests.  This was a dog with a deep, loud bark.  The dog barked for eight hours straight which was impressive as you would think it would lose its voice after a few hours.  Everyone’s nerves were fried by the time the people returned. 

We recently had a guest that asked if they could bring their dog. Even after reading this policy, they let their dog bark for almost an hour. It was not continuous, but it was 5 to 10 seconds of stressed-out, loud barking, and then silence. Every 5-10 minutes there was a barking outburst. I think they tied it up outside, and it wanted to come in the side. The dog was trying to get their attention.  I really did not want to have to walk down there and have a talk with them as we are trying for everyone to have a nice experience. I was very close to walking to their site, and then it stopped for the evening. The problem is the other five domes in the area. This had to disrupt their barbecues, campfires, and evening.
 
Everyone knows their dogs.  Our two dogs would not bark if we left them somewhere unless they were startled.  This is understandable and acceptable.  If you have a dog that will bark from separation anxiety, we ask that he/she not be left alone (or outside alone while the family is indoors).  If you feel, the dog would only bark if startled, then we are fine with a dog.  If you are going to leave for a few hours, we ask that it be kenneled and left in the kitchen/bath structure – NOT left in the dome.  The kitchen/bath structure has more insulation, and the occasional bark will not travel through the entire property. 

The other requirement we have for pets is that they are not allowed on the beds. We have already had to replace two comforters this year because we were not able to get the dog hair out. Please try and bring a dog bed.  If you cannot, we leave an extra sheet in the dresser drawer. This is specifically for your dog. You can lay this on the floor in an area and your pet is welcome to sleep on this. Dog hair on the comforter is subject to a $100 replacement fee.
 
If you agree to these pet policies, you are welcome to bring your dog.  

We are located on 75 acres and surrounded by thousands of acres of state forestry with trails. You can walk for miles and miles.  This is the perfect property to take your dog for a nice long walk.  If he or she will run after a deer, fox, raccoon, or porcupine, then we strongly suggest a lease as you are sure to see wildlife.

hosts.about: A growing network of outdoor parks and people dedicated to creating greater individual wellness by expanding access to experiences in nature in a predominantly digital world.

Wolfpack engineer, rock climber, and day dreamer following the typical path until discovering a new and unlikely future in these mountains. My story starts mid-summer in Marc’s garage: 

2 meddling kids are printing t-shirts with a dream of traveling west. After 35 days of car-camping and hiking across the country, these kids discovered how little they needed to be happy. Inspired, they set out to share the simple gift of nature with others.

description.summary: Breathe deeper in mountain air at the edge of the Eastern Divide. Hike 3 popular waterfall hikes nearby, or sip hot coffee from your king bed with a view of the Black Mountains. Center yourselves on our custom curved deck overlooking 60 acres. Secluded, but only 5 mins from Walmart for supplies. PLEASE NOTE (1) This is a fully off-grid experience (2) the Outhouse is shared with one other site and is ~3 min walk from dome, (3) there's an uphill walk to the dome on a wooded trail, (4) More details
description.space:
Our land is situated at a center point of some of the best hiking in North Carolina. Less than 45 mins from Linville Gorge, Mt. Mitchell, Grandfather Mountain, and Roan Mountain, and within 20 mins of 3 waterfall hikes at Crabtree Falls, Tom's Creek Falls, and Linville Falls. We are located over a mile from any residences on our own forested ridge, but only a 5 min drive from Walmart for quick supply runs.

FRIENDS/Additional Guests: There is only 1 king bed. If you have a friend who would like to join, they are welcome to lay a pad on the wood floor or pitch a tent on the cleared area by the fire pit (max of 2 additional guests).

KITCHEN -- You will have a gas grill & side burner cooking setup with two 7-gallon water jugs, sink basin, and a 55-quart cooler pre-filled with ice.

POWER -- 1000Wh portable solar battery + 400W of solar panels provide power for charging devices, lights, and a standing fan.

HEAT - There is a propane heater that will keep the dome warm at night, but no permanent heating system.

BATHROOM -- About 3 mins walk from the dome, there's an outhouse stocked with toilet paper & hand sanitizer by the parking area! This is shared with Gnome's Yome guests. It is on your left as you pull into the parking area, about 100 ft down a trail.

ACCESS -- You will park about 150 ft away from the dome and hike uphill to it via a fairy-lit trail through the forest. NOTE you will drive on a mile of gravel road to get to the property that can be rough in a few areas. There is nothing steep, just chewed up and bumpy. (take it slow and you should be fine).

FIRE -- Fires are allowed in the fire ring only. Gather your own fire material from the site or purchase firewood from Walmart to make things easy!

TO-BRING-LIST: 
- Sturdy shoes or boots (Chaco folks, strap up!)
- Reusable water bottle
- Headlamp
- Extra layer or two
- Bug spray

LOCATION: Crabtree Falls, Grassy Creek Falls, & Tom's Creek Falls all within a 15-min drive. Take our favorite stretch of the Blue Ridge Parkway to Linville Gorge - 25 mins to Linville Falls, Babel Tower, and Wisemann's View! Or head the other way to the tallest peak East of the Mississippi, Mt. Mitchell.
description.access: You have full access to the dome's immediate surroundings, private fire pit area, outhouse trail, and a short hike to Hoot Owl Falls on the property.
description.notes: *** Visit our Airbnb profile to book the entire property and all 3 glamping sites (4 beds, sleeps 8 guests). ***

hosts.about:
My name is Michell and I am so excited to be your host! 

My husband Tyler and I are Long Island natives that recently relocated to The Catskills with our four children ages 1-6. We truly love The Catskills and all that it has to offer. This is our happy place and we can’t wait for you to experience the beauty!

We own a Property Management and Construction company so we love taking on new projects and meeting new people!

My goal is to ensure that you have a 5-star experience in staying with us and encourage guests to let me know if there is anything they need before or during their stay with us!

My husband Ian and I purchased the Shell House in 2015 and we love stewarding and sharing this special place. In 2018-2020 we created and hosted a biannual artist residency program called Shell House Arts, where artists and designers were invited to create, build, and imagine new works while living communally for two weeks here in the beautiful Catskill mountains. If you stay with us you can see some of the works displayed around the house.

After 11 years in NY we are currently living in California to be closer to family. Rest assured you will be in good hands with Michell as your host, and we're always happy to help or answer any questions.

description.summary: Stay in a light-filled modern architectural wonder unlike anything else you'll find in the Catskills— just 5 miles outside of the town of Roxbury and 7 miles outside the town of Margaretville! The Shell House half dome, featured in Dwell and other design magazines, was built to be in harmony with the environment and boasts a beautiful view of the Catskills from every room. Extraordinary communal spaces and unique rooms will make this a stay you won't soon forget.
description.space:
Kitchen & Appliances

Enjoy cooking, eating, and relaxing with friends and family in the wonderful open concept floor plan of the Shell House Half Dome!!

The kitchen was renovated in 2018 and has been featured on well known design sites such as Dwell and Dezeen. It includes all new Bosch appliances and heated cement floor tiles. The large fridge is great for hosting groups and has a built-in ice maker in the freezer compartment. The kitchen is well stocked with all the supplies groups need for cooking and baking. Spices, baking goods, and other cooking essentials are also provided. There is a drip coffee maker, french press with coffee grinder, tea kettle, and pour over coffee maker provided. 

The dining table can comfortably seat 10 adults. There are also two stools for additional seating at the island.

Living Room

The living room has 25-foot ceilings with floor to ceiling windows highlighting the unique architecture of the dome. It features a bluetooth speaker, double walkout doors to the patio, and a large crescent-shaped blue sectional with marble coffee table and two woven lounge chairs for extra seating. All windows in the living room have roll down shades. The television is located in the hallway closet on rolling stand. It is an Apple TV with Hulu, Disney+, Netflix, and many other streaming apps to enjoy during your stay.

There is also a modern credenza full of indoor games and puzzles, as well as outdoor activities stored in the tall cabinet. 

Rooms & Sleeping Arrangements

There are three bedrooms on the ground floor. The first and second bedrooms have queen sized beds while the third bedroom has a full sized bed. Each room has floor to ceiling windows that overlook five private acres and the Catskill mountains. The first bedroom has a private walk-out door onto the large patio. Each room is comfortably outfitted with storage and a desk for guests. 

The full main bath has a shower/tub combination and is located across from bedroom one.

The loft has two full beds, two desks, storage, and a full bathroom with walk-in shower.

There is also a half bath located off the living room which includes a Whirlpool Washer and Dryer available for guest use.

Outdoors

The 2,000 sq ft outdoor patio features a fire-pit, barbecue, and table and chairs for outdoor dining. There's additional patio lounge chairs as well as a hammock for use in the warmer months. 

The property itself is five acres and includes a large lawn, fruit trees, and a pollinator garden. 

Private driveway for guest parking fits four cars comfortably.
description.access:
The home is self-check-in, we will not be on the property. We will provide the key code to an electronic keypad for the front door entrance a few days before your stay. 

Guests have access to the entire home including backyard patio which includes a fire pit, barbecue, and outdoor table with chairs.
description.notes:
We're lucky to have a number of great options for food and activities nearby. 

4.6 miles from Watershed, The Fierce Grizzly, Roxbury Wines, and Chappies in Roxbury.
7.3 miles from Pakatakan Farmers Market, Cafe Marguerite and Freshtown Marketplace in Margaretville.
14.6 miles from Bellearye Mountain Ski Center.
5.9 miles from Plattekill Mountain.

We also recommend day trips to Andes, Bovina, and Bloomville just over the mountain on scenic rural roads.

description.summary:
Located one hour from Toronto, Birchwood is a luxury camping (Glamping) experience for two. Immersed in a private forest on Scugog Island, our geodesic dome allows for a cozy and relaxing getaway. Enjoy the surrounding landscape and check out local shops and restaurants on Port Perry’s main street.

Our geodome is designed for 2 guests however small families of 4 or a group 3 adults are welcome. Additional guests must be 12yrs or older and added to your reservation at the time of booking.
description.space:
Reconnect with the surrounding forest through floor to ceiling windows and view the stars from the moonroof above your bed. Our dome has heating and cooling and many unique features for you to enjoy a luxurious stay. 

Our living area is decorated and inspired by the great outdoors to create a calm, relaxing experience for guests. It is equipped with a King bed, kitchenette, dining and living area. Free WIFI is also provided. 

The bathroom and shower & hot tub are one with nature. They sit in the woods detached from the Geodesic dome. 

(Please note the bathroom is a glamourous outhouse & our shower is open seasonally and closes when temperatures dip below freezing)
description.access:
The dome is just a short drive from the Great Blue Heron Casino or Port Perry main St.  

DIRECTIONS, PARKING & ENTRY:
- Self check-in 
- Property comes with free parking.
- Enter NORTH driveway marked with Birchwood sign on gate. Push gate to open and close behind you as you enter.
- If you turn into a paved driveway and see a house you have gone down the wrong driveway
- Park in the designated area and walk your belongings to the dome.
- CAUTION forest landscape be careful not to slip, trip or fall proper footwear is recommended  
- To enter, use the keypad code sent to you followed by the lock button. To lock the door, hold the door shut and press the lock button, no code needed.
description.notes:
SHOWER 
Outdoor shower is a seasonal amenity it will be closed early to mid November. 

ENTRY
Enter through the North gate drive past the South driveway and paved house driveways it’s the 3rd  gate off island road
description.house_rules:
Our geodome is designed for 2 guests however small families of 4 or a group 3 adults are welcome. Additional guests must be 12yrs or older and added to your reservation at the time of booking.

CHILDREN:
Children 12yrs. or older are welcome. Please read the following thoroughly prior to booking. 

If you are bringing your children add them to your booking. Additional charges apply. Max (2 children) 

Don't forget this is a camping experience it is important to take the following into consideration if you are coming with your child. 

CHILDREN:
Children are welcome at our domes! The North dome is more spacious however you can fit 2 kids at either North or South. We have a blow up bed and linens for additional $25.00. Or you can bring your own child safe sleep set up.

The dome and surrounding landscape are NOT child proof therefore children should be closely monitored by a guardian at all times. Children are not permitted to use the hot tub (North dome). Come prepared with proper clothing for the weather. Child safe bug repellant & sunscreen as necessary. 

heating and cooling is not like a typical home thermostat. The dome can get cold or hot very quickly if the heat is not closely monitored. If you decide to book during the cold Winter (-10 or below) or hot Summer (+25 or above) we suggest you bring your baby monitor to help regulate the temperature.

If doors, curtains left open or you turn off the heat / cool pump or pellet stove it will cool down or heat up quickly.

We have a mini fridge (North) full fridge (South) so if you are bringing additional food keep in mind cooling space can be limited you may decide to bring a cooler with ice as well for longer stays! 

I hope this helps give you more info to decide what your comfortable with! 

INFANTS & TODDLERS:
Infants or toddlers are not permitted to stay in our geodome.
