description.summary: Unplug from your busy life and reconnect with nature in this brand new glamping dome experience - complete with a cozy king size bed, wood fired cedar hot tub, composting toilet, and picnic table. Enjoy the nature path as it leads to a grassy clearing with a fire pit and Adirondack chairs. You will have two heavily wooded, fenced in acres all to yourself with clearings for the dome, tub and fire pit. We provide water via a large water cooler, and bright, cheery lantern-style flashlights at night
description.space: This peaceful dome is completely off the grid- truly an escape and chance to pause, breathe, and recharge. We do provide strong Wi-Fi should you choose to watch movies on your laptop or phone. There is a charging station available to charge your phone or laptop. Use the propane stove to quickly heat water for (included) tea or coffee, or scramble some fresh, free range (seasonally included!) chicken eggs. A large water cooler provides plenty of fresh drinking water. The composting toilet is conveniently located immediately behind the dome, and there’s an included shower bag that will heat water for a “sun shower.” Enjoy a relaxing soak in the wood-fired cedar soaking tub that is frequently tested and sanitized only by Ah Natural mineral hot tub sanitizer (no chlorine or bromine smell, no burning eyes…) and take a relaxing walk on the 1/3 mile hiking trail, ending in a clearing with a fire pit and wooden swing. There are a few neighbors surrounding our property but you can barely catch glimpses of their homes or lights through the forest, especially spring-fall.
description.access: Everything inside the fenced area is yours to explore! Two acres of forests, streams, shaded paths and privacy. Perch atop the large boulder for a gorgeous view of the two intersecting streams. Livestock are contained on the opposite sides of many of the fences- feel free to offer treats to the sheep, horses and chickens (included in labeled jars.) Keep your palm flat when offering the treat! You can scatter grain for the chickens as well- but no guarantees the chickens will stay within the fences. Our chickens enjoy true free-range status.
description.notes:
The wood fired cedar hot tub takes a couple of  hours to heat up and needs tending when you first light it so the fire doesn’t die out. You will be the one building the fire inside the internal oven, but we’re happy to provide directions and suggestions. All supplies, kindling and firewood that you need to heat up the soaking tub are provided, but it can be a bit tricky to get started at first- if you have questions or run into issues, feel free to text! 

We also provide wood for the fire pit in the clearing. If you need more wood than what we’ve supplied, we can bring you additional firewood for a $10 charge. 

We have sheep, horses and chickens roaming the property full time, and there are chicks and lambs born every year, typically in the spring and summer months. Feel free to feed them the treats provided, they are used to humans. However, animals are unpredictable- interact at your own risk :)

The Dome is located just minutes from downtown Travelers Rest, with a variety of wonderful restaurants, breweries, and cute local shops.

There are also more hiking trails and waterfall viewing experiences than I can list extremely conveniently located a short drive away. If you enjoy bicycling, the Swamp Rabbit Trail is a ten minute drive away. Don’t have a bike? Sunrift Adventures in downtown Travelers Rest will hook you up.
description.neighborhood: You may be able to see glimpses of a few homes through the woods at some vantage points. However, the location is generally secluded and private. Nonetheless, please avoid being intentionally excessively loud or disruptive!
description.transit: Park in your own graveled space and  entrance, then take a 800 foot walk to the dome down a grassy path. There will be a cart provided to tote your luggage. Enjoy these steps into nature and away from the day-to-day!
description.interaction: You can call or text my cell number if you need anything during your stay. If you want to be left totally alone, that’s completely fine as well! I’m available if you need assistance but otherwise enjoy your peace and solitude.
description.house_rules: Please avoid excessive noise, especially after dark!

hosts.about:
I work in government. I'm also a mom, an urban gardener, and a host. 
Outside of work, my focus is family. I  am big into sustainable living.  My home has solar panels and rain barrels.  I compost and have a backyard food forest. Friends consider me a living pinterest board.

My mantra is “Start where you are. Do what you can.  Use what you have.”
A public interest attorney who loves outdoor, off-grid living, and his beautiful 7-year-old daughter, Maia.

recent.comments: I loved the idea of staying at the Geo Dome. It was in a scenic location, however the road getting up to it was not well maintained. Even with a truck it was difficult to drive. The day we arrived it rained and there was no way I would have walked from the bottom of the hill to the Geo Dome carrying all my stuff (luggage, cooler, etc.). It was pouring down rain and the road was very rocky, unlevel, with lots of high and low spots which made it difficult to navigate. It was also very slippery and muddy, which he did say, but you don’t realize how bad it is until you actually have to go up it. Thank goodness for my four wheel drive truck! I can’t even imagine walking up that on a wet rainy or dry day! The Geo Dome itself was very nice inside. We could not get the hot water to work and to be honest we didn’t even bother to call for help with it, because we had other family staying in the area so we just bathed at their rental. All in all it was we enjoyed our stay just don’t  drive a car.

The domes mechanics were easy to operate.  I will be booking again- I’d like to see the dome in each season.

description.summary:
Come enjoy our off-grid, eco-focused, and outdoor-centric geo-dome! 

Just 21 minutes away from historic Cooperstown and Oneonta, this private three-acre parcel boasts unblemished mountain views and includes; a real bed with fresh linens, WiFi, a hot outdoor shower, solar-powered electricity for phone and computer charging, mini fridge, rustic wood-fired indoor stove, and indoor toilet.

Don't see dates that you'd like? Look up our nearby Tiny Home @ Maias Place!
description.space: A geodesic dome on top of a private 3-acre parcel for your enjoyment. The dome is located up a hill off a trail. It is a 1 minute drive or a 5 minute hike. If it is raining or has recently rained, you will need to park your car at our driveway and walk up to the dome for your safety.
description.access: You can enjoy the entire 3-acre parcel to yourself. Anywhere within the rope and chainlink fences is available for you to roam and relax with the best views being in the back of the property by the dome.
description.neighborhood: Our geodesic dome is located on a private and secluded property.  You'll wake up to beautiful mountain views on your own private 3.25 acre plot. It is 23 minutes to Cooperstown and 29 minutes to Oneonta
description.transit: When you arrive, you will drive up a dirt road. You can park in near the dome. The site itself is an open field lined with trees.
description.interaction: Please feel free to reach out to us via the Airbnb app or cell.

hosts.about: We are Maddie & Ben — small business owners in Atlanta, GA. As a marketer and bartender/consultant with 4 kids, we are all about home, memories, and quality experiences. When we're not working we love to enjoy a good porch drink with friends, walk the Westside Beltline Trail, or eat good food around town.

recent.comments: We throughly enjoyed our stay. We are planning on visiting again in the future.

items.comments: We throughly enjoyed our stay. We are planning on visiting again in the future.

If you are looking for a memorable experience, something beyond the status quo of what one may find with an Air BnB experience, we encourage booking this location. We booked this because the uniqueness of the space matched our aesthetic, however, we were in for much more than what we imagined. Firstly, everything is exactly how it looks in the photos, yet somehow even better in person. The geometry of the space carries a comforting energy that is unlike that of being in a traditional rectangular home. It's something you have to experience beyond words. It adds to the additional layer of being nestled in the woods. What was also impressive was the intelligent design of the living space. Although it's one big open dome, the layout of each section of the home still feels like its own individual space, simultaneously connected to other parts of the - again, something you must experience to understand the paradox. Overall It was an excellent 5-day getaway from city life. Thank you Maddie!
It is awesome place to stay away from noise and calm nature vibes.
would stay again

This was a perfect romantic getaway. What a beautiful and unique place to stay! It is well-appointed with attention to every detail. The interior design is beautiful. The bedding was upscale and comfortable. Upon our arrival, essential oils were being infused and bedside lamps turned on. The home was immaculate. We enjoyed exploring every nook and cranny of this fabulous geodesic dome. The deck was peaceful and a perfect place for coffee in the morning and wine in the evening. 
The location is 4 minutes from Amicalola Falls- where we enjoyed a wonderful hike to the top. We also visited Monteluce Winery for a wine tasting and charcuterie and dinner.
 I hope to visit again during apple picking season. I think any season will be amazing at the ga mountain dome home. 
Thank you Maddie for taking care of us and looking after every detail. You and Ben are great hosts!
The dome home is truly a one of a kind experience! Great location. Beautiful scenery and lots to do. Highly recommend and can’t wait to stay again!!
Absolutely incredible Airbnb

description.summary:
Tons of fun details make this secluded, freshly renovated 1984 geodesic dome a true vacation paradise, while the amenities (modern kitchen, laundry, A/C, and internet) will make you feel right at home!
 
Enjoy your coffee from the private wraparound deck overlooking Amicolola State Falls Park, or stoke the wood fire in the living room to warm up during the winter. Stay as a romantic getaway for two or grab your friends and rent the attached 1BR/1BA cottage with king bed & trundle day bed.
description.space:
DOME & COTTAGE

The dome boasts an open floor plan on the main that feels much roomier than its 1200 square feet. The upstairs hosts 1 private bedroom with king bed and 1 lofted semi-private queen bed sleeping area, comfortably sleeping 4 total. 
 
The cottage (connected by the same wrap-around deck) includes 1 studio style apartment with 1 king bed and full private bathroom.
 
The house comes equipped with all the modern conveniences: the best internet money can buy in the woods (good for streaming and video conferencing), a brand new Frame TV, a bluetooth speaker, a french press coffee station in the cottage and electronic key access for easy self check-in.
 
The dining room table seats 6 for easy meals & games, the vintage Eames chair upstairs is conveniently located in a lofted nook with the bookshelf, and the whole gang can cozy up on one of two couches for movie night.
 
The yard is very private and wooded - perfect for a true getaway (that is 10 minutes from restaurants, wineries, apple orchards, and more) and complete with outdoor wood & gas fireplaces.
 
You’ll feel at home in the fully-stocked kitchen. An array of kitchen tools, pots, and pans are complemented by a microwave, coffee maker, coffee grinder. We try to maintain a decent supply of basics (olive oil, coffee filters, spices, salt & pepper), but IGA about 10 minutes away has an array of groceries if you’re in need of something particular. We also always have cocktail glasses on hand.
description.access: Guests will have private access to the dome + cottage with their rental. The original barn on the property and the interior ladder leading up to the cupola are both not accessible to guests.
description.notes:
Looking for things to do? During the day, your options are endless… 
- Enjoy several local wineries, all within 15 minutes of your stay (Fainting Goat Vineyards, Cartecay Vineyards, Chateau Meichtry Family Vineyard and Winery)
- Make a reservation at Big Canoe's finest Home Restaurant (Alex will take good care of you) or enjoy delicious cocktails from Matt at the bar
- Pick apples at B.J. Reece Orchard or R & A Orchards
 
After a long day, you’ll love enjoying a glass of wine by the indoor wood fireplace or outside on the wrap-around deck with gas fireplace.
 
We believe in an environment of inclusivity and diversity and have done our best to ensure everyone feels welcome here!
 
Other things to note
***While we love welcoming kids of all ages we encourage adults to take a second look at the open stairs and wide minimal railings on the loft before they confirm their reservation.
 
The dome sits on a roundabout driveway that can comfortably fit 4-5 cars.
 
Check us out and tag us on IG @gamountaindomehome
description.house_rules: The barn on the property is not open for public use. The ladder on second floor is also not available for public use.

The Bunny Bungalow was a beautiful, private getaway spot! Melissa provided so many incredible amenities that set the place above others, such as a coffee bar, hot tub, and bathrobes/gel masks. She did such a wonderful job of clearly listing instructions throughout the dome as well. We would highly recommend this as a vacation spot to others!

My boyfriend and I had a wonderful weekend stay here. It was a neat experience and surprisingly well ventilated inside with cool air. I recommended it to all of my friends as they thought it looked awesome as well based off the photos I took. :)
This was our first stay at an Air BnB and it was absolutely incredible. Melissa exceeded our expectations in every possible way.  The Geo Dome was incredible to stay at.
Excellent, communicative host. Space was immaculate, clean, and unique. All the information we needed was provided. Really appreciated our stay.

The Bunny Bungalow was so cute inside and out! We loved the private hot tub and wished it didn’t rain our entire trip so we could enjoy the fire pit more.  The only recommendations we have is to download your own shows on your personal devices because sometimes the internet isn’t stellar and life would be easier if you have episodes download for your viewing pleasure.  We loved the full kitchen and ability to grill, the coffee station and really had fun laughing while we did face masks together! They really had everything to make us feel like we were on a mini retreat away to celebrate our 15 years married together!

The Bunny Bungalow was absolutely amazing. Melissa was an amazing host and the place was beautiful and one of a kind. She was very helpful and checked in with us to make sure everything was going well with our stay. She made us aware ahead of time of certain issues at the dome so we weren’t caught off guard. The pictures absolutely don’t do the place justice! We loved it and will definitely try to come back in the future!

description.summary:
Brand new 30ft diameter (700sq ft), 15 foot celiling height geodesic dome with a huge panoramic window overlooking the 20 acres. The geodome is located on the first of the twenty acres. Gazebo with 2-3 person hot tub. Specifically built for 2 ADULTS age 21 and over, sorry NO children or pets******

Full size kitchen and spacious fully functioning bathroom. 
Robes, face masks, makeup wipes/ towels, shower pouffs, q-tips, tissues and toilet paper all provided.

 Dome has air-conditioning and heat.
description.space:
Bunny Bungalow is a unique and beautiful geodome that is 30 feet in diameter. It has 15 foot ceilings and a huge panoramic window overlooking the 20 acres of woods. Be on the lookout for bunnies, squirrels, chipmunks, birds, wild turkeys, and deer.

Walk down the front steps to the 2-3 person hot tub. The hot tub sets on a 12x12 gazebo with mosquito and privacy curtains. The area does have wooden fence panels that provide privacy from the road. Hot tub towels are provided. Next to the hot tub area is a gas grill. Grilling utensils and propane are provided.

A trail leads to the private fire pit area. Roasting sticks and lighters are provided in the kitchen pantry. 2 arondack chairs and a covered swing are there to relax in. Firewood is not provided but guests are welcome to use fallen branches which are always available.

Inside the dome is a spacious bathroom. There are many amenities available for use. Shower poufs, robes, makeup towels, makeup remover wipes, q-tips, cotton wipes, gel eye mask, various face masks, tissues, toilet paper, hair dryer, first aid kit, and hair drying towels. NO shampoo or bodywash is provided. ***

The bedroom has a pillow top king size mattress that is super comfortable to sleep on. Soft sheets and blankets and two types ( firm and soft) of king size pillows are provided.
The bed overlooks the pananaromic window in the woods. Guests may use the mini light projector at night. Simply plug in the USB cord (provided) in and set the colors or stars wanted to show up on the high celiling. Remote is labeled for the projector. Two bedside glass lamps have usb ports in them for easy phone charging. A wardrobe sits next to the bed for all your clothes and luggage items. 

The entertainment center contains a 55 inch Smart tv with Netflix streaming. The TV screen swivels so it can be seen fron the king size bed or the futon. A DVD player is available along with many dvds. Inside the entertainment center are many board games,  some specifically for couples.
Wifi is not great at the dome. So be sure to be prepared for it to run slow. Please be considerate in the amount of wifi used during your stay. Once the high speed wifi is all used up for the month, it will run very slow.
There is a labeled remote that can be used to turn on the electric fire place for romantic nights in.

The front deck is a nice place to sit in the early morning while drinking your coffee. An umbrella is there to provide some shade.

20 minutes away from Lake Logan where you can rent a pontoon boat. Also 20 minutes to Rockbridge, and many other hiking trails, and Logan where you can find a Walmart, Krogers, and several food places including the Hungry Buffalo, Axe throwing, Millcreek BBQ, Pizza Crossing, and the Hocking Hills winery. There are also many nearby places to canoe, zipline, and participate in other outdoor activities. 30 to 35 minutes to Old Man's Cave, Conkles Hollow, Rock House, Devils Bathtub, Cedar Falls, Cantwell Clifs, and Ash Cave.
description.notes:
The kitchen is full size. Has a brand new stainless steel oven to cook meals when you want to have a romantic dinner. Large refrigerator and deep kitchen sink.

recent.comments:
The location was truly beautiful. The views were incredible - you get the sunrise in the direction we faced. The dome was clean and inviting, had coffee, clean sheets, cute decor, and clean bathroom. There was also a very nice fire pit right outside the dome and grill. 
The issue we had was the photos promised more. There was no view through the top of the dome but my guess would be it’s because there may have been extra insulation for the heat. It should still be disclosed. The swings were also completely blocked by very large weeds so they are essentially unusable. 
The biggest problem, however, was we tried to use the hot tub which was murky - but thought it may be okay. After turning on the jets, we quickly found it was actually dirty due to black scum forming on top. We were already in and were quite grossed out. 
Reality vs pictures made the price seem slightly unreasonable. It is a beautiful location and we are happy to have gone and would stay again at a lower price.

We could not have asked for a better place to spend our anniversary! Breathtaking views, comfortable, clean and relaxing! We will be back!
Great place for my husband and I to reconnect. Spend the weekend for our anniversary.  A great place to disconnect from the chaos of life.

We loved our stay here. We booked it during covid 3 years ago. It was clean and comfortable and the only way I’d “camp”. The WiFi is fantastic. We loved how peaceful it was. The description and pictures were accurate.
Great glamming experience.  Beautiful views and a fun time.  Great hiking near by.

Everything was beautiful and peaceful. Tony was quick to respond and very polite and accommodating. Didn’t realize the number of stairs going to the Dome. Several trips to bring down luggage was quite a cardio workout, but the stay was wonderful.

We stayed here for a weekend getaway. It surpassed our expectations. The dome was cozy and the view was spectacular!! We had everything we needed and more. Tony was great with communicating with us and was very hospitable! We even got to witness front seats to a thunder/lightening storm that we will never forget:)

description.summary: Tennessee Glamping’s geodesic dome, as featured on DIY Network’s “Building off the Grid,” is nestled on a mountaintop and 16 acres of secluded property. The perfect place to take in remarkable mountain views and dreamlike starry nights. Peace and tranquility are abundant, as are amenities typically missing with traditional camping.
description.space: The 450 square foot dome provides guests with a fully functioning bathroom equipped with a toilet, sink, and shower. The convenient kitchen, with refrigerator and sink, an outdoor grill, and fire pit allow for multiple dining prep options. HVAC keeps the inside of the dome cozy or cool, allowing you to relax at your perfect temperature. Enjoy the wrap around deck with a fire pit and hot tub, and don’t forget to enjoy the swings below. An incredible 40’ rock bluff sits behind the dome along with an additional fire pit with chairs. Fiery Gizzard Trail, Foster Falls, and Cumberland Caverns are all nearby as well as numerous local trails.

Gazebo area - hang out in our garden, complete with mosquito netting and lights.

hosts.about:
Kelsey and Seth are your hosts at Little Red Homestead!

Kelsey is a lover of all things eclectic and is constantly looking for new DIY projects! Her favorite past times are cooking, finding unique spots around town, and relaxing with some great coffee or bubbly.

Seth can be found out in nature exploring everything the woods has to offer! He is a beekeeper, an excellent bread maker, and can whip up a mean cocktail when asked!

We're proud fur parents to a very spoiled Persian cat, Khoda, our goofy Old English Sheepdog, Snuffleupagus, and a very active 31 year old turtle, Shelly. Hoping to welcome chickens soon - maybe some other critters in the future!

Delighted to host and welcome you to our space! The units are airy, upscale and clean and we hope you will find yourself at ease here. Explore the greater Grand Traverse area through the eyes of locals and experience all the things this great spot has to offer!

recent.comments: We had a beautiful stay. everything was perfect! just as described.

items.comments: We had a beautiful stay. everything was perfect! just as described.

The Hive was a magical experience. Kelsey and Seth were great hosts. The small touches really made you feel at home. Check in and out was a breeze. Kelsey is an excellent chef and leaves the fridge stocked with all sorts of goodies for your stay. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the linens very clean. The bathroom was spotless and the shower has great pressure and got nice and hot. She provides everything you could want from shampoo, to a hair dryer, to paper goods and utensils. Even salt and pepper! The hot tub was clean and hot. The fire pit was stocked with plenty of free wood and the views were amazing. This is my first time glamping and I can’t wait to do it again but man are my expectations high after this!! You are just a short drive to Sleeping Bear Dunes with some of the best views I’ve ever seen. Last tip - order one of LRHs pizzas, you won’t be disappointed!
Great place and location. It was a fun experience.

This place was an absolute gem. My husband and I are so grateful to have found such a unique place to spend our wedding anniversary. Kelsey and Seth (and their dog Snuffleupagus) were the best hosts. Their hospitality was unmatched and they have thought of so many little details to make this place such a beautiful retreat. The pictures of this place in the listing simply do not do it justice. The location is great - nearby to both Sleeping Bear Dunes and Traverse City. You can really create your own experience with your stay. The grounds itself are beautiful. The communal dining area/gardens, bonfire pit and hot tub are all very well maintained. You don't feel like you are on top of other guests staying at the homestead and it is very quiet. We would recommend this place to anyone looking for a peaceful getaway. We look forward to coming back soon!
This place is even cuter than then photos—a perfectly styled, romantic stay close to everything yet in a relaxing location. Truly a special place!
Kelsey and Seth were amazing! We loved our weekend stay in the hive. It was cozy, romantic, and full of accommodations! Would highly recommend.

The Hive was the perfect “glamping” getaway. We celebrated a birthday and Seth and Kelsey included thoughtful touches to celebrate. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was clean and well appointed, and the space has many spots to relax and hang out, including the garden gazebo and fire pit area. The wifi wasn’t the strongest but it was good enough in case you need it, and it’s an incentive to unplug. We really didn’t need to bring any food as the fridge was stocked and ordering pizza was a delicious dinner option after a day out exploring. We had an amazing time, didn’t want to leave, and can’t wait to go back!

description.summary:
Explore Sleeping Bear Dunes, Traverse City, and more from the luxury of your own geodesic dome! Experience this unique stay, nestled away from the hustle and bustle, in the charming small town of Lake Ann. This is the perfect place to kick up your feet and unwind.

✔ Complimentary stocked mini-fridge
✔ Queen size bed w/heated mattress pad
✔ Large panoramic window
✔ Smart TV
✔ Amenities (grill, hot tub, fire pit)
✔ High speed Wi-Fi
✔ Free parking

Inquire about our website and see more below!
description.space:
Little Red Homestead is a bed and breakfast styled, peaceful getaway with multiple units. While each unit is private, we have 3 separate rentals on the property. To get a clear understanding of the set up, check out the property map in the photos.

This listing is for our unit, "The Hive" - our most unique and private unit perfect for those of you looking to get back in touch with nature, or those of you looking for a true glamping experience. This peaceful getaway features a geodesic dome fully equipped with a large panoramic window and skylight. Your private deck offers a propane Webber grill, an outdoor dining area, private hammocks, and a lounge area. Adjacent to the dome, you will find a luxurious, spacious, private bathroom.

Enjoy being surrounded by the secluded forest and experience nature like you never have before! Here you will be able to unwind in your private rental unit or enjoy our shared community areas by soaking in the aqua therapy jet hot tub, dining in the garden gazebo, or sitting by the fire pit to enjoy your evenings under the starry night sky!

★ KITCHENETTE ★
Due to a lack of oven, we are unable to provide our homemade "Wake and Bake" breakfasts. Instead, we fill your mini fridge full of complimentary on the go breakfast items and snacks!

✔ Mini fridge (fully stocked)
✔ Keurig coffee maker (pods provided)
✔ Coffee station (cream, sugar, cups)
✔ Disposable plates/bowls/cups/silverware
✔ Grill utensils
✔ Steak knives
✔ Trash bin
✔ Britta water pitcher

★ BEDROOM ★
Quite possibly our unit with the most luxurious bed, fully equipped with a heated mattress pad with dual side controls. Sleeping here feels like you're falling asleep outside and waking up in an enchanted forest.

✔ Queen size bed
✔ Pillow top mattress
✔ Hotel quality linens/pillows/blankets
✔ Heated mattress pad
✔ Amenities in/on baskets (robes, umbrella)
✔ Reading lamps

★ LIVING SPACE ★
Settle in for the night, grab some snacks, and find a movie to watch - or better yet, just look out your window and see what nature you can spot!

✔ Two swivel lounge chairs
✔ Smart TV w/Roku
✔ Full length mirror
✔ Coat rack
✔ Variety of throw blankets
✔ Games and books
✔ Curtains to close off the window

★ BATHROOM ★
Get ready in a spacious bathroom equipped with fresh towels, essential toiletries, and a rain head shower.

✔ Walk-in shower w/rain shower head
✔ Full size vanity
✔ Large mirror
✔ Toilet (toilet paper provided)
✔ Towels (body, hand, and washcloth)
✔ Essential toiletries
✔ First aid/sunscreen/bug spray

★ PRIVATE DECK ★
When the weather allows, grab a book and head outside to your private wood deck! Pour yourself a beverage, light up the grill, and feel the day melt away in our provided lounge chairs or hammocks.

✔ Webber grill (propane & tools provided)
✔ Lounge chairs w/table
✔ Hammocks w/bug nets
✔ Picnic table for 6 w/umbrella
✔ View of forest and horse farm

★ SHARED COMMUNITY AMENITIES ★
Enjoy the extra amenities that are available to all of our guests staying at Little Red Homestead! Soak in the aqua therapy jet hot tub, dine under the fairy lights in the garden gazebo, or sit by the fire pit and take in the starry night sky! All community amenities work on a first come, first serve basis.

✔ Hot tub w/aqua therapy jets
✔ Gazebo dining in the garden
✔ Fire pit (fire wood & roasting sticks provided)
✔ Large bin of yard games available
✔ Swing set
✔ Picnic table for 6 w/umbrella
✔ Room service w/our pizza/breadsticks/salad menu
description.access:
This listing is for our unit, "The Hive". If you are looking to host more than two guests or are looking for more of a staycation, we recommend checking out our listing for "The Den" as it provides you with a living area and more space to relax in.  If you are looking for something a bit more modern but still intimate, we recommend checking out our listing for "The Burrow".

★ PLEASE NOTE ★

Our community spaces are public SHARED spaces, they are available for all of the guests staying at Little Red Homestead to use. Due to snow, some of our amenities are seasonal and only available in non-winter months.

You will have access to all of the community space amenities including:

✔ Hot tub - open YEAR ROUND

✔ Fire pit area - open SEASONALLY

✔ Swing set/yard games area - open SEASONALLY

✔ Garden dining area - open SEASONALLY
description.notes:
★ ADDITIONAL ACCOMMODATION ★
Traveling in a larger group, or your preferred dates are already taken? Due to having multiple units available on the property, we may be able to find a way to make things work - inquire with us further!

★ CANCELLATIONS ★
Please understand that our cancellation policy is set to strict. The only way to cancel and receive a full refund is to do so within 48 hours of booking and to have at least 7 days left until your reservation. If there is an extenuating circumstance, you are able to discuss with Airbnb and they will review your claim. Otherwise, all other cancellations will be treated the same as explained by Airbnb policy - no exceptions.

★ CHECK IN/CHECK OUT ★
We can not accommodate early check ins and late check outs. We allow for same day check ins and check outs, and therefore need the entire time between guests to reset units. Check in is strictly at 4pm or later and check out is at 11am or before.

★ ONLY REGISTERED GUESTS ★
No additional visitors at any time, other than the guests accounted for in your reservation. We do have actively recording exterior security cameras monitoring the parking area at all times to ensure that the number of guests on your reservation is accurate.

★ QUIET HOURS ★
For the enjoyment of everyone, we ask that quiet hours are from 11pm - 9am, daily. This includes the community space areas such as the hot tub, fire pit & gardens. It does not mean you need to be inside at this time, it just means to use reasonable levels of volume.

★ NO PETS ALLOWED ★
As much as we love all things with tails, we are unable to accommodate them. We ask that the pets stay at home or at a nearby boarding facility.

★ NO INFANTS/CHILDREN ★
Due to the set up of our property, and the fragile nature of this structure, this unit is not suitable for infants or children (ages 17 and under).

★ NO SMOKING ★
Our entire property is non-smoking. Any smoking evidence will result in odor removal and furniture cleaning fees.

★ NO PARTIES/EVENTS ★
We kindly ask you to treat our home as your own to preserve its pristine condition for future guests and your return visits.

★ BE RESPECTFUL ★

Please understand that while your personal unit is completely private, that this property hosts other guests, meaning you will likely have neighbors. You by no means need to interact with your neighbors, but this is a space that requires you to co-exist, respectfully.

Also, please note that our rates, policies, and maximum guest occupancies are non-negotiable.

We appreciate your understanding and cooperation!
description.neighborhood: You will find that Lake Ann is centrally located for whichever type of northern Michigan vacation you choose to have! Lake Ann itself has a charming downtown and neighbors Interlochen, Sleeping Bear Dunes, and Traverse City, where you can find even more dining and entertainment venues.
description.transit:
- PARKING: free on property with a total of 5 spaces for 3 units, so please try to consolidate vehicles when possible.
- PUBLIC TRANSPORT: Uber & Lyft are available but scarce, scheduled ahead private driving services/taxi's are available.
description.interaction:
We try to stop by shortly after your arrival to welcome you in and to see if you have any questions. After the initial meeting, we are available only as requested.

We are available to our guests at all times, but our phones go on silent mode through the night while we are asleep and will be unable to answer until the morning.

description.summary: Meet the newest addition to Your Glamping Adventures property lineup. description.transit: The address will take you to our farmhouse, please continue along the gravel road, past the gates to the back of the property. You will pass through multiple scenic fields and wooded areas before arriving to our 22 acre hayfield with your dome suspended overlooking the lake.

The distinctive architectural design, combined with the seamless blend of comfort and modern amenities, sets The Dome Home apart. Create treasured memories in a setting that truly stands out among the many extraordinary houses in Snowshoe!

recent.comments:
Unique home in a great location. Surrounding wooded area was unlike anything we’d experienced -  very cool! 

The guests before us were very destructive and left the house a mess, stole items from the home, and caused an entire extra day of cleaning, which we learned just before check-in. Harman made sure to communicate with us and adjusted the plan so that the damage they caused didn’t ruin our stay. 

The home is undergoing some improvements (August 2023) so there were little bumps along the way but Harman was very responsive and even refunded part of our cost due to the inconvenience. 

Overall, good experience!

He’s the best host I’ve seen on here and if we go back to West Virginia I won’t be staying anywhere else!! I highly recommend this house. There are a couple of nice shops and restaurants within a 10 minute walk on paths. Cell service is a bit spotty on the drive up but there is Wi-Fi at the house and all throughout town.
Beautiful house with some personality.  Great location and way better than the townhomesand condos in town.

This place is beautiful! It is a bit older than we thought. They are improving it a bit and making it even better. We really enjoyed it. Also the host was very responsive and helpful when we needed something.
Beautiful property! Would def stay there again, highly recommend.

Outstanding in every way! The home has gorgeous views, a lovely living room and game room, tons of character and is well appointed with everything we needed. The location is ideal by top of the world at Snowshoe and walking distance to the village, the lodge and the shuttles take you anywhere at Snowshoe or Silver Creek. Harlan was helpful and responsive and did everything to make our stay amazing! Fantastic weekend and we’ll be back!

description.summary:
“Our group has decided we won’t go back to Snowshoe if this property is not available. That’s how great it is!” – Ama

Discover The Dome Home, a unique geodesic retreat perched atop Snowshoe. This architectural marvel boasts an inviting great room, vibrant bedrooms with colorful wallpaper, and ample space for multi-generational families or multiple groups (and dog-friendly!). Unwind in the hot tub surrounded by trees, relax in the lounge room, or enjoy drinks in the colorful bar.
description.space:
Welcome to The Dome Home at Snowshoe, a true architectural gem nestled atop Snowshoe mountain in West Virginia. This one-of-a-kind geodesic retreat offers an unforgettable vacation experience for those seeking a blend of unique design, breathtaking scenery, and modern comfort.

The spacious great room with its curved interior walls beckons you to gather with loved ones, featuring ample seating, a massive stone fireplace, and large triangular windows that frame awe-inspiring views of the surrounding natural beauty. (Fireplace is getting some much needed love, and will be up and running in the summer!)

For relaxation and rejuvenation, the hot tub offers a serene oasis nestled among the trees, inviting you to unwind under the starry night sky.

Step inside and be captivated by the vibrant and colorful bedrooms, each adorned with unique wallpaper that adds a touch of personality to your stay. 

Indulge in relaxation and reflection in the lounge room, where floor-to-ceiling glass doors invite abundant natural light and provide a serene atmosphere. 

The colorful bar room, with its neon signs and inviting ambiance, is the perfect spot to unwind, enjoy drinks, and create lasting memories.

Our fully equipped kitchen awaits culinary adventures, allowing you to prepare delicious meals and create lasting memories around the dining table. 

“We ended our day resting muscles in the hot tub, and canceled all dinner outs as the place is the kind where you don’t want to leave.” – Dianna

For larger groups or families traveling together, the basement offers a separate living room, kitchen, and dining area, ensuring ample space and privacy. Two additional bedrooms in the basement provide comfortable accommodations and convenience.

Beyond the comforts of the Dome Home, the wonders of Snowshoe are at your doorstep. Immerse yourself in the great outdoors with a plethora of outdoor activities, including hiking, biking, and exploring nature's wonders. And for those who prefer a slower pace, nearby attractions offer horseback riding, golfing, and scenic lift rides.

Our home is thoughtfully designed to accommodate multi-generational families or multiple families traveling together. Its spacious layout ensures privacy, while also fostering togetherness in the shared living areas. The Dome Home is also dog-friendly, allowing your furry friends to join in on the fun.

Whether you're seeking a peaceful retreat surrounded by nature's beauty or an adventure-filled getaway, our Dome Home provides the ideal setting for a memorable vacation. Come and experience the magic of this unique geodesic retreat, where serenity meets excitement, and lasting memories are waiting to be made.

"Outstanding in every way! The home has gorgeous views, a lovely living room and game room, tons of character and is well appointed with everything we needed. The location is ideal by top of the world at Snowshoe and walking distance to the village" – Kathleen

Our garage and detached apartment are currently undergoing renovation and are off limits to all guests. All of these portions of our property will be locked with a deadbolt for the duration of your stay.

description.summary:
Welcome to our dome away from home! This unique stay is one of a kind. 

Our Dome Suite Dome is the perfect get away! 
• 15 mins from Mount Vernon
• 10 mins from Kenyon College
• sleeps up to 6 guests
• 2 bedrooms and a loft bedroom
• private hot tub
• home office
• game night area
• roku televisions
• lots of local recommendations
• pet friendly

“There’s no place like Dome”
description.space:
Dome Suite Dome is a unique dome house located just off of Apple Valley Lake. It is a scenic drive from many intricate small towns. Just a 15 minute drive from Mount Vernon, less than 10 minutes from Kenyon College, and a day adventure from anything in the Heart of Ohio! 

Sleeps up to 6 guests, this spacious dome is bigger than it looks. Come hang out in the living room with our mascot Leonard— he’s the longhorn on the wall. Come play games upstairs in our game room area of the loft. Do some yoga upstairs in our open loft. 

You have to work? There is a single person desk in the loft area perfect for a peaceful workspace, while you listen to the rain on the dome ceiling. Come work from Dome! 

Sip your coffee from the front porch or back porch, there’s lots of space to enjoy the outdoors. A back patio, a fire pit with benches, and a grill to enjoy. As an added bonus, enjoy the outdoors in our six person hot tub! 

Watch a movie in the living room on Roku, capable of signing into any of your favorite TV subscriptions! Relax and enjoy yourself, we hope you enjoy the dome as much as we do!  

•• please note the king bedroom is in the loft area •• 

•• Apple Valley is a private lake community and you must be a property owner to use the lake amenities such a fishing, boating, or going to the beach! We encourage our guests to take a drive around the lake, but also go see some of the amazing public amenities in the area. ••
description.notes:
Dome Rules
Checkin at 3:00 pm unless otherwise arranged 
• overnight occupancy shall not exceed 6 guests
• all children under the age of 16 must be accompanied by an adult while inside the dome or on the property
• no smoking
• please be mindful of the neighbors and keep the noise to a minimum
• when leaving the property, please be sure all of the doors and windows are secured
• no parties or events, unless prior arrangements have been made
• please do not rearrange the furniture

Checkout 
11:00 am checkout time
• please empty all trash cans and place all garbage in the bins outdoors
• place all towels, sheets, and bath rugs in the laundry baskets
• start the dishwasher with any dirty dishes prior to departure
• hand wash any other dishes, return them to the cupboards
• if you changed the thermostat, kindly return it back to 68 degrees before leaving
• ensure all doors and windows are locked
description.interaction: We love to hear about our guests experience. Please let us know if there is anything we can help with, but we will not be on the property.

description.summary: Stay on a 140 acre farm in the only camping dome shelter location in the Smoky Mountains and get back to nature! Look out the windows at the forest, mountaintop and sky. Relax on the little porch and enjoy the warm propane fire pit. Lay down in the comfy queen sized bed and drift off to sleep while watching the beauty of the night sky!
description.space:
Come visit this unique camping dome in the Smoky Mountains! See the night sky from your bed and enjoy being close to nature. This is a Glamping experience. Glamping is luxurious camping with more modern amenities like electricity, finished floors, beautiful views, and comfortable furnishings, but it is still camping. The domes are not insulated so it can get hot during the day in the summer and cold at night in the winter. There is an A/C unit and a heater in the unit, as well as a heated blanket, but similar to camping, expect the weather to be a factor. Explore Tennessee by day and relax in your dome at night. The dome has a large bay window and several sky windows. You’ll find a barn with an apartment, a tiny house, and three other domes on the property. Inside the barn, we have indoor showers and bathrooms. There is also a mini fridge, microwave, and coffee maker available for all guests to use.Additionally, we also have an outdoor shower, but it will be shut off during winter months. There is also a propane fireplace to enjoy s'mores or hotdogs at night. 

PET POLICY: We are pet friendly and understand pets are part of the family. We gladly welcome our guests traveling with pets. There will be a $20 fee per stay for each pet. Pet's MAY NOT be left unattended in the dome or on the property. Guests are liable for any damages done by their animal during their stay.
description.access: Dome, porch and propane fire pit are just for you. Park in the gravel driveway right near the dome. Shower and portable toilet are shared if there are guests in the the other domes and tiny house.
description.notes:
The dome is not insulated so it can get hot during the day in the summer and cold at night in the winter. There is an A/C unit and a heater in the dome, as well as a heated blanket, but similar to camping, expect the weather to be a factor.

Verizon is the only service provider that works here. We do provide Wi-fi on site, but it is spotty around the property, but can be used to check email or send imessages. If you are unable to access Wi-Fi at your dome, you can use the guest area in the passway of the barn to access a stronger WiFi signal. 

There is no plumbing inside the domes. Bathrooms and showers are provided onsite and are shared with other guests.

description.summary: Create ever-lasting memories at our Timeless Mountain Dome! Vero Mountain is excited to share a unique and luxurious getaway adventure. Rediscover your connection with nature and escape society to relax in our geodesic domes. Take in the beauty of the mountainscape while you are submerged in your steamy hot tub. Camp under the stars and watch the sunrise over the countryside without sacrificing any modern luxuries.
description.space:
The Timeless Mountain Dome embodies a mid-century modern style. Step into the dome’s kitchenette supplying standard cooking necessities and additional features that provide the max of next-level glamping. The king bed sits upon the feature wall overlooking the serene mountain range, including Mount Mitchell and Mount Pisgah. Around the corner awaits a full-size modern bathroom, private toilet room, and luxurious shower. Be comfortable at your desired temperature as the dome hosts its own thermostat-controlled air conditioning/heater, pellet stove, heated mattress pad, bath robes, luxury linens, dehumidifier, and portable a/c unit.

Please inquire for more information about our amenities for special celebrations, vacation fun, and retreat packages. We also have a farm on Vero Mountain and would love to show you around. Thelma & Louise love new visitors! Please arrange a visit to the farm to meet the animals, plus it seem like we always have baby animals arriving. Come glamp with us in our modern domes at Vero Mountain. Make sure to check out all 3 of our distinctive domes that offer a different theme and experience.
description.access: Secluded dome, dome's viewing decks, and dome's parking area
description.notes:
- 2 guest maximum per property & must be 18+ years old, guests are welcome (max of 4) but cannot be on property during quiet hours (9PM – 7AM)
- NO PETS, please inquire about recommendations for local dog sitters
- Liability Waiver MUST be signed and returned before arrival
- Any guests that avoid any house rules, cause destruction or a disturbance, may be asked to leave immediately with no refund and/or incur hefty fines ($500+). All subject to owner’s discretion (Please review house rules)
- 4WD is recommended to get to Domes, but doable with 2WD
description.neighborhood:
Vero Mountain is located atop a private 158 acres oasis, including 3 geodesic domes & farm, within the city limits of Mars Hill, NC. The surrounding area offers amazing hikes, breweries, and local attractions (check out our guidebook). Located 35 minutes away from downtown Asheville, 45 minutes away from Asheville Regional Airport, and 1 mile from Wolf Laurel Community & Wolf Ridge Ski Resort. Viewable mountain ranges from the property of the Blue Ridge Parkway include Mount Mitchell & Mount Pisgah. The Appalachian Trail is accessible just a couple miles away.

We recommend stopping by the grocery store & grabbing drinking water on your way in. The nearest grocery stores are Wolf Provisions - 15 minutes  or Ingles - 20 minutes away. Downtown Mars Hill & Burnsville, both 20 minutes away offer a variety of restaurants and shopping.
description.transit: A car is needed to get to the Dome's location up the mountain on the gravel road. AWD or 4WD is recommended! Doable with 2WD but might be slightly challenging especially dependent on weather. 2 parking spaces are  available directly in front of the Timeless Dome.
description.interaction: Host is available and nearby during stay. Please contact by phone or app before or throughout stay with any questions or in need of immediate assistance. Guests will receive information during booking and follow up information a few days before arrival.
description.house_rules:
- 2 guest maximum per property & must be 18+ years old, guest's friends are welcomed (max of 4) but cannot be on property during quiet hours (9PM – 7AM)
- DO NOT litter or leave trash outside, especially things that may fly away/attract pests or animals
- NO PETS, please reach out to inquire about recommendations for local dog sitters
- NO PARTIES or excessive noise, please be respectful of neighbors, especially during quiet hours
- Liability Waiver MUST be signed and returned before arrival
- Security cameras on front exterior towards parking area, do not tamper with
- Any guests that avoid any of these rules, cause destruction or a disturbance, may be asked to leave immediately with no refund and/or incur hefty fines ($500+). All subject to owner’s discretion
- 4WD is recommended to get to Domes, doable with 2WD but might be slightly challenging
- No refunds due to weather, please note we have no control over mother nature, including strong winds, bugs, and animals. We do our absolute best to provide a wonderful experience and take pride in the dome’s cleanliness
- Please check out promptly at 11am, or agreed upon check out time; $50 per every 30 minutes past check out time

description.summary:
Featured on Conde Nast Traveler as one of the best OBX rentals of 2021!

Tons of fun details make this secluded, freshly renovated 1971 geodesic dome a true vacation paradise, while the amenities (fully equipped kitchen, laundry, A/C, and high-speed internet) will make you feel right at home! 

Enjoy your coffee from the private wraparound deck, with the sounds of the sea and the breeze through the marsh grasses, or take a ten minute stroll across the dune to catch the sunrise over the Atlantic.
description.space:
The space boasts an open floor plan that feels much roomier than its 1100 square feet. Two queen bedrooms downstairs and two semi-private sleeping areas upstairs in the loft - one with a queen bed and one with a twin bed - comfortably sleep seven. 

The house comes equipped with all the modern conveniences: the best internet money can buy on the OBX (good for streaming and video conferencing), a brand new Smart TV pre-loaded with Netflix (anything else can be streamed from your phone or laptop), a bluetooth speaker, Nest smart thermostat, and electronic key access for easy self check-in.

The huge, locally-made live-edge table is perfect for meals and games, the vintage peacock chair is conveniently located in a nook with the bookshelf, and the whole gang can cozy up on the large wrap-around sectional for movie night.

There are two full bathrooms (one on each floor), a custom built, eat-in kitchen, and a wrap-around deck overlooking protected marshland where you can enjoy the sounds of birds in the morning and tree frogs at night.

The yard is very private and beautifully landscaped with coastal flowers and trees. Downstairs, wide-plank decking connects the laundry room, lockable storage for your beach gear, a covered clothesline to dry your beach towels, and a fish-cleaning table for the catch of the day.

You’ll feel at home in the fully-stocked kitchen. A wide array of kitchen tools, pots, and pans are complemented by a toaster oven, microwave, coffee maker, coffee grinder, electric kettle, and SodaStream (be sure to bring a CO2 cartridge in case the last one is out). We try to maintain a decent supply of basics (olive oil, coffee filters, spices, salt & pepper), but Waves Deli around the corner has an impressive array of groceries if you’re in need of something particular.

Looking for things to do? During the day, your options are endless… relax on the beach, enjoy local shops, grab sandwiches and beverages at the gourmet deli/grocery, or take advantage of one of the top five kitesurfing locations in the world… all within short walking distance of your home base. In the evening, enjoy the stars from the deck or drinks and live music at Waterman’s… or both!

After a long day, you’ll love sinking into one of our comfortable beds… we’re big believers that sleep on vacation shouldn’t be compromised by “renter-grade” mattresses and linens!

We believe in an environment of inclusivity and diversity and have done our best to ensure everyone feel welcome here!
description.notes:
***While we love welcoming kids of all ages we encourage adults to take a second look at the open stairs and wide minimal railings on the loft before they confirm their reservation. 

There's no street parking on our road and our home only accommodates three cars (two on the driveway, and one parallel parked on the road. 

Check us out and tag us on IG @sunnysideup.nc
description.neighborhood: A centrally-located tree-lined cul-de-sac with private beach access, this quiet residential street is known to locals as the best on the outer banks.
description.transit: There's only parking for three vehicles on property, but you won’t need more than that while you’re here! You’re a short walk to anywhere in Salvo, and we’ve got three beach cruisers available for you to use if you’d like to explore further (BYO helmets!)
description.interaction: You'll have the house all to yourself for your stay, but we're just a quick phone call or text away if you need anything!
description.house_rules:
1. No parties, events, or unregistered guests are allowed 
2. This is a no smoking, and vaping property
3. No commercial uses 
4. No candles, open flames, or confetti
5. Quiet hours = 10pm-8am 

***You may get approval to visit with one well behaved dog. As a guest you must have previous positive reviews. We love dogs but have had really unfortunate experiences hosting them in the past so please speak to us about yours before traveling with them.

hosts.about: I am a lover of all things in the spa world.  I have built my reputation in the Spa world by being a great host and it has carried over to AirBnB as a SuperHost!  I recently sold Bellanina Day Spa & Institute in Ann Arbor, so now I spend more time creating beauty in art and interior design and enjoying gardening in my 50' geodesic greenhouse in the mountains of North Carolina, near Asheville at The Artful Dome Mountain Retreat.   I am in the process of creating my ultimate Guesthouse, The Artful Zen Mountain Retreat which will be open in the spring, 2023.  It is located a few miles outside of Asheville and will have 3 BR/2Bath, Garden room, Spa area, pond, stream, Food garden, a Zen Garden, and plenty of place for relaxation.  I am always seeking the high road and enjoy inspiring people and sharing my vision for our emerging paradigm shift.  My life is built on the foundations of love, gratitude, compassion and generosity.  I am thankful to have so many guests that love staying in my guesthouses!

recent.comments:
Our family had a wonderful time here. It was easy to find & very conveniently located. 

The RV is very comfy & is quite spacious for the amount of sq ft it takes up. We like to cook, & there were very few things the kitchen lacked. Both beds were cozy, although I recommend the bed downstairs for kids. Our 7-year-old daughter loved her cozy  cave. 🥰

The scenery outside is beautiful. You're up in the mountains, so that view can't be beat. Both the modern gas fire pit & the wood fire pit were set in beautiful areas. The Biodome? It really has to be seen to be believed. It's absolutely beautiful during the day, and Nina's artwork makes it even more so. The plantings inside & around it make it even lovelier. However, at night? The biodome  becomes otherworldly. The way the lights hit the reflector & the crystal and how they make the dome glow is incredible. 

It was the perfect place to celebrate the end of my cancer treatments & my bday. I highly recommend staying here.

Waynesville is close by & charming with a great variety of restaurants.  Our favorite was Birchwood Hill. . .try the duck!

It didn't take long to get up to The Blueridge Parkway.  We were fortunate to have perfect weather for hiking & sightseeing.

Even after we checked out, Nina continued to be kind & helpful.  There should be a rating above Super Host for her!
Nina was very frienly and responsive. Property was beautiful and easy to access. Area has great views.

Very nice to stay here. I feel like it was just right. The dome room I did not utilize as much as I should have. But that was due to time restraints and weather. Nina is a very gracious, friendly host. I will def stay again. :)
Loved the space ❤️ thank you for having me!

What a special space! The dome and RV are located close to woods and you feel like you are in a private wonderland. The neighborhood is very quiet. Campfire by the stream was a bonus. We can’t wait to come in the summer.
awesome and peaceful!

description.summary: Modern RV (Glamper) with 2 queen beds (one soft, one firm), a Smart TV, WIFI, full kitchen, BBQ Grill, outdoor patio with lounge chairs for sunbathing, star gazing, outside grilling and dining. My art studio is located in the biodome to the side. Space for yoga or meditation or enjoy playing your instruments or just hanging out while soaking in the energy of this magnificent crystal centered structure.  Next to the fire pit we have  gurgling stream.
description.space:
The Land:  So much more to offer than initially meets the eye, this land sits on a bedrock of quartz crystal and vortex/ley line, according to native american folklore and dowsing.  We are at about 3000 feet in elevation so it does get cool at night.  We suggest turning off the AC and opening all the windows for a nice cool breeze all night.  Ahhhh, mountain air!

The Space:  This 34' Reverse Loft RV has two comfortable queen beds.  The firm bed is upstairs and overhead from the reverse loft downstairs which has a memory foam mattress.  The TV/DVD is in the living area and we subscribe to Netflix which you connect to via the Smart DVD player.  

The Adjacent Porch, Patio and Biodome:  Aside from a very comfortable place to eat, sleep and be merry, this “tiny house” sits next to a "small copy" of Buckminster Fuller’s geodesic dome design, modeled after the 1967 US Pavillion at the Montreal World Expo and built by John Denver’s crew in 1987, right after they finished building singer/songrwriter Denver’s biodome at the Windstar Foundation in Snowmass, Colorado.  Our Biodome is 50' in diameter and 3 stories high!  The Biodome has a deep history as the centerpiece for an early biodynamic farming community.  Your host, Nina Howard,  has converted the Biodome into a modern art studio to paint her large abstracts as well as to protect and house her plants during the colder months so that she can have year round organic veggies and flowers.  Nina asks that you respect the privacy of her art studio and do not enter into it unless she is there (no doors).  The art studio only takes up about 1/3 of the space inside the dome.  The rest can be enjoyed by her guests!  Nina is only there 2 or 3 days a week (usually during the week) for a couple hours each day and you probably won't even see her.  

Patio:  Two loungers on the patio are great for south facing sunbathing or moon gazing at night.  

Porch:  The porch has a dining table and settee and chairs, including a big rocking chair,  for just hanging out.

The Grape vineyard and fruit orchard:  Follow the paved road in front up the hill and to your left you will see the grape vineyard, blackberry patch and fruit orchard.  In late summer the fruits are in season.  Help yourself!!  Also, find a nice spot behind the vineyard to perch and enjoy the rolling mountain views!

Food:  We offer coffee, tea, oatmeal, and crunchy breakfast bars for your first morning so that if you get in late you won't have to go grocery shopping before breakfast.
description.access:
Park behind the RV (go along the gravel road) and turn right just behind the RV.
It is best to enter the Biodome Village from the upper or second Biodome Drive entrance and come down the hill.
description.notes:
Entry and key instructions will be sent in your Welcome Letter. 

A small non-shedding dog will be considered with a $25 pet fee.
description.neighborhood: This neighborhood (The Biodome Village) was built as a Biodynamic Farming Community in the mid 80's that included 8 homes and a large barn right next door (which is now a mixed use residence/business).  Other houses in the Biodome Village are private residences.  The residents no longer do cooperative gardening and live individual and private lives.  Your host has retained the grape vineyard  on a separate lot across the street and up the hill which includes blackberries and fruit trees.  When fruit is in season, help yourself!  The views are awesome from the vineyard!
description.transit: Lake Junaluska has a walking trail around it which takes about an hour.  Beauty abounds!  It is about 6 miles away towards Waynesville.  You can also kayak on the lake.  There is so much to do in and around Waynesville, Maggie Valley, Cherokee, the national park, waterfalls, hiking trails, etc.
description.interaction: Nina Howard lives twenty miles away and will be available to support your stay.
description.house_rules:
Quiet hours after 10 pm (County rule)
Please remove shoes when entering the RV.  There is a shelf to the right of the door to place them.
No smoking inside the RV or Biodome (outside only).
Please park behind the RV.  There is a space available next to an aluminum trailer.  Please do not park out front and block the roadway.  If you have two cars, you can park the second car on the pavement in front of the biodome.
If I am working in my art studio next door, please feel free to come over and interact.  I love sharing my "craft"!
If you use the firepit, please replace the wood.  All the gas stations around sell wood bundles.  Thank you.
If you open the awning, you must close it if you leave.  Wind gusts will rip them off in a snap!
Please take your trash and place it in the metal trash cans along the driveway behind the RV.  We have a recycle can and a trash can.  
Only small non shedding lap dogs are allowed.  We will send a request for $25 pet fee upon arrival with pet rules. 
Please ask children not to stand or walk across the waterfalls. It takes a great deal of time to get them to "fall" and any movement can knock them over.

name: The Golden Star DOME. *King bed *12pm checkout
title: Benton, Tennessee

hosts.about: Hi we are a family of 6. My husband and I have 4 daughters.  The farmhouse was our first Airbnb. We bought the farm to spend more time together outdoors but as the girls have gotten older and busier, we aren’t able to go as often. The farm once had pigs, cows, and goats along with the horses and donkeys. We still love visiting the farm but are more excited now to share it with you. We also have a couple Airbnb’s in Cleveland TN as well as one in Ooltewah TN. We love hosting and hope that you enjoy your stay whichever place you may be!

recent.comments: Incredibly peaceful mountain getaway and I was amazed with all the utilities and cleanliness we were afforded along with the uniqueness of the area.

items.comments: Incredibly peaceful mountain getaway and I was amazed with all the utilities and cleanliness we were afforded along with the uniqueness of the area.

We had the most amazing stay! The dome was so cute and in such a peaceful area. We had the opportunity to wake up to such an amazing view. We wanted to be surrounded by nature and peace while still having some of the luxuries of everyday life (shower, running water, A/C, etc). We got just that. We really enjoyed connecting with each other in such a quiet, private, and beautiful place.
We had a great stay at the dome, highly recommend Tina!
My husband and I stayed one night as an anniversary getaway. It was everything Tina described in the listing. It was a wonderful experience. Would definitely stay again!
I wish I would have booked my whole trip here. It was beautiful and I plan on staying again in the future!
Beautiful place, had an amazing time
Our stay was great! Everything was clean and beautiful! Would definitely go back for a longer stay.

description.summary: The Golden Star Dome brings glamping to a whole new level.  Enjoy the expansive deck overlooking the pond and the lavender field while catching a glimpse of the colorful sunset.  Get wrapped up in the king size bed while enjoying Netflix or your favorite streaming station or just looking out at the beautiful view.  The dome is centrally located between the Ocoee and Hiawassee rivers and is only a 15 minute drive to Benton falls and other points of interests.  A great getaway for memory making.
description.space:
The dome is a great place to relax and unwind after a long day on the ocoee river or hiking the many trail heads that are within 15 minutes of the dome.  It is also a great place to just stay in and do nothing but relax in solitude or cuddle up with a loved one.  Internet is available but can be unreliable at times do to the farm extender system that it is on.  The Dome is well equipped for cooking as well as grilling and pizza making.  The brand new cooling and heating unit will keep you comfortable or cozy depending on the season you are here.  
The Dome is located on Shabo Farm in Benton TN.  You can enjoy the farm animals (2 horses and 2 donkeys) as well as 30 plus acres to explore.  The pond is under construction at the moment but will soon be stocked for fishing.  The lavender field is dormant in the months of Aug-early June and then starts to bloom  mid June and early July.  The Farm is expanding with other points of interests coming soon!
description.access: The property is open to explore.  BEWARE There is an electric fence that is active between the lavender and the horse field.
description.notes: Wifi is available but may be unreliable due to the farm expander system that it is on.  It is un-likely but there may be someone mowing the field while you are there but should only take 30 mins to an hour.  We try to warn our guests ahead of time if this happens.
description.transit: There is a parking space to the right of the dome.
description.interaction: This is a working a farm and improvements are being made on a steady basis.  You may see tractors in the field or someone working at the barn on occasion.  There is a farmhouse airbnb on the far side of the property that may or may not be occupied.  We do not live on the property but are only 40 minutes away if we are needed.

Galaxy show for cloudy nights
Scanlon Creek trails
Walks in the Scanlon Creek conservation area
Shower in the barn
Galaxy show by the fireplace for cloudy nights

recent.comments: If you want to spend a very romantic and special stay close to the nature : this tent is an excellent place ... Hosts very nice. Major commodities inside the tent which is rare !

items.comments: If you want to spend a very romantic and special stay close to the nature : this tent is an excellent place ... Hosts very nice. Major commodities inside the tent which is rare !

Daya and Dave’s place was a nice and relaxing environment. Very peaceful and quiet. Lots of great things to do on the property such as swimming, campfire, walking and more. 

We loved the special touches especially in the kitchen that made the stay much easier. 

They were very responsive if we needed anything but also gave us our tranquil space.

My boyfriend and I stayed at Daya and Dave’s for one night and it was everything we were looking for! We relaxed by the pool, went for a swim, took a stroll on the nice trail at the conservation area, had a fire, spent some time in the hammock, and fell asleep under the stars. The bed was so comfortable that we didn’t want to get up! The nicest part about the experience was that Daya and Dave had stocked the kitchen and mini fridge with things to cook for breakfast! Such a lovely touch! The hosts were also very friendly and had great communication throughout our visit. Daya and Dave really thought of everything with this rental! If we come back, we want to stay two nights next time! Thank you! ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
Fabulous experience! Thank you for hosting us!

We had a fantastic stay with Daya and Dave. They were very helpful hosts. We enjoyed a bbq outside and roasting marshmallows by the campfire ! The dome was gorgeous and the star lights were a great bonus. There was a kitchen stocked with all the utensils you need, and we enjoyed coffee, waffle mix and cereal available for breakfast which was a lovely surprise to start the day. Would recommend this place to anybody. Thanks!

Dave and Daya welcomed us very friendly. Both interior and landscaping were beautifully decorated. So guests can enjoy a variety of things such as swimming, swing, hammock, and bbq etc,.
And I was happy to look at the rainy sky as soon as I woke up.
But only thing you should be careful of is mosquitoes. Although they gave me some stickers and spray, I got a lot of bites:(
Thanks for everything! It was great!

description.summary: Whether you are looking for a romantic getaway for two, a solo remote work week in solitude surrounded by nature, or a family adventure, this  4-season geodesic dome is just the right place. Explore picturesque trails of Scanlon Creek Conservation Area, enjoy inground pool in summer, experience breathtaking sunsets over the farm fields, the starry skies by the bonfire, mesmerizing dance of fireflies in June, and let the frogs and crickets lull you to sleep in the place where time stands still...
description.space:
Located just one hour drive north of Toronto, our rustic property offers quiet, peaceful solitude yet is just minutes away by car from downtown Bradford, local restaurants and farms. 

Our 4-season dome, with year-round heat and AC, is located on a 2-acre property surrounded by farmers' fields and Scanlon Creek Conservation Area forests. We have a solar-heated swimming pool operational during the warm months of the year, 2 firepits,  a heated/airconditioned barn converted into a creative space with an art & photo studio.

The dome deck is equipped with Muskoka chairs, barbecue grill and propane stove with an oven for outdoor cooking, and a private firepit with firewood.
description.access:
The guests have access to the shower / hot water sink in the barn, backyard with the pool and picnic table, Scanlon Creek trails and Holland River at the end of the road.
The Dome features 
In the main area: a queen-size bed, bedside tables, lamps with USB chargers, bistro set for 2, electric fireplace, starry sky projector, bluetooth speaker.
Kitchenette:  a kettle, coffee maker, 2-burner induction cooktop, cooking pans and pots and utensils, waffle maker, a set of dishes, drinking water dispenser, fridge, microwave.
Breakfast food: farm fresh eggs, cooking oil, salt, sugar, pancake/waffle mix, coffee, milk/cream etc. You can make your own meals or we can provide home made meals upon request.
Bathroom: composting toilet, wash basin.
description.notes: Please note: the running water in the dome is for washing up only (washing hands / brushing teeth). Please no washing dishes for it drains directly under the dome and dishwater may attract animals. The hot water shower and sink for washing dishes are available in the barn located next to the dome.
description.interaction: In most cases will greet you in our driveway and take you to the dome. With rare exceptions, we are available for assistance 24/7.
description.house_rules: The owners live in the main house on the property. We also have one house/farm neighbour close to our property. Please be respectful of noise at night.

We have started our short term rental family business- Chosen Stays a company that endeavors to impart joy, peace, and belonging one stay at a time.

We are a fun loving family that loves host friends and family at our new home. We are Texans who have transplanted to lovely Charlotte.

We love music, playing guitar, piano and even the harp. We love nature, tranquility and travel. Also we love our rambunctious boys who keep us busy!!

Dahlonega Ga.

Great Place, Will definitely be back!
Very creative and tidy place.  Hope for more privacy.  We did not stay the night due to a moldy/mildew smell in the house.
Really enjoyed our short time at Meghan’s Glamping Dome!  Perfect little getaway!
Great place, love the dome idea.

We loved Meghan’s place. The dome was so cute, well decorated, and looked just like the pictures. I wasn’t aware of how close we would be to the owners house but once we were there we still felt very private. My kids had a blast exploring the very well, maintained woods. The beds & bedding were comfortable & even though it was a 95 degree day, the AC maintained an ok temp during the day & really nice temp at night. We were pleasantly surprised. Overall, we would be back.

description.summary: Come glamp with us a short drive from downtown Charlotte at Fawn and Fern Hideaway sitting on 5 wooded acres with a private road and parking. We feed the graceful deer community in hopes they visit you. Enjoy your own kitchenette with sink, mini fridge, k-cup and microwave. Your glamping includes a toilet, electric fireplace, and AC unit. It sleeps 4 with a queen and bunk bed.  Use the charcoal grill and fire pit or outdoor dining bistro and picnic tables glowing by whimsical hanging lights.
description.space:
Come glamp with us just 25 minutes from downtown Charlotte at Fawn and Fern Hideaway.  We are located in South West Charlotte near Tega Cay. The space is a beautiful twenty three foot dome that is powered by our solar panels and supplied with water from our 375 foot deep well. While our home shares the land, this is our only dome site and you will quickly feel at peace and secluded when you arrive. Our lot is nearly 5 wooded acres. You will have your own access road and private parking. 

Enjoy your own kitchenette with sink, mini fridge/freezer, k-cup coffee machine and microwave. Your glamping experience has been upgraded to include a plumbed toilet, and climate control via electric fireplace and AC unit. (Dress for the weather as insulation is limited). The dome sleeps 4 guests with a queen bed and bunk beds. There is a private picnic table, charcoal grill and fire pit for your use with whimsical hanging lights and outdoor dining bistro. We plan to one day build an outdoor shower, but until then you may use our washcloths, soap and sink provided to freshen up as needed. 
 
   There is a beautiful tree growing right through your private deck and a great bay window looking into the forest. We have planted lovely hostas and ferns surrounding the dome. Enjoy the community of deer that frequent the site. We have put out deer corn to attract and feed these graceful fawn visitors. 

We hope you enjoy glamping with us and we can’t wait to host you!
description.access: Private access road and private parking for 2-3 cars.
description.neighborhood: South West Charlotte near Tega Cay. 10 minutes from Carowinds, 25 minutes from the Whitewater Center and Uptown Charlotte.
description.interaction: We encourage self check in but live on the property should you need help. Give us a call or knock on the door and we can assist.
description.house_rules:
Glamping Charlotte- Fawn and Fern Hideaway

Parking
- When you come down the driveway just after the bridge on the left, there is a single lane driveway that leads to a double parking spot. Park here and take gravel sidewalk up to dome.

Heat and Air Conditioning
- Cold Weather- use the fireplace primarily to heat the dome to at least 50 degrees. Run for at least 30 minutes before using the portable AC/ heater. The AC unit has supplemental heat but the starting temp must be at least 50 degrees. Use the remote to select the sun emblem to heat.
- Hot Weather- use fans and/or the portable AC unit. You can set using the remote. Select the snowflake emblem.
- Dress for the weather… Due to the limited insulation ability of the dome, we advise you dress for the weather.

Use of the Grill
- Bring your own charcoal, lighter, and fire starters. We are providing a charcoal chimney and Webber grill.

Use of the Fire Pit
- Bring your own wood, lighter, and fire starters. We don’t mind if forage for wood on our land. 
- Never leave the fire unattended. 

Entertainment
- WiFi- “meghansplace”; Password- “restandrelax”
- TV?… no way! Go build a fire, take in the view, or spend some quality time with your friends/ family :-).
- Board games are for your use in the upper kitchen cabinet

Amenities
- Electricity? Yes! Plug in your devices and enjoy camping with a chandelier in your tent. 
- Coffee machine, mini fridge/freezer, microwave, kettle, paper plates and cups.
- Delicious well water from sink. 
- Toilet- yes camping with a private toilet! 
- Bathing? We do not have a shower, but we provide wash cloths and soap.
- Drawers for clothes storage under queen bed. 
- Esxtra blankets under bunks and in drawer under queen bed.

We enjoyed a great sunset from the hit tub, and danced to the record player, and even stayed up past midnight playing Jenga and Monopoly (we organized the monopoly cash btw!).

All in all, great living space, within a convenient driving distance from Virginia Tech, I have already recommended this to a few of my friends and colleagues.
