These domes are absolutely incredible. They are well stocked, super unique, and extremely comfortable. I would highly recommend these to anyone!
Such a cute place to stay for a weekend getaway!
Alberto was a great host! He kept excellent communication. We loved it here and will be back again for sure. Please was very clean and most of all very peaceful. Thanks Alberto!
such a beautiful  place, would recommend  to anyone!

description.summary: Welcome to our luxury Glamping Dome, where nature and comfort collide. Experience a unique getaway surrounded by stunning mountain views, endless outdoor adventure, and wildlife spotting right at your doorstep. Indulge your senses in nearby wineries and savor the charm of quaint small towns. Our dome offers modern amenities, privacy, and a chance to create unforgettable memories. Escape the ordinary, embrace nature, relaxation, and a touch of luxury in this perfect getaway.
description.space: Get ready for a one-of-a-kind experience where nature meets luxury. Inside our dome, you'll discover a fully equipped kitchen with an induction burner for your cooking adventures. Snuggle up on a comfy memory foam bed for a restful sleep and freshen up in the full bathroom with modern amenities. Outside, soak away your worries in the private hot tub and gather around the firepit for s'mores and starry nights. Get ready to relax, unwind, and make unforgettable memories in this cozy slice of paradise!
description.access: You will have full access to the entire Glamping Dome and its surrounding area. Enjoy the privacy and exclusivity of the dome during your stay.
description.transit:
We're excited to have you as our guests and want to ensure you have a wonderful stay. Here's a guide to some fantastic activities and places to explore, categorized by their proximity to our property:

Local Delights in Meadows of Dan:

- Primitive Coffee Shop (15 minutes) - Enjoy NYC-style coffee and a cozy atmosphere.
- Poor Farmers Market (15 minutes ) - Discover fresh produce, local dishes, gifts, and more.

Venture to Mt. Airy, NC:

- Mt. Airy Town (25 minutes) - A great town with restaurants, grocery stores, breweries, and wineries. Don't miss Andy Griffith's birthplace.
- Andy Griffith Museum (25 minutes) - Immerse yourself in the world of Andy Griffith with artifacts and memorabilia.

Nature and Hiking:

- Buffalo Mountain Trail (20-25 minutes) - A rewarding hike with a stunning panoramic view.
- Rocky Knob Trail (20-25 minutes) - Explore another beautiful hiking trail.

Wineries:

- Chateau Morrisette Winery (20-25 minutes) - Unwind with outstanding wine, live music, and a picturesque patio. Perfect for the whole family.

Charming Town of Floyd:

- Floyd Town (Approx. 30 minutes) - Discover a lovely town with unique restaurants and shops.

Local Flavor and Entertainment:

- Willis Gap Community Center (20-25 minutes) - Enjoy Appalachian Acoustic Music every Friday night.
- H.C. Harold Orchard (20-25 minutes) - Pick fresh apples and savor the experience.
- Willis Gap General Store (20-25 minutes) - Get a taste of country store charm.
- Frontera Roots (20-25 minutes) - Shop for eccentric and traditional home decor.

Unique Eateries and Landmarks:

- The Gap Deli at the Parkway (15 minutes) - Savor delicious lunches and coffee.
- Angel Overlook (20-25 minutes) - Witness a breathtaking view from a special spot.
- Mayberry Trading Post (20-25 minutes) - Explore this charming family-run store.

Adventure and Entertainment:

- Buffalo Mountain Ziplines (20-25 minutes) - Experience thrilling ziplines and stunning surroundings.
- River Outdoor Adventures (35 minutes)- Embark on exciting outdoor activities.

Please keep in mind that most of these locations are in rural areas, offering authentic experiences. Enjoy your stay, and feel free to reach out for more recommendations or assistance!
description.interaction: We want to ensure that your stay is as seamless and enjoyable as possible. Rest assured that we are here to assist you throughout your visit. As your hosts, we will be available to offer any help or assistance you may need. Whether you have questions, need recommendations, or encounter any issues, we are just a phone call away. Feel free to reach out to us anytime, and we'll be delighted to assist you. Your comfort and satisfaction are our top priorities, and we are dedicated to making your stay a memorable one.

hosts.about: Creative technology guru. Adventure guide. Photographer. Aspiring farmer.

recent.comments: Neat experience.

items.comments: Neat experience.

Great experience, stargazing was lovely! We stayed up almost the entire night. It was very chilly, the heated blankets helped a lot. Shower and toilet facilities were also good. Would definitely recommend for a nice romantic couple stay! Directions to reach the place were on point.

Scott was an excellent host, and this dome is a magical place to stay. On a clear night, the stars are incredible, and his land is so beautiful to walk around on. The dome itself was clean, cozy, and a fun and unique place to stay. Scott was extra thoughtful, going as far as to get me a brand new heated blanket since it was below freezing for the first time that season, and kind of unexpectedly. I would absolutely stay here or in another one of his stays again.

This place was SUPER cool!  It was incredibly peaceful and cozy.  Be aware it leans slightly more toward "primitive" than "luxury"; somewhere between a big fancy tent and an RV ("Elizabeth" has obviously never slept in either!!) but photos and descriptions are 100% accurate... it's tidy, inviting, and comfortable.  It still has heat, AC, a fridge, a bathroom,  a warm comfortable bed, and frankly the shower house was even nicer than expected - clean and surprisingly roomy!  We like to tent camp at primitive sites so the simplicity was perfect for us and for a brief stay... We were in town for just one night attending GO FEST in Roanoke but we could have easily stayed multiple nights.  The property felt safe; not far from the main road but still plenty private.  It's close enough to a small town for supplies but far enough from the city to experience an INCREDIBLE night sky and only the sounds of nature.  I would 100% stay here again.
Had a great visit to Bucky!  Loved the cool mountain air and getting in that super comfy bed with the electric blanket. Would definitely visit again.
Loved the place!
Perfect location and lovely setting....very cool place to stay.  Convenient to downtown! The host very responsive.  I cant wait to go back!

description.summary: Sleep under the stars and roam through the fields on 25-acre Deerfield Farms. “Bucky” is an open and bright 16-foot Geodesic dome that has a queen bed, four skylights, a picture window overlooking rolling pastures, an indoor sitting area, a coffee station w/ mini fridge, and air conditioning! Outdoor table and chairs. Very clean port-o-let less than 50 feet away, with sink. Shower house close by, with hot/cold water, towels, and toiletries.
description.space: If you are looking for a truly unique glamping experience, come to Deerfield Dwellings and stay in this geodesic structure modeled after Buckminster Fuller’s design. A tranquil oasis, it is less than three miles from downtown Floyd where you can enjoy live music, great food, eclectic shopping, and lots of outdoor adventure along the Blue Ridge Parkway. When you’ve had your fill of the hustle and bustle of a town with one stoplight, you can escape to your inviting and cozy dome, under the big sky, surrounded by nature. There is a mowed path along the perimeter of the farm and a 10’x10’ covered platform at the highest point, with a spectacular view. Hammocks are available there for your use! The pasture on the other side of the fence has cows who may serenade you occasionally.
description.access: “Bucky” is perched on a sturdy raised platform, three steps up from the ground. The door to the dome is a zippered flap, and when entering you will need to duck a little. Once inside, the dome is an open space, 8’6” floor to ceiling.
description.notes:
*There is no lock on the dome door. If you are concerned, please lock valuables in in your car.
*Please remove shoes at the door. 
*We have a dog that lives on the property. Her name is Stella, and she is gentle and friendly.
 *Weather can be unpredictable. There is a space heater and an electric blanket for heat. 
*Any vehicle can easily access sites.
*The toilet is a clean and nice port-o-let, sink included. It is NOT shared with the other listing. 
*The shower house is shared with one other listing, “Daisy” the camper, which may or may not be rented when you are there. Please note- when temperatures are below freezing shower will not be operable.
description.neighborhood:
Floyd, Virginia, United States 
Deerfield Farms is located down a beautiful, quiet, mile-long road that dead-ends just beyond the property.
description.transit: There is no public transportation in Floyd. We are conveniently located less than three miles from the heart of town.
description.house_rules: smoking outside only.

name: Hobbit Hideaway - Do something different
title: Slater-Marietta, South Carolina

hosts.about:
I’m Jacob. A few years ago I converted a van into a camper. It was my daily-driver for a while but eventually decided my Matt Foley days were over and I retired the van in exchange for something more eco-friendly (but much less fun).  The van sat around in between weekend camping trips that unfortunately became less and less frequent as time passed. 

A year ago I decided that the holy grail of swaggin’ wagons could no longer be kept a secret from humanity. You really think I would hide something as great as this van under a bushel?? The answer is NO!!

Anyway... So then I decided to build a campsite in my backyard so that others could enjoy the van the same way I have. 

Well now, I have purchased some land and have begun to draft the dream spots.  First, I started with a dome... reminds me of a hobbit home, but cooler!  I am now remodeling a bus and hope to have that to you soon!

Thanks for reading.

recent.comments: We had a wonderful stay. Such a neat little airbnb. I appreciate that it is dog friendly. Its nice having all the different activities at the place. Would definitely come back

items.comments: We had a wonderful stay. Such a neat little airbnb. I appreciate that it is dog friendly. Its nice having all the different activities at the place. Would definitely come back

Absolutely enjoyed our stay at the dome! It was unique (something we love), quiet (also a bonus), peaceful, and relaxing! We were 15 to 30 minutes from local restaurants and activities. This place made the top of our "best places to stay in Greenville!"
it was amazing, we definitely will be making a trip back soon!!! LOVE the decor and activities
We had a great stay!
He was an excellent caring host which I highly recommend. Best place we have stayed at with Airbnb and we have stayed in a lot.

Love staying at this unique space! Both the indoor and outdoor space were thoughtfully created and we greatly appreciated that everything needed for the grill and fire pit were provided. Highly recommend this place!

We stayed here for the weekend of our wedding at Pretty Place Chapel and it was absolutely beautiful! Jacob actually had a sweet wedding gift waiting for us when we checking in to this beautiful space! By far one of the best houses and hosts on airbnb!

description.summary: Trek back from Mordor and retire to a full kitchen, AC/heat, queen bed, pullout couch w/ new memory foam pad, washer/dryer, shower and more.  Enjoy the patio where you can be the lord of the fire ring, grill PO-TAY-TOES, enjoy the swing, hammock, horseshoes, axe throwing, games and more.  Located 12 min from beautiful Traveler’s Rest, where you can run/bike your little hobbit heart out on the 22-mile Swamp Rabbit trail. Also 30 min from downtown Greenville.

gallery.caption: Custom laser engraved headboard, king sized bed with memory foam topper and dual controlled bed heater pad.
Hexagonal wizard hat roof on our outdoor shower with 18" rainhead. Large enough for two people to stand under while looking out at the mountains.
Full bathroom with nautilus art wall and wind chimes
Enjoy the gorgeous mountain view and sunrises in the sky chairs.

hosts.about: We are an artsy and natural family of four who love music, art, yoga, acrobatics, meditation, gardening, cooking and wordly travel.  We have traveled to various countries and have circled the globe twice.  We are good hearted, simple people and are excited to share our cute and cozy home with you!

We are a couple of acrobatic love-birds who love nesting in the Blue Ridge Mountains and flying freely all over the world. We are communicative & responsible folks who will care for your space when we are your guests and will care for you when we are your hosts. Between our past and present Airbnb listings in New Orleans (Louisiana), London (Ontario), & Asheville (North Carolina), we have Superhosted over 2500 guest bookings.

recent.comments: Amazing and relaxing stay! Loved all the details and uniqueness..I can’t wait to come back!

items.comments: Amazing and relaxing stay! Loved all the details and uniqueness..I can’t wait to come back!

The nautilus shell dome was everything described and more! Right away, we felt at peace! The homey touches were great, from the slippers to the robes and shower shoes! The local coffee, tea, and honey were to die for! My husband and I are already trying to come up with an occasion to go back!
The dome was 10/10!!🤩 it was so peaceful and quiet..perfect for a get-away with my wife!

I can't say enough about this property.  We travel all the time, and it is by far the best place we've ever stayed.  I've never been so sad to leave a property.  I could go on and on about how incredible the experience was. I hate just sitting around, and I'm always on the go, but this space gave me such peace and happiness.  I didn't want to go anywhere else or do anything but enjoy the scenery, the sauna, or the incredible outdoor shower(my favorite part).  PLEASE PLEASE, do yourself a favor....book it!!  You don't need to plan anything else.  Just being there is more than enough. We will be back....often!

Would be worth a trip into asheville just to spend a night or 2 or 10 at this wonderful Zen space that they have created. Every detail thought out, curated and created and and meticulously upkept. From the outdoor rainfall shower to the little private sauna, you can tell how much the hosts care. 
We hope to be back soon!

the Dome was an incredible stay, the list of amenities that were included were substantial. The bed was very nice and the outdoor shower and sauna were very cool and unique. it is a perfect getaway only 20 mins to all the fun Asheville food and drinks!

It’s incredibly beautiful the dome itself is wonderfully made surrounded my beautiful greenery and deer’s now and then saying their hellos. The sauna was totally worth it and the outdoor shower was so cool! You really do feel at peace when staying here!

description.summary: Your humble palace on a mountaintop. Built entirely by our hands with help from friends & family, we carefully crafted this Nautilus Shell Dome with modest luxuries for renewal of self and ecological inspiration. The reviews say it better than we could. Full amenity profile. Sauna. 20min to downtown Asheville, 10 to charming Weaverville. Look to the horizon for long range mountain views with stunning sunrises and peaceful sunsets. Peer into the valley below where a pond is fed by babbling falls.
description.space:
This is a safe and welcoming space for everyone. 🏳️‍⚧️ 🏳️‍🌈 

What sets this dome apart from others aside from it’s one-of-a-kind architecture?

• *King sized bed - memory foam, dual control heating pad
• *Home movie theater - projector and screen for watching streaming services (day or night)
• *Reliable WiFi
• *Sauna
• *Mini split for heat and AC, excellent insulation. Bathroom also heated.
• *Full bathroom/flush toilet

description.access: The Shell Dome sits on a 28'x28' platform with the parking area just below it and a private yard just above. Outside this area guests are welcome to visit the pond and walk the 13 acre property. The driveway is a loop. Various members of our family live in the 3 other houses on the land.
description.notes:
The Shell Dome and parking, yard, and gardens are surrounded by tall ornamental grasses and is quite private. There is a shared driveway nearby so occasionally one may hear one of our passing vehicles as we come and go from the land.

As hosts, we end up with a lot of forgotten items. Should you wish for us to return your items by mail we ask for a minimum $40 service fee plus the shipping costs.
description.neighborhood: Surrounded by large, peaceful, rural family farmland.  Very quiet at night.
description.transit: Long driveway down onto our property, take a right at the bottom and loop around and up the hill to the shell dome. Parking is the first thing you come to directly beside the shell dome before the barn.
description.interaction: Call/text with any questions or concerns.  We want to make sure your stay is enjoyable.

No smoking (of anything) inside the dome please. 

As hosts, we end up with a lot of forgotten items. Should you wish for us to return your items by mail we ask for a minimum $40 service fee plus the shipping costs.

description.summary:
We considered calling this house “The View With Some Rooms,” but settled on The Lodge. One of a few units on the property, this private 3-bedroom house includes a rooftop dome (which serves as the third bedroom). From almost every spot, enjoy the jaw-dropping scenery of endless mountains, three states, and the Potomac River.

We have two other rentals on the property if you're looking to add more guests--the Cedar + the Cabin! Contact us for a full camp rental (sleeps up to 14).
description.space:
The Lodge is a two bedroom, two full-bathroom unit with a fully stocked kitchen, cozy enclosed sunroom, adjoining game room, and two private outdoor patio areas. In the warmer months (March-ish ~ October-ish), one more bedroom opens up... on the ROOF! Sleep under the stars and take in the sunsets in our super cool rooftop dome--the Moonlight. 

We provide almost everything you need including high-quality linens, luxury bath towels/hand towels/washcloths, extra hot tub towels, paper towels, toilet paper, basic spices/sugar/olive oil, fully stocked kitchen, all-natural shampoo/conditioner/body wash, natural hand soap, dish soap/detergent, etc. (we will email a full list upon booking).

We have two twin air mattresses available with all linens/pillows/blankets.

The Moonlight Dome (king bed) is located just outside the Lodge, and up a flight of stairs. Kick back and relax on the private rooftop deck, and use the telescope to stargaze. The dome is air conditioned (with blackout curtains!) during the warmer months. For the colder days, there is a small heater, but the (non-insulated) dome can still be quite chilly. The bed has a heated mattress pad, but there is always the option of two air mattresses/sheets indoors ;)  Please note that the dome shares the second full bathroom inside the Lodge.

Upon arrival, you'll find a bag of fresh coffee beans and a s'mores kit waiting for you. Play some foosball, Pacman, or board games in the game room...tune into the Sonos speakers throughout the house...throw on a record...draw on the chalkboard wall...relax on the outdoor sofa while grilling up dinner (Weber grill)...watch a movie on the smart TVs (we provide Amazon Prime and Netflix to make it easy for you!)...throw some logs in the Solo stove fire pit (we stock you with fire starters and dry firewood!)...and cap off the night in the private hot tub under the stars. 

Directly across the driveway from the Lodge is our outdoor Lounge area (chairs, cornhole, communal fire pit), which is shared with all guests staying on the property.  In the lower level of the Lodge is our newest guest amenity--the Trading Post. Pick up some CPP gear, drinks/snacks, or some items you might have forgotten to pack! There is also a mini library of books and records, and a postcard mailing station. This space is open for all guests staying on the property 24/7. Rest assured that while the Trading Post is located in the "basement" of the Lodge, there is no access from inside this space into the main living area. Once booked, we'll email you our custom Field Guide--highlighting all of our favorite recommendations for what to do, see, eat, and explore in the area. 

The property has reliable, fast wifi, smart TVs, and good cell phone coverage.

Camp Potomac Peak is located on a ridge of Cacapon Mountain and offers stellar views over the Potomac River into Maryland and Pennsylvania. Situated on 8 acres, the property offers plenty of room for stretching your legs and walking around the grounds. We are just 10 minutes from the spa town of Berkeley Springs, two fantastic state parks, and two amazing rivers.
description.access: Please note, the Lodge shares a driveway with our other rentals—the Cabin and the Cedar. The Cedar, in particular, is located a few yards away from the Lodge, but efforts have been made to include privacy for both. Because we have multiple units within close proximity to each other on the property, we ask that guests respect quiet hours after 10pm. Some of the grounds, and the Lounge area (with the killer view!) located across from the Lodge are shared, common spaces with other guests.
description.notes:
We are meticulous about cleaning, and can ensure that the place will be spotless. The towels and sheets aren’t the only things fresh—as we wash all throw blankets and duvet covers before every guest.

We also live just five minutes away from Camp Potomac Peak, so if anything comes up where you might need assistance with something, we are almost always the ones you will interface with. Jeff is incredibly handy and can fix/solve most anything (but don't tell him I admitted that). We are both personally involved in ALL of the day-to-day operations at CPP, and we are available 24/7 (we provide our personal cell phone #'s upon arrival).
description.neighborhood: Once booked, we will email our custom Field Guide to help you navigate around all our favorite spots in the area. In a nutshell, a 10 minute drive brings you to the historic downtown of Berkeley Springs (shops, antiques, farmers market, brewery, historic movie theater, great restaurants) and in 20 minutes, you're at the fantastic Cacapon State Park (lake beach, hiking, 18-hole golf course, mountain biking, horseback riding, tennis).
description.transit: There is a shared driveway that connects all the units at Camp Potomac Peak— the Lodge, the Cabin, and the Cedar. There is room for TWO cars right next to the Lodge. Because this part of the driveway is shared with the Cedar, parking locations are very important. We will send specific instructions prior to your stay. If more than two cars need to park, we have a large gravel lot at the bottom of the driveway!
description.interaction: We will be available 24 hours a day for any questions during your stay, and live just five minutes down the road.

name: Dôme LA Tanière au bord de l'eau
title: Brownsburg, Canada

hosts.about: La satisfaction de notre clientèle est primordiale pour nous. C'est la clé de notre succès !

Manque de Batterie, Ustensile de barbecue et de table sale, Chaleur écrasante dans le camp, manque d'espace pour Kayak et Paddel et eau non baignable poisson mort qui flotte.

My family had an incredible time at the Dome . The clamping experience was impeccably organized, offering a serene and peaceful atmosphere that truly resonated with all of us. Moreover, the delightful vibe of the place was a huge hit with our kids, making it an unforgettable experience.
Nice place for relaxing.

L’accueil était excellent et les lieux vraiment apaisants. Je recommande 10000x! :)

description.summary:
Dôme LA TANIÈRE 
Situé sur une pointe de terre bordée par l'eau, ce dôme vous offre une vue unique à 180° sur un superbe lac sauvage. Véritable sanctuaire faunique, vous pourrez y observer plusieurs espèces animales dans leur milieu naturel dont les castors, tortues et Quiscales.

Vivez une expérience exceptionnelle en tout confort au coeur de la nature. Réveillez-vous avec le chant des oiseaux, le vent qui souffle, le silence. L'endroit idéal pour se ressourcer et sortir de son quotidien.
description.space:
bien isolé, chauffé seulement au poêle à bois et éclairé à l’énergie solaire, ce dôme est conçu pour vous accueillir 12 mois par année. D'un diamètre de 20', il permet à 4 personnes d’y séjourner confortablement.  

En plus du point de vue imprenable sur l’eau qu’offre la grande fenestration du dôme, vous trouverez plusieurs commodités vous permettant de vivre une expérience inoubliable :

- Cuisinette équipée d’un poêle au gaz 2 ronds, mini frigo, BBQ, vaisselle, chaudrons, cafetière à infusion, eau potable fournie via 4 bouteilles de 18L

- 1 lit queen devant la grande fenestration, 2 lits simples superposés. La literie est fournie.

- Espace foyer intérieur et extérieur. Emmenez votre bois pour les feux extérieurs.

- Grande terrasse, table extérieure, hamacs.

- Toilette écologique extérieure privée à moins de 15 pieds du dôme. Petite toilette portative disponible à l’intérieur du dôme sur demande (10$+taxes).

 De spacieuses douches et toilettes classiques sont situées à notre bâtiment d'accueil à 5 minutes de marche. 

Situé sur un domaine de 25 âcres comportant 5 hébergements et un bâtiment sanitaire, vous pourrez vous baigner dans l’eau limpide du lac Martinez (2 minutes à pied), vous laisser flotter sur une planche à pagaie au rythme des vagues ou encore explorer le lac aux tortues en kayak. Les embarcations sont partagées et offertes gracieusement à notre clientèle.
Afin de préserver la tranquillité des lieux, le dôme est accessible à pied seulement. Il est situé à 6-7 minutes de notre bâtiment principal où vous pourrez emprunter des chariots à bagages au besoin. 

Pour un léger supplément (15$+taxes), nous offrons aussi un service de navette pour le transport de vos bagages jusqu'à 19h30 à votre arrivée et entre 10h et 11h à votre départ. 

Au plaisir de vous faire découvrir notre lieu unique !
description.notes:
L'électricité est fournie à l'aide d'une batterie dans le dôme alors il est seulement possible de brancher de petits appareils comme un cellulaire et une tablette. On NE peut PAS brancher de grille-pain, cafetière, four à raclette et séchoir dans le chalet.

RÉSERVATION: Le vendredi, 2 nuits minimum. Aucune arrivée le samedi
description.interaction: Nous sommes disponibles de 8h à 20h pour répondre à vos questions et vous aider à passer un agréable séjour.
description.house_rules:
Pour maintenir la tranquillité des lieux, il est demandé de réduire le niveau de bruit au maximum entre 21h et 10h et de vous assurer que votre musique ne peut être entendue qu'à votre emplacement. Les fêtes bruyantes ne sont pas acceptées sur le site. Les feux d'artifice sont interdits.

Merci de laisser le chalet propre tel qu'il était à votre arrivée, vaisselle faite.

Merci d'enlever vos bottes et chaussures dans tous les bâtiments.

L'électricité est fournie à l'aide d'une batterie dans l'hébergement alors il est seulement possible de brancher de petits appareils comme un cellulaire et une tablette. On NE peut PAS brancher de grille-pain, cafetière, four à 
raclette et séchoir dans le chalet. Le Locataire est responsable des dommages matériels survenus dans ou sur l'unité louée pendant la période de location et ce, pour quelque raison que ce soit causé par lui-même ou un de ses invités, directement ou indirectement. 

Nous offrons de l’hébergement touristique et différentes activités dans un milieu naturel et semi-naturel possiblement accidenté par endroits. Malgré le fait que nous portions une attention particulière à la sécurité de nos clients et faisions en sorte que le site soit le plus sécuritaire possible, il existe plusieurs risques associés à la pratique d’activités sur le site. Nous ne pourrons pas être tenu responsable de tout accident, blessure ou maladie pouvant survenir durant le séjour tel que : 
-Blessures dues à des chutes ou à d’autres mouvements (entorse, foulure, fracture, etc.); 
-Blessures avec un objet contondant ou coupant (branches, roches, équipement d’activité, matériel, etc.); 
-Froid ou hypothermie; 
-Contact avec l’eau ou noyade (lors d’une activité aquatique ou à proximité d’un cours d’eau) 
-Brûlures et/ou troubles dus à la chaleur ou la fumée

name: Moonhaven Haus Luxury Moroccan Design Forest Dome
title: Travelers Rest, South Carolina

gallery.caption: Welcome to Moonhaven Haus, a luxurious immersion in nature and good vibes!
The 525 sq. ft. geodesic dome has everything you'll need for your getaway. You'll be amazed at how spacious it feels!
Enjoy the large, enclosed full bathroom with top-notch shower experience and Moroccan + local design features.
Lights (adjustable) beneath the custom walnut bed make it seem almost to be floating. Note the incredibly-comfortable bed, Moroccan textiles, and organic cotton hotel-style bedding.
After dark, have your own disco party and watch a movie or fire up the karaoke mic!
When you arrive on the property, this will be your first view of Moonhaven Haus, and you are able to park very close to the dome.
You don't have far to haul your belongings (and there's an overhang now above the door). You'll go up just a few steps onto the custom deck and use the keyless entry on the Moroccan-blue front door.
Take off your shoes and coat and stash them here just as you step inside. There's plenty of room for your hanging clothing and several pairs of shoes.
To your left, you'll find the full kitchen and dining area (kitchen chairs have changed since this photo was taken).

The kitchen (which now includes a coffee/tea cart that also houses the microwave/air fryer) includes a granite countertop, full fridge/freezer, large sink, double-burner induction cooktop, toaster, and potable well water.
We provide several ways to wash and drain your dishes while leaving plenty of kitchen workspace.

You'll find a Keurig with k-cups, Stagg x Fellow electric kettle, French press, teapot, milk frother, tea and ground coffee, and other necessities for preparing your own coffee and tea (now at the coffee and tea station).
We've moved the coffee and tea station (plus microwave/convection oven) to a cart to free up valuable counter space.
Kitchen shelving was custom-made for us from local walnut. You'll find Bodum insulated glass cups, outdoor glassware, Moroccan-style dinner glasses for tea and wine, and a full knife block.
Flip through our cookbooks specializing in grilling, small-space cooking, and Moroccan foods.
You'll have at least four of everything, so you won't have to wash dishes after each meal, unless you want to! Extra dish/hand towels are always available.
We've curated a selection of fiction and non-fiction titles, specializing in such topics as forest bathing, mindfulness, Moroccan and eclectic design, and slow living.

Moonhaven Haus has very fast WiFi, so you can stream on the smart TV and your own  devices. We also have a DVD player with a small selection of Moroccan-themed DVDs. Turn on the electric fireplace for ambience or extra heat.
If you're hoping to get away from devices for a bit, we have various analog options: books and magazines, cards and other games including backgammon, various puzzles, and drawing/coloring materials.
Relax in the cozy queen bed or do yoga while gazing into the forest.
Read or practice yoga with a view.
We're crazy about lighting, so you'll find loads of options here. Bedside, the touch lamps have several settings and DC and USB plugs included, so you have various options for charging.
Here's another lovely view, from one of the upholstered swivel chairs. Prop your feet up on the pouf and gaze at the mountains, watch TV, or play games at the large coffee table.
Gaze up at the trees, blue sky and clouds, and the moon and stars at night. We provide eye masks for those not wanting to wake with the sun!
The Turkish chandelier and the sky/moonlight windows are defining features of Moonhaven Haus.
The comfortable chairs swivel 360 degrees. Maybe bring a drink over and put a puzzle together?

Also in the living space, you'll find a vintage record cabinet with a new turntable and some cool vinyl. You can also play your own music through bluetooth (we hope you'll try our Moroccan Eclectic playlist; we'll send you the link!).

You'll discover some great music on vibrantly-colored vinyl, next to a vintage brass lamp. To add to the mood, light some incense (we'll leave some to get you started) in the hanging brass incense burner.
Check out the size and the luxe feel of the bathroom! It features a sink and mirror from Morocco, a standing mirror, fun artwork, plenty of linens, and lots of natural and added lighting.

The bathroom houses a large shower with natural lighting overhead, two luggage racks, and plenty of storage. The strip lighting works great as a night light, but to hide it while sleeping, just close the bathroom door.
You'll love the design and feel of the shower.
Our friend lovingly crafted the live-edge countertop from local wood and resin, and it's lit from underneath.
Enjoy the all-natural, high-end shampoo, conditioner and body wash by Bathing Culture. We use biodegradable toiletries and cleaners whenever possible!

We provide a minimum of two bath towels/two washcloths per person. Welcome to the most environmentally-friendly toilet you've ever seen! It's an incinerating toilet, which is simple to use and involves no water or any treatment of waste by the user.
The mini split heats, cools, and dehumidifies the entire space. The interior walls are insulated, which helps with efficiency.
We think Moroccan tagines are beautiful, so we included them throughout Moonhaven Haus as decor instead of in their intended capacity as cooking- and serving-ware.
Our custom-designed deck with all-weather seating is a great spot for morning coffee or a grilled dinner. This is the only area where we allow smoking (use the provided ash tray).

Interested in purchasing+designing your own love lock (with a small dremel tool) to attach to our deck or cording amidst the trees? Let us know and we'll share where to find the materials). The idea is to return in the future to check on your lock!
Feel free to bring out the yoga mat or hammock from the basket inside.
Ask us about our add-on packages for special celebrations--or "just because"!
Our friend and local yoga instructor Jess can even come and do private indoor or outdoor yoga sessions, if you book her in time! After you book your stay with us, we'll provide her contact info.

Make dinner on the Weber kettle grill with provided charcoal, lighters, chimney starter, and fire starters, plus grilling tools and trays. Ask about our add-on steak or salmon dinner package, which we'd leave inside Moonhaven Haus for you to prepare.
Kick back in comfortable Adirondack chairs around the high-end Solo Bonfire fire pit, with forest and mountain views ahead. We provide complimentary makings for s'mores!
Another option for outdoor relaxation is the large swing. You can also bring out our hammock to hang in the trees in this area.
Bring a book out to the meditation/contemplation spot with mountain views.
Moonhaven Haus is aglow at night, inside and out!
You'll have a great view of the sun going down over the mountains in the distance.
We think Moonhaven Haus is extra-special in the evenings!
For privacy anytime, just close the custom curtains! We'll advise you on how to close them gently and easily!
There's plenty of lighting at night, but not too much!
We've preserved hardwood trees so that you'll feel you're in a treehouse but won't have the distant forest and mountain views blocked.
Beautiful Moonhaven Haus from above, lit by our large Turkish chandelier! Please save our listing and look for us on social media at hausholidays and domehausholidays!

hosts.about: Co-host since 2017. We spent 12 years living overseas with our kids before moving to SC. Jonathan is a Realtor, and I manage our 4 listings, each very quirky and distinctive! I enjoy books, thrifting, decor, cooking, gardening and herbalism, tea, travel, British TV, pets, and being a grandmother. We love being Superhosts! Our 715+ hosting reviews appear under Jonathan’s profile (“Jonathan and Diane”), along with our area Guidebook.

We're Jonathan and Diane, owners of Haus Holidays--4 unique design-forward properties in Travelers Rest, SC. I'm a Realtor specializing in relocation, new construction, land, and commercial. Diane designs and manages our listings. We moved to SC after living overseas for 12 years with our kids in support of the US military. I continue to serve veterans as a Military Relocation Specialist. We love our rural home and also still enjoy traveling!

recent.comments:
I booked this place for my fiancés bday. it looked like the perfect little spot and i am SO glad I did! 
Everything was wayyy better than we expected it to be. Not only was this place beyond what we imagined, but Diane and Jonathan made this 10x better. they were incredibly communicative, understanding and helpful. They even helped me set up a little surprise bday decoration for my fiancé upon our arrival. Mongo was that one thing that appeared right after we said “this couldn’t get any better”, and it certainly did. we fell in love with her, such a beautiful, loving pup. We 10000% will be coming back and recommending this place to every single person that asks about the pictures. 
If you’re seeing this gorgeous spot and debating if you should book it - DO IT! 
Thank you Diane and Jonathan for sharing this space with us 🩷

 a quiet private spot for a weekend stay, and a place that wasn't just another cabin, hotel, or camping spot, boy this place did not disappoint! Easy to find and they have thought of everything you could need to enjoy the space and location they have provided. Thank you for sharing the dome with us! Also mongo is a sweetheart 😁
The dome was absolutely lovely. It was everything they said it was and more. It is so beautiful and peaceful inside and out. We didn’t want to leave the whole weekend.
A great unique place for a little getaway! Location is great for those who love to hike or explore. And the neighborhood dog Mongo is the absolute sweetest!

Words will never do justice to how beautiful and comforting this space is! The dome itself is so tastefully decorated and so cozy! You simply can't beat being able to gaze out at the trees and the sky right from the luxurious queen size bed! Mongo, the neighborhood dog was a very sweet and welcomed guest that we looked forward to seeing each day! They thought of the greatest little touches from games, to records, to the tea selections.. oh and the "Love locks!" We hope to return again and again!
Lovely space—very unique. Loved listening to the rain and watching the sun come up through the dome. We had a great time! Was very well decorated and equipped!

This place was the perfect getaway! The experience was 5 stars, and the mountain dog Mongo gets an additional 5 stars. 

We needed this environment to re-connect and get away as a couple. This location with the added amenities  (outdoor fireplace, grill, etc) serves ideal for couples or someone who just needs to getaway from the fast pace city life.

description.summary: Reconnect with nature without roughing it, at Moonhaven Haus, an unforgettable glamping escape in the SC Upstate. Our luxury Moroccan-inspired geodesic dome has a full kitchen, enclosed bath, ultra-comfy bed and living area with forest and mountain views, and fast WiFi! Just 12 min. into Travelers Rest, 30 min. to Greenville or Hendersonville, and 45 min. to Asheville. Explore our area, then return to your private oasis with intriguing design details and an abundance of amenities inside and out!
description.space:
Imagine yourself securely perched just high enough in the forest (four steps up), inside your cozy but spacious climate-controlled dome. Glamping-Plus, we call it. At a roomy 525 sq. ft., Moonhaven Haus is a design-forward space ideal for couples or solo travelers (no children under 13, or pets, please). You'll love waking to the beauty of nature while experiencing the comforts and amenities of home; we've proactively considered the needs and wants of our guests, who are looking for a memorable experience outside of the ordinary. We cater to those with eclectic but discriminating tastes, who would enjoy sipping Moroccan mint tea while listening to our little vinyl collection and perusing the curated stash of books. Who'd relax in the cloud-like bed while streaming a movie from the Seventies, with swirling strobe lights dancing all around the dome's interior. Who love hiking and exploring cute towns but won't settle for a stay that isn't visually-striking and appealing to the senses. If that sounds like you, come settle in to Moonhaven Haus. The only problem? You just might not want to leave...

Here are some more reasons why:
*super-fast WiFi
*lots of entertainment options, both analog and digital
*entirely-unique interior design and curation
*intriguing vintage decor items throughout the space
*tons of lighting choices, including our gorgeous Turkish chandelier
*high-end details such as Stagg water kettle and Solo fire pit
*granite countertop with plenty of space and supplies for cooking
*posh extras such as water filter pitcher, slippers, eye masks, and robes
*bed made from locally-sourced walnut
*full-length curtains so you don't feel exposed after dark
*upholstered swivel chairs to take full advantage of the views (or watch TV)
*custom wood and resin bathroom countertop, with lighting beneath
*luxe shower with skylight and high-end natural Bathing Culture toiletries
*custom-designed deck (there's nothing else like it!)
*comfy deck seating with beautiful mountain and valley views
*plenty of wood and charcoal for the Weber grill and Solo fire pit
*options for add-on packages, such as love locks to hang from our fence, regular and premium steak dinners, special celebration extras, and the possibility of private yoga and massage sessions
description.access: You'll have private access to the dome site, which includes the dome (with full curtains for privacy and added insulation) and deck, plus a small amount of surrounding wooded area, with a Solo fire pit and chairs, grilling area, and a swing and meditation spot with a soothing wind chime (you can also hang our hammock if you'd like). It's easy to walk around the area on the unpaved road and the paved road going down the mountain, where you will see few cars or people. Please note that you'll be 3 minutes from the nearest restaurant (Country House Cafe) and 12 minutes from the nearest grocery store, so you'll want to plan accordingly.
description.notes: The dome is fully insulated, so there are no worries about adequate heating or cooling via the mini split. There's also a cute electric stove for ambience and/or extra heat. The dome and surrounding area are treated, but since you're in a large dome in a forested area, so you might see a couple of bugs; we recommend that the door be kept closed to greatly minimize this possibility. There are blackout curtains for privacy, but light/heat will come through the skylight during the day (and you can gaze up at the moon at night!). The kitchen has all the basics (and more) except a regular oven and dishwasher. Coffee and a variety of teas are provided. The kitchen also includes a large electric skillet, and the microwave can also be used as an air fryer and convection oven. The incinerating toilet is extremely environmentally-friendly--very easy to use and incredibly clean; the bathroom is enclosed.
description.neighborhood: The property is in a rural forested community with easy access to Hwy 25, atop a small mountain. The road up is paved and not too steep. There's a handful of neighbors, including family members of ours, who look out for each other and the area. You may not see any of them, and they will not be on the dome property. You won't feel isolated but will still have plenty of privacy! Please note that you'll be 12 minutes from the closest grocery store and our lovely downtown Travelers Rest.
description.transit: You'll need a vehicle (no need for 4WD, but it's best not to be towing a trailer, due to a few curves on the way up the paved road). Using a ride share service might be possible, though we would not recommend asking the driver to come all the way up to the dome spot, especially after dark. The road up the mountain is paved; the turn onto our street is a gravel/dirt road, as is the private parking area next to the dome.
description.interaction: Diane usually responds within minutes to any messages, especially between the hours of 8 am and 11 pm. We prefer to communicate via the app and highly recommend you have it on your phone with notifications turned on (you will receive messaging only pertaining to your trips), but if you need to text, just let us know; we do need to know that you are receiving our messages. We're happy to answer any questions you have, before or after booking! Please check out our area Guidebook as well.
description.house_rules: Vaping is fine outside; smoking is allowed only at the table on the deck with provided ashtray (if cigarette butts are found on the ground outside the dome, an extra charge may be imposed--thank you for keeping our forest safe!). Please don't venture onto neighbors' property (marked but ask if you have questions). The two-person maximum is firm, except that we allow an infant who isn't yet crawling or walking. If you play music outdoors, please keep the volume low at all times, where it can be heard only in a small area next to you, as sound travels outside! You can play music quite loudly inside the dome!

title: Grassy Creek, North Carolina

recent.comments: The dome home and surroundings are KILLER! Thanks to the host(s) for sharing this gem. Words don't do justice. This place screams 'stay/relax/explore' and that's exactly what happened. Being an engineer, I was digging the dome structure itself. No Verizon reception but yes fast internet. Host responsive to any question.

This place screams 'stay/relax/explore' and that's exactly what happened. Being an engineer, I was digging the dome structure itself. No Verizon reception but yes fast internet. This dome treehouse was a perfect getaway on a hot summer week. It's so unique and my boys ages 9 and 11, loved it! We could walk around the property, enjoy the pond, see mountains from our fire pit, and enjoy the hot tub. So peaceful and beautiful. Loved it!!

It was a perfect quiet and peaceful getaway. The property was great, with trails I hiked 100 times, and a family of deer I saw daily. There was a beautiful pond with extra large fish and the views of the mountains from the hot tub and fire pit was stunning. 

I felt very safe as there was gate that could be secured at the start of the long driveway. Previous reviews mentioned the dip going from the gravel to the steep paved portion of the driveway. This was actually fixed during my stay as a load of gravel was placed and should make it easier for lower vehicles. Although, the steepness may still be difficult in the winter months, so be aware.

The rental company was very responsive and friendly when needed and check-in was a breeze. Wi-Fi was working as was the satellite TV.

 I truly enjoyed hiking at Grayson Highlands State Park in VA, only 25 minutes away, and the Old Store at Grassy Creek was adorable and right down the road. I recommend their local ice cream sandwiches.
Our favorite place in the mountains!
The place is very tranquility. I didnt want to leave. I would come back again

The unique experience makes this a fun place to stay.  The house was clean and well stocked with the necessary items.    The setting is quiet and peaceful and the outdoor spaces really add to the experience.  There is a nice pond, waking trails, hot tub and fire pits.    This was an excellent place to relax.
We had a wonderful stay! It was private and gorgeous scenery. Perfect getaway spot for us and the pup. Would definitely stay again!

description.space:
Geodesic Dome on 40 acres with bubbling hot tub overlooking a pond this is the tranquil setting you have been looking for. Conveniently located near Shatley Springs Restaurant, River House, Helton Creek, Virginia & North Carolina State Parks.




Long Description

"Unforgettable"

Grassy Creek, NC - Be prepared for a totally UNFORGETTABLE experience!! Set on 40+ acres among the rolling hills of Eastern Ashe County and close to Southwest Virginia, you will find this wonderfully handcrafted Buckminster Fuller design Geodesic 3/4 Dome. With over 300 square feet of windows, the home itself makes you feel like part of the surroundings. Solid cherry paneling, wormy chestnut cabinets, and wooden floors are just the beginning. An inside stairway leads to an enclosed observatory at the top of the dome; a perfectly romantic spot to view the stars above the canopy of trees. A deck surrounds half of the exterior of the dome and offers a nice sitting area for relaxing. Just out the kitchen door, a stone pathway leads to the patio, where swing, picnic table, and hot tub await!!  Be sure to take some time to stroll around the property. Unforgettable is a tree-growing plantation as well as a working Frasier Fir Christmas tree farm and wildlife preserve, so numerous trails meander through the wooded and open areas. From the highest peaks, you might even catch a glimpse of Grandfather Mountain if it's a clear day. If not, the panoramic views are well worth the walk, and you're sure to enjoy just sitting by the scenic pond area with a cup of coffee or a good book. If you wish to venture out, the property is in close proximity to several landmarks in the area. The North Fork of the New River and Gale Winston's famous River House Gourmet Restaurant are only a couple of miles away. The confluence of the North and South Forks of the New River is about 6 miles away. Shatley Springs Restaurant is 5.5 miles away, and the Mount Rogers National Recreation Area is about 15 miles away via Highway 16N and VA Highway 58. If you're in for a day trip, you'll find directions at the home to Chateau Morrisette (fine dining, deli and winery). Check it out at  . It is well worth the 1.5 hour drive north on the Blue Ridge Parkway, at Meadows of Dan, VA where you will also enjoy Mabry Mills. Pick up a Parkway Guide so you don't miss all the hidden treasures along the way!  If the man is coming to fish, this is definitely THE PLACE. You are only one mile from Helton Creek Trout Stream, which is visited by fishermen from all over. In addition, this air conditioned home provides a fully equipped kitchen, Satellite TV, VCR, AM/FM Radio with C/D player, Washer/Dryer, and charcoal grill. With 1.5 baths, 1 Queen, 1 Double and 1 Twin Bed, the home will accommodate 5 in the upstairs loft area. Towels and Linens are provided; the home is pet friendly. MAXIMUM OCCUPANCY: 5

Unforgettable is a Carolina Mountain Properties & Rentals property. Our calendar and rates are updated instantaneously. Contact us atto reserve. We strive to make it as easy as possible to stay at one of our properties. We will notify you proactively when an early check in is possible and you’ll receive the comforts of a luxury home when you arrive with a starter supply of paper products, hand soaps and lotions. In addition, we offer 24/7 emergency after hours service. Carolina Mountain Properties & Rentals uses one of the industry’s most trusted brand of software to securely store all guest data. All of our vacation rentals follow local and state tax rules. Each reservation includes applicable taxes, linen cleaning fee, and a processing fee. Carolina Mountain Properties & Rentals also offers an optional trip interruption insurance to protect your investment.

name: Metarons Dome
title: Saltville, Virginia

hosts.about: Hey everyone! Welcome to Metatrons Dome! I am a reiki master and sound therapist. I believe my purpose in life it create a safe space for people to be their authentic selves. I love helping people feel comfortable and relaxed. It’s my goal to give you a unique experience with any business endeavor I take on. That said I’m here if you need anything. Enjoy your stay!

Loved the hammocks on the deck. The firefly lights were awesome. The inside was better than the pictures. Laura was a great host ...we will be going back. Just not soon enough.

This getaway was amazing! Very clean and well organized space. Laura communicates very well and is very helpful. The experience of the dome and nature together is perfect. I could not recommend  this stay more! 10/10

My husband and I came out to hike the channels and needed a place to stay for the night. This place was perfect! The location was private and peaceful. The dome was beautifully decorated and had everything we needed to make our own meal plus more! We really enjoyed our stay here and Laura was very thorough in her directions and hand guide for the house! We highly recommend this place for anyone looking for a place to get away for a bit!
Loved the dome and it’s location. The views were amazing and the amenities were thoughtful and welcoming. This was easily the best airbnb I’ve stayed in.

The Dome is a magical place and Laura is fabulous host. Everything was so thoughtfully organized, from the abundant tea selection, to the fairyland firefly lights and flowers, the beautiful sketchbook available to use, and the sacred geometry artwork and crystals. Laura was so helpful and friendly and gave us great local recommendations.  We loved staying in the dome and can’t wait to go back. ✨

Laura’s place was the perfect weekend getaway. Secluded off of a beautiful VA mountain road with little traffic so plenty of peace and quiet at night. The porch was ideal for evening cocktails by the fire table and the dome was well beyond stocked with anything and everything you could ever need. Forget your toothbrush?  No problem, there’s one there for you. Felt right at home as soon as I arrived. Can’t wait to come back!
We loved our stay at the Dome! it was so quiet and private, and the interior is beautiful!  the attention to detail here makes you feel so welcomed.  I will definitely be back!

description.summary: Metatron's Dome is a unique airbnb experience nestled in the Appalachian Mountains of Virginia. Our property is designed with relaxation and rejuvenation in mind. Guests can look forward to a one-of-a-kind stay. You can explore the local cuisine and activities with Abingdon, Damascus, Bristol and Saltville a short drive away. Suitable for children 8 and above. Pets are allowed for a non refundable fee $ 100 1rst pet and $50 per additional pets
description.space: Metatrons Dome is a cozy and tranquil 500 square foot Geodesic Dome. The floor plan is open to allow for an airy feeling. Most suited for couples or friend getaways. Wake up to the sounds of birds and have your coffee/tea on the porch taking in the uplifting and beautiful scenery. Close to historic towns to go explore while still being able to have your own little slice of tranquility. The dome offers all the amenities of home while giving you a true glamping experience. description.summary:
***Multiple Domes Available ***
Stay on a 140 acre farm in the only camping dome shelter location in the Smoky Mountains and get back to nature. Look out the windows at the forest, mountaintop and sky. Relax on the little porch, savor eating meals on the picnic table  and enjoy the warm propane fire pit. Lay down in the comfy queen sized bed and drift off to sleep while watching the beauty of the night sky!
description.space:
Come visit this unique camping dome in the Smoky Mountains! See the night sky from your bed and enjoy being close to nature. This is a Glamping experience. Glamping is luxurious camping with more modern amenities like power, finished floors, beautiful views, and comfortable furnishings, but it is still camping. The domes are not insulated so it can get hot during the day in the summer and cold at night in the winter. There is an A/C and a heater in the unit, as well as a heated blanket, but similar to camping, expect the weather to be a factor.  Explore Tennessee by day and relax in your dome at night. The dome has a large bay window and several sky windows. You’ll find a barn with an apartment, a tiny house, and three other domes on the property. Inside the barn, we have indoor showers and bathrooms. There is also a mini fridge, microwave, and coffee maker available for all guests to use. Additionally, we have an outdoor shower, but it will be shut off during winter months. There is also a propane fireplace to enjoy s'mores or hotdogs at night and a picnic table to eat and prepare meals. 

PET POLICY: We are pet friendly and understand pets are part of the family. We gladly welcome our guests traveling with pets. There will be a $20 fee per stay for each pet. Pet's MAY NOT be left unattended in the dome or on the property. Guests are liable for any damages done by their animal during their stay.
description.access: Dome, porch, picnic table and propane fire pit are just for you. Park in the gravel driveway right near the dome. Shower and portable toilet are shared if there are guests in the the other dome and tiny house.
description.notes:
The dome is not insulated so it can get hot during the day in the summer and cold at night in the winter. There is an A/C unit and a heater in the dome, as well as a heated blanket, but similar to camping, expect the weather to be a factor.

Verizon is the only service provider that works here. We do provide Wi-fi on site, but it is spotty around the property, but can be used to check email or send imessages. If you are unable to access Wi-Fi at your dome, you can use the guest area in the passway of the barn to access a stronger WiFi signal. 

There is no plumbing inside the domes. Bathrooms and showers are provided onsite and are shared with other guests.
description.neighborhood: Nestled in the Great Smoky Mountains, you’ll be in a quiet area where you can get away from it all. You’ll be 15 minutes from the Great Smoky Mountains National Park Cosby entrance. Just 30 minutes to Dollywood. It’s also a beautiful 25-30 minute scenic drive from Historic Gatlinburg, Pigeon Forge, Sevierville, and Newport. The property is across the street from a beautiful creek and you’ll have a mountain top in your back yard.
description.transit: Pull in front of the barn and park on the gravel, about 10 yards from your dome.
description.interaction: The dome is equipped with a keypad for self check-in. We’re also very accessible via the Airbnb app, call or text.

description.summary: ABOUT THE GEODESIC DOME
description.space:
Our glamping dome is situated in the middle of the Getaway on Ranger Creek and is stunning. Be amazed as you walk into the 700+sqft, 30ft diameter dome, with a soaring 17 foot high ceiling in the center! Inside is climate-controlled (heat and A/C), with a full modern kitchen, a comfortable reading area (along with a selection of books and games), a large living area with a couch that converts to a bed, and a giant beanbag for relaxing in front of the enormous 8’ tall by 20’ wide window. The bathroom features a large tiled shower with a rain shower head. The bedroom is spacious, and includes a bed with a memory foam queen-sized mattress, ceiling fan, reading lights, and USB charging ports. There are 2 “smart” TVs (living area and bedroom) where you can log on to your streaming service to enjoy your favorite entertainment.  Outside is a patio area with a firepit, great places to sit and lounge, a grill and a picnic table to eat on. The dome’s giant window overlooks woods and meadow, as well as a ¾ acre pond, complete with ducks. 

The Dome also features very good reception from our free high-speed guest Wifi (usually over 75Mbps). Additionally, Verizon and AT&T have good reception in and around the dome.

ABOUT THE GETAWAY ON RANGER CREEK

Do you have a sense of adventure, a true ‘think out of the box’ kind of mindset? Do you like to try new and unusual things just because you can?
Then the Getaway on Ranger Creek is the place for you!

The Getaway on Ranger Creek is a unique 18 acre property in the heart of the South Cumberland Mountains, close to the fabulous new Coalmont OHV Park, Fast Farms MotorX, Greeter Falls, Foster Falls, and many other parks and recreation areas.. 

We have parking accommodations for truck and trailer, and a unique variety of units for you to stay and relax.

The property owners/managers live on-site. While they will be available for quick resolution of any of your needs or for any maintenance issues, they are not always physically on-site. They always strive to provide you with privacy and relaxation, so you’ll rarely see them, unless you need them!T

Outside areas of our property are insecticide- and herbicide-free. However, our small flock of friendly Muscovy Ducks and a variety of chickens work very hard to keep the mosquito and tick levels to a minimum. You’ll be amazed at just how few mosquitoes you’ll encounter, especially considering that the property is in the Tennessee woods! Guests should note that our ducks and chickens are very friendly and may “hang out” in your general area if you are outside. They are completely harmless, and even enjoy eating your food leftovers if you offer them!

We offer so much for those who truly like to experience things outside the norm! Stay in one of our 4 unique glamping units, and explore our 18-acre wooded property, including several trails, a woodland pond, peaceful areas to sit and relax, 2 creeks which border the property, and a small stream. 

Have you ever spent the night in a geodesic dome that is overlooking a woodland pond? Watch the stars sparkling in an indigo night from the wraparound deck!

Have you ever imagined yourself lounging in a stylish glamping tent tucked in the woods with a deer wandering by? Or maybe a stay in a crisp Scandinavian style cabin, nestled in the woods, with a large covered deck. And, coming soon, you’ll be able to spend a night in a “teardrop” style camper, with a huge covered deck for outdoor enjoyment. 

All units offer privacy. The Dome overlooks our pond, and all other units are nestled in their own areas of the woods. The Dome is fully self-sufficient. All other units include electric, a fire pit, a propane grill, a small refrigerator, and a foot-pump sink with 5 gallons of fresh water (can be refilled upon request). 

For guests staying in the glamping tent, cabin, or camper, we have a lovely bathhouse close by with two fully-appointed and private bathroom\showers. Towels are provided for all guests.

The Getaway on Ranger Creek offers free high-speed guest Wifi (usually over 75Mbps) throughout most of the property. Additionally, Verizon and AT&T have very good reception in most areas. 

So, if you like adventure, and being different from the crowd, what are you waiting for? Book one of these unique accommodations and then head out to explore the wonderful world of the South Cumberland Mountains.

We are just 20 to 30 minutes from outstanding trailheads throughout the rugged and majestic Savage Gulf State Park and the South Cumberland State Park. Waterfalls, towering sandstone cliffs, rock climbing, renowned hiking trails, kayaking, an incredible world of nature's bounty!

Don’t miss a truly unique experience.

Pets and smoking/vaping are not allowed anywhere on the property, including within/around any of our glamping units, parking or public areas.

This place is beyond limits, it’s one of the best, the best place we stay at, and we traveled quite often, Hawaii, Caribbean, Central America and South America etc, we know what we are saying, lovely, spectacular views, private, we are definitely coming back, close to Asheville, if u don’t mind driving like us, Hendersonville is another city that u can drive for shopping. My only regret is that I needed to stay longer, next time I will.
Great relaxing place
I enjoyed this stay so much! I wish I never had to leave! It felt so peaceful and quiet and the full moon was amazing!

This place is a gem! Fantastic getaway for a couple or peaceful for someone by themselves. We were so impress with all the dome had to offer. Anything we needed was already there except the actual food. Such an amazing place!!

This is the most amazing place I've ever stayed. The view is remarkable and the design of the dome is incredible. The interior design of the dome is gorgeous and looks exactly like the pictures! I highly recommend this location to anyone looking for a peaceful place to relax. Once we arrived we didn't want to leave. The dome came with a kitchen which had everything we needed to cook the dinner we brought. Chris went above and beyond to ensure the dome includes everything we needed for a comfortable and relaxing stay. I can't wait to come back some day!

The domes on top of Vero mountain offer tranquility and an opportunity to get away from the hustle and bustle of every day life! This specific dome was pristine. My girlfriend and I were able to watch numerous thunder storms move through the area, which offered a special lure and peace. I would recommend this experience to everyone.

description.summary: Become one with nature in our Truth Mountain Dome! Vero Mountain is excited to share a unique and luxurious experience you will never forget. Spend a few nights escaping society to relax in a geodesic dome while you soak your worries away in a private hot tub. Take in all the killer mountain views from every angle while you BBQ with your close ones on our spacious viewing deck. Sleep under the stars, watch the sunrise and set without sacrificing all the comforts of home.
description.space:
The Truth Mountain Dome embodies boho vibes everywhere you look. Step into the dome’s kitchenette supplying standard cooking necessities and additional features that provide the max of next-level glamping. The king bed sits upon the feature wall overlooking the serene mountain range, including Mount Mitchell and Mount Pisgah. Around the corner awaits a full-size modern bathroom, private toilet room, and luxurious shower. Be comfortable at your desired temperature as the dome hosts its own thermostat-controlled air conditioning/heater, pellet stove, heated mattress pad, bath robes, luxury linens, dehumidifier, and portable a/c unit.

Please inquire for more information about our amenities for special celebrations, vacation fun, and retreat packages. We also have a farm on Vero Mountain that we would love to show you around. Thelma & Louise love new visitors! Please arrange a visit to the farm to meet the animals, plus it seem like we always have baby animals arriving. Come glamp with us in our modern domes at Vero Mountain. Make sure to check out all 3 of our distinctive domes that offer a different theme and experience.
description.access: Secluded dome, dome's viewing decks, and dome's parking area
description.notes:
- 2 guest maximum per property & must be 18+ years old, guests are welcomed (max of 4) but cannot be on property during quiet hours (9PM – 7AM)
- NO PETS, please inquire about recommendations for local dog sitters
- Liability Waiver MUST be signed and returned before arrival
- Any guests that avoid any house rules, cause destruction or a disturbance, may be asked to leave immediately with no refund and/or incur hefty fines ($500+). All subject to owner’s discretion (Please review house rules)
- 4WD is recommended to get to Domes, but doable with 2WD
description.neighborhood:
Vero Mountain is located atop a private 158 acres oasis, including 3 geodesic domes & a farm, within the city limits of Mars Hill, NC. The surrounding area offers amazing hikes, breweries, and local attractions (check out our guidebook). Located 35 minutes away from downtown Asheville, 45 minutes away from Asheville Regional Airport, and 1 mile from Wolf Laurel Community & Wolf Ridge Ski Resort. Viewable mountain ranges from the property of the Blue Ridge Parkway include Mount Mitchell & Mount Pisgah. The Appalachian Trail is accessible just a couple miles away.
 
We recommend stopping by the grocery store & grabbing drinking water on your way in. The nearest grocery stores are Wolf Provisions - 15 minutes  or Ingles - 20 minutes away. Downtown Mars Hill & Burnsville, both 20 minutes away offer a variety of restaurants and shopping.
description.transit: A car is needed to get to the Dome's location up the mountain on the gravel road. AWD or 4WD is recommended! Doable with 2WD but might be slightly challenging especially dependent on weather. 2 parking spaces are  available directly in front of the Truth Dome.
description.interaction: Host is available and nearby during stay. Please contact by phone or app before or throughout stay with any questions or in need of immediate assistance. Guests will receive information during booking and follow up information a few days before arrival.
description.house_rules:
- 2 guest maximum per property & must be 18+ years old, guest's friends are welcomed (max of 4) but cannot be on property during quiet hours (9PM – 7AM)
- DO NOT litter or leave trash outside, especially things that may fly away/attract pests or animals
- NO PETS, please reach out to inquire about recommendations for local dog sitters
- NO PARTIES or excessive noise, please be respectful of neighbors, especially during quiet hours
- Liability Waiver MUST be signed and returned before arrival
- Security cameras on front exterior towards parking area, do not tamper with
- Any guests that avoid any of these rules, cause destruction or a disturbance, may be asked to leave immediately with no refund and/or incur hefty fines ($500+). All subject to owner’s discretion
- 4WD is recommended to get to Domes, doable with 2WD but might be slightly challenging
- No refunds due to weather, please note we have no control over mother nature, including strong winds, bugs, and animals. We do our absolute best to provide a wonderful experience and take pride in the dome’s cleanliness
- Please check out promptly at 11am, or agreed upon check out time; $50 per every 30 minutes past check out time

name: Half-Moon Dome at Our Farm
title: Strasburg, Virginia

hosts.about: My husband and I have a small agri-tourism business where we offer unique dwellings for rent through Airbnb.  We look forward to meeting new people!

recent.comments: Super cool dome on a beautiful property! Lots of space for our dogs to run around.

items.comments: Super cool dome on a beautiful property! Lots of space for our dogs to run around.

My dog, and I had the best time at Remy‘s place!  Remy and her family are the nicest people ever, and I felt right at home hanging out with them. They treated me like family. The space was very beautiful and relaxing. They provided me firewood so I could make a fire. And I definitely splurged on the breakfast and coffee each morning. The only negative is there were a lot of ticks so come prepared.  Other than that, I really enjoyed disconnecting from the world and just relaxing with my dog in nature.
Great stay.  An interesting and comfortable place.  Highly recommend!

This dome was great for a quick get away from the city. It’s close to a lot of great, hiking trails and not far from the downtown strip as you’re looking to get something to eat rather than cook. Our only reservation was not the dome was close to the street. Although the street is not a major through fair, cars driving by at night did Leica. That house with a compostable toilet is very clean and comfort.

This spot is the perfect getaway. Remy has thought of all the necessary details for a truly enjoyable stay like a coffee maker, games and books, and bathroom toiletries. Our complimentary bottle of wine really made our arrival fantastic. “Our Farm” has the most beautiful scenery for a peaceful retreat. I highly recommend!
The most magical mountain escape! Highly recommend for your next visit to the Shenandoahs. Pro tip: stay up until dark to watch the fireflies!!!!
We loved our stay at the dome! It was a perfect way to get out of the city and relax for the 4th of July. We will definitely be back!

description.summary:
The Dome is over 200 sqft (16 ft across) with an 8ft tall ceiling at the middle.  The Dome is equipped with a zipper door and has a canvas cover with windows and screens and features a large bay window that allows views of Little North Mountain and a full view of the farm.  There is a solar exhaust fan and wooden floors as well as a queen bed with linens and some causal seating. 

There is no electricity or running water and no WIFI.  We do provide solar-powered and battery-powered lights.
description.space:
The Dome is located in a large grassy area with ample space near a creek.  You can pitch additional tents (not provided) near the dome for no additional cost. There is easy road access and on-site parking.  You are welcome to explore the farm along the mowed paths.  Please be aware that we do have cattle on the farm, so do not open any gates and stay clear of the fences as they may well be electrified.

Outside, there is a fire pit and seating area as well as a grill and a dining area.  Some firewood is provided and there is additional firewood available for purchase on-site.  We also provide complimentary local beer or wine, as requested. 

Lastly, we have a nice bathroom with a compost toilet but no running water and no shower. We are in the process of adding a full bathroom with shower near-by, but it will likely be 2024 before that project is finished.

Disclaimer: If it has rained a lot in the past few days the area will be muddy, please plan accordingly!
description.access:
The farm is over 200 acres of wooded mountain land and grassy pastures with some small creeks and springs.  Our goal is to create experiences, products, and a destination for folks to learn more about agriculture in the Valley and to instill a connection to the land.  This is our take on diversifying the  family farm and creating a modern agritourism destination.

Our Farm currently has grass-fed beef cattle and unique lodging options, like the Dome. We also have a small garden and some hops.  

When visiting Our Farm, please ask about how to purchase our farm-raised beef and vegetables for your dinner.
description.notes:
Our Farm is within 20-30 minutes of Winchester, Woodstock, and Front Royal in Strasburg, VA. The northern Shenandoah Valley has a lot to offer.  There is a binder in the Dome with information on local attractions but please don't hesitate to ask us for more ideas!

Due to weather and the holiday season the Dome will not be available for bookings from December 15th through March 15th.
description.transit: Getting around in this area definitely requires a vehicle. And for parking at the dome an SUV or truck is best but most vehicles can make it into the field.
description.interaction:
We look forward to socializing with visitors over drinks during the evenings as they are interested.

Breakfast is available as requested.  Requests must be received at least the night before by 7p.  We will deliver a basket of fresh baked goods to the Dome at a time decided upon by both parties.  We currently offer popovers, scones and muffins.  Donations are appreciated.

recent.comments: This was a very relaxing and was extremely well curated experience. This dome had all the amenities  you need to have peace of mind. Lastly, you will never forget the beautiful Nature the land has to offer.

description.summary:
This luxury dome is a modern home perched on a mountain top. Our aim is to combine the comforts of a large hotel suite with all the healing qualities of nature.

Venture out or hike our own trails leading to a pond and a stream in the woods. 

Suited for long term WFH stays! We have Fiberoptic internet (ethernet avail) and plenty of space for your setup. Stroll the property at lunch or jump in the heated plunge pool between calls. Ask me about a special offer for long term stays. (14 days +)
description.space: We have high end furnishings from all over the globe, polished concrete floors, 3 mini split systems (A/C and heat), kitchen with all the accouterments, frame TVs in each room, a wall of books, and most importantly, the most comfortable beds you’ll ever sleep in.
description.access: The whole dome home is yours and the patio area is shared with other domes (but they aren’t built yet).
description.notes: Please note the 3rd bedroom is a loft accessed by a ladder (with handrail).
description.neighborhood: We are located on Cowan mountain in Hobart NY. Centrally located between 8 villages and hamlets that offer so much to guests. Everything you need is about 10 minutes away. Venture a bit further for even more delightful experiences.
description.transit: In the winter, you’ll want a four wheel drive vehicle. Parking is readily available anywhere you need to go.
description.interaction: I’ll be available by messages and I’m quick to respond. Local, on site help is available if required.
