gallery.caption: Glamping!  Glamorous + Camping = Glamping.  Enjoy modern luxuries of A/C, heat, indoor bathroom, and kitchenette while enjoying the natural surrounding camping style.
Gather around the crackling fire pit and let the warmth and river sounds enchant you!
Embrace relaxation in our private hot tub, nestled within a serene park-like setting in the heart of the Smoky Mountains.
Step into a world of modern comfort and style with our geodesic dome, where contemporary decor meets the uniqueness of a stunning interior designed to captivate and inspire
Refresh in style with a modern indoor shower designed for comfort and luxury.
Immerse yourself in a tranquil oasis with our geodesic dome surrounded by lush greenery and a serene park-like ambiance.
Living area with sofa-bed and dining table.
Experience Mother Nature with modern conveniences.
Rest after the days adventures in a King-size bed
Where tranquility meets adventure!

hosts.about:
My husband and I LOVE to travel and have new experiences!!!  We love the quiet, quaint places that are off the beaten path and less "touristy". 

We often use Airbnb when we travel and have decided to open up the extra space in our home and other properties for travelers.

recent.comments: Absolutely beautiful place, it was impeccably clean. It definitely was Glamping, as this place had all the amenities that a hotel would but more. An added bonus was a thunderstorm our 1st night,  it was an amazing experience in such a secure dome. I definitely recommend!  I would love to rent both domes (1&2) out at the same time for a couples retreat.

items.comments: Absolutely beautiful place, it was impeccably clean. It definitely was Glamping, as this place had all the amenities that a hotel would but more. An added bonus was a thunderstorm our 1st night,  it was an amazing experience in such a secure dome. I definitely recommend!  I would love to rent both domes (1&2) out at the same time for a couples retreat.

There is so many amazing things about this dome that I can say, but we’ll be here all day! We absolutely loved our stay 15 minutes from downtown Gatlinburg! The hot tub is a necessity after a long day exploring all the great things the Smokys have to offer, and the sleep is amazing listening to the ambient sounds of nature. If you’re lucky enough to experience rain while staying in the dome, it’s so magical falling asleep to. The hosts are kind and very accommodating, and put a lot into making this property everything you could ask for! Thank you for the beautiful stay! ⛰️

This place was beautiful! and the location couldn’t have been better due to how close everything was, I also loved how it had things we didn’t realize we were going to need, (didn’t have to go to the store to purchase) 
Definitely would recommend it to anyone who is trying to experience something other than a typical cabin! It also rained on us the last night and that was an amazing thing to experience as you can definitely hear the beautiful rain yet peaceful enough to sleep through!
We loved our stay here! It was spotless and just as pictured. Would definitely recommend.

I recently stayed at the charming Glamping Globe near Gatlinburg, just a short 15-minute drive from the bustling Parkway and the stunning Smoky Mountains. The globe was incredibly cute and provided all the amenities I needed for a comfortable stay. I particularly loved the spacious interior and the fantastic hot tub that offered a relaxing retreat.

We were lucky enough to have two thunderstorms and it was amazing to watch it in the dome!

Although the host mentioned that you may hear highway noise due to its location, it's worth noting that the nearby highway noise was louder than expected, especially during the day. Additionally, the water had a quirky smell but wasn’t a deal breaker for us.

Overall, my stay at the Glamping Globe was delightful, with the only downsides being the highway noise and the water scent. If you're seeking a cozy and well-equipped glamping experience close to Gatlinburg's attractions, this place is worth considering.

description.access:
There are two Domes located on this 1.5-acre property. You will be staying in the "Mount LeConte" (Dome #2). Follow the pathway from the parking lot and take the trail/walkway to the Left at the split.
Guests will have access to the portion of the property assigned for their Dome.
Guests do not have access to the utility shed located near the parking lot.
description.notes:
LOCATION:
There are 2 domes located on a 1.5-acre property conveniently located just off HWY 321.   Follow the trail/pathway at the parking lot leading to your Dome.     The property also sits along Webb Creek where soft, rustling creek sounds can be viewed and heard.  

**Please Note** You are visiting The Great Smoky Mountains area.  By booking, guests realize and acknowledge they understand the area contains wildlife that may be encountered such as black bears, raccoons, squirrels, bugs, and additional wildlife common to the area that is outside of the host's control.

BEAR and WILDLIFE SAFETY:
Bear activity is very common in The Great Smoky Mountain/Gatlinburg area.   Children should be supervised at all times.  Do not approach wildlife, be respectful and give animals plenty of space. Patiently wait for the wildlife to move out of the way.  Please follow all bear safety rules exactly to ensure your safety.
description.neighborhood: Mount LeConte Geodesic Dome is conveniently located off of HWY 321 and sits in a park-like setting with a view of Webb Creek.
description.interaction: Hosts will be available by Airbnb messaging or by phone text/calls.
description.house_rules:
✦VERY IMPORTANT!!! It is essential to take proper food precautions during your stay! All food must be kept in the refrigerator in closed containers or locked in vehicles at all times. Food must be cleaned up and dishes are done after each use to avoid attracting bears.  Take trash to the caged trash receptacle after each use and latch it properly.

✦Guests agree to the following checkout instructions. These instructions are for safety in order to not attract bears. Cleaning fees are based on these checkout instructions being done: 
•Clean all dishes used during your stay. 
•Wipe the countertop and sink free of any food particles. 
•ALL food and trash must be put in the outdoor caged trash can and latched properly. This included unwanted items from the fridge.

✦Guests agree to be respectful of the Dome, its neighbors, and the owner's rules. Noisy, unruly guests will be asked to leave without a refund. 

✦Guests agree to be responsible for any damages that occur to the Dome or its contents during their stay.

✦Guests must follow all hot tub rules posted at the cabin. Minors must be supervised at all times while using the hot tub!

✦For SAFETY......children must be supervised at all times. 

✦Dome holds a max of  4 guests, if more than 4 guests are found to be staying at the cabin without prior approval, an additional $25 charge per person per day will be charged to the guest booking.

description.house_rules:
* CHALET RULES *

1. All our bookings are covered by Aircover, Airbnb's protection. You can be held responsible in case of damage or non-compliance. If necessary, we will use the resolution center with photos and/or invoices.

2. Check-in can be done at any time after 4:00 p.m. The maximum time for Check-out is 11:00 a.m. You can request for a Check-in earlier than 4:00 p.m. or a Check-out after 11:00 a.m., but we cannot guarantee this request and we will be able to give you an official response only 24 hours in advance.

3. It is strictly forbidden to smoke in the chalet. Failure to comply with this rule will result in a penalty of $ 500.

4. Pets are not allowed. Failure to comply with the rules will result in a penalty of $ 500 and immediate eviction without refund.

5. Parties and excessive noise outside the chalet are not permitted. Failure to comply with this rule will result in a penalty of $ 500 and immediate eviction without refund. We have excessive noise detection systems outside the chalet.

6. If the cottage is left in a messy condition, we will charge $ 40 per additional hour per housekeeping attendant to clean up. We love when guests wash their dishes before check-out or take out the dishwasher.

7. Guests are not allowed to book our chalet directly if they do not have verified ID and a profile photo of their face on Airbnb. We do not discriminate, we just want to know who we are renting our property to.

8. Guests assume full responsibility for any accident, injury or illness occurring in the chalet. By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all customers expressly assume the risk of any damage arising from their use of the premises. Customers recognize that they can personally purchase insurance to protect themselves during such events.

9. If more guests than the number initially stated in the reservation sleep at the chalet, we will charge you $500 of penalty and we will request that the initial number of guests mentioned in the reservation be respected from then on. 

10. If you notice anything that presents a hazard that could cause damage to the place or to people, let us know immediately.

11. If you delay the work of housekeeping attendants, at the time of Check-out, you will be charged $ 50. This charge is applied to any late check-out between 11:00 a.m. and 1:00 p.m. Any guest who is still on site after 1:00 p.m. will be charged for an additional night. This does not apply if we have approved a late check out in advance.

12. When you make a reservation with us you agree to all of the above house rules.

description.summary:
***Now Available For Booking ***
Stay on a 140 acre farm in the only camping dome shelter location in the Smoky Mountains and get back to nature! Look out the windows at the forest, mountaintop and sky. Relax on the little porch and enjoy the warm propane fire pit. Lay down in the comfy queen sized bed and drift off to sleep while watching the beauty of the night sky!
description.space:
Come visit this unique camping dome in the Smoky Mountains! See the night sky from your bed and enjoy being close to nature. This is a Glamping experience. Glamping is luxurious camping with more modern amenities like power, finished floors, beautiful views, and comfortable furnishings, but it is still camping. The domes are not insulated so it can get hot during the day in the summer and cold at night in the winter. There is an A/C and a heater in the unit, as well as a heated blanket, but similar to camping, expect the weather to be a factor. Explore Tennessee by day and relax in your dome at night. The dome has a large bay window and several sky windows. You’ll find a barn with an apartment, a tiny house, and three other domes on the property. Inside the barn, we have indoor showers and bathrooms. There is also a mini fridge, microwave, and coffee maker available for all guests to use. Additionally we have an outdoor shower, but it will be shut off during winter months. There is also a propane fireplace to enjoy s'mores or hotdogs at night. A microwave, coffee maker, and small fridge are available in the passway of the barn for guests to use. 

PET POLICY: We are pet friendly and understand pets are part of the family. We gladly welcome our guests traveling with pets. There will be a $20 fee per stay for each pet. Pet's MAY NOT be left unattended in the dome or on the property. Guests are liable for any damages done by their animal during their stay.
description.access: Dome, porch and propane fire pit are just for you. Park in the gravel driveway right near the dome. Shower and portable toilet are shared if there are guests in the the other domes and tiny house.
description.notes:
The dome is not insulated so it can get hot during the day in the summer and cold at night in the winter. There is an A/C unit and a heater in the dome, as well as a heated blanket, but similar to camping, expect the weather to be a factor.

Verizon is the only service provider that works here. We do provide Wi-fi on site, but it is spotty around the property, but can be used to check email or send imessages. If you are unable to access Wi-Fi at your dome, you can use the guest area in the passway of the barn to access a stronger WiFi signal. 

There is no plumbing inside the domes. Bathrooms and showers are provided onsite and are shared with other guests.
description.neighborhood: Nestled in the Great Smoky Mountains, you’ll be in a quiet area where you can get away from it all. You’ll be 15 minutes from the Great Smoky Mountains National Park Cosby entrance. Just 30 minutes to Dollywood. It’s also a beautiful 25-30 minute scenic drive from Historic Gatlinburg, Pigeon Forge, Sevierville, and Newport. The property is across the street from a beautiful creek and you’ll have a mountain top in your back yard.

description.summary: A unique getaway nestled on the edge of Limerick forest, this 4-season geodesic dome is perfect for any outdoor enthusiast. Enjoy a luxury camping (glamping) experience for two while surrounded by nature on a private lane. Located less than one hour south of Ottawa, you can escape the busyness of the city and take in the peaceful, calming sounds of outdoor living. With easy car access to the picturesque towns of Kemptville and Merrickville, you are never too far from all that you need.
description.space:
The interior of the dome is designed for all your glamping needs. It includes a queen bed, dining and lounge areas, a mini fridge, baker's rack for food preparation as well as collapsible sink for washing dishes. Hang all your belongings in the front entrance nook, and store any extra items in the cabinet behind the bed. 

The 20ft dome is heated by the propane heaters inside. 

The dome deck allows for dining outside in warmer months, with propane camping stove provided for outdoor cooking, as well as a private firepit with firewood. 

The heated bathroom and outdoor shower are detached from the dome. Please note that the shower is open only during warmer seasons. It remains inaccessible when temperatures fall below freezing. The compostable toilet, however, is functional all year round. 

Situated next to Limerick forest, there are many motorized and non-motorized activities permitted within the approximately 180kms of mapped trails. The forest contains 30km of groomed snowmobile trails. Enjoy activities like: hiking, mountain biking, cross-country skiing, snowshoeing, bird watching,  snowmobiling, dirt biking and ATV-ing, etc. 

Snowshoes are provided so you can snowshoe directly on the property. Hop in the car and arrive at the beach within 25 minutes (Rideau River Provincial Park, or Prescott Centennial Park). 

Limerick Forest Retreat has all you need for a perfect getaway in any season!
description.access: Situated on privately owned land near Limerick Forest, you will enter the property through a gated driveway. There is plenty of room to park your car or toys (snowmobile, motorbikes, mountain bikes, etc).
description.notes:
OUTDOOR SHOWER AND SINK
Functional only in warmer temperatures (typically late spring, summer, early fall). There is no running water in the dome itself.
description.transit: Car required
description.interaction: Available for contact via text, call or email

description.summary: Glamp Blue Ridge is a one-of-a-kind glamping resort located in Cherry Log, GA. The property has 7 domes tucked away overlooking Fall Branch Falls and directly bordering the Chattahoochee National Forest and 300 mile long Benton MacKaye Hiking Trail. Each dome is 530 square feet, uniquely styled, and guarantees an unforgettable experience.
description.space:
Dome Interior Details:

-Bedroom (Sleeps 2 adults and 2 children):
     -King size memory foam bed
     -Corduroy bean bag than can easily be converted to a queen size bed (Great for kids)
-Full kitchen equipped with fridge, freezer, ice maker, coffee maker (pods or drip), french press, microwave, dishwasher, 2 burner induction stovetop (compatible cookware provided), and all the tools needed to make a gourmet meal.
-Custom shower, separate toilet room, and a vintage vanity for all your prepping needs
-HVAC via a mini split system to offer year-round heating and air conditioning
-Wireless internet provided by Starlink (plenty fast to stream movies and stay connected)
-Privacy curtains for large clear front window
-4 person dining table
-Games and playing cards

Dome Exterior Details:

-4 person hot tub with privacy walls
-Large exterior deck space for relaxing
     -Cafe lighting
-Blackstone gas griddle (propane provided)
-Tiki firepit
-Comfortable seating for 4 via an outdoor sofa and chairs.

Glampsite Details:

-Fall Branch Falls! Each dome directly borders the falls and offers an amazing way to experience the falls and surrounding environment
-Hiking - Glamp Blue Ridge directly borders the famous Benton MacKaye Trail.  Just cross over at the top of falls and you have access to over 300 miles of hiking!
-2 community firepits
-Treeweave Hammock - Oh man, this is so cool. You're just going to have to trust us here.
-Landscape lighting - the entire property lights up at night to create a very special feel and the ease of getting around.

Dome 7 (Amelia) - Specific Details:

-Named after the iconic Amelia Earhart and the dome's style takes after her affinity for aviation.  You'll notice a spacewoman lounging in floral wallpaper behind the king size bed, and the rest of the dome takes a fun playful vibe that will surely keep all our guests surprised and delighted throughout their stay.
-Amelia's outdoor area includes a tree through the deck with an attached hammock and is our most private dome
-Offers easy access as it is located very close to the designated parking area

General Details:

While we have taken all efforts to provide the highest Glamping experience possible, there are still some elements of camping at Glamp Blue Ridge that we would like you to be aware of:

-HVAC - the domes have an oversized HVAC system and do provide a comfortable interior temperature. But, in extremely cold or hot weather the systems will be unable to offer a crisp 72 degrees due to little insulation in the domes. Expect mid 70s in extremely hot weather and mid 60s in extremely cold weather.
-Nature - the domes are treated monthly for pest control, but it is possible you will see an insect or two in the domes.
-The Falls - Fall Branch Falls is a public waterfall accessible to the public via a hike. You will see hikers around the falls and on the public viewing platform at the bottom of the falls. We have signage designating Glamp Blue Ridge as private property, but it is still possible a hiker may cross the falls to get a closer look at Glamp Blue Ridge. We have met countless visitors over the 2-year process of building Glamp Blue Ridge and have never had an issue politely asking hikers to stay on the US National Forest side of the falls.
-Dome Distances - Each dome is 30-50 feet from each other. We have oriented the domes so that the outside deck space still offers a good bit of privacy from the other domes.

The Area:

-Glamp Blue Ridge borders the Aska adventure area. Offering hiking, mountain biking, fishing, and some of the most picturesque forests in the Blue Ridge area
-20 minutes to downtown Blue Ridge or Ellijay offering high-end dining, breweries, shopping, drive-in movie theater and much more!
-10 minutes from the Toccoa River with tubing, rafting, kayaking, fishing, gem-mining and more!
-25 minutes from Lake Blue Ridge Marina where you can rent a boat and experience one of the prettiest lakes is Southeast.

High-five if you read all this! Nice work

gallery.caption: Exterior of "Clingman's Dome"

hosts.about:
My husband and I LOVE to travel and have new experiences!!!  We love the quiet, quaint places that are off the beaten path and less "touristy". 

We often use Airbnb when we travel and have decided to open up the extra space in our home and other properties for travelers.

recent.comments:
What a great place!  We were looking for a unique place to stay in the mountains for our 30th wedding anniversary and this glamping dome did not dissappoint.  My wife wanted to book a log cabin and so booking this instead was a bit risky!  But it paid off!  We loved sitting on the couch looking out through the huge window watching the creeks flow by and observing wild turkeys walk around outside the done.  Peaceful and beautiful!

We also had a few questions for our host and the response time was truly unbelievable!  We were shocked at how quickly and kindly our host replied to our questions.   We even asked about the bedspread because my wife liked it so much and Heidi sent us a link to the website where she bought it!  Wow!

Overall, for us, this was perfect. 

For future guests, you should know that you are in the great outdoors so the sound of crickets and frogs are prevalent at night.  To us, that is music to our ears as we love camping and the sounds of nature.

Excellent stay! The place was super clean and comfortable.  The amenities were very nice and as advertised. The firepit, grill, and hot tub were assessible and easy to use. The location was convenient to exploring the area (the purpose of my visit) as it is right off the road, there was a little street noise but it isnt bothersome.  The stream and forest view are peaceful. The host was friendly and available!!
We had a wonderful stay! The dome was very clean and private. The river added an extra peaceful and tranquil environment. We will definitely be back!

The dome was an amazing experience! If you’re looking for a unique experience, look no further. It’s easy to find, Heidi is great at making it an easy process and the forest and creek views are stunning. My girlfriend was a bit scared and hesitant at the beginning, but by the end she felt safe and comfortable. There is a spa on the deck, a fire pit on the creek side and a plethora of amenities once you enter the dome. Cooking utensils, glass containers to store food, trash bags, cleaning supplies, shampoo/conditioner, Keurig, microwave, Ninja foodie, and much more. Overall a wonderful clean and very cute decorated little mountain forest oasis retreat.

I celebrated my 10 yr Anniversary here and the place did not disappoint. The place was just like the pictures if not better in person. The dome offered everything we needed plus more and I would definitely recommend to my friends and family. We ran into a little hiccup with the hot water but Heidi was so kind and was very responsive when I reached out. The issue was resolved quickly. I would still rate this place a 10/10 and I am so glad we celebrated our 10th Anniversary in such a magical setting. We will definitely come back!

We stayed here for 1 night and it was perfect!  Easy to get to, about 20 minutes from all the fun, and secluded enough to give you privacy.  The dome stayed very cool which was one of our concerns with the hot weather.  There is a creek that runs behind the property that was tranquil.  We would stay at this location again for our visits to the area.

Indulge in the Ultimate GLAMPING experience, where modern luxury meets outdoor allure! Nestled in the woods along a river in a park-like setting, this unique Geodesic Dome offers an experience to never be forgotten!

Enjoy all the comforts of modern conveniences with the feel of mountain camping!  Book today for an unforgettable Smoky Mountain Glamping Experience!

✦✦Nearby Adventures & Attractions✦✦
▪︎  5 min to Greenbriar entrance into The Great Smoky Mountain National Park
▪︎ 10 miles to Gatlinburg
▪︎ 10 min to Arts & Craft District
▪︎  5 min to Rocky Top Sports World 
▪︎  5 min to CLIMB Works Smoky Mountains Zip Lines

✦✦Important Dome Information✦✦
▪︎  Please note, while our glamping domes offer many luxurious amenities for camping, the domes are affected by outdoor temperatures and weather conditions.  Kindly prepare accordingly.  Check the local weather prior to arriving. 
▪︎  During your stay, it is essential to take proper precautions with trash and food cleaning to avoid attracting unwanted wildlife such as black bears, raccoons, and other common wildlife in the area. 
▪︎  We are conveniently located right off of HWY 321.  Some background road noise can be heard from the domes.

✦Guests are provided "starter" toilet paper, paper towels, trash bags, dish soap, & body soap.  For longer stays, guests may have to replenish these items.
description.access:
There are two Domes located on this 1.5-acre property. You will be staying in the "Clingmans Dome" (Dome #1). Follow the pathway from the parking lot and take the trail/walkway to the right at the split.
Guests will have access to the portion of the property assigned for their Dome.
Guests do not have access to the utility shed located near the parking lot.
description.notes:
LOCATION:
There are 2 domes located on a 1.5-acre property conveniently located just off HWY 321.   Follow the trail/pathway at the parking lot leading to your Dome.     The property also sits along Webb Creek where soft, rustling creek sounds can be viewed and heard.  

**Please Note** You are visiting The Great Smoky Mountains area.  By booking, guests realize and acknowledge they understand the area contains wildlife that may be encountered such as black bears, raccoons, squirrels, bugs, and additional wildlife common to the area that is outside of the host's control.

BEAR and WILDLIFE SAFETY:
Bear activity is very common in The Great Smoky Mountain/Gatlinburg area.   Children should be supervised at all times.  Do not approach wildlife, be respectful and give animals plenty of space. Patiently wait for the wildlife to move out of the way.  
Please follow all bear safety rules exactly to ensure your safety.
description.neighborhood: Clingman's Dome is conveniently located right off HWY 321 in a park-; like setting with a view of Webb Creek.
description.transit: A vehicle is needed to get around the area.
description.interaction: Hosts will be available by Airbnb messaging or by phone text/calls.
description.house_rules:
✦VERY IMPORTANT!!! It is essential to take proper food precautions during your stay! All food must be kept in the refrigerator in closed containers or locked in vehicles at all times. Food must be cleaned up and dishes are done after each use to avoid attracting bears.  Take trash to the caged trash receptacle after each use and latch it properly.

✦Guests agree to the following checkout instructions. These instructions are for safety in order to not attract bears or other unwanted wildlife.  Cleaning fees are based on these check-out instructions being done.  
•Clean all dishes used during your stay. 
•Wipe the countertop and sink free of any food particles. 
•ALL food and trash must be put in the outdoor caged trash can and latched properly. This included unwanted items from the fridge.

✦Guests agree to be respectful of the Dome, its neighbors, and the owner's rules. Noisy, unruly guests will be asked to leave without a refund. 

✦Guests agree to be responsible for any damages that occur to the Dome or its contents during their stay.

✦Guests must follow all hot tub rules posted at the cabin. Minors must be supervised at all times while using the hot tub!

✦For SAFETY......children must be supervised at all times. 

✦Dome holds a max of  4 guests, if more than 4 guests are found to be staying at the cabin without prior approval, an additional $25 charge per person per day will be charged to the guest booking.

title: Williamsburg, Michigan

recent.comments: Amazing location and super clean. We will be back!

items.comments: Amazing location and super clean. We will be back!
This was such a cute and convenient location. Easy check in and very clean. Had all the amenities you could ever need. I can’t wait to come back again!
Great place! Have three kids age 6,4, and 2 and they loved it as well.  Very cool would definitely stay again!

We stayed at Rob's Geodome on a whim to surprise our 16yr old daughters with a girls trip.  The whole stay exceeded our expectations!!  We had an amazing time and the geodome was definately worth the money spent.   All 6 of us were in awe and it just made the trip that much more special.  It is about 15-20 mins from Traverse City which made it perfect.  A definite must at least once in your life!!

My family just got home from our stay in dome #8. My husband and I vacationed with our 4 kids (9, 7, 3 and 3 months) and we had the best time. The dome was so spacious even with 6 of us in there. I’m always looking for unique stays and this is by far my favorite! The location is great. You’re close enough to Traverse City, but yet far enough away to have a peaceful, private experience. My boys loved exploring the property thanks to Rob’s son. We can’t wait to come back next year!!

Beautiful stay. Highly recommend. 
Unique and comfortable. 
So easy to find! 
Very clean ! Will be back definitely!

Book this spot, now. Absolutely perfect. This place is a gem and my girlfriend and I couldn’t pass up on it and boy did it not disappoints. Fresh mountain air, beautiful custom furniture, clean and peaceful. Rob is a dedicated, caring host who has put passion into this location and you can tell. From the little things like kitchen accessories and utilities, condiments etc. as well as bathroom needs like shampoo, razors, and much more.

I can’t begin to explain how much we loved this place and will be back. Incredible, one of the nicest I’ve ever been in.

description.summary: Enjoy an intimate experience with nature and all the amenities of a luxury resort yet only minutes away from Traverse City's finest restaurants, beaches, wineries, shopping, and golf.  Only 3 miles from the Great Lakes Equestrian Show and 1.5 miles from Turtle Creek Casino. 780 sq. ft. of living space with majestic views.  The dome is spacious and 13' tall. Enjoy a private bathroom complete with a bathtub/shower, vanity, & toilet, kitchen with a refrigerator, microwave, & hot plate. AC & Heat.
description.space:
Geodesic Dome-Home #8 is handicap compliant and sleeps six.  It features a massive, handcrafted king-size barnwood bed that is positioned to provide incredible views of the surrounding pristine forest.  A dividing wall separates the bedroom spaces. On the backside of the wall are two handcrafted timber frame twin-over-twin bunk beds sturdy enough to support adults.  There is a private, indoor bathroom and kitchen. 

Outside you will find a private firepit, barbeque, and hammock.  We provide one complimentary bundle of firewood for each day booked.  

With 75 acres of private land surrounded by state land on three sides, you will have access to miles of trails for hiking and birding.  Pine, cedar, spruce, and cherry trees provide a natural privacy barrier from neighboring accommodations.  Neighboring accommodations range from 80' to 300' away.  Please be careful driving in or out in the evening as there is an abundance of deer and other wildlife in the area.  We seek to provide you with a unique, intimate interaction with nature, yet you are only a few miles away from the best of Traverse City.
description.neighborhood:
Near By Destinations

The Silver Birch Resort is located just a few miles from dozens of attractions.

Horse Show – Traverse City Horse Shows is 3 miles away.  Shows run from June until September.  Check their website for show days and hours

Beaches & Swimming – some of Traverse City’s finest beaches are only 5 miles away on East Bay (due west until you dead end into US31, turn left and immediately turn right.

Wine Tasting – Traverse City’s reputation for producing world-class wines is quickly growing as many of the wineries have been winning awards. Most of these wineries call Old Mission Peninsula home. Even if wine is not your on To Do list, the drive through the rolling hills of the peninsula will provide breathtaking views of East and West Bays. The mouth of the peninsula is approximately 10 miles from Silver Birch Resort. After sampling the wonderful wines, you might as well drive to the northernmost point of the peninsula and visit Mission Point Lighthouse.

Breweries – Traverse City and the surrounding areas have a plethora of micro-breweries featuring locally grown hops. Some of our favorites include Shorts Brewery and Stone Hound Brewing Company. Please note: the owners believe in constantly checking the quality of all our local beers. We have never had a bad beer in any of the dozen downtown breweries.

Shorts Brewery – 211 Industrial Park Drive, Elk Rapids, MI 49629
Stone Hound Brewery – 3593 Bunker Hill Rd, Williamsburg, MI 49690

Shopping – downtown Traverse City with street after street of unique gift shops, clothing boutiques, restaurants, and bistros is only 11 miles away.

Elk Rapids – charming Elk Rapids is only 20 miles away. Would you like to see a real-life “Norman Rockwell” town? It doesn’t get any better than this. The beaches are some of the finest in northern Michigan, but sharing this secret will get us in trouble with many of the locals who refuse to tell visitors about Elk Rapids for not wanting to see it lose its “yesterday” charm. Please don’t tell anyone where you got this information. Elk Rapids also has an authentic single-screen movie theatre that was built in the early nineteenth century. You will feel like you are stepping back to a bygone era. The popcorn, root beer & cherry soda is some of the best you’ve ever had. If a movie is desired, be sure to bring cash as twenty-first-century plastic is not accepted. All employees are committed to keeping the old-fashioned movie experience authentic.

Restaurants

Both Traverse City and Elk Rapids are considered “foodie” towns. Restaurants in our area that serve mediocre food do not last long. Just about every restaurant in this area has good quality food. Some of the owners’ favorites are:

Hopscotch Brick Oven & Taproom
2032 US-31, Traverse City, MI 49686

Red Ginger is located in downtown Traverse City. If you like calamari, you must try the appetizer.
237 E Front St, Traverse City, MI 49684

Red Mesa on US31 offers Mexican/Spanish dishes.
1544 US-31 N, Traverse City, MI 49686

Pearls in Elk Rapids specializes in Louisiana Cajun cooking.
617 Ames St, Elk Rapids, MI 49629

McGee’s in Acme. The closest restaurant and only four miles away.
4341 M-72, Williamsburg, MI 49690

Jolly Pumpkin on Old Mission Peninsula.
13512 Peninsula Dr, Traverse City, MI 49686

Don's Drive Inn. 50's diner theme with great burgers and killer milkshakes.
2030 US 31 N., Traverse City, MI 49686

Pizza Options
East Bay Pizza – In our opinion, the best pizza (partly because the owner’s brother operates it) is East Bay Pizza. Their pizza is outstanding and dining in will also give you one of the best views of the Bay. They also serve 30 flavors of Moomer’s Ice Cream. Moomers won the title of Best Ice Cream in America in a contest sponsored by Good Morning American. A perfect summer night in northern Michigan is defined by a good pizza, ice cream, and breathtaking sunsets on the Bay. East Bay Pizza has all three.
4386 US-31, Traverse City, MI 49686

That’s A Pizza – want to eat in? That’s A Pizza will deliver right to your site. This was the owner’s favorite pizza place until his brother opened. They have excellent pizza and a great staff.
5430 US-31, Williamsburg, MI 49690

Sleeping Bear Sand Dunes – named by Good Morning American as “The Most Beautiful Place in America”. People come from all over the world (no joke, Sleeping Bear sees tens of thousands of visitors from Europe and Japan who travel specifically to see the sand dunes. Expending a little energy and climbing the dunes affords you unbelievable views of Lake Michigan and surrounding lakes. You will quickly realize why Good Morning American bestowed this title. The Sleeping Bear Sand Dunes are approximately 36 miles away.

Charlevoix, Michigan – another wonderful, charming town with great restaurants, shopping, and breathtaking views.

Golfing – we are located near three of Michigan’s finest golf courses: The Bear, The Wolverine, and LochenHeath. Check out their websites for all the awards and reviews. These golf courses are only 4 miles away.

The Bear, The Wolverine, and LochenHeath

Turtle Creek Casino –   If you enjoy the excitement of gambling and the nightlife, you will only be 1.5 miles away from the beautiful Turtle Creek Casino.  In addition to your favorite games, there is a fine restaurant and club with music and dancing.
description.house_rules:
PET POLICY

We are dog lovers.  We have two of our own.  We did realize at the end of last year that we must put a pet policy in place. A guest last year left their dog all day in the dome, and it barked the entire time they were gone disrupting the experience of other guests.  This was a dog with a deep, loud bark.  The dog barked for eight hours straight which was impressive as you would think it would lose its voice after a few hours.  Everyone’s nerves were fried by the time the people returned. 

We recently had a guest that asked if they could bring their dog. Even after reading this policy, they let their dog bark for almost an hour. It was not continuous, but it was 5 to 10 seconds of stressed-out, loud barking, and then silence. Every 5-10 minutes there was a barking outburst. I think they tied it up outside, and it wanted to come in the side. The dog was trying to get their attention.  I really did not want to have to walk down there and have a talk with them as we are trying for everyone to have a nice experience. I was very close to walking to their site, and then it stopped for the evening. The problem is the other five domes in the area. This had to disrupt their barbecues, campfires, and evening.
 
Everyone knows their dogs.  Our two dogs would not bark if we left them somewhere unless they were startled.  This is understandable and acceptable.  If you have a dog that will bark from separation anxiety, we ask that he/she not be left alone (or outside alone while the family is indoors).  If you feel, the dog would only bark if startled, then we are fine with a dog.  If you are going to leave for a few hours, we ask that it be kenneled and left in the kitchen/bath structure – NOT left in the dome.  The kitchen/bath structure has more insulation, and the occasional bark will not travel through the entire property. 

The other requirement we have for pets is that they are not allowed on the beds. We have already had to replace two comforters this year because we were not able to get the dog hair out. Please try and bring a dog bed.  If you cannot, we leave an extra sheet in the dresser drawer. This is specifically for your dog. You can lay this on the floor in an area and your pet is welcome to sleep on this. Dog hair on the comforter is subject to a $100 replacement fee.
 
If you agree to these pet policies, you are welcome to bring your dog.  

We are located on 75 acres and surrounded by thousands of acres of state forestry with trails. You can walk for miles and miles.  This is the perfect property to take your dog for a nice long walk.  If he or she will run after a deer, fox, raccoon, or porcupine, then we strongly suggest a lease as you are sure to see wildlife.

recent.comments:
Our stay at the G1 Geodesic Dome was remarkable. So serene and calm. It is a hike down to the waterfront so we decided to drive and park at a friends site closer to the beach during the day.

Note the shower is cold water but we’re told it is being transitioned to warm water in the near future. Though we didn’t mind since it was so hot out. There both AC and a heater in the dome along with all the things you need to glamp in luxury! 

Special shout out to Juan! He was super helpful and really friendly. He even dropped off some fire wood for us! 
 
So grateful for dog friendly accommodations like this one, our pup welcomed at the dome and the camp grounds / beach. 

Highly recommend this stay for anyone looking for a comfortable retreat into nature.

We spent 2 nights an this Dome and enjoyed every minute.
The setting is beautiful and the view into the woods very relaxing.
We didn‘t miss anything, except maybe warm water in the shower ;-).

Arthur and his team are extremely friendly and helpful.
We were brought to our site and when we were missing something it was delivered to us very quickly in person.

We could use kajaks and kanoes free of charge.
The beach and lake is very nice and ideal for smaller children.

We enjoyed every minute of our stay.
Thank you very much.
Amazing manager always nice and ready to help!The place is unique I will never forget those trees and birds singing 🙏🏼 and the face of my kids once they saw were we were staying 😊

We had an amazing stay at the Hillside Dome. The nearby beach was a huge plus because our dog loves playing in the water. The atmosphere was very relaxing and being inside the dome is very comfortable. There are a lot of mosquitos outside so make sure to bring bug repellent. Also, unfortunately the shower only had cold water but I was told hot water should be installed relatively soon. Overall, it was a nice, relaxing stay!

If you think the pictures are nice just wait until you experience it in person. The dome was absolutely amazing, it couldn’t have been better. Arthur was an amazing host, he met us at the store to check in and then guided us straight to the dome. He was very quick to respond when we had questions and made sure we had the most comfortable stay possible. 10/10 all around.
This is our first time glamping.  The dome just like in the photos, inside is clean.  Bed was surprisingly comfortable.

description.summary: Escape the city and immerse yourself in nature at our Hillside dome. Wake up to the soothing sounds of birds and a gentle breeze rustling through the trees. Our glamping experience offers modern amenities and a home away from home feel. Nestled in a lush forest by the Ottawa River, You can stay on a private site within our campground and a 5-minute walk from the beach.
description.space:
The Hillside Dome is located in a private campground.

Welcome to your very own slice of paradise at the Hillside Dome! Surrounded by the dense greenery along the banks of the Ottawa River, this 6-meter dome boasts a simple and elegant interior that will transport you to a world of comfort and relaxation.

Step inside and be greeted by a stunning forest view through a giant window, and watch as the stars twinkle above through the skylight at night. This dome offers a unique blend of glamping and modern living.

Located in the park campground, you'll have access to the best beach (with a volleyball court) on the Ottawa River, hiking trails, a boat dock and a gift shop, while the Hillside Dome sits peacefully away from the trails and other campers. It's the perfect secluded spot to unwind and recharge.

Inside, you'll find everything you need for a comfortable stay. Take a seat on the two lounging chairs or sofa-bed futon, and relax while enjoying a cup of coffee on the coffee table. The comfy queen-sized bed will ensure a peaceful night's sleep, while the mini fridge keeps your drinks and snacks cool and refreshing as you soak up the sun.

Step outside onto the deck and take in the fresh air while lounging in one of the Muskoka chairs around the fire pit. The BBQ grill allows you to cook a delicious outdoor feast, while the outdoor private shower and sink add to the camping experience. And don't worry, there's also a private flushable toilet for those nature calls just a few steps away from the dome.

The Hillside Dome is waiting to welcome you to an unforgettable glamping experience. Take your time to explore our cozy and tranquil dome, immerse yourself in the surrounding beauty of nature, and create memories that will last a lifetime.
description.notes:
> Necessities not included: towels, sheets, blankets, and pillows.
> $200 deposit is required at check-in.
> After two guests, We charge an extra $10 for each guest per night.
> $20 pet fee required (if applicable).
> We also have kayaks and canoes available for use at no cost (We provide life jackets for adults and kids).
> From the car to the dome is 2 minute's walk. 
> There is no washroom inside the dome. A private outdoor shower, a sink and a flushable toilet are outside the dome.
> Included: Plates, Cups, Cutlery, Barbecue Grill Tools, Cutting Board, and Dish Towel.
> There are communal showers in the park accessible to everyone.
> Check-in time is 3 pm - 9 pm. Please let us know if you want to check in after 9 pm.
> Checkout time is 11 am.
> Limited phone network coverage in the park.
> WiFi is not available in the dome.
> Take this opportunity to disconnect from technology and enjoy nature's beauty.
description.neighborhood: Tiny Village Ottawa River is a campsite with other neighbours around. It is located on our 60-acre campground, nestled on the shore of the breathtaking Ottawa River, surrounded by vast wilderness, and only 5 minutes northwest of the tight-knit community of Deep River. Stop by Deep River for a night in the town filled with delicious restaurants and/or familiar fast-food franchises, or stock up on your favourite snacks at a local grocery and/or convenience store.  Deep River town has a few restaurants, Valu-Mart, Pharmacy, LCBO, Tim Hortons, an Alpaca farm, Kombucha Brewery... and much more!!
description.house_rules:
> All Garbage, recycling & food waste/compost must be packed up and taken to the on-site garbage bin-recycling bins and compost to be taken with you upon your departure. 
> Keep all food items in an airtight container, Open Food and Compost must be secure in your car each night because of wildlife. 
> Keep the space clean and remove your shoes when you are inside
> No loud music after 11pm
> No open alcohol in any public areas (beach, roadways, bathrooms etc.)
> Leave the dome and items as you found it.

title: Campton, Kentucky

gallery.caption: Dome Town Nest Dynamic Play and Lounge Net

description.summary: Use this listing to reserve all 3 Dome Town Treehouses (Cloud, Puma and Turtle) at once.
description.space:
Use this link to book all three domes at the same time for a private dome-experience up in the trees!  

By reserving all three domes (Cloud, Puma and Turtle), your group will have exclusive access to the bridges, lounging nets, canopy and Water Dome (where there are two full baths and a kitchen clean up area).  

Dome town is a series of geodesic domes suspended in the trees. The domes are connected by suspension bridges that weave through the canopy. In total there are three sleeping domes, a giant canopy lounge net, and one communal water dome, where there are two full baths, and one wash station. Sleeping in a dome will change the way you think about square building forever!  There is no other treehouse dome experience quite like this. Explore the canopy, enjoy the gorge, sleep in a dome!
description.transit:
The domes are located up a single lane gravel county road. 
 The water dome and other domes are connected by suspension bridges, walkways and stairs.  The outdoor lighting will be on until midnight and then we switch it off to allow the dark night forest sky to be just that--dark!  We recommend packing a flashlight or headlamp to aid in moving around after the lights are off.
description.house_rules:
-Please be respectful of other Dome Town guests and keep in mind the 10 pm to 7 am quiet hours.  
-Smoking is NOT allowed in our main parking lot, near our office buildings or inside of your treehouse. You may smoke outside near your treehouse, but we ask that you to be mindful of affecting others nearby.
-Leave the treehouse in a similar condition to how you found it.  
-Our 3% Management Fee is for our local Wolfe County Tourism Tax and this money is used locally to help encourage sustainable growth and eco-tourism in our area.  
Thank you!

name: Glen Oro Eco-Retreat Glamping Galaxygazer Dome
title: Hawkestone, Canada

hosts.about:
I'm a well travelled outdoor enthusiast, from Heli-skiing lodges in British Columbia to Luxury Yachts in the Mediterranean I've hosted and been hosted enough that I try and create a warm and welcome space wherever I am and with whoever is joining me.  
I feel that travel and meeting new people is essential in our own development as well rounded humans and I think it makes us have a larger social consciousness and actually care about peoples and countries around the world rather than just ourselves.  
As a host I like to provide a private experience for guests, where they can feel at home in their new surrounding - but also be reachable if they'd like to chat about the area, go for a tour, or find out about local activities.

Luke is really helpful, and this place is amazing. Would definitely recommend and come back again :)

Would definitely be visiting again, we loved it!
Amazing place to stay! This was our second time and will definitely come back.

We had a great time, and definitely recommend the galaxygazer dome! It was very peaceful, lots of nature to explore, extremely responsive and friendly staff. Love the 24/7 ability to text staff with questions or when we wanted a ride to another location (they have gators and drive you to where you want to visit on the property, ie. horses, donkey, ducks, garden, parking lot, etc.).
We had a great stay and enjoyed a calm weekend stays in the Dome. Weather was nice and we were able to see plenty of stars at night.
The place is awesome.  So comfortable and clean!  Viewing the stars while lying in bed was fantastic!

description.summary:
The ultimate glamping experience, staying in a large geodesic dome on a 200 acre horse farm.  

This unit has 2 king sized beds, one in the loft - accessed by stairs from the entryway, the other is a king Murphy bed which pulls out of the wall in the spacious living room - this dome can sleep 4 guests, or if it’s just 2 people they don’t need have another bed in their way!

Full  kitchen designed with retro-chic appliances, separate dining room, and a full bathroom with a handmade cedar shower!
description.neighborhood: This is a quiet countryside community in a little valley of Oro-Medonte, where we value the peace and solitude of nature and want to share that with others. Glen Oro is 200 acres and backs onto "Oro Mountain" and a Simcoe County forest with even more public hiking trails which we encourage guests to use.
description.transit: It is dark out here at night, but at least it lets you see the stars!  There is no public transportation nearby so you will need to drive a vehicle to come and go from Glen Oro.  All speeds on property must be 20km/h or below and give way to horses.  Be aware that parking is outside of the forest, and we shuttle you via 4x4 "Gator" into your Glamping Accommodation so that we can preserve the trails and natural environment of the Eco-Retreat, from there it's two feet and a heartbeat!.  Sometimes the paths are muddy or snowy and they are definitely dirty so dress for the outdoors!

hosts.about:
Hello! I'm Megan, the creator and caretaker of Rooted Domes!

At Rooted Domes, my mission is to provide a truly unique and enchanting glamping adventure and I am committed to addressing every detail, from the design of the domes to the amenities offered, in order to bring comfort, curiosity, and fascination to your stay. 

I want to create an unforgettable experience that helps guests detach from the everyday and immerse themselves in the beauty and magic of the forest. 

I believe that everyone deserves a chance to unwind, unplug, and reconnect with the natural world and want to provide the perfect home base for your adventure, whether you want to hike, explore nearby attractions, or simply relax and unwind.

Rooted Domes is more than just a glamping experience. We celebrate nature lovers, adventurers, and dreamers. And I can't wait to share myr passion for the great outdoors with you!

recent.comments: Megan set up such a thoughtful and relaxing experience. She put care into every detail, from a loaded Polaroid camera for us to use to a hummingbird feeder installed perfectly in sight from the outdoor tub. The woods and creek were peaceful and magical. We loved everything.

items.comments: Megan set up such a thoughtful and relaxing experience. She put care into every detail, from a loaded Polaroid camera for us to use to a hummingbird feeder installed perfectly in sight from the outdoor tub. The woods and creek were peaceful and magical. We loved everything.

The place was incredible better than described quite peaceful clean had a amazing vibe too it Megan was more than helpful and responsive to messages 100% would recommend to anyone trying to do a romantic getaway

This is a wonderful place to getaway and unwind. Everything about the stay was perfect, and the host really goes above and beyond with to make your stay special. We will definitely be coming back here!

Megan did a wonderful job with Rooted Domes. I visited by myself for a night just to get away and relax. It just what I needed. So many thoughtful touches with a fully stocked kitchen. By far my favorite Airbnb I’ve stayed at and would love to return!
Had a great time awesome place

We stayed in Megan’s Cocoon Dome and it was wonderful! It was the ultimate glamping experience and it was  beautifully decorated, clean and had so many more amenities than any other Airbnb I’ve ever stayed in. It was private and serene and was so nice to disconnect for the day/evening. The soaking tub outside was my favorite. Megan was very responsive and so easy to communicate with. She even got us in a few hours early so we didn’t have to haul our stuff up to the dome in the pending rain. We’re already talking about our next trip and cannot wait to stay again!

Everything was great and exactly as described but there was no Wi-Fi. Only slightly challenging if you don’t know the area and plan to use service to find your way around, especially since the listing mentions Wi-Fi being available. Other than that, it’s a pretty place, the domes are lovely & the attention to detail is quite impressive. Keep in mind because it’s so remote you have to drive a ways out to pick up cell service. Still a nice getaway nonetheless.

description.summary:
Rooted Domes is a glamping site tucked  in the forest of Southern Ohio. 

When you get the urge to escape the everyday, this is the perfect place to reenergize your senses! 

Here you will find peace in nature's embrace and all spaces are intentionally designed to infuse your stay with excitement and curiosity. 

Let Rooted Domes be your gateway to adventure and relaxation!

Please read through the detailed description to see what amenities and extras are included! That way you can pack light!
description.space:
We host two unique Domes, so check out our other listing and follow us on the 'gram for special deals!

Each Dome is equipped for a maximum of 2 guests and we are "Adult Only." However, any group of four (including kids) are welcome to book both domes and have the entire site to themselves. 

The Cocoon 

Quick Overview
- Located on 18 secluded acres
- Access to the Zaleski State Forest Hiking Trails
- Fully equipped kitchenette
- Fully furnished deck with fire pit and soaking tub
- Modern private bathhouse 
- short drive to Lake Hope State Park 
- under 30 Min drive to Hocking Hills State Park or Athens, Ohio

Detail:

The Cocoon is a 30O sq ft dome  with 14’ ceilings. Inside you will find a loft with a queen size bed (which requires a short climb up a secured ladder) where you can lie under the skylight window and watch the treetops sway during the day and the stars twinkle at night. Tucked under the loft is a fully equipped and stocked kitchenette. The Cocoon also has a small living area facing the bay window which overlooks a winding creek and low lands. 

Outside of your Dome is a spacious deck with a seating area, smokeless fire pit, a propane BBQ grill and a freestanding soaking tub. The property is on 18 acres with a creek and forest that guests are encouraged to explore! (My small home is also located on the property, approx 700’ from the domes)

Your private bathroom is located a short walk away in the bath house. You will have a key and can leave items inside during your stay. Inside is a walk-in shower with rainfall showerhead and views of the forest. Linens and local toiletries are provided.

WIFI:
We do have Wi-Fi on site (though no cell service) but we strongly encourage guests to disconnect during their stay at Rooted Domes.  Here you will find  a unique opportunity to disconnect from the hustle and bustle of everyday life and just BE.  Immerse yourself in the natural beauty of the surrounding forest and indulge your senses with an array of engaging activities to enhance your stay, including games, puzzles, coloring books, musical instruments, yoga mats, and much more! There's no shortage of ways to relax, unwind, and connect with your surroundings at Rooted Domes.


Other Guests:
There is a second Dome on the property and the domes are orientated for the most privacy. The domes/guests share the parking area, the pathway to the site and access to the creek and forest. Please observe a quiet time (low music) between 9pm and 8am so everyone can enjoy the sounds of the forest!

Amenities: 
Here is an extensive list of what is provided for you during your stay!

Kitchenette:
	- fridge with freezer space
	- 12” electric skillet, 2 burner hotplate, toaster oven
	- traditional coffee pot/pour over coffee pot/electric kettle
	- local coffee, tea and honey; as well as creamer, cooking oils, sugar, spices 
               (and everything nice!)
        -6 farm fresh eggs
        - Basic condiments (ketchup, mustard, mayo, soy sauce, minced garlic, hot sauce)
        - a large selection of cooking utensils/equipment
        - full set of kitchen knives
        - dishes, glassware and cutlery for 4 
	- dish soap, dish towels, dish scrubbies, reusable paper towels

Bedroom: 
        - Queen  bed 
	- extra blankets (for maximum coziness!)
	- USB outlets for charging needs

Living Space:
        -cozy furniture and coffee table for board games/puzzles
        -a variety of amenities to inspire and delight you, such as yoga mats, 
                 board games, puzzles, and books
        - record player with bluetooth speaker option
	- universal charger 

Outdoor Space:
	- outdoor furniture
        - firepit with one night's wood provided, lighter and quick start kindling.
(more fire wood can be purchased for $10/night)
        - Propane BBQ grill and utensils
	- Soaking tubs with bubble bath, serene views and privacy screen
	- hammock with straps for use in forest

Bathroom: 
	- stand in shower with views of the forest, vanity, flush toilet
        - stocked with toilet paper, local soap, shampoo, conditioner and lotion	
        - all linens provided
	- hairdryer, first aid kit
        -selection of medicines, extra toiletries in case you forget anything
description.access:
PARKING: 
A small gravel parking area is available for up to 4 vehicles. Please note the driveway is steep. An All wheel drive is recommended but not required.

PATHWAY:
Our domes are a short 500-foot walk from the parking area which includes a steep set of stairs. Rest easy, we've got your luggage covered! While we provide everything you need for a fantastic stay, we also provide luggage carts to assist with your belongings. However, please pack lightly as the carts cannot traverse the stairs leading to your dome. Leave your cart at the bottom for your return trip!

THE PROPERTY: 
Feel free to explore the property and beyond as much as you would like. There is one marked trail that will get you to Zaleski state forest hiking trails but I recommend saving your location on your GPS to ensure no hiccups. Trails leading to my personal residence will be closed from 7pm until 9 am. Otherwise, feel free to come say Hi!
description.notes:
DRIVING: 
Please save directions offline as there is no cell service in the area. 

CELL PHONE SERVICE:
Only T-Mobile users will receive any signal on the property. 

FIRES: 
you have your own smokeless fire pit on the deck for small contained fires. 

FIREWOOD:
One night’s firewood is included during your stay. Additional bundles an be purchased for $10 with cash or message me for digital payments.

ACCESSIBILITY:
The domes are located a short walk from the parking area (approx. 500 ft) and require going up a set of stairs. Please bring appropriate shoes for the weather. 

STEPS:
Access to the deck/dome requires a short staircase.
The bathroom also requires a short staircase to enter.

BOOKING THE ENTIRE SITE: The entire site will accommodate 4 people. If interested in booking the domes together, please send me a message through Airbnb for select group rates and availability.

SEVERE WEATHER: In the event of severe weather it is important for guests to know that the dome frame is extremely strong and  is rated for hurricane force winds. The dome frame is designed of inter-connected steel triangles that give it unparalleled strength should anything fall on the dome and the frame is bolted to the foundation making it secure. As with any building located in the forest, there is a slight risk of tree damage. However, before the domes were built the site was examined by a professional and any concerning trees were felled!
description.neighborhood:
Two Mile Rd is a quiet country road that follows the northern side of Zaleski State Forest. Your “neighborhood” consists of one other Dome, a seasonal creek that is fun to explore, and a 15 min marked trail that will lead you to Zaleski State Forest hiking trails.  My personal home is also on the property about 700’ from the Domes.

You can find many outdoor activities within a 15 to 30 minute drive from Rooted Domes, including hiking trails, kayaking, zip lining, mountain bike trails and more!
description.transit:
A vehicle is needed to explore this area! 

Around...

Lake Hope State Park (15 min drive) Located inside Zaleski State Forest, Lake Hope offers hiking trails, kayaking, fishing and boating opportunities plus a very pleasant beach and swimming area. It is also home to the Lake Hope Dining Lodge which offers a true home cooked BBQ based menu, fantastic Brunch Buffet on Sundays, beer and wine and a fantastic view of Lake Hope.

Zaleski State Forest (15-30 min drive) Zaleski Forest is the largest State forest in Ohio! You will find many hiking, horseback riding and mountain biking trails here! Home of the Haunted Moonville Tunnel!

Hocking Hills (30 min drive) Hocking Hills has some awesome trails and caves to explore. There is also the Inn at Cedar Falls which hosts a great restaurant, gift shop and massage opportunities.

Athens (30 min drive) Athens is a small, walk-able college town with many diverse shops and restaurants with a strong focus on supporting local farms and craftsmen. Athens hosts a great bike trail, a city swimming pool, a good selection of craft breweries, and a lively bar and music scene! 

Logan (25 min drive) Logan is the best starting point for kayaking and ziplining along the Hocking River. It also boasts a great pizza place (Pizza Crossing) and delicious frozen yogurt at Hocking Hills Frozen Yogurt Company! Perfect after a day of kayaking!
description.interaction: Although I am often on site cleaning, I value your privacy! I live on the property and am easily reachable via AirBnB messages.

name: Dôme La Hutte au bord de l'eau
title: Brownsburg, Canada

hosts.about: La satisfaction de notre clientèle est primordiale pour nous. C'est la clé de notre succès !

recent.comments: It was just perfect!

items.comments: It was just perfect!

L’expérience du dôme était agréable; nous avons apprécié avoir notre propre terrasse avec BBQ, foyer et hamacs. Nous avons relaxé sur le quai au milieu du lac mais je ne recommanderais pas le lieu pour l’expérience du lac puisqu’il était petit donc limité pour la pêche et le paddle board. Sinon très tranquille et relaxant! Nous avons eu des réponses rapides à nos questions et le dôme (omis la toilette chimique) était très propre.
Quel bonheur! On aurait voulu rester bien plus longtemps! De la tranquillité, de l intimité, la nature tout autour, vraiment la retraite que nous cherchions!
Merci beaucoup
Magnifique endroit ! Je recommande 🥰
Catherine’s done house was a delightful way to spend the night on our way between Michigan and Maine. The view out of the window as you lay in bed is spectacular! I hope to stop again someday.
We had a nice stay at the “Hutte”. As described and peaceful.

description.summary:
Dôme LA HUTTE
Situé directement au bord d'un lac sauvage, ce dôme vous offre une vue imprenable sur un véritable sanctuaire faunique. Vous pourrez y observer plusieurs espèces animales dans leur milieu naturel dont les castors, loutres, tortues, grenouilles et Quiscales.

Vivez une expérience exceptionnelle en tout confort au coeur de la nature. Réveillez-vous avec le chant des oiseaux, le vent qui souffle, le silence. L'endroit idéal pour se ressourcer et sortir de son quotidien.
description.space:
Chauffé exclusivement au poêle à bois et éclairé à l’énergie solaire, ce dôme est conçu pour vous accueillir 12 mois par année. D'un diamètre de 20', il permet à 4 personnes d’y séjourner confortablement.  

En plus du point de vue imprenable sur l’eau qu’offre la grande fenestration du dôme, vous trouverez plusieurs commodités vous permettant de vivre une expérience inoubliable :

- Cuisinette équipée d’un poêle au gaz 2 ronds, mini frigo, BBQ, vaisselle, chaudrons, cafetière à infusion, eau potable

- 1 lit queen devant la grande fenestration, 2 lits simples superposés. La literie est founie.

- Espace foyer intérieur et extérieur. Emmenez votre bois pour les feux extérieurs.

- Grande terrasse, table extérieure, hamacs.

- Toilette écologique extérieure privée à moins de 15 pieds du dôme. Petite toilette portative disponible à l’intérieur du dôme sur demande (10$+taxes). 

De spacieuses douches et toilettes classiques sont situées à notre bâtiment d'accueil à 5 minutes de marche. 

Situé sur un domaine de 25 âcres comportant 5 hébergements et un bâtiment sanitaire, vous pourrez vous baigner dans l’eau limpide du lac Martinez (2 minutes à pied), vous laisser flotter sur une planche à pagaie au rythme des vagues ou encore explorer le lac aux tortues en kayak. Les embarcations sont partagées et offertes gracieusement à notre clientèle.

Afin de préserver la tranquillité des lieux, le dôme est accessible à pied seulement. Il est situé à 6-7 minutes de notre bâtiment principal où vous pourrez emprunter des chariots à bagages au besoin. 
Pour un léger supplément (15$+taxes), nous offrons aussi un service de navette pour le transport de vos bagages jusqu'à 19h30 à votre arrivée et entre 10h et 11h à votre départ. 

Au plaisir de vous faire découvrir notre lieu unique en son genre!
description.house_rules:
Pour maintenir la tranquillité des lieux, il est demandé de réduire le niveau de bruit au maximum entre 21h et 10h et de vous assurer que votre musique ne peut être entendue qu'à votre emplacement. Les fêtes bruyantes ne sont pas acceptées sur le site. Les feux d'artifice sont interdits.

Merci de laisser le chalet propre tel qu'il était à votre arrivée, vaisselle faite.

Merci d'enlever vos bottes et chaussures dans tous les bâtiments.

L'électricité est fournie à l'aide d'une batterie dans l'hébergement alors il est seulement possible de brancher de petits appareils comme un cellulaire et une tablette. On NE peut PAS brancher de grille-pain, cafetière, four à 
raclette et séchoir dans le chalet. Le Locataire est responsable des dommages matériels survenus dans ou sur l'unité louée pendant la période de location et ce, pour quelque raison que ce soit causé par lui-même ou un de ses invités, directement ou indirectement. 

Nous offrons de l’hébergement touristique et différentes activités dans un milieu naturel et semi-naturel possiblement accidenté par endroits. Malgré le fait que nous portions une attention particulière à la sécurité de nos clients et faisions en sorte que le site soit le plus sécuritaire possible, il existe plusieurs risques associés à la pratique d’activités sur le site. Nous ne pourrons pas être tenu responsable de tout accident, blessure ou maladie pouvant survenir durant le séjour tel que : 
-Blessures dues à des chutes ou à d’autres mouvements (entorse, foulure, fracture, etc.); 
-Blessures avec un objet contondant ou coupant (branches, roches, équipement d’activité, matériel, etc.); 
-Froid ou hypothermie; 
-Contact avec l’eau ou noyade (lors d’une activité aquatique ou à proximité d’un cours d’eau) 
-Brûlures et/ou troubles dus à la chaleur ou la fumée

name: LUXE Dome
title: Whitwell, Tennessee

hosts.about:
Creating one-of-a-kind, inspiring spaces for our guests is our life's passion. 
We honeymooned in The Majestic Treehouse in Walhalla – the treehouse Seth built with his dad. And since then, we've continued to build treehouses and domes in other beautiful nature settings across the USA. 

Check out our treehouses on Netflix's "The World's Most Amazing Vacation Rentals" and on Chip & Joanna Gaines' Magnolia Network!

We love traveling the world with Airbnb! Our goal as 27x Superhosts is for everyone who visits one of our places to feel like they're finally home. One of our biggest joys in life is creating unforgettable experiences for people and helping them rest & connect!

recent.comments: The place was beautiful and very clean. It was nice to get away from it all and be in nature.  I was thinking the deck would be completely private to where no one could see us, but people could still see us from the deck. Overall though it was a very good stay and the amenities and little details made for an even better stay. Thank you and we will visit again.

items.comments: The place was beautiful and very clean. It was nice to get away from it all and be in nature.  I was thinking the deck would be completely private to where no one could see us, but people could still see us from the deck. Overall though it was a very good stay and the amenities and little details made for an even better stay. Thank you and we will visit again.

My wife and I came to bolt farms to get away from the stress of work and to have some one on one time. We stayed in one of the luxury domes and I can say it was a 10/10 experience. It’s the attention to detail that really stood out to us. All the little things that bring you closer as a couple. The staff was amazing! Thomas and his hospitality was on point, he went above and beyond to make our experience even better. Also recommend ATV riding with Doug! It’s close by, fun, and you learn history of the town. My wife and are very close, it’s been almost eight years and I can say this brought us even closer! Don’t miss out on this and say “maybe one day.” Book the trip.

description.summary: Perfect for couples & solo travelers. Magical, unforgettable, Instagrammable, mountaintop luxury geodesic dome!
description.space:
Perfect for couples & solo travelers. Reconnect, laugh, and lose track of time on top of the world in a magical, inspiring, socially distanced environment that is guaranteed to lift your spirit and create cherished memories that will last a lifetime! Enjoy 1,175 square feet of private space (dome + deck + fire pit) and breathtaking mountaintop views from this impressive, Instagrammable, luxury geodesic dome! Enjoy our award-winning treehouse experience in a fascinating new structure with even more amenities. The LUXE Dome is a unique, bucket-list experience in an inspiring environment that is guaranteed to lift your spirit.

LIVE LIKE KINGS & QUEENS while being immersed in nature and surrounded by luxury comforts: stargaze in the hot tub, shower under the stars, roast s’mores, play antique board games, enjoy popcorn + movie night, blazing fast internet, BBQ grill, pizza oven, and furnished kitchenette. Wake up in the clouds to the relaxing sounds of songbirds and savor magical mornings in luxurious robes after waking up refreshed from the best sleep of your life. Journal, read, dream, and enjoy the art of slow living with french-press coffee and breakfast with million-dollar views. Then, PLAY LIKE KIDS in Chattanooga’s nature playground: scenic hikes, waterfalls, horseback riding, ATV tours, paragliding, paddleboarding, kayaking, fishing, cruise the Tennessee River on a pontoon, and fill your lungs with fresh mountain air.

Hey I’m Lauren!

With the knowledge I’ve gained I am now able to apply to my own business! My aim is to ensure the Meadow Dome is spa-like, comfortable, clean and always a great getaway!

The pictures do not do justice to the actual place, it is equipped with a great functioning kitchenette area and a little dining spot too. We enjoyed the seclusion so much with the hot tub and the Finnish Sauna that we barely left the place. items.comments: My husband and I went up for a little getaway, and we were extremely pleased and impressed with the Meadow Dome. We enjoyed the seclusion so much with the hot tub and the Finnish Sauna that we barely left the place. Me and my partner got surprised when we saw the location cause honestly photos doesn't do any justice to what's actually there...Great Vibe..Truly some RNR..had a beautiful quality time with my partner.And our host Lorne is very knowledgeable guy nd was very helpful he explain everything ...I would say it's a better home away from home...Will definitely come back...Thanks Lorne nd faimly, for a beautiful stay nd giving us some unforgettable memories

First, the place. Its an amazing and very private place. Its ideal for couple. The amenities are absolutely impeccable. My boyfriend loved the sauna and i loved the hot tub. Both of us had an amazing time and we had a great sleep. This is a great place to unwind from the city life and reconnect with the nature.

Amazing host and such a beautiful secluded peaceful place. Would love to go back. One weekend isn’t enough.

What a mesmerizing experience it was!!! Amazing host, Lorne, who did above and beyond hospitality. This place is something you will never forget. Mindblowing exposure to mothernature, including vegetation.
Amenities include everything that we needed. wooden Hot-tub was the most captivating. We were so fortunate that we got a chance for "Stargazing" as both the nights had very clear sky and comfortable temperature during our stay. This place was that much engaging that we didn't even go to Algonquin park trails even if we had a reservation for that. Thank you so much, Lorne and family, for  everything you did for us. Lots of love from Nirav and Priyanka.

Beautiful place to get away and relax! My husband and I traveled 4 hours to spend a couple nights. The experience was amazing. It was stocked with everything we needed for a private relaxing mini get away. Definitely recommend to anyone wanting to have some quiet time with a loved one

description.notes: The Monarch Meadowdome is located in the middle of 98 acres. The trail leading to the dome is rough but drivable.  Please drive slowly.
description.neighborhood: This truly is a nature lover’s paradise.  We are surrounded by lakes, forests, beaches and beautiful scenic drives. There is great fishing, hiking, with the famous Hastings Heritage Trail which is a four-season multi use recreational trail, farmers markets, and rock collecting just to mention a few things to do.  For you rock hounds, Hastings County is known as the mineral capital of Canada!  Bancroft offers some great vintage shopping with unique little shops. And check out Grumbling Granny’s with unique finds from Bali and the Madawaska Coffee Shop both located in Barry’s Bay.  There are maps of hiking trails and brochures of many more attractions in the area for your perusal!
description.transit: We are located in a rural setting so local attractions will be a short drive away.
description.interaction: We are available to our guests and just a call away. We sincerely appreciate our guests and want to make your stay as enjoyable as we can.
