title: Elizabeth, Indiana

recent.comments: This was our second stay and surely won't be the last. Ed & Vicki are a lovely couple and a delight to visit with. Their home and property are absolutely beautiful and very unique. It's always peaceful, tranquil, and very comfortable. This time we brought our dog and their dog Lee was incredibly well behaved (in spite of ours). The cost is higher than other options we had, but that did not dissuade us from choosing to stay with Ed & Vicki this time and most likely won't in the future either.

items.comments: This was our second stay and surely won't be the last. Ed & Vicki are a lovely couple and a delight to visit with. Their home and property are absolutely beautiful and very unique. It's always peaceful, tranquil, and very comfortable. This time we brought our dog and their dog Lee was incredibly well behaved (in spite of ours). The cost is higher than other options we had, but that did not dissuade us from choosing to stay with Ed & Vicki this time and most likely won't in the future either.

We were welcomed as family immediately. Wanted and cared for. Ed and Vickie are warm, engaging and salt of the earth people. Quick with a smile and easy with conversation. My husband and I felt comfortable “right out of the gate!” Lee is special and a welcomed companion. Sharing a space with others was smooth and a way to get to meet new people! Southern hospitality never left us thirsty or at odds with a serene and beautifully landscaped backdrop. With community and friends welcome our stay has been top notch and exceeded our expectations! 20,000 out of 10!! Thank you
Excellent stay, very kind people and unique home

It was a genuine pleasant experience from start to finish.  Ed and Vicky were both very helpful and accommodating.  We had a rough trip and our eta was very off but they were very flexible .  The house itself is like something out of a story. Very unique and beautiful design. And to top it all off their dog lee was a pure joy.  I will be coming back soon!
Beautiful & unique home with an amazing host

Ed was soooooo nice to serve welcome appetizer and leaving breakfast for me and my friends. He also has an awesome helper, Mr. Lee, an elegant but warm dog, being a great host as well. The house is really awesome. Since I was in these two days, Ed’s become my dream house hahaha. It was constructed by woods and likes a dome cinema. The environment made me feel like my home, the warmth from Ed and the company from Lee. Will come back again!!!

1st it's the driveway, with a grassy knoll, next to the mansion up by the road. Ed is a great cook and generous with food, a kind unexpected gesture. I felt like family visiting with cousin George, his wife and mother-in-law. Ed volunteers help maintaining the mil's family cemetary and hosts a 5star meal too! There's a few topless mermaids and if dog allergies or sobriety are issues this is not your place. This felt like a vacation of lifetime in an architectural wonder, built by an Amish man for his family. The remote woods are so beautiful. I'm thankful for being able to sleep 8hours through 2 of my 4 nights there, I generally can't. I missed getting to meet Vicki, who was in Hawaii, hearsay she's kind and friendly. If there was a yearly rate & they would have me I'd love to make this my retirement home.  A bargin with utilities, maintenance, a cook and cleaning person! Lee, a gentle, loving, beautiful long haired malinois with soulful eyes stole my heart. Thanks Ed, your top notch.

description.summary:
High in the hills outside Louisville sits our relaxing countryside hideaway, a 4,500 square foot handcrafted stone and timber home offering pleasant views and quiet country nights. 

The perfect place to start your Bourbon Trail trip; only twenty minutes to downtown Louisville, ten minutes to the casino, and five minutes to The Sporting Club, our home sits atop the hills on the Indiana side of the Ohio River.

Relax and enjoy the birds and the wildlife sightings and the peace of the country.
description.space: This listing is for a lockable bedroom. It has a queen size bed. It is in my home. It is a private room but has a shared bathroom to shower. You will share this bathroom with other guests. There are also several other bathrooms in the home which you are welcome to use, and you have access to the rest of the house while you are here: including the patio, living room, tv room, kitchen, dining room, etc.
description.notes:
We have a friendly dog. He will be hoping you want to pet him.
 **You are not renting the entire home for yourself.
description.neighborhood: Quiet country neighborhood in the hills outside Louisville.
description.transit: Plenty of outside parking. No public transportation.
description.house_rules: GUESTS WITH DOGS: We love dogs, but we ask that yours be properly house trained, meaning they do not chew on furniture or have accidents in the home. We ask that you do not bring any aggressive dog(s). And we ask that you do not leave your dog(s) in the room unattended for long periods without caging them. Thank you.

description.summary: Less than an hour from Toronto and 5 minutes from the beautiful historic town of Dundas! Our Country Dome Home is a unique glamping overnight stay. The dome is located on a private property in a field behind our home. You will have access to the Dome with it's back deck, a half basketball court to play on and a parking space for your vehicle. The Dome is located within walking distance to the famous Webster's Falls (if you want a longer hike!) and a cute farm market/bakery!
description.space:
The dome offers stunning sunset views, and an opportunity to fall asleep with nature – you will often hear the local wildlife and if you are lucky, wake up to deer in front of your window. Plenty of open space and natural light, it makes for a wonderful glamping experience.

The dome has a back deck with an outdoor BBQ and patio set. Inside there is a mini fridge and stove top oven. There is a lovely indoor fireplace, if you have a chilly evening it makes for romantic ambiance.

The oversized window creates beautiful views of the rolling hills and trees, a great place to relax or read a book.

The bathroom and kitchen both have hand wash trickle sinks that are gravity fed through a water bag in the dome storage loft and the bathroom has a compostable toilet [however no shower - this is why we only book 1 or 2 night stays]. Drinking water will be provided in the kitchenette for your stay and upon booking we offer food packages to stock your fridge for you if that is of interest – we utilize the wonderful market down the road which has gourmet meats and other treats (or you can go for a shop yourself as it is a very nice experience).

The dome features a queen-size bed with sheets, blankets, and two pillows.
description.access: Guests can access the dome and it's deck, the sand volleyball court, and the half basketball court. The trampoline however is off limits.
description.notes:
• Guests must be comfortable with dogs as there is a sweet dog living on the property. Unfortunately, this means NO DOGS ALLOWED in the dome. 

• This is a camping experience, so although the dome comes equipped with a fan and a AC/heating unit, it is a large tent like space and therefore will not be temperature controlled like a home would be (but will be more comfortable than a tent on it’s own).

You may experience some bugs or animals, and coyotes can often be heard in the middle of the night.

THIS DOME DOES NOT HAVE A SHOWER. Please note that there are sinks for handwashing and an indoor bathroom (compostable toilet) but for this reason, we do not rent out the space for more than 2 nights. 

• Guests are responsible for their own safety and are expected to have basic camping skills. Guests should feel comfortable operating a wood-burning stove if they choose to use it.

Trampoline is off limits please, but basketball court and volleyball court are free to use!

Please do no walk through or own the neighbouring farm properties, they are private.

• For your comfort, please keep the door closed at all times to avoid bugs entering the dome. It can happen but this will greatly minimize this.

description.summary:
Private off-the-grid dome experience to clear your mind and activate your inner natural creativity. Located on historic River Road next to an old quarry turned township park and within minutes to Ringing Rocks and the Delaware River, privacy and nature abounds. Get cozy in this unique Dome experience with an artistic flare.

No WiFi. No plumbing: composting toilet, Joolca hot tap propane sink & shower, berkey water filter system. Solar and ryobi 18 volt battery electric.
description.space:
Spacious dome for up to four people. 1 King sized bed, Loft for two additional guests. Must climb ladder for loft access. Loft includes a soft mattress pad and  a bean bag chair. This area is great for sleeping bags!  

Guests must BYO king fitted sheets, pillow cases or sleeping bags and bath towels.  Linens/bath towels are NOT provided.  We are happy to make up the king bed and provide bath towels for a fee of $50. If you just want us to supply the linens and towels and you make the bed yourself only $30. 

The loft bed is BYO only and meant for sleeping bags.

You will need sleeping/camping gear!  BYO cooler to store food and/or ice. NO FOOD/DRINKS inside dome.  We provide Coffee, Green Tea and water which is fine to drink inside dome.  (Sorry NO SUGAR)  Please keep everything else outside.

We provide an assortment of Ryobi 18 volt battery lights.  Head lamp lighting is highly recommended.  

We have a blue bin filled with camping items such as:  silicone pour over coffee maker with filters, ground coffee, tea, 2 burner coleman foldable propane stove.  1 propane bottle included.  (Use matches to light stove) Cast iron pans, tea kettle, dishes, cups and utensils provided.  Guests are expected to wash all dishes used before they leave.  ALL COOKING MUST BE DONE OUTSIDE THE DOME BY PICNIC AREA/FIRE PIT.  Only Coffee, Tea or Water inside Dome.

If you use anything in the Blue Bin please clean it and put it back as you found it.  

A great place for breakfast/coffee/snacks is Homestead General Store.  It is historic and right along the canal path. Highly recommend checking it out. 1650 Bridgeton Hill Road, Upper Black Eddy, PA 18972

Frenchtown has a nice grocery store less than 10 min drive if you need ice for your cooler or misc. items.  Address: 28 6th St, Frenchtown, NJ 08825
description.access: You will have the entire property to yourselves. We have two neighbors, one is a quarry turned park. The other you may see mowing the lawn or tending to their property.
description.notes:
FAQs

This is a list of questions and answers developed to help potential guests determine if they would like to experience/book this stay. If you have a question not on here, please let us know and we will add it for future guests!

Can we have a fire and is there wood?

Yes! We supply one bundle per night and you are welcome to BYO more or purchase from us. Prices will be sent via check in info when you have booked.  

Is there a thermostat/heating or cooling?

NO. This is an off-the grid experience. 

What do I do when it gets really cold?

Come prepared and be ready to use blankets/sleeping bags.  We supply heavy wool blankets for winter but encourage everyone to BYO whatever they like.

What do I do when it gets really hot?

Open the 2 side flaps on the dome and attach them using the carabiners provided. This will create a breeze. Instructions are also provided with check-in.

What should I do with food items?

As we do not want to attract unwanted guests, please place all food items in a sealed container or cooler.  NO FOOD/DRINKS inside Dome other then  provided Coffee, Tea or Water.

Will there be insect or bugs?

Maybe and Yes! While we try our best to keep the inside of the dome reserved of guests only. This is a natural experience and you may come across an unwanted bug or insect. Please know this going into the experience. We provide a fly swatter. Please BYO your own bug spray if you think this will be an issue for you or your group.

Will there be things larger than insects or bugs?

Maybe and Yes! Larger wild life in this area include deer, raccoon, skunk, turkey vultures, turtles, snakes etc. Coyotes can be heard off in the distance howling if you are lucky! Please keep all food in closed container or cooler to discourage animals from getting an easy meal.

You will probably like this stay if you want to:

-Experience nature to the extreme, try a compostable toilet, be limited to electrical usage from battery and experience "off-grid". Don't mind seeing bugs, insects, wild life or hearing any noises related to nature.  Be OK without HVAC. Are a camper but looking for more than a campsite.  Have never camped but want to give it a try.
description.neighborhood: Located in Upper Black Eddie on scenic and popular River Road. Close to the river towns of Milford, Frenchtown, Stockton, and New Hope. 1/2 mile from D&L Trail Ringing Rocks Trailhead and access to the Delaware River. 6 mins from the Giving Pond also located on River road.
description.interaction: We are available for all questions that you may have via the app and any emergencies by phone from 6am-8pm. If you are calling outside of those hours, please leave a voicemail and also call three times in a row as our phones will be on sleep mode.
description.house_rules:
House Rules/Rental Agreement:

1.  Please remove shoes/boots and place on provided rubber mat after coming inside.  
2. NO food, chips, candy etc. inside dome.  Coffee, Tea and water are fine.  Any sugary drinks please keep outside/by picnic table.  NO COOKING OR EATING INSIDE DOME. This is to limit attracting ants and other unwanted guests:) 
3. There will be native insects including ants, spiders, tics, Bees, wasps and other wildlife like deer, groundhogs, birds, snakes etc.  We CAN NOT guarantee the place will be free of these "bugs and native wildlife".  We provide a fly swatter and dust pan.  We do not have bug killer/RAID/insecticide.  Please BYO bug spray if you are concerned.  We will not refund or discount for native insects etc. inside the Dome.  Please don't book if these is a concern...
4. Bag and tie up all trash and place in outdoor metal trash can by bathroom.
5. Please replace anything you use from Blue Bin back and wash all utensils, plates, mugs etc.  

***Guests must BYO king fitted sheets, pillow cases or sleeping bags and bath towels. Linens/bath towels are NOT provided. We are happy to make up the king bed and provide bath towels for a fee of $50. If you just want us to supply the linens and towels and you make the bed yourself only $30. 4 pillows provided.

It is mandatory to communicate on the Airbnb platform. I would put my phone number in here but it is not allowed from Airbnb. If you have an emergency, please send questions before 8pm.  If you cannot reach me and it is an emergency please call 911.  

*Guest/Tenant shall fully indemnify, hold harmless, and defend Host/1886 River Road and property owners and its agents from and against all claims, demands, actions, suits, damages, liabilities, losses, settlements, judgements, cost and expenses.  (Including  but not limited to reasonable attorneys fees and costs), whether or not involving a 3rd party claim, which arise out of or relate to any act or omission of guest/tenant or their guests. 

Sleeps 4, one king sized bed. Top bunk sleeps two but must bring your own sheets and pillows -or- this is a great area for sleeping bags. There is a mattress pad and bean bag on the top bunk.

1 bundle of firewood is included for outside fire pit and if you wish to purchase more they are $5 per bundle.  Feel free to BYO your own if you like.

We provide an assortment of Ryobi 18volt battery items such as a flash light and bluetooth radio. None of these items are waterproof. Any batteries /items left outside in the rain could potentially be ruined. If you use anything, please put it back and do not leave it outside.

If a battery or item is not functioning, we may at our discretion, request replacement costs using whatever prices are on Ryobi website/ home depot.

EARLY CHECK-INS are not guaranteed. Airbnb allows you to choose a preferred check in time, but it is ultimately up to the host to approve any check-ins before 4pm. An accepted request to book does not mean your early check-in time was approved. You will need to send us a message asking us if you can check in early.

LATE CHECKOUTS must be approved by the management team. If you stay past your 11am check out time without approval, you will automatically be charged for the next nights’ stay at the listing’s full price.

PACKAGES We do not allow guests to order mail/packages to this location for privacy reasons. If you attempt to have something delivered to this address, it will be rejected by the leasing office and we are not held responsible for its whereabouts.  

MAINTENANCE Understand that we are at the mercy of the property management maintenance team for most general “fix-it” requests. We ask that all our guests are patient and understanding in regards to this. If a previous guest has damaged something minor and we were unable to fix it before check in, it will be reported to the complex staff, but it is dependent on the maintenance team’s schedule. Examples: blinds, curtains, and lightbulbs fall under the “non-emergency” maintenance category and won’t be completed until they’ve addressed any emergency requests around the property first.

CLEANING Our cleaning fee is based on a courteous guest (e.g. someone who cleans up after themselves, puts dishes in the dishwasher, towels in the washer, leaves the place as they found it, etc.). This is NOT a hotel. If the housekeeping crew discovers an unreasonable mess post-checkout, we will charge an additional fee of $100.

HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT:

1/HOLD HARMLESS

The hosts and owners of the property do not assume any liability for any loss, damage or injury to persons or their personal property. Neither does the owner accept any liability for any perceived negligence or for any inconveniences, damage, loss or injury arising from any temporary defects or stoppage in supply of water, gas, cable, WiFi, electricity or plumbing due to weather conditions, natural disasters, acts of god, or other reasons beyond its control.

2/ENTRY BY OWNER

Owners or their designees may enter the premises under the following circumstances: In case of an emergency, to make any necessary agreed upon repairs, alterations or improvements, and to supply necessary or agreed upon services.
Landscaping services are apart of regular exterior maintenance of the property, this work may occur without announcement from 10:00 - 5:00 pm 7 days a week.

3/SLEEPING CAPACITY/DISTURBANCES

Guest and all occupants will be required to vacate the premise and forfeit the payment fee and security deposit for any of the following: Occupancy exceeding the agreed upon guest count and names thereto, or occupancy exceeding the contracted guest count in the reservation, using the premises for any illegal activity, causing damage to the premises or any neighboring properties and any other acts that may interfere with neighbors rights to quiet enjoyments of their properties.

4/MAINTENANCE

Please report any maintenance needs discovered on the premises and the host will respond as quickly as possible.
Refunds will not be made for maintenance issues including, but not limited to electrical service interruptions, heating and air conditioning, appliances, televisions, cable, WiFi, and stereos.

5/GUEST COUNT AND NAMES

As per booking platform rules names of all guests using the property must be listed on the reservation with the host. Any revisions to this list must be shared with the host prior to entering the property. Falsifying this information will result in termination of reservation without refund. Additional guests are not insured by Airbnb even if they stop by for a moment, everyone is better off being protected , we appreciate this respect in advance. All children of any age must be listed on the reservation without exception.

6/GUESTS of GUESTS

No guest may invite any guest to the property that is not listed and named on the booking thought the booking platform. Any changes to the original guest list must be agreed upon with the host though an altered reservation before any new guest is allowed to enter the property. If the guest list is amended on the day of check in a call to the booking agent may be necessary but in all cases no new guest is allowed to enter the property without being listed on the reservation altered or otherwise.

7/ GUEST CONTRACTORS

If a guest contracts any services during the reservation the host must be notified in advance. The contractor must be approved by the host who will require any such contractor to provide a valid insurance policy naming the property owners as beneficiaries of the policy.

8/ OTHER ITEMS OF NOTE

If hiking in the woods be careful not to touch poison Ivy. It is a vine that grows up trees and around shrubs, 3 leaves and shiny. Also, check for ticks. We are in the North East of the United States and they are in the woods. Not so much near the house or lawn:) If you are planning on hanging outside all day or night I recommend bringing bug/mosquito repellant. Just a precaution. Tick season is April to October for our region.

Please leave all blankets and indoor items inside, this will reduce the amount of bugs tracked into the dome.

All food items left in the dome or over night while sleeping could potentially attract animals. Ideally, keep all food that you may have overnight outdoors in a cooler, etc. This is recommended for camp sites.

As this dome is essentially a large tent that is not a sealed structure, there may be bugs, spiders, flies, wasps, etc. We can't guarantee no bugs or pests in this camp-like experience.

By booking this unit, you have read, understood, and agreed to all these house rules.

As of mid 2022 Airbnb started offering trip insurance.  Please purchase that if you think you may have an issue with cancelling as it will offer full refund.

If you have any other questions just ask.

description.summary: Enjoy an intimate experience with nature and all the amenities of a luxury resort yet only minutes away from Traverse City's finest restaurants, beaches, wineries, shopping, and golf.  Only 3 miles from the Great Lakes Equestrian Show and 1.5 miles from Turtle Creek Casino. 780 sq. ft. of living space with majestic views.  The dome is spacious and 13' tall. Enjoy a private bathroom complete with a bathtub/shower, vanity, & toilet, kitchen with a refrigerator, microwave, & hot plate. AC & Heat.
description.space:
Geodesic Dome Home #4 sleeps six and features a massive, handcrafted king-size barnwood bed that is positioned to provide incredible views of the surrounding pristine forest.  A dividing wall separates the bedroom spaces. On the backside of the wall is a handcrafted timber frame queen-over-queen bunk bed strong enough to hold four adults.  There is a private, indoor bathroom and kitchen. The bathroom has a tub/shower, toilet, and vanity.  

Outside you will find a bathtub.  This outdoor bathtub is private and positioned so you can enjoy a relaxing bath while listening to the soothing sounds of nature.  In addition, there is a private firepit, barbeque, and hammock.  We provide one complimentary bundle of firewood for each day booked.  

With 75 acres of private land surrounded by state land on three sides, you will have access to miles of trails for hiking and birding.  Pine, cedar, spruce, and cherry trees provide a natural privacy barrier from neighboring accommodations.  Neighboring accommodations range from 80' to 300' away.  Please be careful driving in or out in the evening as there is an abundance of deer and other wildlife in the area.  We seek to provide you with a unique, intimate interaction with nature, yet you are only a few miles away from the best beaches, restaurants, shopping, wineries, and golfing in Traverse City.
description.neighborhood:
Near By Destinations

The Silver Birch Resort is located just a few miles from dozens of attractions.

Horse Show – Traverse City Horse Shows is 3 miles away.  Shows run from June until September.  Check their website for show days and hours

Beaches & Swimming – some of Traverse City’s finest beaches are only 5 miles away on East Bay (due west until you dead end into US31, turn left and immediately turn right.

Wine Tasting – Traverse City’s reputation for producing world-class wines is quickly growing as many of the wineries have been winning awards. Most of these wineries call Old Mission Peninsula home. Even if wine is not your on To Do list, the drive through the rolling hills of the peninsula will provide breathtaking views of East and West Bays. The mouth of the peninsula is approximately 10 miles from Silver Birch Resort. After sampling the wonderful wines, you might as well drive to the northernmost point of the peninsula and visit Mission Point Lighthouse.

Breweries – Traverse City and the surrounding areas have a plethora of micro-breweries featuring locally grown hops. Some of our favorites include Shorts Brewery and Stone Hound Brewing Company. Please note: the owners believe in constantly checking the quality of all our local beers. We have never had a bad beer in any of the dozen downtown breweries.

Shorts Brewery – 211 Industrial Park Drive, Elk Rapids, MI 49629
Stone Hound Brewery – 3593 Bunker Hill Rd, Williamsburg, MI 49690

Shopping – downtown Traverse City with street after street of unique gift shops, clothing boutiques, restaurants, and bistros is only 11 miles away.

Elk Rapids – charming Elk Rapids is only 20 miles away. Would you like to see a real-life “Norman Rockwell” town? It doesn’t get any better than this. The beaches are some of the finest in northern Michigan, but sharing this secret will get us in trouble with many of the locals who refuse to tell visitors about Elk Rapids for not wanting to see it lose its “yesterday” charm. Please don’t tell anyone where you got this information. Elk Rapids also has an authentic single-screen movie theatre that was built in the early nineteenth century. You will feel like you are stepping back to a bygone era. The popcorn, root beer & cherry soda is some of the best you’ve ever had. If a movie is desired, be sure to bring cash as twenty-first-century plastic is not accepted. All employees are committed to keeping the old-fashioned movie experience authentic.

Restaurants

Both Traverse City and Elk Rapids are considered “foodie” towns. Restaurants in our area that serve mediocre food do not last long. Just about every restaurant in this area has good quality food. Some of the owners’ favorites are:

Hopscotch Brick Oven & Taproom
2032 US-31, Traverse City, MI 49686

Red Ginger is located in downtown Traverse City. If you like calamari, you must try the appetizer.
237 E Front St, Traverse City, MI 49684

Red Mesa on US31 offers Mexican/Spanish dishes.
1544 US-31 N, Traverse City, MI 49686

Pearls in Elk Rapids specializes in Louisiana Cajun cooking.
617 Ames St, Elk Rapids, MI 49629

McGee’s in Acme. The closest restaurant and only four miles away.
4341 M-72, Williamsburg, MI 49690

Jolly Pumpkin on Old Mission Peninsula.
13512 Peninsula Dr, Traverse City, MI 49686

Don's Drive Inn. 50's diner theme with great burgers and killer milkshakes.
2030 US 31 N., Traverse City, MI 49686

Pizza Options
East Bay Pizza – In our opinion, the best pizza (partly because the owner’s brother operates it) is East Bay Pizza. Their pizza is outstanding and dining in will also give you one of the best views of the Bay. They also serve 30 flavors of Moomer’s Ice Cream. Moomers won the title of Best Ice Cream in America in a contest sponsored by Good Morning American. A perfect summer night in northern Michigan is defined by a good pizza, ice cream, and breathtaking sunsets on the Bay. East Bay Pizza has all three.
4386 US-31, Traverse City, MI 49686

That’s A Pizza – want to eat in? That’s A Pizza will deliver right to your site. This was the owner’s favorite pizza place until his brother opened. They have excellent pizza and a great staff.
5430 US-31, Williamsburg, MI 49690

Sleeping Bear Sand Dunes – named by Good Morning American as “The Most Beautiful Place in America”. People come from all over the world (no joke, Sleeping Bear sees tens of thousands of visitors from Europe and Japan who travel specifically to see the sand dunes. Expending a little energy and climbing the dunes affords you unbelievable views of Lake Michigan and surrounding lakes. You will quickly realize why Good Morning American bestowed this title. The Sleeping Bear Sand Dunes are approximately 36 miles away.

Charlevoix, Michigan – another wonderful, charming town with great restaurants, shopping, and breathtaking views.

Golfing – we are located near three of Michigan’s finest golf courses: The Bear, The Wolverine, and LochenHeath. Check out their websites for all the awards and reviews. These golf courses are only 4 miles away.

The Bear, The Wolverine, and LochenHeath

Turtle Creek Casino –   If you enjoy the excitement of gambling and the nightlife, you will only be 1.5 miles away from the beautiful Turtle Creek Casino.  In addition to your favorite games, there is a fine restaurant and club with music and dancing.
description.house_rules:
PET POLICY

We are dog lovers.  We have two of our own.  We did realize at the end of last year that we must put a pet policy in place. A guest last year left their dog all day in the dome, and it barked the entire time they were gone disrupting the experience of other guests.  This was a dog with a deep, loud bark.  The dog barked for eight hours straight which was impressive as you would think it would lose its voice after a few hours.  Everyone’s nerves were fried by the time the people returned. 

We recently had a guest that asked if they could bring their dog. Even after reading this policy, they let their dog bark for almost an hour. It was not continuous, but it was 5 to 10 seconds of stressed-out, loud barking, and then silence. Every 5-10 minutes there was a barking outburst. I think they tied it up outside, and it wanted to come in the side. The dog was trying to get their attention.  I really did not want to have to walk down there and have a talk with them as we are trying for everyone to have a nice experience. I was very close to walking to their site, and then it stopped for the evening. The problem is the other five domes in the area. This had to disrupt their barbecues, campfires, and evening.
 
Everyone knows their dogs.  Our two dogs would not bark if we left them somewhere unless they were startled.  This is understandable and acceptable.  If you have a dog that will bark from separation anxiety, we ask that he/she not be left alone (or outside alone while the family is indoors).  If you feel, the dog would only bark if startled, then we are fine with a dog.  If you are going to leave for a few hours, we ask that it be kenneled and left in the kitchen/bath structure – NOT left in the dome.  The kitchen/bath structure has more insulation, and the occasional bark will not travel through the entire property. 

The other requirement we have for pets is that they are not allowed on the beds. We have already had to replace two comforters this year because we were not able to get the dog hair out. Please try and bring a dog bed.  If you cannot, we leave an extra sheet in the dresser drawer. This is specifically for your dog. You can lay this on the floor in an area and your pet is welcome to sleep on this. Dog hair on the comforter is subject to a $100 replacement fee.
 
If you agree to these pet policies, you are welcome to bring your dog.  

We are located on 75 acres and surrounded by thousands of acres of state forestry with trails. You can walk for miles and miles.  This is the perfect property to take your dog for a nice long walk.  If he or she will run after a deer, fox, raccoon, or porcupine, then we strongly suggest a lease as you are sure to see wildlife.

We love pets. Please let us know if you are bringing your four-legged friend(s) as we do charge $35 (per pet) for pet fee and there are some simple house rules to follow.

Wildlife:
Wildlife in the mountains can be categorized into diurnal and nocturnal. Animals that are largely active during the night time are coyotes, bears. Keep in mind that it is illegal to pick them up as they are State protected animals. Enjoy wildlife from a distance and allow them to pass through. After all, this is their home too!

*Please DO NOT hunt, shoot or trap wildlife for any reason. Respect and live harmoniously with Nature as we are all custodians of Mother Earth.


! No loud music from 8pm-8am its prohibited by neighborhood community

hosts.about:
Hi! I am originally from the Shenandoah Valley in Virginia and formerly worked for the US Foreign Service in Uganda, Cameroon, and Canada. During my time abroad, I  collected art from all over the world, which you can see in my airbnbs. 

My partner is Canadian and together we love sharing our beautiful Toronto house in High Park, as well as a forested Geodesic Dome surrounded by the Blue Ridge Mountains that my artist father built in the 70s. Between us we speak English, French, and Farsi. 

We love recommending local food, craft beer, and wine. Let us know if you want restaurant suggestions or kid activity recommendations!

description.summary:
Unplug in your own 3k sq ft private forest dome. Built by a Shenandoah Valley artist, this funky and fun geodesic dome has 4 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, 2 soaking tubs, Nintendo, books, games, piano, ping-pong, and a deck to watch the stunning stars on at night. 

10 min to Grand Caverns, Valley Pike, vineyards, middle river, and many hiking trails. Near JMU. Enjoy the birds, bunnies, and deer.

Groove to our record collection, tour vineyards, workout, or reconnect with friends, family, and yourself.
description.space:
The dome was built by a local artist in the late 70s, inspired by dome-master Buckminster Fuller and updated again in 2021 to showcase the original retro vibes, but with new, modern twists. 

The house is on 18+ acres of forested land on a hillside. There is a front and side yard that is mowed and plenty of woods to explore for the more adventurous.

You'll enter from the back deck into an open-concept living area with a dining room, kitchen, coffee bar, and a large living room with high, rounded ceilings and large windows. 

Off the main circular living room, there is another den with a video game station, yoga mats, and home fitness gear, as well as a boho floor bed for extra sleeping. 

Upstairs there is a master loft king-bed bedroom, a bathroom with a soaker tub and shower, and a separate, open office area with a writing desk.

Downstairs there is another master suite with a king-bed, an ensuite bathroom, walk-in closet, and a daybed for extra sleeping, as well as a table and coffee station. 

There are two additional bedrooms on the main floor, off the den, and both contain desks. These bedrooms share the main floor bathroom and shower.
One main floor bedroom contains a queen bed. The other is a "kids" room with a full and single bunk bed.  

In total, the dome has: 
2 King beds
1 Queen bed
2 full beds
2 single beds. 

There is an additional desk and printer in the basement foyer.
description.access: Guests have access to the full property, except for the owner's closet and boiler room in the basement and the garage. These areas will be locked during your stay,
description.notes:
Massages and personal training sessions can be coordinated for you at an additional fee. 

Horseback riding, kayaking, tubing, and organic farm visits are available in the area. 

The property is not fenced on the sides, only along the front road. If you'd like to hike up behind the dome and through the woods, chat with us first so we can explain the property boundaries. 

Please note that the Internet at the dome is "country Wi-Fi" not "city Wi-Fi." You can stream Netflix etc. on the main TV, but in general, the Wi-Fi is best when used on one device to stream at a time. Att, Verizon, and Tmobile work at the dome but are on country speeds, not city speeds. This is not fast internet. We've tried, but they just don't offer fast internet here. So come to relax and not work! We do not guarantee high-speed Internet. 

Please see our house rules for details on wildlife.
description.neighborhood:
Encircled by the Blue Ridge Mountains, nestled on a forested hillside in the Shenandoah Valley, the dome is secluded and surrounded by tall trees, rolling hills, farms, vineyards, and the Appalachian mountains. 

This is a great location to explore both Harrisonburg and Staunton as we're halfway between both and 30 minutes from the Massanutten Ski Resort and Water Park. 

Take a five-minute drive to the Valley Pike for hot cinnamon buns, lattes, and homemade goodies, or visit their bar and try a locally brewed beer. There is a Mennonite farm a few minutes away that sells fresh produce daily, or hit the Old School food truck for a seriously amazing peanut-butter-and-jelly burger. Yep. Taste the best ice cream you've ever had at Smiley's up the road in Bridgewater. Pick strawberries, blackberries, or pumpkins, or take a hay ride depending on the season.

Easy access to I-81 and the Shenandoah Regional Airport, as well as many antique markets, JMU, EMU, the Grand Caverns, George Washington National Forest, Staunton's authentic Shakespeare Theater, and the Cross Keys Vineyard.
description.transit: We have ample parking. The dome is up a long, winding hill. For winter bookings, a 4-wheel drive vehicle is suggested in case of snow and ice.
description.interaction: You will have self-check in and we are available if you need us, otherwise we will give you privacy. There is a caretaker that waters potted outdoor plants and picks up the trash weekly. Cleaning during your stay is available upon request.
description.house_rules:
We cannot guarantee specific Wi-Fi speeds. The Internet works, but it may be slower than you're used to if you're coming from a city. Don't miss your chance to unplug and avoid your emails!
Phones on ATT, Verizon, and T-Mobile can receive calls, texts, and call out, and usually have 1-2 bars of data. 

Please be aware that we try our best to keep the dome critter-free on the inside, but we're in the forest, so you may see all types of critters outside. 

NO HUNTING on the property. 

No pets. 

Keep within the property boundaries and do not hike to the neighbor's land. An image of the boundaries will be provided once you check-in. 

Smoking is fine outside and on the deck, but not inside. 

Events may be approved on a case-by-case basis with prior permission and an added event fee. Message the host for details.

hosts.about: Hello! I live in South Georgian Bay Area with my husband and two little kids. I am  a critical care nurse who enjoys hiking, canoeing, cooking, creating, gardening and hosting!

Hi there! I am Ben and along with my wife, Alyssa, we are the owners of Back Forty Glamping. We have just completed our first geodesic dome for rental stays. We’re so excited to finally be able to welcome guests and give them a luxurious glamping experience in the beauty of Grey Bruce!

recent.comments: A great stay. We had a good time just relaxing and being in nature.

items.comments: A great stay. We had a good time just relaxing and being in nature.

Back 40 is beautifully setup, well maintained and stunning property all around. Every comfort of home is available to you. When I say the hosts thought of everything, I mean it; they truly left you wanting for nothing. From available fire starter and wood for their included fire pit, to makeup remover and toiletries, they had all your bases covered. Our friends and families are envious of our mini getaway and we would recommend their space to anyone looking for a quiet, romantic getaway.
so grateful to have been able to spend a couple days in this beautiful space, it was the perfect getaway and a fun experience.
Had a wonderful time at this very clean and private dome. Will definitely come back!
Great experience! Dome was bright and clean! Host was very helpful throughout the stay!
Unique stay truly under the stars - The beautiful area also offers great hiking. We really enjoyed our first glamping experience.
Beautiful place! Friendly service!

description.summary:
Back Forty Glamping is a year round geodesic dome short term accommodation stay outside of Meaford. It is way more than just an overnight stay, but the basecamp to experience adventure Grey County on South Georgian Bay, the backdrop for connection and the opportunity of feeling restored. Be given the gift of time, to hit pause, to connect with not only the wonder of the natural world around you, but yourself and others.

**PLEASE NOTE: this is not the only dome on site, there are 2 others**
description.space: Each dome has a big bay window and large sky light that allows you to remain in the comfort of your dome, but still feel immersed in nature all throughout your stay day and night. Imagine falling asleep to the twinkling stars and waking up the glowing forest! We offer 3 domes that sleep 2 people each. Each dome has high end finishes, a king size bed, luxurious sheets, a full kitchen, 3 piece bathroom, a/c, wood pellet stove, sitting area, WIFI and a private deck with BBQ and hot tub. Don't miss out out on this new exciting Grey County experience! The dome includes a king size bed, luxurious sheets, a full kitchen, 3 piece bathroom, A/C, a wood pellet stove, sitting area, WIFI and a private deck with a BBQ and hot tub.
description.access: At B40 we want our guests to really experience nature, so they will have almost full access to our whole 30 acre property. You will have full access to all the trails on property as well as your own private patio and private fire pit located right next to your dome.

hosts.about:
With the purchase of Deer Lake Lodge in June 2021 I entered an exciting new chapter when I became a glampground proprietor (a.k.a. professional putterer). 

I've rebranded it as Deer Lake Wilderness Retreat, and my vision is to create a community where my guests can relax in nature, reflect on life, and restore their soul. Phase A is well underway with the establishment of a glampground, and phase B will be to introduce workshops with a focus on wellness.

Cheers,

Sara

recent.comments: Beautiful dome and very private! Only thing was the bugs in the area but there was an electric swatter and netted hats provided in the dome. Had everything you need there for an easy glamping experience.

items.comments: Beautiful dome and very private! Only thing was the bugs in the area but there was an electric swatter and netted hats provided in the dome. Had everything you need there for an easy glamping experience.
A wonderful experience, Sara was a great host! Beautiful surroundings as well!

The geodome is very cozy, comfortable and cute, it is well secluded and private, quiet and peaceful and good to relax in nature. Everything you need is provided, so you don't need to worry about bringing all your camping gear.

It is particularly nice to lie down and look at the stars at night though the window at the top of the dome and to have a nice little snack by the lantern and candle light.

This place has left me speechless. Everything was absolutely perfect. The geodome was spacious, relaxing, therapeutic, and full of everything that you need - twinkle lights, sleep masks, extra blankets, kitchen supplies, bug candles, flashlights, cozy chairs, it was fully stocked with everything you’d need. The shared barn has everything as well - microwave, toaster, every kitchen thing you can think of, board games, books, a shower, big table and couches to hang out at. It has everything and it felt so cozy. It’s truly a retreat because you just get there and can totally relax. The communication was fantastic, clear and easy-to-follow instructions. Sara doesn’t give you a million rules like most airbnb hosts do, so you feel comfortable and can truly relax. I’ll be coming back again (and again and again). Thanks for an amazing stay.

We had an amazing weekend at Deer Lake Wilderness retreat! The geodome was so cozy and peaceful. Even though there were other guests on the property, the geodome's space felt sheltered and private. Sara was super helpful and responsive, and had thought of everything in terms of instructions and recommendations before we arrived. The pass to Mikisew Provincial park was an amazing bonus. We can't wait to come back!

The Geodome in the woods provided a perfect blend of modern comfort and nature. With its sleek design, panoramic views, and cozy interior, it was a magical retreat. The host's attentiveness and nearby hiking trails added to the unforgettable experience. Highly recommended for a tranquil getaway.

We had a beyond perfect weekend at the Geodome!! The space, the property and the forest were all so wonderful! We had high expectations going in, and everything surpassed them! Sara has built an incredible space. The Geodome, communal barn and entire property are so so intentionally and thoughtfully built. The Geodome itself was SO cozy, spacious and charming. It was such a joy to spend time in.  We were so sad to leave our little paradise bubble! 
Sara is a world-class host! She is so considerate, communicative and helpful! We can't wait to come back!!! 20/10 experienece! Thank you Sara!!!

description.summary: The Stargazer Geodome at DEER LAKE WILDERNESS RETREAT is glamping at its finest. It is the perfect place to relax in nature, reflect on life, and restore your soul.
description.space:
The Stargazer Geodome features a panoramic window with chairs for curling up in while you enjoy the woodland view. Connect with each other as you sit around the campfire escaping from it all while watching “nature’s tv” under the stars. Snuggle up at night in the king sized bed as you gaze up at the stars through the skylight. In the winter the wood burning stove provides warmth and ambiance. 

DEER LAKE WILDERNESS RETREAT is a secluded paradise on 10.5 acres with four acres of woodland trails for forest bathing. Use it as a base to explore the Almaguin Highlands, a four season outdoor getaway known for its scenic hills and lakes. In summer enjoy water sports, biking, hiking, artist galleries, shops, restaurants, ATVing, horseback riding and golfing. In the winter cross country skiing, snowshoeing and snowmobiling are available at your doorstep and dog sledding is just one hour away.  

Guests of DEER LAKE WILDERNESS RETREAT are welcome to use the atmospheric communal space in the barn. In the communal barn apartment you'll find a kitchenette with a stove, microwave, water, coffee maker, tea kettle and all your cooking basics. There is also a sitting area and farmhouse table for your use, connecting at the end of the day in the candlelit barn is a magical experience.  

The amenities in the Stargazer Geodome include a kettle, french press coffee maker and your cooking essentials such as plates, cups, cutlery, utensils, cutting boards, pots and pans. There is also a BBQ with a side burner on the deck for your exclusive use. It does not have running water but spring drinking water and well water is provided. The Stargazer Geodome is off grid but it comes with a cooler for your perishable food and it has lanterns with a plug to charge your phone. 

The Stargazer Geodome’s washroom facilities include a comfortable outhouse and there is a chamber pot for night time use. There are two hot water showers (one in an outdoor shower house and one in the barn apartment) but both are out of commission during the winter months when the pipes are frozen.

DEER LAKE WILDERNESS RETREAT is a 20 minute drive from the town of South River where you’ll find your essential needs including a grocery store, LCBO, craft brewery, restaurants and pharmacy. The Crystal Caves and its surrounding artisan village is a spectacular way to spend an afternoon and Sundridge, with its quaint Main Street, is just 10 minutes down the road.

NOTES: 

Although there are three other sites on the premises of DEER LAKE WILDERNESS RETREAT they are spread out and each site has its own private outdoor space. 

There is no TV and WIFI is only accessible in the communal barn, there is no wifi out at the Stargazer Geodome although cell reception in the area is excellent. 

DEER LAKE WILDERNESS RETREAT is not directly on water, public beaches are about a 10 minute drive away and your rental comes with a free park pass to Mikisew Provincial Park which has three beaches (one of which is a dog beach). 

IF YOU BOOK FOR A FRIDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT PLEASE ASK HOW YOU CAN EXTEND YOUR VACATION FOR JUST $99 ON SUNDAY NIGHT.

recent.comments: We had a great stay at the Dome! If we go again, we’d definitely stay more than one night to fully enjoy the serene surroundings. The Dome was beautiful and cozy, and we had a good night there! Jeannie was very kind and welcoming, we felt right at home!

items.comments: We had a great stay at the Dome! If we go again, we’d definitely stay more than one night to fully enjoy the serene surroundings. The Dome was beautiful and cozy, and we had a good night there! Jeannie was very kind and welcoming, we felt right at home!

This was a last minute booking the day before my stay; Jeannie mentioned that she had a cancellation and it's magic how things work out sometimes. I agree!! My arrival was about 10pm, so it was dark outside. Jeannie made sure that I found the Dome easily, so she met us and I followed her to the location. Super friendly and responsive. Wished my 15 year old and I a good night's rest and a pleasant stay. After we had left the next  morning, she texted asking how our stay was and wished us safe travels on our waterfall trip. The Dome was rather quant, cute and charming. My daughter loved the swings hanging from the dome ceiling. I loved all the crystals in each window. Very earthy and a sense of mystical energy. I would definitely stay here again! Namaste.
A whimsical decor to lift your spirit and bring out your inner faerie! Many trails and a short walk to a unique and unexpected hidden labyrinth. Very clean, super responsive host.

I stayed here with my daughter for our summer weekend getaway. We had so much fun here. We felt right at home super cozy. We decided to cook dinner and breakfast there. We cooked the meat outside based on instructions and it was fantastic! We watched Moulin Rouge up in the loft. We planned walk the trails but just didn't have the energy. This Air BnB was perfect and there was always something new to look at.

Jeannie’s place is so peaceful, and beautiful. Way more space than we could have imagined. There are tons of wild mushrooms, beautiful trails, and pretty scenery to take in. Jeannie is an awesome host. Very kind, communicative, and just overall good vibe! We can’t wait to have time to come back again.
Amazing and unique!
Awesome host who made our stay very comfortable! Very unique and beautiful place in the wood! Very helpful. Will definitely recommend the place.

description.summary: The Dome is nestled in the pines in the woods on a snowmobile trail surrounded by state land. Located just 5 minutes from I-75 Exit 215. There are miles of trails surrounding the Dome. It is also a short hike away from the International Peace Labyrinth which can be found on the International Labyrinth Locator Zip code 48661. Tent camping is also an option. It's a lovely PeaceFULL place most of the time. There is also a historical Well near the RR tracks that's nice to visit and make a wish!
description.space:
Welcome Dome!  4 acres of Red Pines, neighboring properties have weekend campers sometimes they are there, sometimes not. There"s campfire pit and a screened porch with a futon that is fun to watch the woods from, maybe even sleep, for fun! 
Inside the Dome is a wonderful feeling of peace and WellBEing open, spacious unique structure. Relax in the hammock chairs, or lounge on the beds (covered for pets and lounging.) Table in Kitchen area with comfortable seating for eating and playing games. The 3/4 Loft has a love seat and chair to relax and watch DVDs, a queen bed fit for a queen.

description.access:
Guests have access to an outdoor common area near the reception, which includes a BBQ area protected by a roof as well as a campfire area with logs.

There is no wifi in the dome, but guests have access to a connection when they are near the reception, in the common area. So remember to download your movies before arriving at the dome

The shared fire pit is not accessible from November to April.
description.notes:
1- The water in the dome is not drinkable, but there is a water dispenser with a filtration system beside the sink, that provides drinking water.

2- There is no cellular network or wifi in the unit. Wifi is available at the chalet at the entrance to the domain, which is a 1-minute walk away. You must therefore be near the chalet to receive the internet connection.

3- There is no television in the dome.

4- Pets are NOT ALLOWED at the dome.

description.house_rules:
* CHALET RULES *

1. All our bookings are covered by Aircover, Airbnb's protection. You can be held responsible in case of damage or non-compliance. If necessary, we will use the resolution center with photos and/or invoices.

2. Check-in can be done at any time after 4:00 p.m. The maximum time for Check-out is 11:00 a.m. You can request for a Check-in earlier than 4:00 p.m. or a Check-out after 11:00 a.m., but we cannot guarantee this request and we will be able to give you an official response only 24 hours in advance.

3. It is strictly forbidden to smoke in the chalet. Failure to comply with this rule will result in a penalty of $ 500.

4. Pets are not allowed. Failure to comply with the rules will result in a penalty of $ 500 and immediate eviction without refund.

5. Parties and excessive noise outside the chalet are not permitted. Failure to comply with this rule will result in a penalty of $ 500 and immediate eviction without refund. We have excessive noise detection systems outside the chalet.

6. If the cottage is left in a messy condition, we will charge $ 40 per additional hour per housekeeping attendant to clean up. We love when guests wash their dishes before check-out or take out the dishwasher.

7. Guests are not allowed to book our chalet directly if they do not have verified ID and a profile photo of their face on Airbnb. We do not discriminate, we just want to know who we are renting our property to.

8. Guests assume full responsibility for any accident, injury or illness occurring in the chalet. By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all customers expressly assume the risk of any damage arising from their use of the premises. Customers recognize that they can personally purchase insurance to protect themselves during such events.

9. If more guests than the number initially stated in the reservation sleep at the chalet, we will charge you $500 of penalty and we will request that the initial number of guests mentioned in the reservation be respected from then on. 

10. If you notice anything that presents a hazard that could cause damage to the place or to people, let us know immediately.

11. If you delay the work of housekeeping attendants, at the time of Check-out, you will be charged $ 50. This charge is applied to any late check-out between 11:00 a.m. and 1:00 p.m. Any guest who is still on site after 1:00 p.m. will be charged for an additional night. This does not apply if we have approved a late check out in advance.

12. When you make a reservation with us you agree to all of the above house rules.

A super romantic get-away, just rugged enough to feel like you're out camping, but enough amenities that you never feel uncomfortable. The hosts were extremely down to earth and super understanding of our last-minute changes. we really look forward to our next stay here.

We had such an amazing time! So peaceful waking up in the forest, and so central to everything! The hostess was amazing super friendly and helpful, we felt right at home.
It was sad to go, hope to come back soon!
Amazing experience! Really enjoyed the evening by the fire and Martina’s sweet dog! Incredibly clean and exactly as advertised. We loved every minute!

Had an amazing experience and a great time there. The host's house is right next to the dome but the place is very private. Perfect for a peaceful weekend getaway. If you are not into art you might not like the interior as it is filled with sculptures. Loved the outdoor shower.

We loved the space, comfortable warm bed, amazing views. Enjoyed a fire, indoor toilet and basic kitchenette inside  a shed. Outdoor shower is not for everyone! You feel like your in a museum inside the dome! Could use some cushions for outdoor space as we used her 2 blankets to sit on the wood chairs by fire. Maybe some twinkle lights in the trees would add some ambiance to the space. Knowing that the property just outside the dome where the bed faces is not her property, made it intimidating to change or shower here. We did see someone walking around in the forest when we arrived. All of my questions were answered promptly and she was very kind.  Overall a good experience though.

description.summary: This is an air b&b you'll definitely remember.  Experience the magical feeling of waking up among the trees and birds.  Feel the exhilaration of taking an outdoor shower.  Enjoy the crackling fire and take the time to dream again. Nature, art, waterfalls and trails are all just outside your doorstep.  You don't want to miss this peaceful retreat.
description.space: This is a 24' geodesic dome with bed, couch, chair and incredible wood sculptures.  Two roll up windows allow for an expansive feel.  Just outside the dome is a mini kitchenette, bathroom, outdoor shower, table set and fire pit.   The dome is within an enclosed space that has an entrance way that is separate from the house.

description.neighborhood: This is a scenic wonderland. Trails, waterfalls, Georgian Bay, lakes, Blue Mountain are all outside your door step.  Meaford is 15 minutes away, Thornbury is 15 minutes away.  Collingwood is 1/2 hr away. Owen Sound is 1/2 hr away. There is a very vibrant art and music community in the area.

used community kitchen and it was clean and basic needs, of kettle microwave, toaster stove. 
very comfortable, very responsive. 
we lost hydro during the evening they came out as soon as we came back from town offering us a space heater. told us how to run the pellet stove when the hydro came back on. 
it was great over all experience

Was a last-minute request due to the snowy weather that was expected. The map brought us right to the designations. Once we arrived, the location is a public camp. I went to the check-in the office where the host greeted us and signed a waiver. They then escorted me to my tent. They briefed me on the room, the kitchen area, the public washrooms, and how to use the fireplace.

That being said. Yes, is a cute spot with, beautiful view, and kid friendly. But, it was cold. They do have a pellet fireplace installed, it would run and then automatically turn off due to a set timer or overheated fireplace that was pre set by the owners. Not ideal for the temperature drop we had. Take this inconsideration of winter bookings. 

I will definitely be going back this fall with the kids and enjoy the activities they could put on.

We are a family of 5, we stayed in the mid-winter with our 4-month-old daughter and 2 older sons and we enjoyed it. 

Very Family friendly and environment and the host was very responsive whenever we needed help or instructions.

Very clean, warm glamping experience in the winter.

We will definitely book this place again for Summer.

Awesome stay at Camp Adelaide. The place is as accurate and clean as the photos on Airbnb and the camp offers many amenities (shoutout to the lake and canoe) and a peaceful sleep. 
Make sure to bring equipment against the mosquitos. Could be even better if the washrooms/showers and shared kitchen get a refresh but overall it's very good.
Thank you!
The tent was super clean. Friendly and helpful owners/staff.
Espectacular

description.summary:
Please note that there are mosquitoes in the forest, especially at sunset time. 
Open field! Besides the Lake! Enjoy the sights and sounds of the forest!  
[Outdoor events]:  Canoe, kayak, pedal boats rent starting at 40cad/day!  You can bring your own non-motorized boats. 3 different trails within the property(including ATV trail!) Visit our farm with chickens, ducks and gooses. Enjoy the forest and wetland:) 
[Indoor events]: Pokers and Mahjong free for rent! Wifi provided!
description.space:

Can host up to 4 guests.

Additional single mattresses available for rent in the office. 

Sitting area - 2 chairs and 1 table 
Please bring your own linens and pillows.

No washroom facilities in the tent

Private Small Patio (Deck) with 2 outdoor chairs for each tent
Firewood BBQ grill provided - can be used as fire pit too!
description.access:
You have access to up to 360 acres of forests, grass fields and our beautiful lake!
 - Public bathroom at the boathouse (1 minute walk) 
 - Public shower room less than 5 minute walk
 - Public kitchen is about 50 m from the site on Sunrise (Site #5)
 - Ask our staff for FREE morning coffee and hot water!

You will find the following items at the boathouse:
- Fire extinguisher 
- First aid kit
- Water

Private Access:
- Small Patio (Deck) with 2 outdoor chairs. 
- BBQ Grill (firewood)

Laundry Facilities - Available at the lower level of Adelaide House
description.notes:
Wifi - Weak Signal
2 USB chargers and lights are provided. 
Electricity Limited - Please do not use large devices in the dome!
[Winter Booking]
Not functional when temperature is lower than -25C! Fireplace and Electrical Portable Heating- Warmth guaranteed! 
[Outdoor events]: Skating and snow shoeing(Few shoes open for reservation), Sledding, ice fishing(ice fishing houses open for reservation), snow ball fight, making snowman...
description.neighborhood:
Located in Camp Adelaide with boat for rent and outdoor entertainment facilities suitable for children to play with.  
Supplies for sale at the office. 
There is also a large grass field besides the house. 
You can find wild animals such as deers and foxes in the forest. 
Ski clubs near the town open for reservation. 
Restaurants and supermarkets open in the town, with 10 minutes drive.
description.house_rules:
-Quiet Hour is from 12am to 7am.  
-Take off your shoes in the tent.  
-No lifeguards at the beach. All boaters must wear lifejackets regardless of age or skill level. Boats need to be rented, or bring your own. Lifejackets available. 
-Do not feed wild life. Hiking is encouraged, hike carefully. Be mindful of ticks and wildlife. Hunting is NOT permitted on our grounds.  
-Roadways have a 20km/hour max rate. Please watch for those on foot.  
-Be respectful of all our guests and staff.  
-Bring your own bedding and pillows.  
-Smoking, vaping is not permitted under any roof on the grounds.

and travel

recent.comments:
We weren't really sure what to expect as we've never done a glamping experience before, but sufficed to say we were blown away! The setting is beautiful, and the location is highly convenient to downtown Banner Elk - a few minutes drive away. But, it's far enough that we felt like we were truly escaping. The decor in the geodomes was perfect, the finishing touches were thoughtful and complete. The bed was super comfortable. The bathroom is right outside the door and very clean and new. We particularly loved the hot tub and spent quite a bit of time in it enjoying the stars and the private hilltop setting. 

We seriously did not want to leave when it was time to check out! Also have to mention that for a the few questions we had, Joseph responded with lightning speed and was very helpful with some local hiking suggestions; he knows the area so well!

Can't recommend this glamping experience enough!

items.comments:
We weren't really sure what to expect as we've never done a glamping experience before, but sufficed to say we were blown away! The setting is beautiful, and the location is highly convenient to downtown Banner Elk - a few minutes drive away. But, it's far enough that we felt like we were truly escaping. The decor in the geodomes was perfect, the finishing touches were thoughtful and complete. The bed was super comfortable. The bathroom is right outside the door and very clean and new. Joseph has a hidden gem! Could not have asked for a more relaxing weekend. Everything that we were looking for! Would highly recommend this stay to anyone, has everything you need. Close in proximity to downtown banner elk and the banner elk winery. Joseph and his wife are amazing hosts, they are willing to go out of there way to do anything for guests.

This place was amazing. This is the first vacation in which the rainy weather only enhanced the experience. It’s location is perfect. Super close to town and tucked away nicely for privacy. The Nitti family are extremely kind and accommodating. The view from the dome is beautiful. From the mist on the mountain to watching a thunderstorm through a skylight. This gem will not stay hidden long. Can’t wait until the next visit.

Wow! We loved this place! The property is amazing!  We will be back for sure. We soaked in the hot tub for hours looking at the fields.  We fed the goats. The bed was really comfy and the bathroom tidy and clean. The host left us a basket of goodies. We had a fabulous relaxing stay celebrating a birthday! Highly recommended to stay with such thoughtful hosts.
Amazing stay! Highly recommend if you’re looking for a great place to glamp with great, thoughtful hosts. The dogs and goats were a fun little treat on top of it all!

Do yourself a favor and book a stay here! My husband and I went for an anniversary trip, we were pleased to find a basket of snacks, yeast bread, and two little bottles of wine on our bed upon arrival. The hosts also had soda, juice, coffee, tea, and bottled water for their guests in the kitchenette (which is something you don’t often find). It was clear they pay attention to details as far as things you may need during your stay. The hosts were kind and responsive. 
The entire place was very clean. The geodome was cozy, appealing, and welcoming. We loved everything about it and will be returning!

You won’t want to leave! We had a perfect weekend at Dr. Joe’s. The geodome is a little piece of heaven on earth. We had planned on a few hikes and visiting some restaurants but once we checked in we didn’t want to leave. The hosts were very accommodating and the home had everything we could’ve possibly needed. We cannot wait to book again!

description.summary:
Stunningly design upscale Geodome Overlooking the vineyards of Banner Elk Winery and the surrounding Mountains . A Unique Glamping Experience offering a Spectacular way of emerging in Nature's  beauty in Luxury .Private Outdoor Area with gas grill and  Firepit Area .Enjoy Your private Hot Tub as the sunsets .Meet Our Curly Hair Angora Goats  . Swing on a hammock under the large Pines ,Relax at our Sreamside Gazebo. Only 5 min from many Banner Elk Restaurants. Book An Experience Like No Other!
,
description.space:
The meticulously designed  interior consists of a comfy Kingsize Memory Foam bed,  high quality bedding ,dining table, bean bag , Mini Split Heat/Cooling ,Kerug Coffee Maker and so much more! .Thehuge Bay Window and Skylight bring  nature indoors.  Unique Wine barrel door leads to a small pass thru and onto Your well equipped private Bathroom. 
The private multi level outdoor entertainment area  was created around The “Awe Inspiring View” . Blackstone Grill and Solo Firepit enhance Your Outdoor Experience  The Retreat had been designed with the utmost care to provide a Peaceful and Tranquil Experience . Our private parking area is at the lower end of the property and Lodging is up on hillside so a brief walk Up the gravel driveway or path will bring you to your Geodome . 
There is a shared Kitchenette that is Available which includes a Large Toaster Oven, Blender, Mini Ice Nugget Maker and Basic Accessories .
Our Covered  Gazebo is along the babbling brook at the lower part of the property, a great place to picnic ,read a book or enjoy the lush surrounding ountryside.
description.access: Part of this Unique Glamping Experience is a visit to Our Curly Haired Angora Goat Farm .A special path through the woods and across  a small bridge willl bring you to their home, where you can Meet and Greet them . This Opportunity will be available  Specific times only
description.notes: Nearby Dining Options are Endless as we are located less than 5 minutes away from Downtown Banner Elk with a multitude of Restaurants, Outdoor Dining, Concerts and Drinking Establishments including a  Local MicroBrewery . We are a short distance from The Blue Ridge Parkway ,Linville, Roan and Grandfather Mtn .The opportunities for Adventure is Endless. Go for a Hike or Bike in the Surrounding Mountains,  Tubing down a nearby Cool water River. Make sure to check out Blowing Rock and Valle Crucis, which offer a Plethora of Galleries, and boutiques .. Free Music and Activities abound in these Mountains
description.neighborhood: The Perfect Mountain Location! 4100ft Elev. Set on a hilltop overlooking  Vineyards & Villa of The Banner Elk Winery ,Mountain and Rolling Farmland ,yet 4 min from Downtown Banner Elk. Both Tranquil and Convenient .For Exploring there is no better place. Close to BlueRidge Parkway, Linville 20 min , Beech Mountain 10 min, Grandfather 15 min, Roan Mountain TN 25 min, Valle Crucis 15 min , Boone 26 min  Even The Creeper Trail in Damascus VA is only a 1hr 15 min pleasant drive .
description.interaction: Both myself and my wife will assist in any way possible to make your stay Unforgettable. As an Avid four season Backpacker , Adventurer and  Award Winning Nature Photographer  ,I am excited to offer You suggestions as to where to go and what to do . Don't forget to stop by my Downtown Banner Elk Photo Art Gallery to see some of the Local treasures on Canvas .

THE HOUSE RULES 


﻿﻿NO ANIMALS of ANY KIND allowed on property as this is a Working Farm for the Safety of Animals and everyone This includes  ESD -Emotional Support Dogs and Service Dogs (Exemption issued due to Safety ). .NO EXCEPTIONS!!! You will be asked to leave with no refund.﻿
- Maximum of 2 Persons per Dome
ALL Guests MUST be registered at time of Booking No visitors on property to maintain Peace ,Safety and Security ﻿
Our Glamping Experience is designed for adults. Due to safety hazards of property terrain and farm animals No children allowed.
All guests must be at least 25 yrs old .

title: Rodney, Canada

recent.comments:
An amazing place to stay if you are looking for some peace and quiet away from the busy city! Has everything you need to cook, keep you clean and keep your electronics charged.

You’ll get lost in sound of nature and the crash of the waves from the lake below. The lake itself is just a 10 minute walk away through a beautiful nature path.

The host is extremely kind, friendly and more than willing to make your stay the best they possibly can!

If you want to camp with extra comfort this is the place to go!

items.comments:
An amazing place to stay if you are looking for some peace and quiet away from the busy city! Has everything you need to cook, keep you clean and keep your electronics charged.

You’ll get lost in sound of nature and the crash of the waves from the lake below. The lake itself is just a 10 minute walk away through a beautiful nature path.

The host is extremely kind, friendly and more than willing to make your stay the best they possibly can!

If you want to camp with extra comfort this is the place to go!
Had such an amazing time at this little get away. The photos don’t do justice to how beautiful this dome was. Highly recommend to people who want to escape the city and enjoy nature.
Beautiful location

Absolutely amazing view of Lake Erie! Nice short walk to the beach, with an amazing view from the campsite. Watching the moon over the water was by far the best way to see the moon. Our host was super accommodating and everything was clean and well stocked. Definitely recommend!
This place is the perfect oasis! Our host was super friendly and helpful. The view is absolutely stunning and the Yert was clean. Tons of creativity went into this. I give this place a 10/10.

Off-Grid Glamping at its finest! 

Our host was super friendly and helped bring our bags down a short walking path to the dome which is situated in a very private, natural oasis overlooking Lake Erie. Everything was very clean and pristine.  There was loads of fire wood, bbq, propane, cooking utensils and drinking water. Literally all we had to bring was food, clothes and some bug spray. 

The bed was nice and comfortable and we stayed toasty with the wood stove inside. There is even a little battery pack to operate a light and charge our phones with. 

The outdoor washroom was nicest “outhouse” I have ever used. 

Very cool experience overall and I would recommend to anyone!

description.summary:
Enjoy the lovely setting of this dome nestled in a Carolinian forest with the views of lake erie! Just a 3minute drive to unwind on the beach , fishing  at the port glasgow marina or just stay in ,enjoy the tranquil vibe of the dome! 
a very unique stay !
