description.summary: STAIRWAY TO HEAVEN offers one of the most unique features at GLAMP Dunn's Creek. Not only will you find all of life's modern conveniences but guests will enjoy their very own private stairway to heaven with fantastic views and private dining. There's a king bed with trundle, living room, kitchenette, and electric fireplace. Also features a private hot tub on the patio.
description.space:
HEY FRIEND! WELCOME TO GLAMP 📚😇 Stairway to Heaven by STAY MINTY

Let nature shine with a visit to GLAMP Dunn's Creek, in the Great Smoky Mountains of Tennessee. In true Stay Minty fashion, GLAMP is all about 🍾🥂celebrating all the ✨shimmers in nature and in life, surrounded by people you care about. We do this by combining all the fun and adventure of camping with a few of life's modern conveniences you just can't live without while keeping the signature style and trendy interiors Stay Minty is best known for. With eight uniquely GLAMP-styled accommodations to choose from, guests will experience something new with each and every visit.

⚠️BEFORE YOU BOOK

❗ No pets allowed
❗ 21+ to rent
❗ There will be bugs :)
❗ Reservations are non-refundable
❗ We highly recommend travel insurance
❗ Discounts not available via third parties
❗ Best price always available by booking direct
❗ Wifi or internet access may not be available.
❗ Cellular signal may not be available
❗ Your dome, though it may be full of glamorous amenities, is still very much an uninsulated tent that will be affected by the outdoor temperatures and weather conditions. Please prepare accordingly and check the local weather prior to arrival. 

📚😇 ABOUT STAIRWAY TO HEAVEN 
- 3 guests, Private Stairway to Heaven, Hot Tub, 415 sqft.
- Getting to this dome requires walking up at least 30 stairs.
- This is our only dome without a fire pit

Booking this listing will guarantee your stay at STAIRWAY TO HEAVEN, our dome named after the famous song by Led Zeppelin and with this dome offering a private stairway to a private lookout and stars reaching to heaven, what name could be better!?

At 415 square feet, the dome is larger than the average sized hotel room so there's plenty of room to spread out and get comfy! You can expect a full sized fridge, dishwasher, microwave, countertop burner, toaster, coffee maker and electric fireplace. There's also a small dining table and seating. Outside, you'll find more seating, and a charcoal grill.

📐 SIZE MATTERS
- Diameter ............... 23 feet
- Height .................... 11 feet
- Max Occupancy ... 4 guests
- Max Parking .......... 2 cars 

🛏️ SLEEPING ARRANGEMENTS
- Bdrm ............ 1 king bed w/trundle
- Living ............ Seating and electric fireplace
- Kitchen ......... hot plate, fridge, dishwasher
- Bathroom .... sinks, shower, toilet
- Outside ........  charcoal grill, seating
- This is our only dome without a fire pit

⛺ DOME LOCATION
- Surroundings .... private, lots of stairs to access dome and private viewing area, private picnic area over head with great views.
- Parking ................ parking lot

GUEST AMENITIES & EXTRAS
🧴Shampoo, Conditioner, Body Wash, 🧼Soap, 🧻Toilet Paper,Paper Towels, Trash Bags, 🍳Cookware,🥃Glasses, 🍽️Dishware, Flatware, 🧂Salt & Pepper, 🃏Games, 📻Record Player, 🛌Bedding, Blankets, Pillows, Sheets, Hot tub

OUTDOOR ACTIVITIES
🎣 Fishing, 🥾 Hiking, 🥏 Frisbee, Corn Hole.

CHECK-IN ......... 4p 🕓
CHECK OUT ..... 10a 🕙

🗺️ SITE LOCATION
- Located in Cosby, Tennessee
- Highlights: wildflower viewing, hiking trails
- 3 miles from Nat'l Park
- 22 miles from Gatlinburg

Cosby is an area of the national park without huge crowds, where facilities are rarely full. That's why it's a favorite among locals and long-time visitors to the Smoky Mountains. The main draw for most people to the Cosby area is hiking and white water rafting.

GUEST REGISTRATION
Upon booking with us, simply register your stay within 48 hours to gain access to our guest portal where you'll find reservation and property details, access codes and other pertinent information. To complete registration, you will be asked for personal details and will upload your driver's license and a selfie (don't worry - it's super simple!). 

★OUR PROMISE★
At  GLAMP by Stay Minty, we’re a dedicated and small (yet mighty) team on a mission to bring more passion and joy into the world through unique shared experiences. And great news for you, we both have the same goal: for your stay to be nothing short of perfect. With that said, sometimes the unexpected happens. You are camping and these domes, are not much different than a tent.... well maybe little cooler, but that’s why you’re here! If anything comes up, we promise to spring into action faster than Taylor Swift after a break-up and do everything we can to resolve it… and then maybe write a hit album about it. I mean, we are from “Music City, USA”.

If you have any issues or are unhappy with your stay, be sure to call, text, or email us like a good friend so we can get your stay back to minty fresh.  Please be mindful that there will be bugs, temperatures will be warm in the summer and cold in the winter so come prepared to camp and enjoy the great outdoors!


We look forward to you booking our dome and hosting your stay!!

xoxo,
Stay Minty!
description.notes:
FEE SCHEDULE

We want you to have a good time but you remain responsible for any damage or excessive cleaning caused during your stay by anyone who enters the property.

Please understand this fee schedule exists only to deter bad actors who plan on causing chaos and damage to our properties. We have no intention of excessively or randomly charging fees to five star guests.

DAMAGE / EXCESSIVE CLEANING FEES
from $250 .......... Excessive Cleaning
from $750 .......... Hazardous Waste


POLICY VIOLATION FEES
from $850 .......... Pet Policy Violation
from $950 .......... Smoking Policy Violation
description.house_rules:
TRIP INSURANCE
Planning a vacation can be stressful enough when everything goes right but adding a pandemic to the mix adds a whole lot of uncertainty. Trip insurance keeps you from losing your vacation rental investment if you need to cancel for a covered reason. We're here to help if you have any questions!

GLAMPING RULES
These are all no brainers but we don't want any confusion so we're gonna state the obvious:

- no smoking (for real)
- for safety reasons, no pets are allowed.
- no parties (gatherings not exceeding max occupancy are cool)
- no horseplay or yelling
- no rearranging furniture (leave the decorating to us)
- no confetti or tape on walls (or anything else that would cause damage)
- no blocking driveways, garages, illegal parking or ignoring posted signage
- don't enter the unit early without permission
- use cosmetic wipes or cloths for makeup removal (not our white linen!)
- Every person over the age of 18 who will be staying on site must sign a waiver

BE A GOOD NEIGHBOR
Please have some respect for your dome neighbors. If you make excessive noise or cause complaints by fellow glampers, we reserve the right to revoke your stay without a refund.

TRASH
GLAMP Dunn Creek by Stay Minty is located in the Great Smoky Mountains which is known for Black Bears. It is critical that you follow all directions and signage regarding the disposal of garbage and trash. Leaving trash out where a smart black bear can get to it can bring all sorts of consequences and can even be dangerous. 

MINIMUM AGE REQUIREMENTS
The primary renter has to be at least 25 years old. There are exceptions made on a case-by-case basis and with a paid security deposit and our express written permission. Contact us for details.

SECURITY CAMERAS
We have cameras on the campground but no cameras inside the dome. 

GUEST REGISTRATION
After you book your reservation, simply register your stay within 48 hours to gain access to our guest portal where you'll find reservation and property details, access codes and other details. To complete registration, you will be asked for personal details and will upload your driver's license and a selfie (don't worry - it's super simple!). Everyone over the age of 18 must sign our contract and waiver within 48 hours of booking or we reserve the right to cancel your booking.

FEE SCHEDULE
From bachelor and bachelorette parties to birthday celebrations, guy's getaways and girls weekends, we welcome groups of all sizes who celebrate together. We want you to have a good time but you remain responsible for any damage or excessive cleaning caused during your stay by anyone who enters the dome or sets foot on the GLAMPground.

Please understand this fee schedule exists only to deter bad actors who plan on causing chaos and damage to our properties. We have no intention of excessively or randomly charging fees to five star guests.

DAMAGE / EXCESSIVE CLEANING FEES
from $250 .......... Wall Damage
from $250 .......... Excessive Cleaning
from $500 .......... Re-staging Furniture
from $25 ............ Damaged Linen
from $50 ............ Damaged Bedding
from $500 .......... Hazardous Waste
from $250 .......... Confetti / Glitter
from $75 ............ Lost Item Return

POLICY VIOLATION FEES
from $250 .......... Police Visit
from $500 .......... Neighbor Complaint
from $850 .......... Pet Policy Violation
from $950 .......... Smoking Policy Violation

SUPPLY STARTER KIT
No one wants to have to worry about getting to the store after traveling all day! That's why we provide a supply starter kit - to get you through the first day or two of your stay. 

The kit includes paper towels, dish sponge, two dishwasher pods, five trash bags, dishwashing liquid, all-purpose cleaner, a small selection of coffee pods, hand soap, shampoo, conditioner, body wash and two rolls of toilet paper in each bathroom.

FIVE STAR GUEST POLICY
At the end of the day, this is still camping! We try our very best to deliver the best experience but you should be aware that you are booking a dome in the mountains and are not a hotel with hundreds of rooms or some big company with gazillions of dollars and armies of staff. We're a small team providing good service to good people. We promise to treat you better than we expect to be treated and we ask that you do the same.

recent.comments: Kacy went above and beyond by providing some extras, such as a basket of goodies, which my teenage daugthers liked! The home was clean and comfortable and easily housed our group of 5. We enjoyed the country setting and exploring the beautiful area. The hammock was very relaxing, there was plenty of parking, we love the couch and the kitchen chairs!!!

items.comments: Kacy went above and beyond by providing some extras, such as a basket of goodies, which my teenage daugthers liked! The home was clean and comfortable and easily housed our group of 5. We enjoyed the country setting and exploring the beautiful area. The hammock was very relaxing, there was plenty of parking, we love the couch and the kitchen chairs!!!

Our stay was great!!!!!

Kacy and her husband were super accommodating and even brought us something we needed during our stay that was out. 

And she is very responsive all the time, even before we got there she answered all my questions before our stay. 
I would recommend this house, it is clean and exactly as described. 
Kacy is a great host!!!!!

We had a great stay.  We came to “town” for a small wedding for a friend at the local brewery and wanted something to make our visit memorable and Flat Top did not disappoint.  The house is unique and well appointed.  The framing of the house offers interesting acoustics that kept us entertained for hours.

We enjoyed the firepit late into the Saturday evening of our stay and were amazed at the number of fireflies that came out to join us.  Reminding us of the simpler joys of childhood of chasing them around the yard and failing to realize we do not get to enjoy the same in our regular urban settings.

We look for unique Airbnb’s to help highlight the few trips we get away and Flat Top proved to be a 10 out of 10.  Unique, Quiet, Comfortable, and not lacking in amenities.  Thanks Kacy!!!

We loved staying in this unique dome house! There was plenty of space to spread out and relax. The beds were very comfortable with quality linens and pillows. 

We cooked every meal in the spacious kitchen during our two-night stay, and we had pretty much everything we needed. We had two young kids in our party, and they loved it. Great place for families!
One of the coolest and most unique places I have stayed. Very clean, with great attention to detail.

This cabin was amazing!! It was an ideal location for a little getaway to celebrate my daughter for her birthday. It is beautifully decorated, comfortable, cozy, & stocked with all the essentials. Kacy thought of everything & I can’t think of anything else we would have needed to ensure we had a nice, relaxing weekend away. The entire experience from check in to check out was top notch.

Really enjoyed our stay here. Furniture, decorations are all in excellent condition and very modern looking. The most comfiest couch we’ve ever sat on in a rental place. Kacy was very understanding and always responsive. She let us stay longer on our checkout day since she didn’t have it booked for that day. thank you again for this unique experience and a beautiful place.

description.summary:
Enjoy the sounds of nature when you stay in this unique place. This dome house offers relaxing retreat in the beautiful Appalachian Mountains!  3 bedroom, 2 bathroom that can sleep 8 is ready to host your next getaway! 
Located on 10 acres and equipped with a fire pit, firewood, and plenty of room to explore. Amenities include: Grill, cooking equipment, air fryer, instant, towels, washer and dryer, sheets, board games and puzzles. Close to skiing, rafting, hiking, mountain biking, and more!

Laundry area with washer and dryer (detergent available) Observatory area at the top of the house- twin bed for relaxing and taking in the beautiful views.

hosts.about:
I am an elementary school teacher.  My husband, Wesley, is a Golf Professional at Old Toccoa Farm in Blue Ridge, Georgia.

Living in the foothills of the Appalachian Mountains, we very much enjoy exploring the great outdoors, whether we are hiking on a remote trail or enjoying the quiet and peace on our back porch. We enjoy great company, tasty and unique food, a glass of fine wine, and travels across the world.

To read more about our glamping getaways, visit North Georgia Glamping.

recent.comments: What a great getaway. Very relaxing and very enjoyable. Will definitely go back.

items.comments: What a great getaway. Very relaxing and very enjoyable. Will definitely go back.
A fantastic little get away place for rest and relaxation. Fantastic views of the night sky.
My husband and I had an awesome weekend at the geodome! It was like camping, but with all the amenities to make our stay nice and comfy. We will definitely be recommending this place!

This was one of the best vacations we’ve ever had. My kids absolutely had the best time and the fireworks Rebekah recommended at the vineyard were the most beautiful thing I’ve ever seen. We will absolutely be back. Thank you so much.
Everything was as stated. Gave great directions. Hosts were friendly & responded to questions quickly. Such a fun & well setup place. Grandkids loved it!! Memories made for sure!!
The place is as described, and it felt private and secluded which was perfect for glamping.

My two boys and I had a really great time staying in the dome tent! Lots of memories made. It was a perfect blend of camping and comfort. It rained quite a bit while we were staying, which was really the only downside, but we had a wonderful time anyways. Great space and great hosts! Highly recommend!

description.summary:
Inspired by the desire of adventure, this Geodesic Dome rests on private lot. Stargaze from the magnificent deck. Enjoy hiking on the trails in Ellijay, biking on the Pinhoti, and swimming in the nearby Carter's Lake.

If the dome is not available to book, visit our other rental, a 1977 Vintage Airstream to check availability.
description.space:
The dome invites you to explore the Appalachian foothills and its surroundings, lakes, rivers and towns.  Enjoy a true glamping experience, private bathroom, a bathtub, and a fantastic outdoor shower.  The dome has one full bed, two twin beds, and a futon.

The Argentine Geodesic Dome is a harmonious blend of camping and the comforts of home. The luxurious beds are perfect for sleeping in and resting. The bathroom, shower, and tub are the perfect addition to a magical glamping experience.

Please note that the Geodesic Dome is basically a large tent. During the summer, it gets warm inside the dome during the day (while you're out exploring!) and cools off nicely during the night. 

The cowboy kitchen includes pots, pans, silverware, coleman cooktop, charcoal grill, paper towels, plates, cups, lighter/matches, coffee maker, and toaster. The perfect setup to cook a meal in the great outdoors.

What we provide:
ingredients for s'mores
a couple bottles of water
towels
soap/shampoo
description.access: Downtown Ellijay is about 15 minutes away. Carter's Lake is 5 minutes away.
description.neighborhood:
Carter's Lake is 5 minutes away. It's beautiful, pristine, lightly trafficked. 

Downtown Ellijay is 15 minutes away. It's a must-visit, mountain town: antique shops, wine bars, restaurants, ice cream parlours. 

Hiking trails are nearby but requiring driving to them. Some trails are 15 minutes away, some are an hour away. All are worth exploring, it just depends on your preference.
description.transit:
Exploring the area will require driving. We are about 15 minutes from downtown Ellijay. Blue Ridge is about 35 minutes away. 
If you are visiting vineyards in the area, keep in mind there isn't Uber or Lyft.
description.interaction:
Check in is independent. When our schedules allow we love to meet our guests. We are always available by phone. 
We very much respect the privacy of our guests.
description.house_rules:
Sorry, no pets allowed.
No fireworks or parties.

name: Luxury lakefront Geodesic Glamping Dome - Fox
title: Unorganized Centre Parry Sound District, Canada

location.address: Unorganized Centre Parry Sound District, ON, Canada

description.summary:
Situated on over 2 acres in Ontario’s beautiful cottage country, our luxury geodesic dome is the perfect escape from the busyness of everyday life.
Experience camping without sacrificing comfort as each dome is equipped with 2 queen beds, kitchenette with appliances, full size bathroom and linens. We have 4 domes on site each with their own space. Enjoy your morning coffee overlooking the swim-friendly water of Deer Lake before exploring all it has to offer by kayak (rent upon availability)
description.notes:
Dome Rules:

Shoes: No shoes within the dome. The area surrounding the dome is sandy - in order to keep the floors clean please place your outdoor shoes on the coat/shoe rack. 

Smoking: No smoking inside the dome. Extra cleaning fees to remove odor and stains may be applied.

BBQ:  BBQ can be used leisurely by guests. Propane tank and bbq utensils are provided. BBQ utensils can be found in the bottom shelf of the utility cart inside the dome. Please cleanup after yourselves and keep the grill clean. If found left dirty and requires extra cleaning, an extra cleaning fee will be applied.

Fire Pit: Fire wood is not provided. Do not leave fires unattended; please extinguish  fire before turning in for the night.

Furniture: Furniture such as a lounge chair, bed, night tables, dining table, outdoor patio set, and muskoka chairs are provided for guest use. Please leave furniture in the position that it was found before checking out. 

AC/HVAC: Our domes are equipped with AC/HVAC units to keep guests comfortable in Ontario’s hot Summers and harsh Winters. Please ensure the unit is turned off before checking out. PLEASE NOTE THE MINI-SPLIT ON THE WALL IS NOT ACTIVE DURING THE WINTER. The heater on the hall tree is what is used during the Winter months - please turn the knob to reach desired temperature. ***IN THE SUMMER MONTHS: Please leave the AC ON at 72F at check-out*** 

Linens: 2 towels, 2 hand towels, 1 bath mat, 2 throw blankets, 4 pillows, 1 duvet comforter, and 2 bedsheets. Please note the top bed does not include a comforter. Please throw all the linens into the laundry hamper before checking out. 

Kitchen Utensils and Appliances: 1 frying pan, 1 pot, spatula, tongs, steak knife, 4 forks, 4 knives, 4 spoons, can opener, grater, wine opener, 4 wine glasses, 4 drinking glasses, 4 small coffee mugs, 4 big plates, 4 small plates, 4 bowls, cutting board, small drying rack, drying mat, microwave, single burner, kettle, toaster and mini fridge. Please ensure all dishes are washed after use and appliances are turned off before checking out. If dishes are not washed extra cleaning fees may be applied. 

Noise: Although we would like for you to be as loud as you’d like, we have to be mindful of our neighbours. Please note that each dome is is 40ft apart so it may be possible for you to hear the neighbouring guests. The domes are not 100% soundproof so you may hear what is happening outside the domes. Taking this into consideration, please keep noise to a minimum after 10PM. We cannot guarantee a noise-free experience during your stay.

Guest Information:

Parking: Parking is provided in the paved area next to the ‘Cosco’ container. Please use the pathway next to the parking area to walk down to the domes. Please note this pathway is approximately 100ft in length and declines gradually. 

Breaker box: Use one electronic kitchen appliance at a time to avoid tripping the breaker. In case of a breaker trip please reset the breaker located in the far kitchen cabinet. 

First Aid Kit: Stored in the far right kitchen cabinet. In case of emergencies please call 911.

Fire Extinguisher: Stored in the far right kitchen cabinet. In case of emergencies please call 911 or South River Machar Fire Department. Cooking is the number one cause of residential fires in Ontario. Please do not leave your cooking unattended and avoid having loose clothing and articles near the burner. NEVER attempt to extinguish a grease fire with water. 

Shower: Guests are able to enjoy hot showers, however, it is important to note the hot water runs for an average of 8 minutes. If the hot water runs out, guests will need to wait 30 mins to an hour for the next guest to be able to enjoy a hot shower. Please bring your own hair care products and bodywash as they are not provided. 

Water: Our water is tested regularly and is safe for consumption, however it is not chlorinated. Please bring your own drinking water if you feel more comfortable, or the tap water can be boiled in the kettle provided. 

Kayak Rental: single-seater kayak with life jacket and paddle board available for the entire duration of your stay. 4 kayaks - first come first serve. $25 each. Advance notice required - check with host if rental is possible. ADULT SIZE LIFE JACKETS ONLY. KIDS SIZE LIFE JACKETS ARE NOT PROVIDED. 

Paddle Board Rental: 10 ft inflatable paddle board available for the entire duration of your stay. 3 paddle boards - first come first serve. $20 each. Advance notice required - check with host of rental is possible. 

Wild animals: This area is home to a lot of Ontario wildlife including deer, caribou, moose, black bears, coyotes, and gray wolves. Although sightings are rare, please keep this in mind and use your best judgment if seen. DO NOT approach.

recent.comments: Joseph has a hidden gem! Could not have asked for a more relaxing weekend. Everything that we were looking for! Would highly recommend this stay to anyone, has everything you need. Close in proximity to downtown banner elk and the banner elk winery. Joseph and his wife are amazing hosts, they are willing to go out of there way to do anything for guests.

items.comments: Joseph has a hidden gem! Could not have asked for a more relaxing weekend. Everything that we were looking for! Would highly recommend this stay to anyone, has everything you need. Close in proximity to downtown banner elk and the banner elk winery. Joseph and his wife are amazing hosts, they are willing to go out of there way to do anything for guests.

What an amazing Glamping weekend my husband and I had! 2 days is just not enough and you right away want to come back. Jo & Marianella thought of everything and are wonderful hosts.
You walk into your Geodome and feel right at home. The Décor is just beautiful. A welcome basket with all kinds of goodies was a nice surprise. You have your own coffee station inside. The kitchen is in a separate building and has everything from soda, coffee, tea, water bottles & farm fresh eggs. Your private bathroom is only two steps from your dome entrance. 
The Blackstone Grill was my husband's favorite. He made us breakfast every morning - all dishes, silverware and cooking utensils are provided.
Sitting by the Solo firepit in the evening was so relaxing and we were lucky to have clear nights with wonderful stars....and don't forget your swimsuits. The hot tub is right outside your door!
Saying Good bye was a little easier with a visit from the goats and a photo op right before check out.

description.summary: Stunningly design upscale Geodome Overlooking the vineyards of Banner Elk Winery and the surrounding Mountains . A Unique Glamping Experience offering a Spectacular way of emerging in Nature's  beauty in Luxury .Private Outdoor Area with gas grill and  Firepit Area .Enjoy Your private Hot Tub as the sunsets .Meet Our Curly Hair Angora Goats  . Swing on a hammock under the large Pines ,Relax at our Sreamside Gazebo. Only 5 min from many Banner Elk Restaurants. Book An Experience Like No Other!
description.space:
Luxury " Happy Goat " GeoDome with Hot tub! .Breathtaking Views Overlooking the Vineyards of The Banner Elk Winery, surrounding Mountains and Countryside . The Geodome offers a Spectacular way of Embracing Natures Beauty in Luxury and Comfort.

The Meticulously Designed Interior consists of a Dreamy Memory Foam Kingsize Bed ,Dining Table for Two, Comfy Loveseat and Bean Bag Chair ,along with many other Amenities . The View through the Large bay window and skylight bring in Nature with unforgettable Views .A Unique Wine Barrel entrance leads to Your Private well equipped Bathroom .
Your Private Outside Multi level Entertainment area includes a Blackstone Grill , Custom Wine Barrel Dining Counter ,Solo Firepit area . Enjoy Your private Hot tub as The Sunsets or watching The Stars , Cook up a Steak on The Blackstone Grill , Toast Marshmallows over The Solo Firepit as You take in The Spectacular Sights and Sounds of Pure nature.

Don't forget Your Exclusive" Greet and Meet" with Our Curly Haired Angora Goat Farm as part of Your Stay for That Memorable Moment and Photo Op.

Enjoy The peace of your surrounding in a Hammock under The Large Pine Trees

Our beautiful Gazebo on the babbling stream offers the perfect spot for enjoying a picnic, reading a book, or just taking in the beauty of the surrounding Countryside .

There is even a shared Kitchenette room available ,with Large Toaster Oven ,Blender ,Mini Nugget Ice Machine and other basic accessories . However , Nearby Dining options are endless as we are located just minutes away for Downtown Banner Elk with a Multitude of restaurants and Outside dining and Drinking Establishments .

Located only a short distance from the Blue Ridge Parkway, the opportunities for adventure are endless. Go for a hike in the surrounding mountains, take a bike ride along the parkway or go tubing down the nearby river. Make sure to check out the artistic communities of Blowing Rock and Valle Crucis, which offer a plethora of galleries, boutiques, and antique shops. Experience the thrills of the Grandfather Mountain ,Linville ,Roan Mountain and The Blue Ridge Parkway, providing an Endless Opportunity of Outdoor Adventure
description.neighborhood: The Perfect Mountain Location! 4100ft Elev. Set on a hilltop overlooking  Vineyards & Villa of The Banner Elk Winery   The Winery for Award Winning Wine and Live Music on weekends . Peaceful Mountain and Rolling Farmland Views , yet 4 min from Downtown Banner Elk. Both Tranquil and convenient. There is no better place to explore some of the prettiest scenery in the Southeast. Close to BlueRidge Parkway, Linville 20 min , Beech Mountain 10 min, Grandfather 15 min, Roan Mountain TN 25 min, Valle Crucis 15 min , Boone 26 min  Even The Creeper Trail in Damascus VA is only a 1hr 15 min pleasant drive .Visit the winery for award winning wine and Live music on weekends
description.house_rules:
THE HOUSE RULES 


﻿﻿NO ANIMALS of ANY KIND allowed on property as this is a Working Farm for the Safety of Animals and everyone This includes  ESD -Emotional Support Dogs and Service Dogs (Exemption issued due to Safety ). .NO EXCEPTIONS!!! You will be asked to leave with no refund.﻿
- Maximum of 2 Persons per Dome
ALL Guests MUST be registered at time of Booking No visitors on property to maintain Peace ,Safety and Security ﻿
Our Glamping Experience is designed for adults. Due to safety hazards of property terrain and farm animals No children allowed.
All guests must be at least 25 yrs old . 
-NO Smoking of any kind/Vaping inside any enclosed spaces 
        $250 Cleaning fee for smoking  which is only permitted in Firepit area
 -Goat Farm visitation will be 8am -7 pm 
- Quiet Hours are from 10 pm -8 am
- Guest assumes Full Responsibility for all damages, excessive cleaning charges, and/or missing items. 
- Hot Tub and Covers -Will be inspected before and after each rental., you will be charges a minimum fee of $150 as a excessive cleaning fee for misuse . Cover must remain on Hot tub when not in use . If cover is left off  hot tub ,water temperature will not recover for the remainder of your stay . Please Shower prior to use

hosts.about: We've been in the real estate business for 20+ years.  This includes rental properties, flipping, building and realtor.  When we came across the dome concept, we knew it would fit perfectly in Chattanooga.  We had to have one.  The interior feel of the dome is engulfing.  It surrounds you with warmth, comfort, positive energy and wonderful acoustics.  We are currently looking for that special lot to build our own personal dome residence.

recent.comments: We loved staying at the dome! It was very clean and such a unique experience. We highly recommend it!

items.comments: We loved staying at the dome! It was very clean and such a unique experience. We highly recommend it!

We loved our time in the dome! Glenn and Donna are such thoughtful hosts. The cleanliness of the space is also worth noting as it’s something I find that helps with feeling more comfortable during my stay. Thank you for making us feel at home. I also just appreciate domes and clay/concrete structures. So architecturally, it was very fun to stay in this house. I would absolutely stay again and recommend to others!

Some folks have complained about the neighborhood but it’s completely fine. The location is so close to everything you might want to do in Chattanooga!! The place was unique and perfect for a weekend trip and Glenn and Donna were so kind, I had a great time and would definitely stay again!!

When we first drove up I was nervous about the neighborhood but everything was good and the place was above what we expected. If you forgot something they had it. Snacks and drinks were left for us. Towels were great also. A very unique experience. Great Great Great
The place was just like the pictures showed. The owners were very helpful and were willing to help. Everything was laid out for you for clean up. The place spotless. Thank you for the stay!!
Absolutely loved Dome sweet Dome! Great weekend getaway! We had the best time! The owners quickly respond and also had everything we needed. The bed is super comfortable. We hope to come back again!
great place! it's a super unique Airbnb and is perfect for couples looking for a getaway.

description.summary: Welcome to Dome-anooga. This is the first monolithic dome home in the City of Chattanooga.  Why get a hotel room when you can have the entire place as your home?  This dome features a kitchen, 1 murphy  tempur -pedic queen bed, 1 bath,  and all the wonderful amenities of home.  Privacy fence and outdoor patio for grilling. Sorry we can't accept pets at this time.  Be sure to play the music channel so you can hear the acoustics!! Only minutes from downtown Chattanooga and all attractions.
description.space: The minute you walk through the door, the dome envelopes you with warmth and safety.  The round space feels endless.  There are no corners to end your vision.  It makes your body feel alive.
description.access: Guests have access to the entire space with the exception of the loft.  The loft holds the water heater and WiFi.
description.notes: The dome is so tight that a window needs to be open when using the clothes dryer.  This will dry clothes much quicker and make dryer more efficient.
description.neighborhood: The dome is located 10 minutes from downtown and most major attractions.  The aquarium is on the waterfront surrounded by wonderful restaurants.  From the aquarium you can walk up to the art district and visit the Hunter Museum.  Take the walking bridge over the river to North Chattanooga for unique boutique shopping.  Surrounding the city are top notch hiking trails and mountain climbing.  Tons more to do in Chattanooga the scenic city.
description.transit: You’ll have to drive into the city.  Parking does cost downtown.  However you can rent a bicycle for $2 and cruise the city that way as well.  Uber’s are readily available.
description.interaction: Guests can email, text, Airbnb message or phone.  Do not hesitate to contact.  We will reply as soon as we can.

description.summary:
High in the hills outside Louisville sits our relaxing countryside hideaway, a 4,500 square foot handcrafted stone and timber home offering pleasant views and quiet country nights. 

The perfect place to start your Bourbon Trail trip; only twenty minutes to downtown Louisville, ten minutes to the casino, and five minutes to The Sporting Club, our home sits atop the hills on the Indiana side of the Ohio River.

Relax and enjoy the birds and the wildlife sightings and the peace of the country.
description.space: This listing is for a lockable bedroom. It has a king size bed. It is in my home. It is a private room but has a shared bathroom to shower. You will share this bathroom with other guests. There are also several other bathrooms in the home which you are welcome to use, and you have access to the rest of the house while you are here: including the patio, living room, tv room, kitchen, dining room, etc.
description.notes: **You are not renting the entire home for yourself.
description.house_rules: GUESTS WITH DOGS: We love dogs, but we ask that yours be properly house trained, meaning they do not chew on furniture or have accidents in the home. We ask that you do not bring any aggressive dog(s). And we ask that you do not leave your dog(s) in the room unattended for long periods without caging them. Thank you.

description.summary: Yonah Go Glamping? Brasstown Dome is our Luxury Geodesic Dome with a View of the Highest Point in Georgia, Brasstown Bald over 15 miles away. This 30' Dome gives you 706sqft with all the Creature Comforts of home: King Bed, Full over Full Bunk Beds, Full Indoor Bathroom, Full Kitchen, Washer/Dryer, 2.5 ton Heating and Air Conditioning, Gig Fiber WiFi, Live TV, Firepit and more. Plus the things that you don't get in the City: 30 acres of land to explore, creeks, waterfalls, and walking trails.
description.space:
Yonah Go Glamping? Brasstown Dome is our 30' Dome that is perched between the trees on the shoulder of Yonah Mountain looking North all the way to Brasstown Bald, over 15 miles away. Actually, Brasstown Observatory is one of the few man made structures that you can see in all of your view. 

Brasstown Dome has 706 square feet of living space that is insulated and has a 2.5 ton HVAC unit to keep the dome heated and cooled in any weather. The dome is an open floorplan with all the structure in the middle. Enter the Dome right into a Full Kitchen with full size Refrigerator, sink, dishwasher, and combo oven/microwave, and cooktop. As you walk around the dividing wall, you are in the Master Bedroom with a King Bed and full views out of the 15' wide window that has views of the mountains that you can see from both rooms. Walk around another wall and into a room that has Full over Full Bunk Beds, perfect for kids or adults. Further around the next wall is the Full Bathroom with 2 pocket doors to provide full privacy to your 3'x5' Shower and 60" vanity, then another pocket door to the Toilet Room. Washer/Dryer unit is stacked in the utility closet for longer stays. 15' ceilings/walls that are insulated give great light and sound dispersion to listen to that favorite vinyl on the sound system. 

30 Acres to explore are shared between you and one other dome during the daylight hours. At Dusk, we ask you to stay away from the other dome for privacy. 2 creeks and many springs spill their way down Yonah Mountain and  over waterfalls, through our fields and more springs pop up from underground to feed the Beaver Pond before they run into Duke's Creek and then to the Chattahoochee River.  Bring your water shoes to play in the crystal clear creeks in the warmer months.
description.access: You will have the entire Dome and surrounding to explore.

description.summary:
A tidy private apartment in a secluded & safe Asheville neighborhood. Super Low cleaning fee, and no list of cleaning chores for checkout!

The garden apartment is large (aprox 650sqft) 1br/open plan unit on the ground level of a unique multi-unit dome building. Fresh bright paints & eclectic decorations that reflect the colorful culture of Asheville!

The perfect home base for your Asheville getaway!
description.space:
1 partitioned bedroom features a TempurPedic California King memory foam bed, with plenty of closet storage, integrated charging station, and a lighted vanity with table & chair. 

The bathroom has stone tile floors and a spa-inspired wood panel ceiling with shower, bidet, and toasty space heater. We provide crisp white towels & washcloths- plus shampoo, bodywash, conditioner,  and makeup removal wipes . 

Living room has exposed block walls & beams, with an ample sectional couch that converts to a full comfy Queen bed (no bars or slats!). For rainy days there is a 42" TV equipped with roku and HDMI cord: log in to stream all your favorites from Netflix or connect your laptop! 

The kitchenette/food prep pantry holds a fridge, microwave, toaster, coffee maker, watercooler, and kettle. It's the perfect place to make sandwiches for your hike, prepare a simple breakfast, or warm up leftovers! Coffee, creamer, sugar and condiments are provided in addition to a few snacks, drinks & ice for your arrival. Compostable plates, napkins, and recyclable cutlery/cups are freshly stocked for each guest.

Outside your private entryway there is a semi-covered flagstone patio with chairs and a tranquil woods view of the mountainside. A nice spot to relax and listen to the babbling creek. 

**Accessibility Notice* *
Please be aware that the unit is situated on a steep wooded lot which can provide challenges to those with mobility issues. There are several railroad tie stairs from the parking area to the walkway. The path to the entrance is a combination of flagstone walkway and pea gravel, approximately 60' in length. When you reach the door there are an additional 3 deck-style stairs to negotiate. It is impossible to pull a vehicle up to the door for unloading luggage or passengers.
description.access: This is an entire private apartment with its own separate entrance there are no shared spaces with the other tenants of the building
description.neighborhood:
Nestled in Merrills Cove under the shadow of Butler Mountain, the neighborhood is a safe and quiet residential area with just a handful of homes on large dispersed lots. The location feels wild, remote and off-the-grid, yet only 14 minutes to downtown Asheville, 17 min to Haywood Rd (West AVL), 19 minutes to airport, and about 5 min to grocery stores, restaurants, or coffee. The structure sits on several acres along one of the last remaining state-maintained gravel roads in Buncombe county. There is little noise, even less traffic, and virtually zero light pollution. Bears, wild turkey, deer, and assorted other woodland creatures wander thru regularly.  The road is a total of 1.5 miles, gently graded, wide, and regularly maintained.  Perfect setting to step out the door for your morning jog, a sunset bike ride, or just a scenic stroll down to the working farm with goats, cows, pastoral views and (seasonal) u-pick berries or farmstand produce. It's a far cry from sketchy hotel parking lots or crowded city streets with questionable security. The driveway touches some of the greatest motorcycling and road biking routes in the world, plus the closest Blue Ridge Parkway entrance is just 6 minutes away! 

Quiet, scenic, and serene best describe the setting. It's got backwoods vibes with central location & the conveniences of city life just around the corner!
description.transit: **flatlanders warning**- there are 3 routes into our quiet hollow. The most direct route shown via google maps is usually a steep winding (beautiful) mountain road that could potentially make some drivers nervous. There are two easy flat routes of only 1.5mi further distance, if you have any concerns about mountain driving or inclement weather, please ask your host and we can help you navigate the 'longer' but less curvy route!
description.interaction:
Contactless and keyless check in/out.  Unit is equipped with smart locks for easy check in on your schedule! You will be provided with a unique lock code in your check-in message.

Apartment is well separated from upstairs units with plenty of privacy.  

Host is always available via Airbnb messages. Happy to help with your trip, answer Asheville questions, give directions, or offer recommendations- Or simply leave you alone to enjoy your time!
description.house_rules:
Quiet hours 11pm-7am

1.  Communicate with your host only through the AirBnB app.  This ensures all conversations are visible to Airbnb customer service personnel.

2.  All guests must be registered in the form of an accurate count. No parties, gatherings, or unregistered guests.


3.  One off-street parking space is provided. Large truck/SUV drivers, motorcyclists or those in low/sportscars please contact the host for instructions. Trailers, campers, or RV’s cannot be accommodated.


4.  No Pets allowed at any time or for any length of time. There are many wonderful AirBnB’s that allow or even cater to traveling pets. We maintain pet-free accommodation for guests who value an allergen-free environment.


5.  Secure all trash. Our mountain property is home to black bear, raccoons, possum, turkey, and more. Trash left unsecured outside for any length of time will be torn to shreds and spread all over. This includes placing trash in outside bins! If you need trash removed from the unit during your stay (smelly takeout containers, diapers, etc) please contact the host and we will remove it to a secure container. If your trash is placed outside and subsequently destroyed, your party is responsible for cleaning it fully or incur a $100 trash cleaning fee.


6.  No Smoking inside the unit. In Asheville, we don’t care what you smoke, but it must be outside! Smoking in the apartment will incur a $250 cleaning fee.


7.  ‘Back side’ of the property is off-limits to AirBnB guests. Guests are free to explore the area from the creek to the driveway, on the front (street) side of the dome.

8.  No flushing of foreign objects down the toilet. A wastebasket with opaque bags & a bidet are provided.


9.  Respect the unit, the linens, and the check-out procedure. You are not expected to clean the unit, strip the beds, or do laundry when you stay at the dome! You are on vacation and we don’t believe guests should be given a list of chores to complete before they check out! Cleaning supplies are provided in case of accidents or if you feel the need to straighten up during your stay. Do not remove towels or linens from the unit. There are extra color/pattern towels in the armoire for guests with hair dye etc.. We also supply makeup removal wipes. Please don't use the white towels for those needs.

 
10.  Acknowledge there are cameras on the property. There are no video cameras inside the unit. For your safety and security, the property is monitored with video surveillance covering parking areas, property, and the AirBnB entry door.

The place is like a little boutique hotel at treetop heights with gorgeous views right -what more could you ask for to relax?!

The dome rental was okay.  The bathroom door needs maintenance.  It would not close  but also would not even stay partially closed and that normally would be okay however I was there with my teenage kids and it was a bit uncomfortable for all.  We had to use luggage straps to get even partial privacy.  The sheets were not laundered well.  Lots of what appeared to be crumb like pieces and hairs.  We also had some earwigs and spiders in the dome but it is a "treehouse" so bugs have to be expected somewhat.  Overall, we would not stay again but we made the most of it.  It did have a nice kitchen area, a full bath and the couple chairs to sit and look outside.  The restaurant food was very good!  The town is small and quiet and we were there for a festival but other than that, not a lot to do except relax and enjoy nature.

Jill and her husband let us access the Tesla charger at the venue without any additional charge (this is a game changer for EV owners). They also have a general EV charger. The glamping dome was just as in the pictures. One of a kind yet very clean. My husband and I loved everything about this place and we will definitely be back.

recent.comments:
Our stay at Riverside Dome was lovely! 

The team at Tiny Village are all super friendly and helpful and were at our site within 5 minutes when we asked for firewood/a new propane tank for the BBQ. 

The dome is very clean and the stream running through the site is serene. They were also very welcoming of our dog.

The dome is well equipped with everything we needed! Id recommend bringing a little camping stove because it’s not super practical to cook everything on the bbq. They even recently installed a flushable toilet which was a nice surprise! They are very proud of their domes and take feedback seriously

4 hours of canoe rental was included with our stay. They have adult life jackets and we brought one for our dog. 

Make sure you bring a good bug spray as the water definitely attracts extra bugs, but well worth falling asleep to the sound of running water!

Thank you tiny village! We have told our friends and plan to come back!

We had a great little fall getaway at the River's Edge Dome! We knew we were gambling with the weather booking a "glamping" trip in October, and it ended up being a bit of a cold and rainy weekend, but we still loved our stay in the cozy dome listening to the rain. Being able to have our dog with us for the weekend was a big reason why I chose to book with Tiny Village, and she had a great time at the dome too! Thanks for a fun and unique stay!

description.summary:
Located just over two hours from Ottawa, Ontario.

Experience our truly beautiful River's Edge Dome in Tiny Village - the ultimate glamping destination. Our dome is nestled in the dense forest on the shore of the Ottawa River and serves as your basecamp with all the modern amenities needed. Located on a private campground hosting over 59.1 Acres of nature - you will always have something to do or explore. Connect with not only the wonder of the natural world around you, but yourself and others.
description.space:
Our dome features an expansive bay window and a mesmerizing skylight, providing an immersive connection to nature while enjoying the comforts of your dome. Imagine drifting off to sleep under a backdrop of twinkling stars and waking up to the calming sounds of the surrounding forest!

This is more than just a dome in a forest. You actually have over 59.1 acres of property as your private playground to explore. Filled with 1000 ft of serene sandy shores, hiking trails, free kayaking and canoeing, you will feel like you’ve escaped Canada!

It's fully equipped with a kitchenette, AC, an outdoor shower and bathroom, fire pit, BBQ, and more to make your stay as comfortable as possible. 

Sleeping arrangements include a primary queen sized bed and a secondary sofa-bed for families or larger groups. 

10 minutes away - Bars, Restaurants, Groceries, LCBO, Museums and more.  

This is a perfect retreat for two or families seeking to commemorate special moments or simply unwind in the embrace of nature together.
description.notes:
> Check-in time is 3 pm - 9 pm. Please let us know if you want to check in after 9 pm.
> Checkout time is 11 am.
> We have kayaks and canoes available for use at no cost (We provide life jackets for adults and kids).
> From the car to the dome is 2 minute's walk. 
> There is no washroom inside the dome. A private outdoor shower, a sink and a flushable toilet are outside the dome.
> Included: Plates, Cups, Cutlery, Barbecue Grill Tools, Cutting Board, and Dish Towel.
> There are communal showers in the park accessible to everyone.
> WiFi is not available in the dome.
> Necessities not included: towels, sheets, blankets, and pillows.
> $200 deposit is required at check-in.
> After two guests, We charge an extra $10 for each guest per night.
> $20 pet fee required (if applicable).
description.neighborhood: Our magical Riverfront Luxury Glamping Dome provides a modernized atmosphere where you can go to relax after spending time exploring and reconnecting with nature. Located on our 60-acre campground, nestled on the shore of the breathtaking Ottawa River, surrounded by vast wilderness, and only 5 minutes northwest of the tight-knit community of Deep River. Stop by Deep River for a night in the town filled with delicious restaurants and/or familiar fast-food franchises or stock up on your favourite snacks at one of the local grocery and/or convenience stores.
description.house_rules:
> All Garbage, recycling & food waste/compost must be packed up and taken to the on-site garbage bin-recycling bins and compost to be taken with you upon your departure. 
> Keep all food items in an airtight container, Open Food and Compost must be secure in your car each night because of wildlife. 
> Keep the space clean and remove your shoes when you are inside
> No loud music after 11pm
> No open alcohol in any public areas (beach, roadways, bathrooms etc.)
> Leave the dome and items as you found it.

There is no electricity or running water and no WIFI.

name: LUXE Dome Maximum Privacy
title: Whitwell, Tennessee

hosts.about:
Creating one-of-a-kind, inspiring spaces for our guests is our life's passion. 
We honeymooned in The Majestic Treehouse in Walhalla – the treehouse Seth built with his dad. And since then, we've continued to build treehouses and domes in other beautiful nature settings across the USA. 

Check out our treehouses on Netflix's "The World's Most Amazing Vacation Rentals" and on Chip & Joanna Gaines' Magnolia Network!

We love traveling the world with Airbnb! Our goal as 27x Superhosts is for everyone who visits one of our places to feel like they're finally home. One of our biggest joys in life is creating unforgettable experiences for people and helping them rest & connect!

description.summary: Perfect for couples & solo travelers looking for maximum privacy during their stay.  Magical, unforgettable, Instagrammable, mountaintop luxury geodesic dome!
description.space:
Perfect for couples & solo travelers looking for maximum privacy during their stay. Reconnect, laugh, and lose track of time on top of the world in a magical, inspiring, socially distanced environment that is guaranteed to lift your spirit and create cherished memories that will last a lifetime! Enjoy 1,175 square feet of private space (dome + deck + fire pit) and breathtaking mountaintop views from this impressive, Instagrammable, luxury geodesic dome! Enjoy our award-winning treehouse experience in a fascinating new structure with even more amenities. The LUXE Dome is a unique, bucket-list experience in an inspiring environment that is guaranteed to lift your spirit.

LIVE LIKE KINGS & QUEENS while being immersed in nature and surrounded by luxury comforts: stargaze in the hot tub, shower under the stars, roast s’mores, play antique board games, enjoy popcorn + movie night, blazing fast internet, BBQ grill, pizza oven, and furnished kitchenette. Wake up in the clouds to the relaxing sounds of songbirds and savor magical mornings in luxurious robes after waking up refreshed from the best sleep of your life. Journal, read, dream, and enjoy the art of slow living with french-press coffee and breakfast with million-dollar views. Then, PLAY LIKE KIDS in Chattanooga’s nature playground: scenic hikes, waterfalls, horseback riding, ATV tours, paragliding, paddleboarding, kayaking, fishing, cruise the Tennessee River on a pontoon, and fill your lungs with fresh mountain air.

hosts.about:
I am continually kindling a peaceful dwelling and am hopeful you will be Blessed by it as well. This has been a labor of love and is a work in progress. However, not currently under construction. Our valley has held two weddings , helped to raised two sons ,produced bountiful gardens, echoed with singing, laughter and indeed some tears. It has been photographed, sketched and painted, yet it is ever changing , ever growing just as we all are. 
A former guest sums it up best:
“I have an aura of happiness here”.

recent.comments: The Dome was a great place to stay! We had a great time with the views and the decor!

items.comments: The Dome was a great place to stay! We had a great time with the views and the decor!

This is definitely a unique experience. The inside of the home seemed very big and open. The beds were very comfortable. The outdoor space was serene and inviting. We saw a little wildlife while drinking our morning coffee. Linda made sure the light was on for us when we returned from dinner. Just make sure to bring some jugs of water; there was no sink in the kitchen - which is clear on the pictures, but we were at a cross as to how to clean the dishes. Which ultimately we rinsed off in the bathroom. I do wish we could have spent more than one night to explore the walking trail and enjoy some more peace and quiet!

This home was exactly as expected. Very quiet, pleasant and cozy. I appreciated the abundance of towels and comfortable beds. I enjoyed the walking trails, and outdoor seating areas especially. Linda was helpful, and available for questions and concerns.

Unique, delightful "hobbit home" dome house in a beautiful setting out in nature.  The decorations fit the character of the house well.  The only missing element may be that the area to prepare food lacks a faucet and sink (water must be brought from the bathroom).  Linda, the owner, was extremely helpful in answering our questions beforehand through the Airbnb site.  She gave us a friendly greeting outside the house when we arrived to give guidance about walking down the hill and entering the house and to answer any other questions.  The location may be a bit remote for persons with medical or mobility issues, but we are septuagenarians and had no difficulties.  We would definitely stay here again.
Very good location! Close to some trails and not far from Walloon lake or Lake Cherlevoix. Lots to do around this area
This was the peaceful place we were hoping for! Easy access to all the incredible towns on all sides, Linda was extremely helpful and responsive

Very peaceful, beautiful, quiet, and clean. The walk from parking area down the path to the entrance was described accurately and was a challenge when unloading and loading for an older couple.  Linda was nice and very communicative.  Her instructions and info provided was excellent. It was a nice stay.

hosts.about: Greetings! It is a pleasure to be your host, my goal is to ensure you have an amazing experience during your stay. I have worked in the in the hospitality industry for over 18 years.  I love meeting new people and I am looking forward to connecting with you for your vacation.

Cheers! My name is Billy-Dee Greenwood, not to be mistaken for Billy December Williams. Bat Man (1989), Star Wars, Mahogany, Colt 45? I’m a full-time insurance professional who enjoys the outdoors. Abstract art enthusiast, my favorite painter is Jackson Pollock.

recent.comments: I cannot say enough great things about our time in Lake Lure! The home was beautiful and so incredibly peaceful! From listening to the water flow from the back porch while reading to taking challenging hikes in the mountains to getting restful nights sleep, it was exactly what we needed to recharge! My husband loved the local golf courses, the kids loved the pool and beach plus the restaurants were great! We went to Chimney Rock, whitewater rafting w Asheville Adventure Company and visited Whistle Hop Brewery! We are eager to return to the area when our schedule permits!  The hosts were extremely friendly and responsive, definitely a 5 star experience!

items.comments: I cannot say enough great things about our time in Lake Lure! The home was beautiful and so incredibly peaceful! From listening to the water flow from the back porch while reading to taking challenging hikes in the mountains to getting restful nights sleep, it was exactly what we needed to recharge! My husband loved the local golf courses, the kids loved the pool and beach plus the restaurants were great! amazing, beautiful mountain view’s all around, perfect to propose to your lover ;)
Enjoyed our stay.
We really enjoyed our stay even though the weather did not cooperate. It was cozy, and the screened in porch was a great place to sit and relax! We would love to come back!
A great place to stay at Lake Lure! Comfortable and great outdoor space!

We had a great girls trip, but this place would be good for a family with older kids as well -  I would bring my 7 and 4yo (for those toddlers and little kids, it would be ok as well under supervision… there is a slight drop-off in the yard going to the creek, with a partial fence). The hiking trail was just past the next house over. We liked the trail, great for hiking and biking. 
The home had some great touches that made it extra relaxing. My personal fave was the gas fireplace outside on the deck and the porch with cozy chair to take in the mountain and creek view. If you’re looking to just veg and mountain bathe without doing much work, I think this is a great spot! Made it easy just to stay in or on the porch and really enjoy it.
We absolutely loved this place!! Everything was perfect! Cannot wait to come back!

description.space:
At this home, nature is in your backyard. Enjoy your favorite beverage on the patio while listening to the calming sounds of Buffalo Creek. Unwind in the hot tub or by the fire pit while admiring Blue Ridge Mountain scenery. The home has an exterior access multipurpose room with a dedicated work space area to take Zoom calls or enjoy a game night with your loved ones.

As a guest, you will have access to the city’s premiere destination, Rumbling Bald Resort which boasts numerous amenities such as lake activities, wellness center, racket sports and access to one of Western Carolina’s only multi-course golf destinations.

At Buffalo Creek Retreat, we want  to create lasting memories that will have you booking your next trip before you leave!

hosts.about:
Wolfpack engineer, rock climber, and day dreamer following the typical path until discovering a new and unlikely future in these mountains. My story starts mid-summer in Marc’s garage: 

2 meddling kids are printing t-shirts with a dream of traveling west. After 35 days of car-camping and hiking across the country, these kids discovered how little they needed to be happy. Inspired, they set out to share the simple gift of nature with others.

description.summary: Immerse yourselves in a unique nature experience on 60 acres of secluded paradise in the Blue Ridge Mountains. Our 3 glamping sites offer privacy and modern amenities including BBQ grill, fire pit, heated shelter, memory-foam bed(s), and solar power only 3 min from the Blue Ridge Parkway. Walk to our on-site waterfall or explore nearby Crabtree/Linville Falls just 20 mins away. Secluded but only 5 min drive to Walmart. Get off the grid and embrace the best parts of camping with your loved ones.
description.space:
**This is an upscale camping experience - not a luxury hotel room in the woods (read all details below!).**

Explore the property freely. Our land is situated at a center point of some of the best hiking in North Carolina. Less than 45 mins from Linville Gorge, Mt. Mitchell, Grandfather Mountain, and Roan Mountain, and within 20 mins of 3 popular waterfall hikes at Crabtree Falls, Tom's Creek Falls, and Linville Falls. Over a mile from any residences on our own forested ridge, but only a 5 min drive to Walmart for quick supply runs! Each of our 3 structures were hand-built on a custom ~25' x 25' deck platform in the Summer of 2022.

Site #1 Yurt: The Gnome's Yome
 - 1 Memory-Foam Queen Mattress
 - Best long range views
 - Outdoor gravity-fed shower
 - Outhouse shared with Site #2

Site #2 Dome: April's Treetop Dome
 - 1 Memory-Foam King Mattresses
 - Highest elevation site with Black Mtn views
 - Custom circular deck
 - Outhouse shared with Site #1

Site #3 Yurt: The Wild Fairy Inn
 - 2 Memory-Foam Queen Mattresses
 - Covered kitchen area
 - Largest deck space (300 sqft)
 - Private outhouse

The following amenities apply to all 3 glampsites. Please READ all below.

BEDS: At each site, there are king or queen memory-foam mattresses. If someone would like to pitch their own tent by the fire pit at any site, they are welcome to.

KITCHEN -- There is an outdoor kitchen equipped with a BBQ grill & single-stove burner cooktop, two 5-gallon water jugs, a sink basin, and a big cooler pre-filled with ice.

POWER -- A 2000-Wh solar battery and 400W of solar panels provide plentiful power for device charging, lights, and a standing fan.

HEAT — A propane heater is provided with 20lb propane tank for heating. There are screened windows, a standing fan, and roof vent for cooling. The yurts/domes are not temperature controlled environments.

BATH + SHOWER -- Each site will have a clean & private outhouse about 100ft walk from the site stocked with toilet paper, hand sanitizer, and sawdust.  There is one outdoor shower available at the Site #1 Gnomes Yome.

WIFI -- There is no wifi on-site, but there is LTE cell service for T-Mobile, AT&T, and Verizon (provider signal strengthens in that order).

ACCESS -- You will park about 100-150 ft away from the sites and walk to them via a fairy-lit trail through the forest. NOTE you will drive on a mile of gravel road to get to the property that can be rough in a few areas. There is nothing steep, just chewed up and bumpy. (take it slow and steady and you will be fine).

FIRE -- Fires are allowed in the fire rings only. There are fire rings at each glampsite. Gather your own fire material from the site or purchase a fire starter and firewood from Walmart to make things easy!

TO-BRING-LIST:
- Headlamp
- Sturdy shoes or boots (Chaco folks, strap up!)
- Reusable water bottle
- Bug spray
- An extra layer or two!
description.access:
You will have access to exploring the entire property's trails and roads with a commitment to "Leave No Trace"
